VB-186670

DOM: TempTool crash inside Marionette

I have a simple Temp-Tool funktion like:
{noformat}
def TempToolCallback(a,b,c):
x, y = vs.vstGetCurrPt2D()
vs.Message(str([a,b,c,x,y])

vs.RunTempTool( False, TempToolCallback ){noformat}
This python Script runs in a Vectorscript but not in a Marionette Script. Finally the request would be, that the possibility of user-interaction of pascal scripts would work in the same comfortable way (or work at all) in a python script and/or Marionette Script.

I think this requirement exists till the python implementation and is devoutly wished from all scripters. I detect some improvements in SP3 (CallTool can handle a callback now) thats why again hope is flaring and looked again in the possibilities.

At one End it would be great for Marionette if a Node-Script (Button) would allow to interact with Vectorworks (pick an object, draw something etc.) which would make many things much more user-friendly. Seems to be hard to implementate.

I guess this is a limitation but it would be nice to not seeing a crash. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-185342

Spotlight truss inventory import bug

If a user uses the import button in the truss inventory to import a truss inventory CSV file to update the current inventory its possible to crash Spotlight to desktop.

To reproduce
open a new file

select several truss libraries in the resource manger and download them

insert a single section of truss into the design layer file,

Activate the replace truss command in the Spotlight rigging menu

In the Replace truss dialogue hit the truss inventory button to enter the truss inventory dialogue

Hit the update button to add the downloaded truss libraries into the inventory

once the list of trusses in the inventory has updated hit the export button to export a CSV file of the inventory to desktop

open the CSV file with Excel

In excel change the contents of the USE column to true for all rows (except the header) and change the count column to 10 for all rows again except fot eh header.

save the file

in Spotlight use the import button in the truss inventory to import the edited CSV file back into the inventory,
Spotlight will crash to desktop

 

As far as I can tell if the you only make a few changes to the CSV file in excel the file will successfully import, but the moment the number of changes goes above a certain number Spotlight will crash to desktop

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-190974

Spotlight - Braceworks - Faulty calculation

Hej Guys

[~mstaffel]

The calculations in this file are incorrect in version 2022.

When the drawing is calculated for the first time in 2023, a correct calculation appears. As soon as this drawing is calculated a second time in 2023, a different result appears.

Open the file in 2022
Open the Workspace " Braceworks
Braceworks -> Calculate all objects

then some error messages appear and the load of the chain hoists is wrong.

Open the file in 2023
Open the Workspace " Braceworks"
Braceworks -> Calculate all objects
No error message appears
The calculations are correct
Close the window
Braceworks -> Calculate all objects
Now some error messages appear and the calculations are wrong.

THIS is a serious bug that we need to fix urgently.

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-184698

Spotlight Cable Tools incorrent cable type inserted between distributors

In the attached file:
# Choose the cable insertion tool.
# Select a Socapex Multi Cable
# Select the single connection mode
# Click on the Distro.
# In the popup, check the always use next free output box.
# Select Out.A.120 to choose the first multi output and click OK
# Connect to Breakout #1
## This inserts a multi cable as expected.
# Click on the DIstro again
# Click on Breakout #2
## This inserts an Edison Jumper instead of the expected multi cable
# Repeat again by clicking on the distro and then breakout #3
# Open the power planning web palette and note the connections. Breakout #1 is connected as expected. #2 & #3 are both connected to Edisons on the Distro and Multi on the breakouts.

I had expected the tool to read the only connector available for the end-point and then attach to the appropriate and available output connection of the start-point. Thus, using a multi-cable for all three connections.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-188778

Spotlight Cable Tools Select Symbol in OIP of Distributor removes all patch info from all systems

Related to 
# VB-188635

Exchanging a distributor for another distributor removes all power planning patch information. In the attached drawing, I have one generator and TWO distributors. Replacing one distro via the Select SYmbol button in the OIP removes all patch info from both distro systems.
All the cables retained their start and end points, but none of the devices retained their patch mapping information.
To test, please open the attached file.
# View the patch information in the power planning palette.
# Select one of the Distros.
# Click on the select symbol button in the OIP.
# Select a new distro.

After the replacement is complete, the power planning palette loses the patch information. Refreshing the palette doesn't help.
To confirm, select a distributor or lighting device and check to see if they are connected to anything in the patch selection dropdowns.
Also, select the cable and note that the start and end points still exist.

 VIdeo and file attached. 		Kevin Linzey

Message:
Braceworks laskenta antaa virheilmoituksen BrxFemHandle not set kun Dropissa on Hoist Position Hoist Up. Samalla kahden &quot;symmetrisen&quot; nostimen kuorma lasketaan väärin. Kuormasta tulee &quot;epäsymmetrinen&quot; ja kuormien yhteenlaskettu summa kasvaa.

Block Screen tiedoston vasemmassa laidassa olevat Dropit M3, M4, M40 ja M41 on ne joilla olen testannut asiaa. M3 ja M4 on Hoist Up niin ne generoivat virheen ja väärän laskelman. M40 ja M41 on Hoist Down niin niistä ei tule virheitä ja laskenta onnistuu. Samoin käy M3 ja M4 kun ne kääntää Hoist Down.

Drop Up Down tiedostossa ei ole vastaavaa ongelmaa vaikka käytössä on samoja objekteja ja Hoistit on Up.
Kevin Linzey

VB-188422

VW Crashes When Creating Section Viewport from Existing Top/Plan Viewport (Mac Only) - Multi thread - VGM::TessellationMgr::TessellateGeometry

Note: this crash only seems to happen with a very specific set of steps. I tried narrowing it down to fewer steps but didn't have any luck.

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Top/Plan Viewport that displays a Wall and some Windows.

To reproduce:

-Edit the Top/Plan viewport's design layer
-Convert the Window to a style as shown
-Edit the 2D Components of the new style
-Go to a Front view and run the "Generate 2D from 3D" command, then Ungroup
-Create Polygons using the Inner Boundary Mode as shown
-Delete the Lines (I did this by drawing a new Line and using the Select Similar tool)
-Exit back to the sheet layer
-Update the Graphic Legend
-Select the Top/Plan viewport and run the "Create Section Viewport" command
-Draw the section line as shown

Note that VW crashes. Crash log is attached (I couldn't get it to symbolize for some reason).

I don't see the crash on Windows 10 so it looks like Mac-only. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190664

Section Viewport Update Uses-Up Lots of Memory in SP2

The attached movie and test file show this in 2023 SP1 compared to SP2. The file contains a few Hidden Line Section Viewports.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and update the viewport.

In SP1, note that the updates takes just a few seconds and only uses a couple GB of memory.

In SP2, note that the update causes the RAM usage to go up indefinitely (I got it over 70GB at one point).
Josh Loy

VB-191942

VWX Import of Revit file crashes and closes program

User at LDI 2022, Andrew Fisher from Barbizon Charlotte presented me with a query of best workflow to import Revit files he was receiving from customers to complete his Vectorworks drawings.

After conferring with other Vectorworks industry specialists, I updated my application 2023 SP2. I set the import options to what I though would produce the least amount of issues. Once the import began, it is quickly discovered that there are almost 11300 elements trying to import. Once the loader reached about 4900 elements, Vectorworks would crash and close, and would present me with the Apple crash report.

File can be accessed for testing at: https://www.dropbox.com/s/z4kz0o1rdvwmpq1/LINK%20Herrin%20Office_CENTRAL%20%28R20%29_detached.rvt?dl=0 		Vasil Kitanov

dwg import fails in version 2023. Regression.

Hello,
This file imports fine into v2022 SP3 (636848) but does take some time.

The file has about 50,000 3D polys but they're not that complex. In v2022 I note that the geometry is 5345km away from the internal origin. I don't know if that's why perhaps this problem exists?

VB-184814

We tried various settings on Mac and Windows. Same result. 
Our tries:
- 2D and 3D view 
- Import as 'Vectorworks Mesh' or 'Vectorworks Solids'

VB-190030

Updater error says to close VW first but VW is not running

I got a message on VW launch that a new service pack was available (screen shot attached).  I clicked the "More Info" button and got the Update Screen dialogue (screen shot attached).  I quit VW and then immediately clicked "Update".  I got a message "Please Close Vectorworks 2023 first"(screen shot attached).  I figured that VW had not finished its closing process.  So I waited a minute and clicked "Retry" and got the same "Please close..." message again.  I restarted the computer and did not launch VW. I launched the updater from the Vectorworks folder and got the "Update VW" dialogue but when I clicked the Update" button I get the same "Please close...) message.  I am attaching a screen shot of the version number of the updater. Next I deleted VW 2023 Beta 6 and reinstalled it from the same .dmg that I had used to install it originally.  I got a message "Updater needs to be refreshed"(screen shot attached) which I did.  I launched the updater from the Applications folder (VW was not running) clicked "Update" and got the same "Please close..." message.  Since the updater had been "refreshed" I checked the version # of the updater and it was the same as the previously mentioned screen shot. Tim Ardoin

VB-185192

SBE: ISDK::Set2DComponentGroup does not work in multiview

- Copy attached plug-in Fenster CW in your plug-ins folder (Mac, 27.0.x, Debug version)
- Add plug-in to your workspace

- Open attached file "Testfile 9098_vwi_no_multiview.vwx"

- Select tool. Click "Don't show again" for all debug alerts that pop up.

- Click on "Update" button in mode bar (redlined in screenshot "mode bar fenster.gpg")

This will trigger a regeneration of all window PIOs in the document.

- Have a look at 2D components / Back view (see screenshot "back view no multiview.png")

Note that there is a small gap between the outmost line of the green frame and the blue window sill.

These objects (green frame and blue sill) are created by the PIO and assigned to it by Set2DComponentGroup

- Now open "Testfile 9098_vwi_multiview.vwx"

This is the identical document as the first one except that I had disabled multiview in the other document

- Select tool and click on update button

- Have a look at 2D components / Back view

Note that the back view looks different (back view in multiview.png). THe green frame looks slighly different.


The reason for the difference is that Set2DComponent did not attach the new (correctly drawn) group to the PIO but left the old one (which was drawn at an incorrect position).

Somehow Set2DComponent does the correct thing if multiview is disabled but fails if it is enabled.

Debugging revealed that - if multiview is enabled - the bug seems to happen somewhere in CheckInputDataForComponentGroup whichj is called by Set2DComponentGroup.

In these lines 3059ff in GraphicDataManager.cpp

if (!UseMainContainerFor2DGraphic(inhObject, inoutComponent) && !GraphicDataManager::DeleteWrongObjects(inhObjectToAdd, true, ELevelsOfDetail::All, ECollectDrawListOptions::Extract2DFromHybridGroups, nullptr))
outResult = ESetSpecialGroupErrors::CannotSet_BadData;

DeleteWrongObjects returns false and therefore Set2DComponent does not do anything and leaves the old swap group in place.

I don't quite understand what's going on in DeleteWrongObjects, but it seems that this function deletes all geometric subobjects of the group I want to become the back view and then DeleteWrongObjects sees that the group is basically empty and returns false.

Obviously, DeleteWrongObjects should not delete these objects (green and blue 2D polygons that represent frame and window sill) in the first place.

It is also very weird that the bug does only happen if multiview is enabled. If there was actually something wrong with the obbjects in the passed group, they should have been deleted in the other document as well.

This bug in Set2DComponent also seems to destroy the undo table (you will get strange undo warnings for instace when editing 2D components).
Josh Loy
VB-192184

Hitting "Update" for viewports is often a crash point

I don't have a repeatable bug for this VB entry, but rather just an observation that I've noticed over time. Of all the hard crashes I experience, quite a few of them seem to occur moments after clicking the "Update" button on a viewport. Attaching a log from a crash I just experienced.

I'll keep an eye out for other contextual clues.

 

[is this sort of entry useful?] 		Rick Berge

VB-191372

Vectorworks crashes the first time when trying to render the viewport in this user file [HOU-LONGHORN-3D_02_180DPI.vwx]

Steps to reproduce.
- Start a fresh instance of Vectorworks
- Download the attached .vwx file and open it.
- Start a viewport update and Vectorworks will crash a few seconds after that

Note that if you start Vectorworks again and open the same file, rendering will start successfully. The crash is reproducible only with a freshly downloaded .vwx file. Once it has crashed once, it is no longer reproducible.

I found this issue while investigating a cloud job which consistently crashes on the cloud. The locally observed behavior explains why the Cloud job crashes every time - the Cloud always works with a freshly downloaded copy of the file. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190476

Multiple and Ongoing VGM Crashes on iMacs : JBC

One of our very long term customers with 10 seats of Architect on VSS have been experiencing VGM crashes on multiple machines running either Big Sur or Monterey on identical iMacs (see attached screen shot for computer specs) running Vw 2022 SP3 and SP4. This issue did not occur with Vw 2021.

The following machine had been experiencing the most crashes so was updated to Monterey to see if that would make a difference following Gunther's comment (see below). It didn't :

EHXZCZ-CZPKAR-ZNZXZP-G0KDFF (Monterey)

They have had two crashes and a freeze already this morning. 

These machines have also experienced crashes, though not as regularly:

EHXZCZ-VZLKL7-ZZZ7ZM-G12T3T (Big Sur)
EHXZCZ-2Z9KC1-ZRZSZZ-G0JT3K (Big Sur)
EHXZCZ-KZ0KJW-ZNZJZF-G05JKD (Big Sur)

The crashes happen in multiple projects so are unrelated to a particular file. We have also obtained one of their files and could see nothing out of the ordinary that might contribute to this issue (see attached). All machines should have had error reporting set to verbose for at least a week.


Gunther had this to say when I asked him about it last week:


_I have found a few of their crash reports.  Looks like it's related to VGM, in Justin Hutchison's area, though he's on holiday at the moment.  Might be able to have Dave D. take a look?_

_I made some observations while digging into crash logs.  Anyone experiencing this crash, is using macOS 10.14 or 11.x. I looked at 100 or so crash reports, there were none on macOS 12. Perhaps a driver/graphics issue in older OS versions? This seems to be a Vectorworks 2022 issue also. Nothing shows up in Vectorworks 2021 or prior._

_Wonder if they would be willing to update one of the computers to macOS 12 to see if it helps with the crashes?_

Please give this a high priority as this is a high profile firm in Sydney.


Thanks. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-186878

Vectorworks doesn't release memory after rendering and becomes very slow

# Open test file (preferably on an Intel Mac to match me) and render any of the sheet layer viewports (which have Hidden Line foreground and Shaded background). To better experience the effect, render a number of viewports individually before moving to next step. (I'll typically use at least and 64 GB RAM, and it will increase with each render)
# Save file. Notice that memory is not released.
# Now go into the Annotations layer of the viewports and try to manipulate objects. In particular try to enter Groups and move the objects within them. (sheet layers 21311 and 21312 currently have groups of polygons for brick coursing you could use).
# You should find VW very slow to enter the group and allow you to move objects around in the Annotations layer.
# Now quit Vectorworks and reopen the file. Notice memory is released and it's easy to manipulate objects on the Annotation layers. 

I can't remember when VW started doing this, but it's been a while. 		Josh Loy

VB-185247

Crash on Windows 11

*Issue:*

Crashes even when dealing a simple 2D drawings of a circle. No error messages comes up. 

 

*Findings:* 

Dxidag

https://vectorworks--c.na96.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.FileDownload?file=00P2M00000sOnrUUAS&operationContext=S1

Processor: AMD Ryzen 7 5800H with Radeon Graphics (16 CPUs), ~3.2GHz

Memory: 16384MB RAM

Card name: AMD Radeon RX 6600M

Driver Date/Size: 25/01/2022 00:00:00, 1818680 bytes

 

Msinfo 

https://vectorworks--c.na96.content.force.com/servlet/servlet.FileDownload?file=00P2M00000sOnrWUAS&operationContext=S1

25/01/2022

Faulting application path: C :\Program Files\Vectorworks 2022\Vectorworks2022.exe

Faulting module path: C :\windows\System32\ucrtbase.dll

 

 

*TS done:*

Run a repair (1 file has been fixed) after the repair the crash happened again but took longer to happen. Requesting msinfo and dxdiag for further investigation.

Asked to update GPU drivers and run a System File Checker (dll)

User will come back later with the TS feedback.

Asked to double check if they are using the dedicated gpu for VW and provided AMD link explaining how to check this in their end.

Asked customer to open VW in a new Windows user.

Suggested to try disabling antivirus. If issue persist asked updated system files for further investigation.

Asked to perform clean install Vectorworks.

Asked to deselecting Save VGM graphics cache in the Document Preferences

Asked for updated diagnosis files.

The user has formatted their PC and reinstalled Vectorworks and updated gpu drivers again. 

Asked to try without the displaylink usb connected as based in the following forum article:

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/52708-dual-nvidia-graohics-cards-pulling-my-hair-out-over-constant-black-screens-and-freezes/]

Also to update their Windows to the latest version available.

Crashes still remain. 

 

 

Any suggestions?

 

Thanks 		Rick Berge

VB-188482

Spotlight: Power-Palette - Different behaviour when deleting objects

Hey guys,

If you delete a device in the drawing, it updates the power palette immediately.
But if you delete a connection/cable, you need to refresh the web palette to see the changes. The behaviour should be equal to all objects shown in the web palette.

Also: After deleting the device on the drawing and bringing it back with cmd+z it will not show up in the Power-Palette.
At this point you need to connect them again by drawing a cable between these devices. This will be really annoying if you need to draw a cable from understage to the Lighting Device at the Rigg again. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-191794

The transformation of a French CRS is incorrect

The French CRS projection "Lambert II centre france" EPSG 27562" is wrong on Vectorworks. Indeed the point of origin on Vectorworks (see image) is placed close to Spain towards the Atlantic. whereas in other softwares (Global mapper, Argis, Qgis) the point is shifted towards the East.  

This means that a client cannot import his tree surveys. The surveys are projected into the ocean. 

I am attaching the Qgis image with the location of the origin point (with WGS 84 coordinates) as well as the file (.tsv) and (shp) of the tree surveys. (Test arbres).

I also include an image of datum transformation. Maybe this will help

  		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-188010

With it selected, navigate to Debug > Debug List View Ex...

Choose the Find Selected Object button

Choose Show Info

In that dialog, click Reset Object at the bottom and close out of all dialogs

Beta Undo Alert 9 will repeatedly alert until the object is deleted 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-192507

WS: Addition doesn't work in a simple setting

The first of the two described issues might be WAD, but the second definitely is NOT.

Please watch the attached video for more detailed information.

Issue 1: When doing "Sum Values" in one column and "Summarize Item" in another column and doing the sum of the two in a third column there seems to be some kind of conflict.

Issue 2: When doing the sum of the same two columns (cells of the database) in a separate cell (outside of the database cells) I get the result I expect. So good so far. If I now want to access this result from the third column of Issue 1, the strangest thing happens: not only do I get 0 in the third column, but the result in the separate cell also turns to 0, even though it is not connected in any way or shape with the third column (database cell).

I am currently preparing a worksheet crash course for a customer and find this worksheet behaviour very unsettling. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-190094

Spotlight schematic view issue when X & Z rotation is set to 180.

to place a light on top of a truss, a user would rotate on the X axis to 180°. they were then move it higher on the Z height so that it sits on top of the truss. If a user wishes to then rotate the unit, they would change the Z rotation 180°.

This presents a problem in schematic view as shown in the attached screenshot.

The issues seen in the screenshot include:
# In the schematic front view, the light appears to be hanging down from the top of the truss. It should be sitting on top.
# In the side view, the light is also hanging down.
# The draw beam for the light is checked.  In ISO view, the beam points to the focus point. In Schematic view, the beam points up and away.

  		Kevin Linzey

I have attached the original file, my "Fixed" version of the file and a screenshot showing the broken fixtures. Kevin Linzey
VB-190095

Spotlight parameters causes unwanted results with focus point draw beam

The parameter setting checkbox to automatically rotate 2D to focus messes up a unit with X at 180 and draws the beam to the focus point in Top/Plan view

I have placed a lighting unit on the floor with an X rotation of 180°. The light is set to focus point C and the draw beam checkbox is checked. It works as expected until I change the spotlight preferences parameter for orientation and check the box to automatically rotate 2D to focus. In this case, the light itself points in the opposite direction from the focus point in Top/Plan view.

 

screenshot attached with notations. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-190096

spotlight unit rotation unexpected results with menu command flip horizontal.

Menu command to "flip horizontal" (Ctrl+Shift+H) rotates 90 instead of flipping 180.

Using the menu command modify/rotate/flip horizontal results in unexpected rotation of the lighting unit. My screenshot shows that it only rotates 90° rather than flipping the expected 180°.

I was an isometric view during the testing. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-188767

Simplification tolerance problems for Landscape

When working with site models and Landscape/Hardscape areas you will always have issues with curved edges - to improve on the vertex count we normally apply a simplification tolerance.

However, if you have a more complex site, you can't update more than one area at a time, otherwise, Vectorworks hangs and you have to force quit. 

The file attached is at the stage when you start having constant issues and it becomes impossible to work with it. The image shows three areas that my machine couldn't manage at the same time.

I've worked on it in 656460, so it might be possible a solution has been achieved since.

Otherwise, it's a dream to be able to add Landscape areas and not worry about site modifier edges! Our users will love the new site model. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

The attached file contains a few Path-type Hardscapes with curved paths.

Note that the 3D mesh geometry shows random polys near the start and end points (see attached screenshot).

The same thing happens going back to 2023 SP0. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-190518

End caps of the wall break referenced file.

Grzegorz reported:

Case - User wants to reference a file (e.g. building, attachments Obj_1, Obj_2, Obj_3) into another (e.g. terrain, attachment Main model).
It turns out that, if a wall has both end caps and inserted element (door, symbol) then VW creates huge selection area which breaks visibility - VW counts this as there are object far away. 3D geometry often fails to render properly.

Attachment Main model consists of 3 referenced files:
Obj_1 - no end caps, but wall has inserted element - no problem
Obj_2 - end caps and inserted element - selected area is huge
Obj_3 - end caps but no element in a wall - no problem

Files:

 

Also happens in 2023 SP0 		Christopher Graye

VB-188866

Shaded render: When moving objects when rendered they disappear

Hello,
Originally this was going to be a question on the forum or probably Slack about whether or not when moving objects when in Shaded mode in v2022 it was correct that the object's bounding box became a black box when moved? Once placed they rendered ok.

In v2021 in OpenGL moved objects when rendered remained rendered and you could see them properly.

However it seems that if I do the same in v2023 the objects disappear when moved and do not reappear!

The enclosed movie was made directly after the computer was restarted with just the programs opened. All renders are Medium quality and ambient occlusion on + Clip Cube. There are also the v2021,v2022 and v2023 files enclosed.

The computer is a MBP M1 Max 32 core GPU + 64GB UM.

Cheers,
Peter

PS The file came in as v2022. It was exported to v2021 and converted in v2023. Just an observation I notice that v2022 and v2023 have bigger file sizes than v2021 although nothing has changed. 		Josh Loy
VB-190951

VB-191904

Reshape tool no longer moves 2D or 3D Plug-in Objects

This is a regression. The Reshape tool fails to move any plug-in objects that are both selected and included in the tool's marquee area. It works as expected in Vectorworks 2020, but does not work in Vectorworks 2022 or Vectorworks 2023. You can see the tool has been redesigned between 2020 and 2022 so perhaps that work affected this functionality. 

This functionality is crucial to this user's workflow. They draught 2D construction plans and rely on this functionality to move (2D) walls and all associated geometry including the 2D i-beam PIOs when the building design needs to be extended. Of greater concern is when walls or beams need to be moved small amounts, like an inch. It will not be apparent if such a change fails to complete as instructed by the user and there could be massive consequences for the construction and related costs.

This is a highly replied upon function that is used frequently by the user and for which there is no easily applied substitute, hence why I've marked this as 'Crucial.' 

See the attached screen recording demonstration and applicable .vwx file. 

 

Thanks! 

Jeremy  		Josh Loy

VB-185677

IfcOpening are far to big for corner windows

We realized that IfcOpening are far to big for corner windows. We think that has to do to avoid some technical issues with the new wall structure but don't know for sure. However, openings are often used in AVA applications (cost calculation software) to get quantities out of the model. If the openings are to big this is a problem.

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Watch the attached movie
# Open "Testfile 20220304_01" to reproduce the problem

VB-187192

Ambient Occlusion in Shaded viewports renders inconsistently; affected by current Zoom

Since 2021 I've had issues where the size and appearance of Ambient Occlusion is rendered inconsistently from one viewport "update" to the next... I think today I finally recognized what's causing this: for some reason it seems to be based on the current Zoom level that you're viewing the Sheet Layer. Clearly this should not be the case, as AO should only be dependent on the size of the actual Design Layer geometry plus the AO size determined in Lighting Settings.

I've captured the issue in the attached Screen Recording, in which I zoom out and hit Update to show that the AO is now smaller / more dense that it was previously. Then I update again after zooming backing in. Towards the end of the recording I duplicate the viewport and send to front / sent to back, to visually compare the two renders.

VWX file also attached. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190018

Faulty Braceworks Report Export

Hey guys,

we hat a customer complaining about the created Calculation reports of Braceworks.
The model from the export was scaled 10 times too small. In addition, various loads were attached to completely wrong Trusses (especially the hoists). This error occurred in Vectorworks v2021 and v2022. The structural analysis office uses the current RSTAB version.

The export with file format SCIA was recognized as faulty by RSTAB.

Upcoming questions from this customer:

Why is there no possibility to control the export?
Why isn't the industry standard IFC supported?
Why the outdated DSTV?
Why is the export SCIA also broken?

And also two points he mentioned, that are still not possible in 2022:
- Calculation of ground Support
- Pipes on raked trusses

I sent this to [~mstaffel] by Mail, but want this in here, too.

Thanks for helping out here.

VB-189523

# Open the attached file.
# Check the worksheet for information such as Cable Run ID prefix, Loom ID, Box ID, etc.

VB-185299

Spotlight Cable objects reshape mode doesn't connect cable to anything

If a cable is reshaped to connect to a new object (cable, distributor or consumer) both the cable and the object being connected to do not register that the cable has been connected. Nothing will change in the cable objects properties to document the new connection, the target will not display an auto-connect highlight and will also not register that the cable is connected in the power info connection dropdowns

This means that it is effectively impossible to use the reshape mode to make a new connection, or to reconnect a cable. The only option is to redraw the cable from scratch 		Kevin Linzey

VB-189570

Spotlight Cable Tools daisy chain mode fails to report properly in power planning device graph

When running cables to patch lighting units using the daisy-chained mode, lights patched after the first are not accounted for in the power planning palette.

The ability to daisy chain lighting units together is critical when using LED consumers.

To test this,
# open a blank document.
# Add a power source, a distributor or dimmer rack, and several lighting units.
# Connect the generator to the distributor with a cable to provide power.
# Use the cable insertion tool set to daisy-chain mode and patch lights.

Check the power planning palette for your results. 		Kevin Linzey

spotlight cable tools breakouts incorrect load and phase loading

VB-185014

Spotlight Cable Tools web palette unexpected display of L1, L2, L3 paths

In the component graph of the power planning palette, all the dimmers are reported to be in L2. All the Edison outputs and the consumers themselves all show they are in L1. The dimmer pack itself shows a balanced load between L1, L2, and L3. The blue lines mapping from the L outputs are properly drawn from L1 two dimmers one through four, from L2 out to dimmers five through eight, and from L3 out to dimmers nine through 12.

As an electrician, I would expect everything that gains power from L1 to report that it belongs to L1. Everything that reports being connected from output L2 should report that it belongs to L2, and respectively everything from L3 should do the same. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-188116

Spotlight Cable Tools incorrect cables being reported.

The worksheet is mixing cable types between the Used Parts Sum and the Used Parts Ordered fields. This creates incorrect equipment lists for users to send to suppliers. Kevin Linzey

As soon as all objects are selected (CMD+A) the 9 lighting devices are counted.

In addition to that, a phantom distro is created in the Power Planning Palette even after deleting the distro and reconnecting a new one.  This issue can be resolved by saving the file and reopening.

VB-189372

Mesh Causes File Size to Bloat

 

Mesh furniture (downloaded from various source) end up becoming very big mesh objects in VW, cause file size to bloat - Making it very hard to operate. 

We have to put the furniture into a separate file with the main model referenced in, to not cause performance issue when working with the main file.

See file with and without a few mesh objects in the Resources Browser.

It is normal workflow to have a lot of objects in the Resources Browser as we go through furniture options. 

See enclosed file... with or without mesh furniture objects the file can go up to 3x in size. 

(NB, this issue was originally posted as VB-183078 close to a year ago, but the focus was changed to multipane by the engineer)
!image-2022-07-29-02-27-43-784.png!!image-2022-07-29-02-27-52-561.png!

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-188157

Enscape objects: Not possible to control pen color

If you place an object from the Enscape asset library a document for the first time, object will have the pen color as set in the attributes palette at that moment. This is correct. But if you want to change the pen color afterwards, the object doesn't adapt to the setting. All Enscape objects which are placed later on will have that initial pen color, even if the attributes palette is set differently in the mean time.

The pen color of an Enscape object should be:
- (preferably) the color as indicated in the attributes palette, like with any other object type
- If it can handle just one color, it should always be black.

Now, if a user had set an unlucky pen color (like yellow) in the attributes palette the first time he/she placed an enscape object, the user is bound to that pen color for the rest of the project for all the enscape objects. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-189150

Localization ACC: Menu Command Document Settings - Standard Naming does not give proper result

When running the Standard Naming command, several things that should occur are not.
# Start with a blank document.
# Change the default fill color to something other than white. This helps show the problem.
# Add a Door and Window. The fill should be the previously chosen default.
# Document Setting | Standard Naming command.
# *Problem 1:* The first item should already be chosen...instead the popup shows blank.
# Choose the first option from the list - VW Arch. Also check Enable Auto-Classing. Click OK and answer Yes to the question applying to all objects.
# *Problem 2*: The fill has not changed as expected on the door and window. New doors and windows also do not display properly.

Note also that this is a problem that has been reported in the past with localization test builds. 		Payne Chang
VB-189518

Floating Document Windows Lose Focus When Docked Palettes are Used

Movie and test file are attached.

To reproduce:

- Drag the file header to create a floating document window
- Make the floating window active
- Now click in the OIP or change the active tab in the Nav Palette

Note that, as soon as you click, the focus changes to the application window and the active document disappears.

Since the docked palettes are showing info from the active file, it seems like you should be able to keep that file active/visible while accessing the palettes. Some operations, like changing the visibility of classes/layers in the Nav palette, work fine without causing the focus to change.

This only happens when the palette that's clicked-on is docked.

The same thing happened in past versions.
Ian Lane
VB-186189

Issues with windows exported as "IfcWindow"

Customers who try to export a window as IfcWindow are confronted with problems like a green solid that appears as an Opening element (in VW2021) or the window that is placed on the origin, instead of being inserted in the wall (in VW2022).
These issues were found while exporting Belgian Exterior Joinery objects to Ifc, but the issues seem to be linked to the IfcWindow tag. So, we presume that the same issues exist for US windows as well.
Mihail Rizov
VB-186678

IFC tagged objects in a group in a symbol are exported displaced to IFC

If you export the next objects to IFC, the objects will be displaced in the resulting IFC file:
Objects with an IFC tag, inside a group without an IFC tag, which is inside a symbol without an IFC tag. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-186948

Nested Symbols still do not export properly via IFC

Working on housing developments where there are not only repetitive floor plates, but repetitive unit typolgies, containing repetitive bathroom pods, kitchens, balcony and window assemblies, all of which are not possible with native PIOs, and have to be modelled as symbols, some containing PIOs, some containing nested symbols.


For efficiency we model the units as symbols, the pods as symbols, the kitchens as symbols and use symbol nesting.


However, there is a limit to this workflow.


Export a symbol inside a symbol via IFC and the nested symbol fails to export correctly, often with objects becoming misaligned in the IFC, located, it seems, relative to the internal origin of the host symbol. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-190072

Objects in symbols that are displaced are primarily plug-in objects.

Check the examples, please.

Thanks!

  		Mihail Rizov
VB-186673

Snapping to a referenced IFC sfile doesn't work

When you import an IFC file as a reference (automatic update off) you cannot snap to the objects in the file after closing and re- opening the file. Only when you update the reference, you can snap. With small IFC files, this is an option, but with large files, you can loose a lot of time because of this Mihail Rizov
VB-186349

Dislocated IFC export

A client of mine noticed that whenever they export our VectorMEP pipes to IFC, they get a dislocation on some elements.

I've investigated this further and noticed this only occurs whenever I manually change the path which means the first vertex of the path shifts away from the internal 0,0,0 origin. Since the objects are in the correct position within Vectorworks I assume this is a translation error when exporting our objects to IFC.

I have attached two images showcasing the difference in Vectorworks and BIMCollab as well as the original files.

  		Mihail Rizov

VB-186532

VB-185978

'2D Polys to 3D Source Data…' command produces geometrical errors

This command converts curves into straight line segments when it should not. Also, the curves that get converted to straight lines change every time the exact same procedure is run. 

Watch the video to understand. 

Method:

❗️ Does not occur with all geometric shapes.

❗️ Negative results occur ~90% of the time, but sometimes it converts fine. 

❗️ Negative results only occur if the 'Segmentation Length' field is used. I used 100mm in my tests. 
# Start with multiple, nested, *irregular* shapes, about 40,000 mm wide. 
# Select them all then use command, '2D Polys to 3D Source Data…' 
# Set:
## Start Elevation to 0
## Interval to 200 (mm)
## Segmentation Length to 100 (mm)
# Use EITHER 'Create 3D Polygons' or 'Create 3D Loci' because they both are affected by this problem.  		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-186743

T02287 - Lock profile plane on a EAP object prevents it from being sent to the surface

If you have an Extrude along path object with the "lock profile plane" box checked in the OIP, the "send to surface/fit path to object" command does not work on it.  It will work if you use the "elevate the object" option. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-186750

T02287 - Sending an EAP object to the site model surface can cause it to rotate

In the attached Vectorworks file, if you send the EAP object with a double profile to the surface of a site model with the "fit the path" option, the profile is rotated 90 degrees along the path axis. Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-191056

2023: Viewports move to Center of Page when View or Scale is changed

In the attached file, select the viewport and change its View to a different view such as Right. The viewport jumps to the center of the page (i.e. the X and Y coordinates of the center anchor point are now 0,0). This is an undesirable change in behavior from previous versions, wherein the viewport's X coordinate would be unchanged, keeping viewports aligned as per drafting conventions.

See screen recording which demonstrates the 2023 bug, along with a recording of the previous behavior in 2022.

Additionally, another user reported the same behavior here: https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/101560-vw2023-changing-sheet-layer-viewport-view-causes-viewport-to-jump-to-centre-of-page/ 		Rick Berge
VB-192178

In the attached file I have styled walls with doors and windows inserted. When I edited the file's Story to change the Z of the Base layerless level from 3 1/2" to 5 1/2", the inserted doors and windows no longer created openings in their walls. They appear correctly in 2D. Purging the file seems to repair the appearance of the inserted objects and their walls.

This occurred in the same file from which the sample geometry for VB-192177 originated, so these could be related bugs or corruptions. 		Christopher Graye

VB-191786

The attached screenshots show a model with a Renderworks Background set to "Two Color", with a gradient from orange to blue. The Shaded render looks as expected, but the Renderworks rendering adds an erroneous pink shade in the middle, so the view out of the windows looks completely wrong.

There's something wrong with the way renderworks is blending the two colors of the RW Background. Shaded is correct and matches how one would expect a gradient of those two colors should to be blended.

1) Create a Dimension with the Constrained Chain Mode.
Create some dimension lines.
2) Hover the cursor on the dimension and right-click.
3) Press "E" key to delete a dimension. It is deleted successfully.
And operate the same way several times.
(Or Press "D" key to add dimension and operate the same way several times.)
4) VW hangs up while the operation.

The hang-up doesn't seem to freeze completely, but it looks every tool and command doesn't work even "Quit" , and there is no way other than doing force shutdown on the task manager.

As long as we tried this seems to occur on Windows 10 only.
On Mac, the shortcuts don't seem to work.

VB-186787

Partially wrong transformations on DWG import & DWG referenced import

DWG import & by reference import work almost ok. However, there are some objects that do not transform properly - and should be fixed, or at least filtered.
This may be considered as either bug / enchancement request.

Use the attached files ("COS East Portion.dwg" and "projection.txt").
- Create a DWG referenced import - you will notice that some of the geometry is imported at the wrong location - thus, the viewport does not look ok.
- Create a pure DWG import - it looks mostly ok. However, some of the objects are with line size = 0, or somehow invisible. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-186620

DWG Referenced import of a Georeferenced file from Nav palette or Org dialog - workflow changes required.

After changing the referencing behavior for DWG files when referencing is started from the navigation palette or from the organizational dialog, it is now acceptable to import the GIS settings from the DWG/DXF file and apply them to the master document, in the same way we do that when starting referencing from the Import DWG/DXF menu command. However current referencing code is not prepared to work in that way. We should decide how to proceed - either to not allow direct using and applying of the GIS settings, i.e. using the Use Document georeference settings option only allowed OR to add the appropriate code in the Subscriptions.cpp in a similar way to the one we use now when starting from the import menu command.

I tend to follow the second approach because in VW2022 the reference with GIS settings is properly shown in regards to the geoimage and even stays on its place when updated, even in some cases seems that no GIS date are actually available... Now, probably due to T0 implementation, positioning and update does not work - probably this is the correct behavior, but for the end user it would appear as a regression.

It might be however easier to allow only the Use the document's coordinate system...

I used //depot/Engineering/Documents/Tests/VW28/Acceptance Tests/Interoperability and Support/DXF Import/Georeferencing/151-155 Chestnut Survey.dwg for testing. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-190897

Local Mapping doesn't export correctly

When exporting hatches with local mapping to dwg - hatches do not maintain continuity with VW version. In one export (attached) the same hatch comes in at different sizes and rotations. It is correct in one instance, but the others are off. Vasil Kitanov

# Even via Hardscape Settings..., Draw 3D > Main Area Components ... gives no access.
# Also, the one with Style "Granite edging" has lost it's Slab thickness, while it has Components with thicknesses.

VB-187548

Marionette: GCD and LCM need to be updated for Python 3.9

the GCD function was moved from fractions to math

I encountered two possible crashes when running the Home Screen acceptance tests for build 677773. Both crashes were during a transition to the main application from the home screen. Details and logs are labeled Crash 1 and Crash 2.

Crash 1:

I was running the test for creating a new file, clicking New and selecting Ok in the dialog. As the home screen closed and the main application appeared, the software closed. There are three logs, including dmp file, for this crash attached.

 

Crash 2:

In testing the operation of the Preferences button on the Message Center pane, I found the Preferences dialog was not appearing (previously logged in VB-190514). With the software in that state, I launched Zoom to record the screen for the bug. The attached video captures the following:

-The Preferences button was clicked multiple times to get the dialog which did not appear.

-The X of the Home Screen was clicked to exit the Home Screen.

-An attempt was made to click the Help menu to get to the build number in the About dialog, but the software closed.

One log file is attached for this (potential) crash.

*It is possible that a second mouse click was registered that actually closed the application after closing the Home Screen for Crash 2 as its log appears to show a routine shutdown. One strange thing in the log file, however, is that the serial number was replaced by "demo" in the last section of logging.

 

Crash 3:

Repeat of Crash 1 in build 689284. Attaching log files and .dmp file.

 

Crash 4: 

Repeat of Crash 1 in build 707692.  		Ian Lane
VB-187265

Lines not moving to Working Plane properly

If you have a bunch of 2D geometry that's set to Layer Plane, then go to a side view and change the plane dropdown in the OIP to Working Plane, all of that geometry should move to align with the current view, and the relationship between all of the geometry should remain the same.

However, there seems to be an issue were Line objects don't properly move to the Working Plane. Instead they get projected onto the Working Plane based on how they're currently drawn on the screen (this is a little hard to describe so take a look at the attached screen recording). It seems to not affect lines which happen to be perfectly perpendicular to the working plane; those move correctly. But all other lines behave incorrectly.

VWX test file also attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-189355

Using Ayrton lighting instruments from the Ayrton Moving Light library folder, there is a consistent crash/freeze issue with the Huracan symbol.

 

The symbol seems ok in top plan view but in 3D views it has been noticed that on some instances of the symbol there are parts missing such as yoke, base, body. 

 

When selecting Top View and trying to Export to DWG, the process causes a long infinite spinning wheel or crashes VWX. 

 

Test file and crash log file provided by user attached.  

Also attached is a screenshot showing where the file freezes in the exporting process.

 

Thanks 		Vasil Kitanov

The specific drawing is for a exhibition event. The stands has records on it, where the data of the client is filled in. To show the data, we use data tags.

VB-191131

Record Format: Popup list item modification causes selected values of other popups to change

In the attached document there is one rectangle object with a record format attached that has many different fields. Some of these fields are of the type popup.

To replicate the issue (see video):
1) open the document
2) (make sure the rectangle is selected) look at the set record field values in the OIP
3) edit the record format:
   modify the popup list for "16 Bauart" (this could be any other popup): just remove some of one popup list item
   confirm OK OK OK
--> watch most of the popup values change in the OIP to the first list item of the popups

Something very odd is going on here.

I suspect that there is a problem with this specific record format definition - possibly caused by one or several conversions in the past. Is there some kind of work around for our VIP customer?

I'm attaching both the original v2022 document of the customer and the small one with just a rectangle and a record format definition. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-185941

In Export DXF/DWF and Export DWF, the characters displayed in Section Viewport and Horizontal Section Viewport are not exported.

In Export DXF/DWF and Export DWF, when the Background Render of Section Viewport or Horizontal Section Viewport is set to Hidden Line / Dashed Hidden line / Polygon type rendering, the displayed characters are not extracted.
*Characters entered in Viewport Annotations are exported.

Reproduction example:
1) Open the sample file "12840.vwx". The Sheet Layer has a horizontal section viewport with the Background Render set to Hidden Line rendering, showing characters created using the Text Tool, Callout Tool, and Constrained Linear Dimension tools in the design layer.
2) Execute File> Export> "Export DXF/DWG ..." from the menu and click OK with the default settings to extract.
3) Execute File> Import> "Import Single DXF/DWG ..." from the menu to import the file extracted earlier with the default settings.
4) As a result of being imported, the characters are not extracted.

Please also refer to the reproduced movie "12840.mov".

VB-188177

Editing first or last chain dimension makes it disappear

In the attached file there's a chain dimension that when you select it and move the very first or last control handle, the respective dimension completely disappears from the chain. Screen recording attached of this happening.

I believe this only happens when the chain dimension was originally a single dimension, which you then right click and choose "Add Dimension" to create the chain. When you create a chain dimension directly using the second mode of the Dimension tool, this bug doesn't occur. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-191058

Dimensions in viewport annotations won't constrain to objects in design layers once they become unconstrained.

# In a design layer, place some objects and created constrained dimensions to those objects.  You'll see the green constraint indicators for them.
# Select a dimension and move the control point for one of the witness lines away from the object.  Notice the constraint is lost.
# Now move the same control point back to the object.  Notice the constraint is automatically obtained as seen by the green indicators.
# Delete the dimensions
# Create a sheet layer viewport of the design layer.
# Edit its annotations and place similar dimensions constraining to the objects from the design layer.  Note the green constraint indicators.
# Select a dimension and move the control point for one of the witness lines away from the object.  Notice the constraint is lost.
# Now move the same control point back to the object.
*BUG:* The constraint is not obtained leaving the dimension disconnected from the object.

This problem can result in many errors in drawings forcing users to abandon using viewport annotations or forcing them to examine many viewports and manually correcting them after editing the model. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-188693

When you change the units of a document, de dimensens in a symbol are not updated. Karthick Chilaka

VB-192512

Request for investigation- If Vectorworks2022 (series B) is started with a LAN cable connected, it may crash several tens of seconds after startup.

Request for investigation

If Vectorworks2022 (series B) is started with a LAN cable connected, it may crash several tens of seconds after startup.
Would you please give us some information on what causes this and how to fix it?

◎Customer's machine environment, etc.
OS: Windows 10
Network:
It uses a closed network called "LGWAN" that can only be used within national, prefectural and local governments.

◎Remarks
-Occurs when VW2022 is started with a LAN cable connected. If VW2022 is started with the LAN cable disconnected, there is no problem, but if the LAN cable is connected after startup, the amount of memory used by WV2022 increases rapidly and eventually crashes.
*Please refer to "Task Manager.png" for the state of the sudden increase in memory usage.

-When starting Vectorworks for the first time after connecting a LAN cable, the Vectorworks account sign-in screen was not displayed.

-In the safe mode of the OS, the error "Failed to create the safe-pipe socket with error 10050/WSAENETWOWN...." is displayed and VW cannot be started.
*Please refer to "Safemode.png" for the state of the error.

-The customer has previously used VW2015 series B, and there is no problem with VW2015 even in the same machine environment. Therefore, there is a possibility that the specification change after VW2016 is affecting this issue.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Tim Ardoin

VB-187235

T02121 Unified View turned itself off in document w/ Legacy 2D Features disabled - Reproduced!

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
Update from Andy Broomell:
Okay okay okay......... I think I just found repeatable steps!!!!

3064_IntCrownChicken_230120_WorkingFile_V06_AEB.vwx

Download this file, and double check that "Unable Legacy 2D Features" and "Turn off Unified view" are both UNchecked.

In the Nav Palette, the Design Layer called "Crown Chicken" is Active. Right click the other Design Layer called "SKP Import" and choose Duplicate. Then choose both "SKP Import" and "SKP Import-2" Layers, right click, and choose Delete. Those layers are removed and you're taken to the Sheet Layer "Letter" as the Active Layer. At this point, check Document Preferences and you'll see that there is now a checkmark next to "Turn Off Unified View." And if you make another Design Layer, it operates independentlly from "Crown Chicken" indicating that Unified View is indeed turned off. This should not be possible since "Enable Legacy 2D Features" is turned off.
/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Somehow in the last 24 hours Unified View turned itself OFF in the attached filed. This shouldn't even be possible since legacy 2D features are disabled (and always have been) in this file.

I first noticed that navigating in 3D on a single Design Layer was incredibly slow, then when I turned on my other Design Layers I discovered the issue with Unified View being 'off.'

How did this happen?

(For now I've fixed the issue by turning on legacy 2D features, unchecking the Turn Off Unified View checkbox, then turning legacy 2D features back off.) 		Josh Loy

VB-192155

VW2023 SP1 - Viewer

Reported by Casper:

Customer is running OS X 12.6.1 and has VW2023's Viewer installed. When opened and palettes are docked, VW 2023 Viewer exits. And then opened again, the palettes are not shown again. You will need to restore the user folder to fix this.

You should be able to dock the palettes and save that. On Windows, the palettes are already docked, and I don't experience this problem. So it really seems to be a Mac related problem.

Customer melt that this was also already the case with VW2022's Viewer. 		Tim Ardoin
VB-187118

Vectorworks with dongle doesn't start on Mac OS 12.3.1

Many of our customers with a dongle serial number (B-series) have issues after the update to Mac OS 12.3.1. The dongle is functional (it lights up), but Vectorworks can not find it.

The server site protection software has the same issue. If the network license functions works with a dongle, the server software will stop immediately after starting when a machine is updated to Mac OS 12.3.1. Dongle drivers were updated in all cases.

I added the SPX file of the server computer where the site protection software didn't start. If you need an SPX file of one of the computers where Vectorworks didn't start, let us know. 		Tim Ardoin

VB-192085

Login at first start up fails regulary, especially on Mac

Many users have the issue they can't log in at first start up because of permission issues. This can be resolved by assigning "read and write" permissions to the Vectorworks folders in the application support as you can see in issue "https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/GS-64835".

Lately, it seems that on every Mac where Vectorworks needs to be started for the first time, users can't log in because of this issue. This is a very inconvenient experience for the customer and puts a lot of pressure on our customer support department.

Vectorworks should regulate the login in a different way, so no change in permission settings are needed. 		Mark Farnan
VB-191344

2023 installer not giving invalid serial error

I had a customer who would run the the 2023 installer, put in his license and all the agreements and get an error "An error has occurred and installation could not be completed, Please contact support. Press "Exit" to quit the installer"

I asked him for his license number and this is what he sent me

EJXUSZ-JG6KG2-ZBZWZ2GOHGS0

He is missing a dash and input a letter O 

This is his correct license.EJXUSZ-JZ6KG2-ZBZWZ2-G0HGS0

I sent him that and the installer works.

I am wondering why he did not get an invalid serial number right at the start?  		Tim Ardoin

VB-189864

VB-192351

Spotlight instrument summary position height and fixture weights not working

The position height setting of the instrument summary is broken, it doesn't matter whether the summary is filtered to a hanging position, truss position name or other filter option, the position height will not be correctly displayed in the summary, once its added.

The fixture weight option will not work unless the user manually adds the light info m record back onto the lighting devices' definition in the resource manager.
I can reproduce both of these issues and have had them reported separately from user in Israel during the AB electronics workshop yesturday

# The application is open to the Home Screen.
# An instance of Chrome is already running.
# Sample Files is clicked.
# *The correct (filtered) results are loaded on the web page.
# Chrome is closed.
# Sample Files is clicked again.
# Chrome is launched, initially with the correct URL.
# The URL changes to the default course page.
# The incorrect (unfiltered) courses are loaded.

VB-191186

KLS: A grid of grid Lines out of Shape when changing layer Scale

First of all, this is a bugreport from one of our very important customers in Germany, which is ppp architects in Hamburg.
The recently switched from 2021 to 2022 and ran into this when testing the new version.

Situation is, that you create a grid of lines and use it for curating plans and layout on sheet layer. If you create a sheet layer viewport in the scale of the design layers, then everything's fine. But I you change the scale the grid of grid lines does not really adjust its dimensions to the new scale and the grid looks out of shape. See video.

With respect to the common workflow of using grids in architecture, we consider this a bug. A bug with very high priority.
If you don't call it bug, then please make it a wish with a very high priority.

Thanks and regards, Klaus Lüttich 		Josh Loy

VB-187390

Data Visualization doesn't work correctly on Wall textures

Data Visualization should hypothetically be able to override one texture in a model with another. However this is currently impossible when working with Wall objects, due to unreliable results.

In the attached file there are two sets of walls, which are using the same Wall Style, but one set of walls is textured By Component and the other set is textured By Object.

There is also a Data Vis which is set up to replace "Wall Framing RT" with "Carpet Red RT." Try enabling the Data Vis and you'll see that it doesn't work correctly on any of the walls:

Issue 1: Walls which are textured By Component get entirely replaced with "Carpet Red RT" instead of only the wall component that had the "Wall Framing RT" texture.

Issue 2: Walls which are textured By Object get the *wrong* Part replaced. The Data Vis is replacing the "Paint White RT" on the Right side of the wall instead of the "Wall Framing RT" on the Left side of the wall.

Along with the VWX file, there are screengrabs showing 1) the original model, 2) the Data Vis applied showing erroneous results, and 3) the expected results which I've re-textured manually. 		Christopher Graye

VB-192027

Material loses texture if textures disabled

I noticed this because in the last autobuild (680389) textures are disabled on Mac Intel.

Not sure which step fails, but I don't think this is what we want to happen.

Please, see the video attached.

I have a Material with a Texture. I edit the Material, change its fill (note it still shows that it has a Texture), close the dialog. The preview does not have the texture. This is expected, we cannot draw it. If I reopen the Edit dialog, the texture is still there.

Now I do Save and commit, and open the file on Windows.

The Material has texture None. I think this is incorrect, we should preserve the texture even if textures are disabled at the moment. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-187069

Machine Freezing the Rebooting

EU is having a problem where when he is using VW (specifically when he is entering data in the OIP) his machine will freeze, and then if he just waits a few minutes then his system reboots. We have tried looking into everything we could, and came up short. He then looked into the background processes (I had mentioned it could be something conflicting with VW) and found Adobe Creative Cloud was a startup app running in the background. He disabled it opening at startup and isn't opening it himself, and now his freezing/rebooting has stopped. I have attached his system report and a file he created that describes what he is doing when it freezes and reboots. Ian Lane
VB-191468

Horizontal Section: Cut Graphics from Plug-in Objects Shifted

# Open the attached VWX file.
You will see a horizontal section on the sheet layer.
Notice the black partial section graphic at the bottom of the viewport.  That graphic is coming from the second Structural Member object from the bottom.
# Right-click on the viewport and choose the "Edit In-place" context menu command.
# Select that Structural Member (2nd from bottom) and move or nudge it up/down on the page.
Notice how the cut graphics shifts to the left/right.
# Select the Framing Member (2nd from the top) and move or nudge it down on the page.
Notice how the cut graphic appears below and shoots to the right as the Framing Member is moved down on the page.

NOTE:  Both the Structural Member and Framing Member have a 45º pitch.  The two objects at the very top on the page have a 60º pitch.  Selecting those and moving them down will have the same effect.

*This is a regression from VW27.0.5(664120)* 		Josh Loy

VB-185371

Internal Origin Marker - snap points on blue circle

When drawing or moving objects in Top/Plan, the blue circle of the Internal Origin Marker has snap points even though it's a glyph that shouldn't be snappable at all. Only the 0,0 origin itself should be snappable. See attached video.

 

I believe this issue has been present since 2022 came out. 		Josh Loy
VB-189181

Window Elevation: jamb is included even when size reference is set to Sash Opening

Please see the attached video which explains the issue better than I could type it out...

The video is also posted in this thread: 

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/99032-setting-window-elevation-major-issue-or-am-i-crazy/]

Basically, when a window object has its size reference set to "Sash Opening" the 3D window is being drawn at the wrong elevation compared to the "Elevation" that you set in the OIP. The elevation that you determine should be at the sash opening (same as INSIDE of the jamb), however the window is currently drawn with the elevation at the OUTSIDE of the jamb (or the overall unit size). So for example if the jamb is 3/4" of an inch thick, the window ends up either 3/4" too high or too low in the wall, depending if you're setting the elevation at Head or Sill of window.

In 2023 this issue is highlighted by the placement of the blue editing handles, which appear misaligned with the 3D window. However the handles are in the 'correct' spot and it's the window geometry which is wrong.

I'm not sure if this affects other size reference configurations other than "Sash Opening" since that's is the only one I use. I briefly tried "Unit Size" just now and that one seems to work as expected.

Once it's fixed the goal should be that you can set the head of the window to 6'-8" and it would be at the exact same elevation as a 6'-8" door. File attached to demonstrate that this currently doesn't happen.

 

I want to also share Don Seidel's blunt but accurate comment from the thread: "Yes... longtime bug. VW users would expect this bug to be embarrassing enough as to get an immediate fix..."

  		Christopher Graye
VB-189729

2022 Freezes on export to 2020 & 2019

Exporting this file to 2020, and 2019 will spin/crash the app.

Even tried exporting to 2021, opened the file in 2021 and it also froze/spin on export.

 

 

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-189807

TextureMappingInfoSDK f2DRotation behaves differently for render lights

Applying a texture to a render light (new in 2023) behaves differently than regular textures in the SDK.

TextureMappingInfoSDK.f2DRotation appears to require degrees.

This could either be a bug in the SDK or an issue with documentation (RenderOptionsValues.h line 384).

I'm flagging this as High, as if this is an SDK bug, I would need to know in enough time pre-release to change. If this is just a documentation issue, than the priority is lower, but it should be a very easy fix. 		Justin Hutchison

In fact...

Many things in the drawing no longer behave as expected. The menu items grey out. The key pad no longer controls the 3D views. Each keypad entry causes the screen to pan left. 

Tools still seem to work. The menu items do not work using the key stroke combinations command Q, command S etc.

I had to force quit vectorworks. I realized on recreating the bug that I could quit by using the mouse to activate the menu commands.

In the last movie you can see I open a file and test the dimension. It will edit as expected. I then created a new document and attempted to edit the dimension. It does not work.

I would classify this as one of the worst bugs I have seen - because it is easy to cause and it debilitates the program. 		Josh Loy

VB-189034

2023: Vectorworks 2023 unable to be used all of a sudden! Very weird licencing errors/ too many activations/eval mode unable to save/Click ok> then quits

Hello,
Gosh this is strange. I have only one user account on this new machine. Only one installation of 2023.
I did do a full installation of our SP4 with a renamed user folder for testing for our release soon of SP4. I was drawing in that version and saved a file.

I then went back to 2023 which was open and was working fine. I opened the 2022 file and it converted it. I selected the Spotlight Blended Screen object and got the message about "Vectorworks can not save the preferences!"

Eventually I quit then reopened. I then get a message about it needing re-activation and click ok. I then get the message about the fact it has been activated too many times and will quit. However it does open.
When I then open the file (and converts it to 2023) I get the next message saying that it is running in Evaluation mode and can't be saved! If I then click OK it quits!!

File and screenshots and movie and user folder enclosed. I deleted the Vectorworks user folder and the same thing happens!

I am going to run the uninstaller and re-install from scratch as I am unable to run it.

Cheers,
Peter






Tim Ardoin

VB-190277

Windows - multi-line text objects lose linebreaks, render garbled overlaid text

UPDATE: this bug is caused by some data corruption in AppData\Roaming\Nemetschek\Vectorworks\2023 folder. When it occurs, the bug will happen in any 28.0.x build on the local machine (does not seem to be due to a certain code change). Renaming/removing the data folder will correct the issue.

To reproduce, once data is in the state:
# Open sample .rtf file in WordPad; select and copy all text
# Create new VectorWorks document
# Activate text tool and create a new text object, active for edit
# Paste the copied multi-line rtf text

EXPECTED: The copied rich text pastes into the text object with linebreaks and styles intact

ACTUAL: the pasted text is badly formatted all on one line, with multiple lines of content overlapping

Also, this can actually happen simply by trying to type into a text object that has been sized with wrapping enabled - it is not specifically related to paste, it's a general issue with the text engine failing to insert linebreaks as it renders the text.

Hopefully this is a difficult state to get into (I've run many different 2023 beta builds etc. through many changes of the software, including localization testing, without removing my data folder). Nonetheless I think the severity of this bug makes it worth continuing to investigate.

I've attached a 7-zip archive of the data folder that produced the issue. 		Rick Berge

Why the inconsistency?

The default behaviour should be consistent between the tools, one way or another.  		Josh Loy

VB-187032

Can't mirror certain objects in Annotations

I keep running into issues where certain 2D objects within SLVP Annotations behave strangely. It seems to occur with objects that are ether:

• Pasted into the VP from elsewhere, or

• Created using the Paint bucket mode of the 2D Polygon tool.

 

The issues that occur might include:

• Inability to mirror these objects (the mirrored copy ends up in the same spot as the original). Example file below.

• Moving the viewport leaves the object in its original place (it doesn't move with the viewport) OR the object moves a different vector than the viewport.

• Other oddities like the object suddenly being rotated 90° and moved way off to the side.

 

I've attached a file that exhibits the issue where I can't mirror an object. Open the file, double click the viewport, select the dashed small circle representing the hinge, then try mirroring it using the second mode of the mirror tool. The duplicate ends up right where the original was. 		Rick Berge

VB-184873

Glow texture cannot not cast shadows

In the attached file

With 2 lower extrudes one with textures set to cast shadows and one not cast shadows. When a point source is placed above them they behave as intended one casts shadows and one does not. However, when the point source is removed and replaced by an extrude with a glow texture applied. Both extrudes cast shadows irrespective of their settings.

VB-189817

WS: Function IF does not work for PON='SLAB' in German version

I write "German" version, because I have no other localized version to test this with, but I'm pretty sure this issue affects all but the international version of Vectorworks.

To replicate (see video):
1) open attached document (IF-slab-02.vwx) in VW27.0.4 (international version)
2) recalculate the shown worksheet to be sure it's up-to-date
> the formula {color:#333333}=IF((PON='SLAB'); AREA; '--'){color} *works* and shows us the area
3) open attached document in VW27.0.4 (German version) - 5b works, too!
[VW27.0.5b(652868-17561)_Mac.zip|https://www.dropbox.com/s/hj2pw84javwrz1k/VW27.0.5b%28652868-17561%29_Mac.zip?dl=1]
[VW27.0.5b(652868-17561)_Win.zip|https://www.dropbox.com/s/g9885r0sihonjre/VW27.0.5b%28652868-17561%29_Win.zip?dl=1]
4) recalculate the shown worksheet ("Aktive Tabelle aktualisieren")
> the formula =IF((PON='SLAB'); AREA; '--')

does not work and shows us '--'

According to the replies on VB-189661 this formula should work.

If this is not a bug, then what is the solution? 		Hugues Tsafak

VB-188085

Data Bar input sometimes fails in 3d view

This one is a little complicate to describe. I have attached a video, and the file, which should help.

Entering values into the Data Bar (tab to field; type in value; hit return to lock) is one of the most useful features. It works more or less flawlessly in Top/Plan View. However I often have trouble with it in 3d views. In this example I am in a straight-on frontal view and tying to draw a line of a specific length, along the angle of the edge of an extrude (a modeled rafter, or truss). As you will see in the video, I get inconsistent results. This is not new to this version or build. I have encountered it frequently in previous versions.

My understanding of the functionality is that once the user-desired value has been entered, the value creates a visible, highlighted constraint. And that once the content has been "locked", the next (or final) mouse click, to end the drawing operation, should create an object (in this case a line) in which the final result(in this case the length) never varies from the user-inputted value. As you can see in the video this is often not the case.

If my use of the future is incorrect please advise as to how to correct it.

Let me know if you need more info, and thanks. 		Josh Loy
VB-187597

VB-187106

Scaling a viewport with vertices

In VW 2020, when you group a viewport and then deform the group, that deformation changes the scale parameter of the viewport.
In VW 2022, when you group a viewport and then try to deform the group, that action only leads to moving the group. The scale remains unchanged.

Was this change was deliberate or not? If not, it might make sense to revert back to the 'old' behavior. If this is a deliberate change, we need arguments to explain the customer why it happened. 		Rick Berge
VB-186897

When using multiple view panes the OIP sometimes stops responding to selected objects.

When using multiple view panes in a file for a extended period of time I am finding that the OIP starts to not respond to selected objects. Right clicking an object to bing up its properties works as expected however the OIP either remains blank or it is still showing a previous selection. This does not happen in any particular time fame or with any sequence of tasks. It progressively gets worse as well and the only way to correct it is to restart VW. I have not been able to reproduce this under any other condition that with the use of multi-view panes.

VB-184856

Line Types and/or Hatches dramatically increase memory consumption

Not sure if the following computational performance is fair to expect or if the software incurs some very inefficient code when these conditions apply, but either way this warrants review due to how extreme the results are. 

See the user file supplied. The 'Surfaces' Design Layer contains 2000 objects, but they are all efficiently-drawn 2D polygon or polyline objects and rectangles, etc. Many of these objects have Hatches applied as well as Line Types. When you open this file on Windows and navigate to the 'Surfaces' Design Layer, you'll see in Task Manager memory consumption increases a massive amount, then after a lot of processing will decrease. (See attached screenshot series). 

The user's computer has 16GB of RAM and it crashes every time doing this process. Mine has 32GB and manages to get through despite RAM maxing out and the 'Committed Memory' (extended memory on the hard drive) reaching 68GB! 

After changing the Line and Fill attributes to 'Solid' for all objects on this Design Layer, the file performs great. 

I thought the way Vectorworks displayed repeatable geometry (such as symbols, hatches and line types) was done in an efficient way, something like: One instance of the pattern is stored in memory, then Vectorworks tells the graphics card the scale and extents inside which to repeat the pattern. In theory this should be very efficient, at least compared to defining the geometry for every location the pattern should appear. So why is this so terribly resource hungry? The graphics card doesn't seem to working very hard at all and while the VRAM consumption is among the highest I've seen for a file, it seems super low _compared to the [main] memory consumption_. 

*Is this a bug (or inefficient code)?* 		Josh Loy
VB-186758

VS ScreenVecToModelVec() & ScreenPtToModelPt2D() also appear to be broken

VectorScript calls ScreenVecToModelVec() & ScreenPtToModelPt2D() also apper to be broken, but I have not been able to determine exactly how they misbehave. 

The only thing I did observe is that they return the same values in VW2020 as they do in VW 2019, but only if you input the broken values generated by ModelVecToScreenVec(), and ModelPt2DToScreenPt(). Therefore, it stands to reason, if you input real Screen coordinates from the rotated Plan, you will not get the Model coordinates you are expecting.

Please see: (*VB-186726) VS ModelVecToScreenVec() & ModelPt2DToScreenPt() return incorrect values in VW 2020 and newer*

Thank you. 		Josh Loy
