VB-185572

Project Sharing - Checkout Dialog Appears When Attributes Palette Menus are Expanded (Mac Only)

Movie and Project File are attached. The file contains a Rectangle with a Hatch applied, and has the "Use Local Mapping" option enabled.

To reproduce:

-Select the Rectangle
-In the Attributes palette, click on the three-dot buttons to expand either the fill mapping menu or the Drop Shadows menu

Note that, as soon as you click on the button, the object checkout dialog appears and the Attributes palette menu flashes briefly then disappears.

This feels pretty awkward from a usability perspective since it forces the user to have to expand the Attributes palette menu again once they've confirmed the checkout.

If I try this on Windows the checkout dialog doesn't show until an actual change is made to the mapping, and the mapping menu remains expanded even after the checkout is done. Ideally this would work the same way on Mac.

Ian Lane
VB-185149

Some disabled list browser controls are not grayed and appear to be editable

There may be more types of controls that have this issue, but the following shows the one I'm aware of:

Steps to reproduce:
# Select the Wall tool
# Open the Wall Preferences dialog
# Choose a Wall Style
# Click the "Wall Closure at Inserts" button
# Go to the Wrapping tab (Screenshot.png)
*BUG:*  The checkmark shown in the Core column is read-only and cannot be changed.  However, it does not display grayed to indicate that.
# Click in the "Wrap" column for the first two components (rows) in the list browser so that they select with a checkmark icon.
Note:  All items in the columns to the right of the checkmark will enable and allow editing.
# Click to select (with a checkmark) the items in the Wrap to Insert and the next column to the right.
# Now click in the "Wrap" column for the second component (row) in the list browser so that it deselects (no checkmark).
*BUG:*  All items to the right of the "Wrap" column will become disabled but the two checkmark icons re not grayed and appear to be editable.  They should be grayed like the other items.

 

This issue makes the UI confusing and makes understanding the behaviors of these controls very difficult. 		Ian Lane
VB-185301

On specific machine customer: Import PDF is not possible

On a specific machine it is not possible to import any PDF. You'll get the error "Some or all pages cannot be loaded" and the PDF doesn't get imported. This is the case with all Vectorworks versions.
We tried already the next things:
- Re-install the windows redistributables
- Disable the anti malware software
- End all unusual an bloatware- related processes in the task manager
- Re- install Vectorworks

In the attachment, you can find the DXdiag, the error and the list of installed software on that computer.

We got the next answer from tech support:

"Hi Yana,

I have seen something similar a few years ago that was caused by missing Windows components, specifically Microsoft Visual C++ redistributables. Can you send me a list of their installed applications and their dxdiag.txt so I can investigate?

Thanks,

JOSEPH BLOCK
SENIOR TECHNICAL SUPPORT MANAGER
D: 443.542.0411"

We sent the required information, but didn't get any answer last month, despite a reminder. That's why I bring this case straight to Jira, since I don't know where else to look for answers. 		Josh Loy

VB-184585

Rotated VP Hidden line missing geometry

User has a rotated viewport in Top mode in hidden line.  The rotated viewport is inconsistent in generating all the geometry.

The user started with a rotated design layer and made a viewport.

I tried returning the design layer to a regular top/plan orientation to rotate back to 0 degrees rotation.  Moved to Top and created a new viewport.

VB-190271

Importing/replacing a Plug-in Object Style with the same as one already in the document for a different type of Plug-in object causes the original Style to be deleted and all instances of that style become unstyled.

The behavior described in this VB began with change 668533 submitted to Mainline (to fix VB-178619).  This change is is dealing with the end result of the Resource Resolution System and helps to prevent objects from becoming corrupt by using a PIO designed for a different PIO type.  While the change helps, the end result is not good for users.

To reproduce the problem:
# Create a new blank document.
# Place an unstyled instance of a stylable Plug-in object (eg: a Base Cabinet).
# Right-click on the object and use the "New Plug-in Style from Unstyled Plug-in…" context menu command to create a style with a simple name.
# Create another new blank document.
# Place an unstyled instance of another type of stylable Plug-in object (eg: a Utility Cabinet).
# Right-click on the object and use the "New Plug-in Style from Unstyled Plug-in…" context menu command to create a style with the same name as the one in the first document.
# Go back to the first document and use the Resource Manager to import the style from the second document.  "The Resource Name Conflict" dialog will appear.
# In the "Resource Name Conflict" dialog, choose the option to "Replace the symbol definition in the current document" and click OK.

Notice the imported Style replaces the old one and all instances of that Style become unstyled.  This problem can easily go unnoticed and cause problems later in the project.  Users will have to recreate the PIO style (which can be very difficult for PIOs with many parameters), then they need to figure out which unstyled PIOs scattered throughout the model had the original Style and apply the new Style. 		Rick Berge
VB-190547

wrong texture view on the Hedgerow with rounded shapes

Reported by Agnieska:

the texture on the side of a hedge with rounded shapes is not spreading correctly 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-190905

Hardscape: using 2D attributes by class doesn't work as it should

When you create a hardscape in an empty document, you can edit the 2D fill color via the attributes pallet. However, when you try to manage this fill color by the class, things go wrong. when you turn the "use at creation" option on in the object's class settings, you see that the attributes palette show the correct information. But the hardscape itself show another fill color. The fill color it shows, is the fill collor of the class set in the 2D fill settings in the hardscape wich are pused trough. This behavior is very inconsistent. Alexandra Beshevlieva

# Draw a rectangle.
# Without closing the Edit Layout goup, from the Resource Manager edit the TBB style.
# In the Edit style dialog choose "Title Block" pane - "Import Title Block Graphics..." and import new graphics. Exit with OK.

VB-191365

Plant Data visibilites

In the Plant Style editor there is a page called More Data

This has a Field Visibility button and can be set to by style

In a recent training session the customer Plant Library manager set up a plant with the correct field visibilities she wants the company to have and with 'by style' checked. She then saved this in the company workgroup folder.

When other users opened the plant the field visibilites had not come across. They had all refreshed the libraries (the plant was there and had the other changes she had made)

When the Plant Library manager edited another plant she found it now had the same field visibilites.

This implies that this is a machine setting rather than a style setting. That is not necessarrily bad but it is not obvious. Also it would be good if resource managers could dictate this and roll it out across all computers without each user having to set it up seperately (as they had to do) 		Alexandra Beshevlieva

VB-192445

Create grade limits from planar pad - not the expected result

When using the command "Create grade limits from planar pad..." the result isn't what the user expects.

In the dialog box a (maximum) slope is set:

!image-2022-12-21-11-32-46-884.png|width=263,height=329!
# In the drawing, the calculations don't calculate correctly around the corners.
!image-2022-12-21-13-05-42-854.png|width=508,height=303!
# The "Test Increment" also indicates the minimal distance of the grade limit to the planar pad. This is not what the dialog box or the help says.
This value shouldn't be used for a minimal grade limit distance. Where the planar pad crosses a height line, the grade limit should touch the planar pad.

VB-191758

Several bugs found on DTM use

1 The command Simplify 3D polys creates simplified polys on new layers e+ven when this option is not selected

2 Until 2023 a closed 2D polygon could be used to define the boundary of a DTM, not anymore. As a workaround one can edit the DTM boundary on the object info Edit crop, by deleting the existing polygon VW has created and pasting in place a 2D polygon.

3 A section Viewport of a DTM creates no section line or fill even thought the section class is correctly set to have a line and fill in black and with the Use at creation option checked. I've also checked the advanced properties and all is correct. Section Fill only shows while on Shaded rendering, not on Hidden line.

4 The Section Viewport only shows the correct projection on orthogonal or perspective mode. Any other projection only shows if the viewport is on Hidden line mode. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

WMS does work pretty fine while WFS obviously does not work.
There's a really big amount of data behind those url. So my question, is there a limitation of data in Vectorworks?
The freeware QGIS on the other side can handle the data. It takes about an hour to read (download) all the data, but then the downloaded buildings are all visible.

Vectorworks tells me, that unsupported service type. How can that be? These are official url from the city of Berlin.
Could you please have a look?

VB-190139

GIS Feature service - Issue Netherlands

The following feature service does not work in Vectorworks:[https://data.3dbag.nl/api/BAG3D_v2/wfs?request=getcapabilities]

 

It is a WFS often used in the Netherlands and contains 3D objects.

"The 3D BAG is an up-to-date data set containing 3D building models of the Netherlands. The 3D BAG is open data. It contains 3D models at multiple levels of detail, which are generated by combining two open data sets: the building data from the BAG and the height data from the AHN. The 3D BAG is updated regularly, keeping it up-to-date with the latest openly available building stock and elevation information.([https://docs.3dbag.nl/en/)]

This is what it looks like online: https://www.arcgis.com/home/webscene/viewer.html?webscene=abd5e3c4b173417f8c14f1283dee33c6

links via ArcGIS: https://www.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=abd5e3c4b173417f8c14f1283dee33c6

 

Vectorworks produces the following error message when this url is used (see attached)

GIS Error Lag.txt

CPLErr( 3 ), err_no( 1 ) /vsicurl_streaming/http://schemas.opengis.net/iso/19139/20070417/gsr/spatialReferencing.xsd:19:39 type 'http://www.opengis.net/gml/3.2:AbstractCRS' not found. You may retry with the HANDLE_MULTIPLE_IMPORTS=YES open option

 

I am guessing cause it needs to import 2 datasets?

 

We often get the question from clients why they can not use this URL.

My guess is that the term 'WFS' in the URL gives the wrong impression it can be read in Vectorworks. Checking the ArcGIS online options it seems to be listed as a Map Service.

 

Could you help me finding an informed answer why this is so?

Thanks! in advance

 

  		Vladislav Stanev

VB-189664

DOM: Marionette Stile, Script Update regenerates PIOs too much

I think it is hard on the limit of Bug or WAD. As far As I can see, we regenerate die PIOs times (even more if we have path objects) 3 times.

1. When we Enter the script via Style Window (Exit Dialog in fact)
2. When we leave the Script Re-Enter the Style Dialog
3. When we Exit the Stile Dialog when we Exit with OK

What maybe could be improved
1. By Edit the Script the dialog window saves the settings of the dialog but do not regenerate the PIOs
2. By leaving the Script the Dialog settings are also applied and the dialog is not shown again.
3. Implementing to edit the Script without enter the Dialog.

I understand that the logic of the dialog and the edit button inside the Dialoge produces this behavior as WAD but maybe you have a god Idea to prevent the amount of Marionette PIO Updates.
Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-187942

DOM: Edit marionette path PIO, code runs twice

If I run this attached path object (reduces example, just one node "Marionette"), we can see the code runs if i move or "reset" the object. If I edit the path the code runs twice.

There is a counter (record) attached to the pio which adds +1 by moving or resetting the counter count +1. If I edit the path the counter count +1.

Also the issue could be that the script needs longer to execute, because it does everything twice instead of one. Is there any workaround? I played around with objectvariableboolean 1167 but without success.

Attached a movie "Example Usage.mp4" which shows what I wanted to do. The Script tracks if a point is new, moved or replaced. This will not work because the script runs always twice if I edit the path.

Also tested with 2023 Beta. Same behaviour. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-187295

T02315 - By-Style End Conditions Get Handled Oddly on Mirrored Members

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a styled Member that has its Start and End Conditions set by-style (start is set to Horizontal and end is set to Vertical).

To reproduce:

-Mirror the member as shown

Note that everything looks fine at this point.

-Now edit the style and click OK without making any changes

Note that now the start/end conditions get flipped for the mirrored object.

In a way this is working correctly, since mirroring an SM causes its start/end to swap by design. Ideally though the swapped state would show immediately after the mirror operation instead of showing it only after the next style edit.

Christopher Graye
VB-187660

View Previous/Next buggy with data visualization changes

If you have a Vectorworks document with some visualizations defined, when you change the active visualization it looks like it changes the view stack. For example, the previous button becomes enabled.

However the Previous and Next buttons behave erratically. You have to click Previous more than once to get back to the prior visualization. Also Next does not become enabled to bring you back forward.

To reproduce:
# Open the attached document - note that there are two layers and data visualization is set to None.
# In the data visualization list drop-down from the view bar, select Layer Visualization 1 - you should see the Layer 1 objects become red
# Now select Layer Visualization 2 - you should see the Layer 2 objects become blue
# Now click the Back button

EXPECTED: the document switches back to the Layer 1 (red) visualization, then you can click back again to go back to None, or click forward to go back to Layer 2 (blue), etc.

ACTUAL: the first click does nothing, but the back button stays enabled; if you click it again (or maybe a couple of times) it will finally work at bringing you back to the Layer 1 visualization, but now the forward button is disabled. You actually have to click back many more times (4 or 5) to get back to "None", and again the forward button is disabled.

So in general, Back and Forward are broken with data visualization navigation, but it seems like they were intended to work.

UPDATE: happens on both Mac and Windows 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-184800

format's SetFieldName has no handling for too-long names

Spotlight Inventory task is making this more accessible to plugins etc, so we'll have more problems too. The lower level APIs don't check if the name is too long for the field to store, and have no ability to return either an error or a modified name.

I suggested they handle it in the VWFC class method they add, but the lower levels need something too. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-192171

BUG: Wall-Joints + command "Move" OR "Move 3D"

Hi VW-Team,

 

as architect, I work a lot with walls, we can say the wall-tool is one of the most
important tools for me in everyday use.

 

I found a bug, or maybe it is w-a-d (works as designed),
but this bothers me since years and I want to have it fixed.

 

The bug is related to the commands “Move” and “Move 3D” +
walls with Wall-Joints (L- or T-Joints).

If I move my walls to a new position, I want to use the “Move” or
“Move 3D” command, because I find it better to move by command
instead of move by mouse.

Side note:
If you move walls by mouse, you don't get the bug I describe here!

… but if you move your walls with the above-mentioned commands,
all capped Joints will be overwritten to uncapped Joints and you
have to reconnect the walls.

This shouldn't happen!
I think this behavior isn't intended to the commands!

Attached you find a video + test document.

In the video, I show only T-Joints,
but L-Joints are also affected

Please fix this bug that existed for a long time.

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Christopher Graye

VB-184865

Property Line: values are out of place

Attached is a test-file with 2 different Property Lines.

In both Property Lines we can see that the values/text aren't all in place.

As example, the left one has some values a bit more far away from the Line than expected and other values are inside of the line instead of in the outside. In red is text showing how we expect the values to be displayed. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-190215

Hardscape's tag is floating when Tag Display is Left and Tag Text Alignment is Center

Open file 'hardscape tag left center.vwx'. The hardscape's tag is floating, the text of the tag is not attached to the shoulder of the tag. This issue is not present when Tag Text Alignment is set to Underline. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-190058

Not possible to change text color if Stake linked to Grade

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

It is possible to fully change the color of a Stake object (including text), but if a Stake object is linked to a Grade object, the text will not change color. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185621

Creating a hardscape using a style fails to set the correct name

Maybe related to VB-184321

I use hardscape names to to quantity takeoffs so the correct naming is important to my workflows.

I created a new blank file and imported 3 hardscape styles.

I double clicked on each of the styles and placed a small hardscape using the Hardscape tool. In each case the name of the placed hardscape was "Hardscape-1". in previous versions the hardscape name would match the name of the hardscape used to create the style and this is the expected behaviour.

I duplicated the three hardscapes and then dragged the style definition (from the resource browser) over each of them. The hardscape name now changes to the name used in the hardscape to create the style definition (which is the expected behaviour). 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-185622

Edit Hardscape Style Dialogs do not contain a place to edit the Hardscape Name

I don't know if this is a bug, and oversite, a wish, or if the Hardscape Name is being depreciated....

The hardscape style remembers the Hardscape Name of the Hardscape Object used to create it.

Nowhere in the "Edit Style" dialog boxes is one given an option to edit the Hardscape Name associated with that hardscape style. At least no where I can find.

This is a little problematic when one wished to change the name associated with a style. The workaround is to place a hardscape object using that style. Edit the name of the placed hardscape object, and then create a new style with the new name. This is somewhat cumbersome. 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-191946

Geoimage often fails to generate due to the users current Zoom factor

AS per conversation with [~vstanev] & [~kollikainen] 

 

Martyn:

I wonder if we could improve the initial experience of the Geolocate tool for users by finding a way of automatically zooming out to an area large enough that is typically deemed acceptable for the tool. Certainly for Architecture, I have a feeling that many users would be too closely zoomed in for the tool to be able to create a valid image and so continuously get a ‘Image Failed to Generate image’. For example, if I am opening any of the Architectuture templates, I would typically be working at a nominal scale of 1:50 and a Zoom level of 100%. I am finding that I fairly consistently have to zoom out to level of about 1% before the Geoimage will generate.

 

Katarina:

Sounds like a good idea - I agree that I often have to do the same, even if I’m working on a 1:100 or 1:200 scale 		Alexandra Beshevlieva
VB-191940

Plant List Reports do not show Image for Plantobjects within a Landscape area

Regardless if a plant is added to the design as a Plant object or as a Landscape Area object it is possible to create a report that gives you the sum value of the total amount used for that specific species (Plantstyle). Which is very useful when ordering the total  amount of plants needed.

When adding the column 'Image' to these Reports (where the criterium is set to search for Plant record) the image option no longer works. Vectorworks seems not capable of reading the Image data for that specific Plantstyle used within a Landscape area.

This appears to be a bug as it is no problem to get the other data fields... 		Alexandra Beshevlieva

VB-187225

Spotlight Cable Tools cable ignore truss path and intentional clicks in Schematic layout mode

When running a cable between a distributor and a breakout and using the schematic view setting, the cable adheres to cable paths as expected but not truss lines. I had expected the cable to follow the cable path inherently built into truss objects.

In the attached video, I show my placing a cable starting at a distributor, then specifically clicking on a cable path followed by an intentional click upon a truss line and then finishing at four breakout distributors. Upon completion, the cables follow the cable path but ignore the truss and my intentionally placed routing point upon the truss.

In the second half of the video, I placed an additional cable path as an overlay upon the truss, resulting in the cable as I had expected.

It is my understanding that our cable layout workflow does not need to include adding cable paths over truss. Perhaps we need to rethink that approach. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-185502

When performing a Custom Selection with a Field Value criteria, We're not able to use numbers and measurements to perform the selection.

VB-191196

Spreadsheet Cell Value read and displayed as zero when used in database header calculation

In the attached file we are trying to calculate the percentage of each roof area from the total roof area.

The intent is to store the value from the database header row cell B3 into a worksheet cell and then use a reference to that worksheet cell as part of a calculation in cell C3.

Check and see that the formula in cells A1, B5, D1, and D5 are each =B2. They should all be displaying 2996.48.

Edit the formula in database header cell C3 to be = B3/B5.  The expected result is to divide the individual subrow values by the total of all the subrows to get a percentage. 

The actual result is that cell B5 switches to displaying zero (0) even though the formula continues to show as =B3. That zero value is then used in the calculation in C3 resulting in the wrong value (either 0 or a Div by Zero error) showing in each of the subrows.

The same conversion of the displayed and used value being switched to Zero occurs no matter what spreadsheet cell is used in the calculation if it reference a value from the database header row.

It does not matter what mathematical function is used, the value transferred in is zero.

 

I exported back to VW2022 and still saw the same result.

 

The expected result is that using a spreadsheet cell as a go between to take a database header total and use it in further calculations should work by using the value displayed in the spreadsheet cell, not zero. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-190009

WS: non-numerical values are counted as 1

To replicate see the screenshot and document.

With a formula like

= IF(AREA>5;'-';AREA)

and at least one of the reported areas being >5, the sum will not be the numerical sum of all numerical values.

Non-numerical values should never be counted. Why should they?

The document is v2022. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-191119

Spotlight Cable Tools changing truss height disconnects cable path from truss

Selecting the A Truss and changing the trim height disconnects the cable path assigned to it. I show, in the attached screenshot and video, before and after changing the height. The cable path stretching from the cable bridge to the trusts does not stay attached at the truss end.

I had expected cable paths snapped to truss objects to stay connected at both ends of the path itself. Not doing so will present problems for electricians and riggers as they make adjustments through the engineering process of their projects. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-191915

Automatic Working Plane: Working Plane Rotation not always as Expected

A user on the forums (Tobias Kern) reported this problem to me and it's a pretty frustrating problem where the rotation of the auto working plane is unexpectedly rotated.  See attached videos.
----
The bug is related to the Working Plane (“Automatic Working Plane” + “Set Working Plane”).  If you see in this video with the cube, the “Working Plane” axis are not always placed right.  I would expect, that x+ is always facing to the right and y+ always facing upwards (relative to my viewing of the scene).  Mostly it is okay, but sometimes the axis are flipped (in cube video = left- and back-side).  You see, if you want to draw on the sides with the flipped axis, the drawings (in the video it was a text) orientate wrong.  As user, you always have to flip the axis manually on the wrong sides to have axis like expected.

In the video with the cylinder, you see that the axis of the TOP working plane, does have also a wired behavior.  Sometimes the “Working Plane” (relative to my viewing), is also flipped, mostly if you try to set the WP from the left side.  Placing the “Working Plane” on the round side of the cylinder always works good!

This bug/behavior is related to all modelling in 3D AND should be a high priority fix, because it bothers all work in 3D.

Hope you understand my points and the need for a fix!

Please help to fix this long-time-wrong-behavior!

-Tobi 		Hernán Stamati

VB-189852

Selected lighting devices are not recognized by the type of objects in the OIP

1) Open new document and insert couple of single cell lighting devices 

2) Select all of them and notice that in the OIP it's showing "N Lighting Device Objects"

3) Click on "Edit..." button in the OIP to open the Edit dialog

4) Select one of the rows, that matches for one of the selected lighting devices and change the symbol of this lighting device to be multicell symbol

5) Close the dialog with OK

6) Deselect the lighting devices

7) Press Undo(ctrl+z). The selection is back and the lighting device which it was multicell, is now back to single cell. Notice that in the OIP it's showing "N Lighting Device Objects".

8) Press Redo(ctrl+y) Notice that in the OIP it's showing "N Objects". But the N lighting devices are selected 		Kevin Linzey

VB-185227

Lighting Devices placed onto a Lighting Pipe at a Hanging Angle of 90 will only snap to the top of the pipe

When placing a Lighting Device on a Schematic View, if the Hanging Angle is set to 90, it will snap to the top of the Lighting Pipe.  I've included a file and video showing this behavior.  It seemed to work okay in 2021 testing it on my end.

I haven't tested this with other Schematic View items.

VB-192504

Height of duplicated Lighting Devices by the Mirror tool or the Move by Points tool change from the original.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Draw a truss with the Truss tool.
2) Select the Lighting Device tool and place any Lighting Device on the truss.
3) Make sure the height of the placed Lighting Device is 0.
4) Select the Lighting Device and Select the Mirror tool or the Move by Points.
Mirror: Duplicate Mode
Move by Points: Move and Duplicate mode or Distribute mode, plus Object Retention mode
5) Duplicate on the truss with Shift key. (To align the line with the original.)
6) The height of the duplicated Lighting Device is different from the original one.

On Windows, it seems to occur the problem when duplicated by the Mirror tool only.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Kevin Linzey
VB-189416

All of the Lighting Devices that are part of the truss system become attached to the hanging position if convert a truss that is part of truss system

1. Open the attached file.
2. Select the left truss and the Lighting Devices that are attached on it.
3. Go to Spotlight > Object Conversion > Convert to Hanging Position.
4. Create a single Hanging Position from all selected objects.
5. Enter a name and Hit Use Geometry button.
6. Note that all of the Lighting Devices become attached to this truss object.
Kevin Linzey
VB-191827

Speaker Tool Align Object Left Mode and Align Object Right Mode insert centered speaker symbols and catalog objects

When inserting a speaker with both Insert by Symbol Mode and Insert by Catalog Mode, all insertions are centered regardless of the selected alignment mode, even though outline preview is drawn correctly before insertion if left or right alignment is selected.  Additionally, if you switch away from the tool and switch back, the outline preview will be centered even if left or right mode is selected.

 

*Steps to Reproduce Speaker Insertion Alignment Bug:*

1. Start from reboot (not necessary)
2. Launch Vectorworks
3. Create a new blank document
4. Change to Spotlight Workspace if not already there
5. Select the Speaker tool from the Event Design Tool Set
6. Select either Insert by Symbol Mode (selected by default) or Insert by Catalog Mode in Mode Bar (same behavior in both modes)
7. Select any speaker from Speaker Symbol or Catalog Item pull-down menu
8. Select Align Object Left Mode or Align Object Right Mode (same behavior in both modes)
9. Move cursor over easily observable point (e.g., Page Center): note that the dashed outline of the speaker matches the alignment mode selected
10. Click once to start the insertion process: note that the dashed outline of the speaker still matches the alignment mode selected
11. Click again to complete the insertion mode: note that the speaker inserted centered on the mouse click, though the outline will still show the correct alignment
12. Select another tool (e.g., the Selection tool)
13. Select the Speaker tool again
14. Move cursor over easily observable point (e.g., Page Center): note that the dashed outline of the speaker does NOT match the selected alignment mode
15. Click once to start the insertion process: note that the dashed outline of the speaker now matches the alignment mode selected
16. Click again to complete the insertion mode: note that the speaker inserted centered on the mouse click, and the outline will now show center alignment and NOT the selected alignment

*Notes:*
It's unclear how far back the reversion goes:
- Build 622768 behaves correctly
- Builds 664120, 672648, 678727 and 676510 do not behave correctly
- 27.0.6 (680324) and 28.0.2 (680333) on Win 11 (64-bit) do not behave correctly 		Kevin Linzey

*Crash when attaching Lighting Accessory from other file

[https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=106523&build=668344-vectorworks-win]

https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=106385&build=653494-vectorworks-win

Attached is a file with two lighting instrument symbols and one static accessory(barndoors).
If I open the file and then also start a new document, I can add any of the lighting symbols into the new document by double clicking and then plotting them in the drawing.
If I try to use the Accessory tool to add the barn doors to the instruments, and the barn door symbol is not already in the new document, Vectorworks crashes.
Meaning the lighting instruments are already in the new document but the barn doors are not.
Then I use the accessory tool and choose the barn doors symbol from the other document in the Resource Manager. It crashes.
If I add the barn doors symbol to the drawing before using the accessory tool, then it does not crash. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-192497

Function returns supposedly wrong value

If wall information, such as the wall height, is output in a worksheet, it does not correspond to the actual height of the wall. This is because the wall has been modified using the "Fit Walls to object..." command. However, this leads to glaring mistakes in the worksheet for further calculation.
For example, the selected wall height in the attached document "wall height" is defined as a height of 9m; in fact, it is only 3.87m. This means that there is a difference of almost 5m. 		Christopher Graye
VB-189368

Wall Bounding Box Becomes Very Large in 2023 After Being Moved

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023. The file contains a Wall network with a few Round Walls, along with an auto-bounded Slab.

To reproduce, in each version:

- Select the Walls and Slab
- Move them 1500' or so along the X-axis
- Now run the "Fit to Objects" command

In 2022, note that the view centers on the objects as expected.

In 2023, note that the view gets zoomed very far out. It looks like the Round Wall on the left is the one that has the large bounding box.

If you move the objects 1448' or less along the X-axis the problem won't happen, but if you move them 1449' or more the problem will happen. 		Christopher Graye

VB-185029

Renderworks texture color ignored in some wall component instances

In the attached file I have two walls in the same style and with the same rendering settings (by component). In one case, the siding is light blue (as it should be since this texture gets its color by object fill), but the other wall's texture suddenly started rendering as white (this occurred spontaneously the other day when I opened the file).

Toggling the wall's 'Use world Z for origin'  rendering pane setting causes the white texture to render correctly as blue, as does copying the walls into a new file. 		Christopher Graye
VB-187933

VW Hangs when Combining Curtain Wall Frames within Test File

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 

-Open test file

-Double click the curtain wall to enable Edit Wall tool. x

-Use 1st mode (Edit 3D Wall Peaks Mode) and adjust one of the sides of the curtain wall.

-Switch to the 2nd mode (Edit Frames and Panels Mode) and enable "Combine Frames" mode

VB-189364

Slab with Drainage refers to a different Z value (Z Offset) than entered

Hi Vectorworks

The Z Ref from the Slabs is on "Ok-Fertigboden" (Ref height in the story = 0.00). But they have a Z offset from -0.2475. The interesting part is, if I chance it to 0.00, the value first jumps to the number -18.67. Only in a second attempt does the floor jump to the value 0.00. If I draw a new slab with a drainage in this file, it insert it on the right height.
I've attached a screen record that hopefully shows, what I mean in the description.
(The file is from version 2021. I converted it for testing in to 2022)

If I compare the Value with the story elevation from the active design layer (ABS_ARC_GRN_OG3H_BOR / OG3H) it seems like the same number in the slab (minus values of Z ref.). If we look the the first value -0.2475, it is the same value like in the drainage (highest point). Maybe a possible theory is that the edit from the drainage moved the slab in the minus. Or the drainage was edited from a other layer like "ABS_ARC_GRN_EG0H_BOR / EG0H" and it calculate with the parameters from this layer. This may have caused the soil to be shifted so far down.

I have not really found out the main reason for the occurrence. Although the workaround with the double input is easy to apply, I hope you can find out something more here.

Thank for testing.

Best regards, Denis 		Christopher Graye

I don't see this problem on Windows, so this seems specific to Mac.

VB-192418

Unwanted lines might appear on the joint of walls when inserted objects that Wall Closure enabled.

*This problem occurs on Vectorworks 2022. We couldn't reproduce on Vectorworks 2023.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the attached file. (Sample221110_2.vwx)
2) There are some walls and windows. The walls joined each other, and the windows that enabled "Wall Closure" inserted.
3) Unwanted lines are appearing on the joint of walls.
They disappear if removing the windows from walls.
4) Right-click on "Sash" object on the Resource Manager and select "Plug-in Object Style Options...".
5) "Plug-in Object Style Options" dialog box opens. Disable "Use wall closure" and click OK.
6) Insert the removed window into the wall. The unwanted line doesn't appear.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi

VB-186790

Create Roof bug

Sometimes, you come across a bug that you're sure was fixed 5 or 10 versions ago. This is one of them. To reproduce:
# Create a multi-story file (bugfile included);
# Go to roof layer (which is up in the air, some Z value);
# Draw a rectangle in a 3D view (it will show up in the correct plane);
# With the rectangle selected, choose the Create Roof... command. (Use defaults if you like);
# The roof is created at _*project*_ z=0.0.
# The only way to get the roof at the proper location is to use Move 3D. 

I understand the roofer object doesn't have a Z property (this should be fixed also), but the _*least*_ it can do is create itself at Active Layer Z = 0.0, not World Z = 0.0.

See bugfile and vidcap. 		Christopher Graye

All 12 objects have the same settings, eg. Data, Render, etc.

The Viewport Annotations is empty.

The Plug-Ins were updated.

Please take a look why 10 of the 12 roof objects are being exported in green and not grey. 		Christopher Graye

*It does not occur when Oval is cut in half.

Reproduction example:
1) Open the sample file "12849.vwx". In the drawing area, the placed "Oval" and the overlapping "Line" at the top of the Oval are displayed.
2) Select Split Tool and select "Line Split Mode" on the Tool bar.
3) Snap / click the "Line" Endpoint and snap / click the opposite Endpoint to disconnect.
4) Select the upper side of the disconnected Oval (Polyline) and delete it.
5) If zooming the overlapped part of the disconnected Oval (Polyline) and "Line", when Zoom is about 60,000%, the overlap is displayed out of alignment.

VB-186341

Auto bound slab breaks more easily when editing model in section viewport.

When you edit a BIM model via "section in place", the Auto bounds of the slab break more easily compared to editing the model in the Design layer.

Example: Moving a wall (with "connected wall mode" disabled) twice in the design layer, the slab still stays connected to the wall. When you do the exact same manipulation in a section viewport, the connection between slab and walls breaks after the second move. 		Christopher Graye

VB-189991

Roof elements in roof and roof face

Reported by Vicky:

If there is an roof element in a roof, the walls of the roof elements are displayed with texture in the design layer.
If there is a roof element in a roof face, the texture is not displayed in the design layer.
If you make a section viewport and render it at something else then OpenGL, the texture of the roof element is visible.

If you move the roof face in the design layer, the texture of the walls suddenly becomes visible. 		Christopher Graye

VB-189704

Wall End Cap Causes Large Bounding Box When Reset from a Sheet Layer

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Wall with a Wall End Cap.

To reproduce:

- Select the Wall and run the "Fit to Objects" command

Note that the view fits correctly at this point.

- Now switch to the sheet layer
- Run the Tools/Utilities/Reset All Plugins command
- Switch back to the design layer
- Select the Wall and run "Fit to Objects" again

Note that now the Wall has a large bounding box that causes the view to zoom way out. This seems to be related to the Wall End Cap.

If you run "Reset All Plugins" again but on the design layer instead of the sheet, it'll fix the problem.

The same thing happens going back to at least VW 2021, so this isn't related to Wall Modernization. 		Christopher Graye

VB-187072

Fit Walls to Objects: Roof Display not the same

We can see that both Roofs are not displayed the same when looking at the lines on the sides, but if we remove the two walls (like shown in the video) that are on the side of the wider / broader Roof, then the display becomes exactly the same.

We would expect that the display of both Roofs is the same, independent of how many walls each is attached to. 		Christopher Graye

VB-189549

Eave Cut Horizontal: Add Surface results in partial vertical eave cut

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

2. Now select both objects and use the "Add Surface" command, like its shown in the video.

As a result, we can see that the side where the rectangle was added its with horizontal eave cut, as expected. The rest of the Roof side is with vertical eave cut, which we believe its not correct. The full side of the Roof should present a horizontal eave cut. 		Christopher Graye

VB-191598

Path-Based Plugins Get Split in the Wrong Location When Split By-Point is Used in 3D

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Contour-type Site Modifier with a single segment, and a 2D Locus to be used as a snap point.

To reproduce:

- Go to any 3D view other than Top
- Activate the Split tool in Point Split Mode
- Split the Contour on the locus point

Note that the object gets split in the wrong location. This only seems to happen when the split operation is done in a 3D, non-Top view.

This looks like a general problem with the Split tool and not a Site Modifier bug. Other path-based plugins like Railing/Fence and Repetitive Unit show the same problem.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-187981

<ROOF FACE>: the slope can sometimes exceed 85° - this creates a clipped roof object

For practical reasons, the slope of a Roof Face cannot exceed 85°. You can test this by selecting a roof face, and entering in the OIP an angle value higher than 85°. Vectorworks will give a warning sound, and the value will be clipped to 85°. This is the correct behavior.

However, an error occurs when changing the rise over run in such a way that a very steep roof is created. For instance, if:

Rise = 100cm
Run = 2,54 cm (=1 inch)

Then the roof face gets clipped (see attached screenshot).
The resulting angle is 88,60°.

It shouldn't be possible to define a rise/run combination that exceeds a resulting 85° angles.

When trying to do the same upon creation of the Roof Face, the dialog returns a warning (see attached screenshot). 		Christopher Graye
VB-185066

VS ConvertToArcPolyline: still doesn't recognise Radius vertexes

The VectorScript routine ConvertToArcPolyline should convert all vertexes in a polyline to corner or arc, but it behaves inconsistently. Notably, it doesn't yet recognise radius vertexes, which where introduced after this routine.

Given a polyline with mixed vertex types, these upon conversion will be:
* corner: preserved
* arc: preserved only on dFuzz = 0, otherwise they turn into corner, which is truly strange, since the purpose IS to create arc vertexes
* radius: ignored, turn into corner
* cubic: turn into arc[s]
* bezier: turn into arc[s]

Please test on the attached document, containing two scripts, one where it fails on radius vertexes, one where it fails on both arc and radius vertexes. Select one of the polylines in pink and run the scripts. 		Christopher Graye
VB-184994

Split Tool: Tool Dependence on the object orientation screen plane.

Hi Vectorworks

In the split tool it can become an obstacle, if in the document settings "Legacy 2D" the unified view is adjusted, that display screen objects are no longer visible. The tool is blocked by this, because it depends on the screen layer. You get a hint when selecting, but it is difficult for may user to recognize the connection from the split tool to the screen plane.
However, since this only occurs when you edit the 2D Legacy settings, this is only conditionally a bug. However, the inconsistency exists as soon as you edit the unified view with the split tool active. In that case, you can turn off the screen layer visibility and continue to use the tool. It will only be locked once you select it again.

I've attached my test file and a screen movie.

Best regards, Denis 		Christopher Graye

VB-192518

Specific Document : A display bug on roof windows

VB-187982

<ROOF FACE>: "Height" setting in OIP doesn't (seem to) work

When a Roof Face is selected, the OIP shows a button called "Height". This doesn't seem to work. The button should do two things:

- Allow the user to set a Roof Height value in a dialog box.
- After confirming the value, allow the user to define the location in the drawing where the value should be applied. The user gets a special cursor to do this (crosshair).

It is this second step that seems to be failing. Clicking in the drawing with the cursor doesn't change the rise and/or run, while it should change if the function was working.

 

The parameter 'Height' is vague. The button allows the user to set a reference point, and a vertical height for the roof starting from from that reference point.

'Define rise/run in drawing' would be more accurate than 'Height'.
(In Dutch: "Helling door muisklik" would be quite clear, I think)
In the "Create Roof Face" dialog this function is called "2nd Click Height".

  		Christopher Graye
VB-189887

The test file is v2022 and only contains one space.

To replicate simple open the document and try using the reshape tool and watch the video.

Notice also how the grid in the background changes when grabbing a control point. See screenshots. 		Christopher Graye

- because of clipping the wall, the roof face gets to have openings in placed that shouldn't be affected by the manipulation at all. 		Christopher Graye

VB-192089

# Make sure Safari is your default browser.
# Disable your WiFi/internet connection so that Vectorworks tries to open the local help instead of the online help.
# Run Vectorworks and select menu Help > Vectorworks Help. Online help cannot be opened so a dialog pops up, select Use Local.

VB-188657

Interactive sizing insertion mode behaves unpredictably with shift key held down

As seen in the attached video, when trying to insert a window with the interactive sizing insertion mode _and having the shift key held down_, the insertion location of the window is somewhat erratic/unpredictable.

It feels like the tolerance/forgiveness of the cursor position may need some tuning. One would expect that as long as the cursor is in a particular quadrant, the 1:1-constrained window will be inserted in that quadrant, however this is not occurring.

To see how one would expect the shift-key constraint to behave/feel, simply switch to a top/plan view and draw a rectangle which holding the shift key. The quadrant predictability and "feel" of the drawing action should be as smooth as that.

I have not attached a Vectorworks file because the issue can be reproduced in any new, blank file. 		Christopher Graye
VB-188218

Door preview wrong in this specific case

1) Open the attached file

2) Select the door tool and notice how the preview is far away from the cursor

 

Steps to reproduce this from a new file:

1) Change the user origin

2) Set some plan rotation

3) Go in Rotated Top view

4) Select the Door tool

5) Notice how the preview is with some offset before the first tool point is added

 

Similar problems could be seen with other tools too. 		Josh Loy
VB-188257

T02309 - Unable to Constrain In-Wall Window Movement with Selection Tool

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023. The file contains an in-wall Window.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in 2022
-Double-click the Wall to activate the Reshape tool
-Drag the Window while holding-down the SHIFT key to constrain the movement

Note that the movement gets constrained, so the Window can easily be moved upward on the Z-axis or sideways on the X-axis.

-Now open the file in 2023
-With the Selection tool, drag the Window while holding-down the SHIFT key

Note that now the movement can sometimes be constrained horizontally on the X-axis (though it's not as consistent), and it can't be constrained at all on the Z-axis.

The ability to move the Window with the Reshape tool (or with the new Edit Wall tool) has been removed in 2023, so from what I can tell there's no way to constrain vertical movement in 2023.
Christopher Graye
VB-191315

Slab drainage - Drains will not move when another object is present

See the attached test file and movie

I have a slab with drainage and drains.

I want to move the drains to a new location. 

Oddly, and this is a long standing bug, the drains will not move if another object is present at the new location. Nor will a drain be created where there is another object.

In the test file, right click on the slab and choose edit drainage.

Choose first mode - "Edit Mode"

now select the drain and move it to the center of the CB. The drain will not move.

Now move the drain to a location away from the CB. The drain should move.

Even with snapping suspended the drain will not move where there is another object.

There seems to be something that is messing up the drainage when another object is in the vicinity of where you'd like to move a drain or create a drain.

In the test file, right click on the slab and choose edit drainage.

Choose Second mode - "Create Drain Mode"

Try to create a drain where there is another object. - It is not possible.

If you watch the create drain preview double cross hairs you can see they disappear when an object is moused over.

 

When editing slab drainage to either in edit or create a drain the presence of other objects should be immaterial to the success of moving or creating drains 		Christopher Graye
VB-189772

Curtain wall fails to resize until view changed

Open the attached file. Select the bottom curtain wall. Drag the rightmost control point to the right. The wall does not update. Change to an isometric view. Change back to top view. Resize. The resizing works. Christopher Graye

strange rotation when I put building shell object in Top View

Attached file and video

  		Christopher Graye
VB-188156

Enscape library objects: preview rectangle is not always shown correctly

If you place Enscape library objects in a perspective top view, the preview rectangle is displayed in the wrong locations. The longer you're drawing, the more the offset of the preview rectangle compared to the actual object placement. Josh Loy
VB-191474

Cannot select objects in front of PDF page in wireframe, works fine in Shaded

Once a PDF page is present in a drawing, selection of objects in front of it fails, even if the PDF page is behind these objects. In Shaded mode, it works as expected.

 

Try to select the wall in wireframe and shaded modes. 		Christopher Graye
VB-189031

Working plane pink guide appears when adding doors or windows to front, ortho elevation

When using the interactive sizing insertion mode to add doors or windows to a wall in front ortho view, the working plane's pink guide is now appearing when it has not previously. The guide does not appear when doing the same in a 3D view. Ideally the pink guide should not appear.

See the attached video to see the issue in action. 		Christopher Graye

VB-190690

Extrudes Change Elevation When Resized in Rotated Top View

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

- Go to a Left view and draw a Rectangle somewhere above the ground plane
- Extrude it to any height
- Go to Top/Plan view, and rotate the plan 90º
- Enable the "Working Plane Views" toggle button in the mode bar
- Switch to Top view (which will become Rotated Top view)
- Resize the Extrude

Note that the Extrude moves to the ground plane.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Josh Loy
VB-185244

Left mouse click hold and drag not working with German Version

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

How to reproduce:

1. Open the attached Vectorworks file.

2. All displayed objects are already selected. Left mouse click hold and drag the objects.

Result:
- With the US Version works correctly.
- With the German Version objects behave individually, for example if we left mouse click hold and drag over a wall, it will drag that wall only and its dimensions and increase the size of the adjacent walls. All other objects remain in place.

When switching the drawing scale, for example from 1:50 to 1:100, is as if a refresh in the drawing is done and now its recognized that all objects are selected, hence it will work correctly after that. (Its all shown in the video).

We do not know what could be causing this specifically with the German Version. We request help to find out what can be causing this and a possible solution for this problem. Thank you in advance. 		Christopher Graye
VB-186083

Wall loses orange Highlight after edit

Wall loses its orange highlight state after editing Reshape editing.

The red segment highlight issue only on linear path walls.

VB-188190

T02309: Interactive Sizing Insert - Door swing direction not consistent in straight path vs arc path walls in Top/Plan.

The attached VWX file has two straight path and two arc path walls drawing in opposite directions.  Notice when placing doors in the straight walls, the door swings consistently towards the exterior (left) side of the wall.  However, this is not the case foe arc path walls.  When placing doors in them, they consistently swing towards the counterpoint of the wall path's arc.  It would be more expected to have them always swing towards the exterior (left) side of the wall. Christopher Graye
VB-192342

Some snaps on Section VPs can't be grabbed to move viewport

Some Section Viewports contain points which can be snapped to, and which provide proper snapping tooltips and acquisition hints, but which don't allow the user to grab the Viewport and move it as expected (using the Selection tool).

Attached is an example file and a recording which illustrates which points are misbehaving. Notice how the cursor doesn't change to the 'move' cursor when hovering over certain areas, whereas other areas of that same viewport work as expected. 		Josh Loy
VB-192088

Detail Cut Wood (and other Detailing objects) not compatible with Reshape Tool

The Reshape Tool does not recognize the Detail Cut Wood object. I’ve noticed this behavior with other objects from the Detailing tool set, for example, the Wood Screw and Hole Pattern objects.

To be more specific about the reported incompatibility: A customer recently reached out claiming that she can use the Reshape Tool to “stretch” Detail Cut Wood objects in files opened in version 2020 but not in version 2021. What she means by “stretch” is to MOVE the DCW object with other objects when selected—for example, when working on a 2D wall section and raising the plate height along with the stud wall (represented by a rectangle) two feet upward.

I’ve experimented with this procedure described above in a blank document, and I have confirmed that one can MOVE a Detail Cut Wood object using the Reshape Tool in version 2020, but the same procedure fails in versions 2021 and 2023.

*A related bug may occur when Detail Cut Wood objects are moved using the Reshape Tool: a graphic glitch or ghost of the objects in their original position remains once the objects have been moved to a new position. This glitch may be remedied by toggling on and off the Show Sizes checkbox in the Object Info palette when the Detail Cut Wood objects are selected. To select them, however, you must drag a window large enough to capture the original and the new position of the Detail Cut Wood object.

THE ATTACHED VIDEO DEMONSTRATES ALL OF THE ABOVE ISSUES. 		Josh Loy
VB-188279

Interior Wall Wrapping get Disabled when Window includes a Sill

I've attached screen shot showing how the wrappings look with and without the Sill.

 

-Open test file. Note the wrappings looks as expected

-Open the Window settings dialog and enable the sill ( check 'include sill' option)

-Notice the interior wrapping disappears. 		Christopher Graye
VB-189612

Changing Sliding Operation moves leaf to wrong side of track

In the attached file, I have a sliding door inserted in a wall with the Sliding Operation set to XOO (operable or venting leaf as the left-most panel as viewed from the exterior). Note the outside of the wall is rendered as green stucco (for reference). Also note the operable/venting panel is the interior-most panel, on the inner imaginary "track" as it were, as expected and as any real-world slider would be constructed.

If I change the Sliding Operation (say, to OXO), as I have done in a duplicated instance of the wall and PIO, the operable panel shifts to the outermost "track". This is both an incorrect representation of real-world exterior sliding doors, and a "flip" spontaneously executed by Vectorworks but not by the user. The operable leaf should stay on the inside "track".

I have observed this behavior in 2022 and 2023. 		Christopher Graye

-Notice when the window is within the wall, the interior sill is outside the wall. It seems the wall closures are causing this issue. [Sill type: Brick] 		Christopher Graye

_"I’ve been working in a blank file trying to adjust the door & transom settings on my own but cannot find a way to control the slope direction of the transom without flipping the door. Apparently in earlier versions, one could assign a negative value to the “rise” value in the transom in order to reverse the slope.  {color:#de350b}+*This issue* *is* *a big issue because, currently this door is wrong in my plans and I don’t know how do show it correctly."*+{color}_

VB-188272

Christopher Graye
VB-186660

Door Settings Dialog Options Fail to Update Preview Images Due to Single-Field Configuration

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Door object with a custom Open Angle.

To reproduce:

-Open the settings dialog and go to the 3D Visualization pane
-Change the Open Angle and press the TAB key

Note that the preview window doesn't update.

It looks like this happens because there's only one entry field in the 3D Visualization pane, so there's no way to apply the Open Angle change unless you change some other setting in that pane or switch the focus to an entry field on another pane.

By contrast, the "Size" field in the Centerline Marker pane will update the preview even though TAB doesn't actually move the cursor to another field. Ideally the Open Angle field would behave the same way.

On Windows 10, you can get the preview to update if you press the TAB key about 15 times. Also on Windows, the Centerline Marker pane shows the same problem as the 3D Visualization pane (whereas the Centerline Marker pane works fine on Mac). 		Christopher Graye
VB-185511

Styled Window Leaves Missing Component Lines when inserted into Wall

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue

 

-Open the test file. When you insert the first instance of window into the wall, this works as expected. However, when a second window is inserted, notice the missing vertical lines on the edges of the window. 		Christopher Graye
VB-190388

Static texts in Door Preferences dialog should not be multiline

In the 3D Visualization pane of the Door Preferences dialog, the localized strings for "Open Angle:" and "3D Detail Levels" are longer and become multiline. I don't think these two texts need to be multiline, they should be in one line, adapting to the text length. Christopher Graye
VB-189196

Truncated Configuration tab names in Door Settings dialog

In the Spanish version of Vectorworks 2022 (SP1 and SP3), place a door on a wall. Then right click on the door, select *Properties* (*Propiedades*), then press the *Settings* (*Configuración*) button on the OIP.

In the *Door Settings* dialog box (*Configuración de puerta*), you'll see that the names for the following tabs are truncated in Spanish:
* {{Configuración: Puerta corredera rústica}}
* {{Configuración: Puerta corrediza con cámara}}
* {{Configuración: Puerta corrediza}}

Mouse hovering does not help since there are no hovering tips for such UI elements (unless I'm wrong.)

*Impact:* localization (language) and UX (user experience) for our Spanish-speaking users.

*Recommendations:* widen the window about 40-50% for the tab names in the Configuración de puerta dialog box. See screenshots for visual context.

!image-2022-07-11-17-58-10-563.png!

!image-2022-07-11-17-58-25-409.png! 		Christopher Graye

3) Check "Include sill" and close the dialog with OK.
4) Create a wall.
5) Duplicate the window and insert it in the wall.
6) Change the current view to the right. The sill of the window in wall looks like shifting from the original position, comparing with the window not in wall.

Sanshiro Moriyama

VB-186346

Door/Wdw ID text not responding to Text Style changes

We use a class for Door & Window ID text (done via Door/Wdw definition dialog, not manual text). In particular Doors and Windows that are part of a STYLE, do not respond to changes in the Text Style for the ID, such as font size.

If we "edit style" of a window (OIP) , but make no changes and exit with "OK", this triggers the text style change desired, but only for that window style. We have to repeat for each window style to get the text to change.

Any change in a text style should be global, and immediate. 		Christopher Graye

VB-188101

Styled Plugins Take-On the Wrong Initial Parameters After Editing Style

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Wall and a styled Window where everything but the Width and Height are set by-style.

To reproduce:

-Activate the Window tool using the custom style and place an object
-Change the Width/Height of the object
-Now edit the style
-Change the Width/Height and set them to be by-style
-Now place another Window using the same style

Note that it gets created with the wrong height/width. If you edit the style again and click OK the problem will correct itself.

If you re-select the Window Style before placing the last instance, the problem won't occur, so it seems like the tool is storing old info from before the style was edited.

The same thing can be seen with Windows and Doors. If I try with other plugins like Base Cabinets, I see the problem in the interactive insertion preview graphics but not in the object itself.

The same thing happened in VW 2022. 		Christopher Graye

These are his notes

Unable to adjust bottom rail size in Unstyled Door setting when ... Glass Door (w/ muntins) has segmented (arched) top A similar Unstyled Glass Leaf Door WITHOUT the segmented top allows for bottom rail adjustments These two example glass doors included in file (plus a panel door that also has a non-adjustable bottom rail dimension)
Steps: Creat a new door from Tool Set Edit to segmented top and choose glass (or panel) type of leaf Bottom Rail Setting in Diolog Box is dimmed. Note: Attempts at Converting to 'Unstyled' does not change this behaviour 		Christopher Graye

VB-189666

Window Transom Shows the Wrong Texture with Certain Spring Values

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a Window object with a Transom enabled, that currently has a Spring value of 2.5". The Transom Glazing is assigned to the "Glazing-Clear" class, which uses a transparent glass texture.

To reproduce, open in VW 2021 and 2022.

Note that the transom shows the glass texture in 2021, but in 2022 it incorrectly shows the texture assigned to the "Finish-Paint-White" class (see attached screenshots).

If you increase the Spring value to 3", the texture then shows correctly.

This also happens in VW 2023. 		Christopher Graye

VB-191269

Window and Door Settings Dialogs Fail to Show Previews When Tag Displays are Enabled

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023. The file contains a Window and Door that currently have their 2D and 3D tag display disabled.

To reproduce, in each version:

- Open the Settings dialog for each object
- In the ID Tags pane, enable the "Show Tag in 2D" and "Show Tag in 3D" options

Note that this works fine in VW 2022, but in 2023 it causes the dialog preview images to hide everything but the tags.

The same thing happens going back to 2023 SP0. 		Christopher Graye
VB-189610

T02172 - Leaf/Sash Dimension Terminology is Ambiguous for Windows/Doors

The attached file contains a Graphic Legend that shows a Door with Sidelights and a Transom enabled. The legend is set to show a "Leaf/Sash" vertical dimension.

Note that, even though the Door contains a "sash" from the sidelights and transom (shown in red), the dimension only includes the leaf geometry (shown in blue).

Likewise, with Window objects, the auto-dim option is also named "Leaf/Sash" even though Windows don't have a "leaf".

Since the Dimension menus in the Define Legend Image dialog have the ability to differentiate between Windows and Doors, it would make sense to rename these dim options to "Sash" (when Windows are the defined object type) and "Leaf" (when Doors are the defined object type). 		Christopher Graye
VB-191268

Graphic Legends Show Window ID Tags Incorrectly

The attached file contains a few Graphic Legends that display Windows and Doors. The Windows and Doors have their "Show Tag in 3D" option enabled.

Note that, when displayed in the legend, the Window ID tags show multiple overlapping, flipped copies (see attached screenshot). The Door ID Tags seem to show fine.

If I go back to 2023 SP0, the same problem happens with one of the Door objects while most of the Window objects show fine.

I don't see this problem with regular Viewports or Section Viewports so it looks like a GL issue. 		Josh Loy

VB-191455

Window dialog allows you to edit parameters that are by catalog

# Place Windows object on drawing
# Edit style
# Press the button "Catalog...". From the "Select catalog" dialog select "Attach Catalog" and select catalog: "Loewen Windows". Press ok. From the "Catalog" dialog select any line from LB. Press ok.
# Repeat step 3, but this time from the "Select catalog" dialog select "Andersen Custom Windows"

VB-190741

SBE: Error message after editing worksheet cell is incorrect

Please see attached image.
The error message at the bottom of the window is displayed after I edited a cell in the worksheet.
But the message is completely wrong.
The PIO whose value I tried to edit is even unstyled.
The actual reason for getting the error was that I returned false in the PIO's "AllowWorksheetEdit" function.
The error message should therefore be like "This value could not be changed as the object did not accept any changes for this parameter.".
The current incorrect text needs to be replaced by a non-misleading one.
Optimal behaviour would be if the PIO could return a specific error message in "AllowWorksheetEdit" and VW would display that. 		Christopher Graye

-Enter the Settings dialog, then the Custom Configuration Options dialog

-Go to the Settings/Custom Configuration dialog again

VB-187347

"STRUCTURAL MEMBER" Center mark always XY-oriented

A customer noticed that when they use a structural member in their design and rotate it, the center mark does not rotate with the structural member.

VB-185220

Use Wall Closure checkbox in the Plug-in Object Options dialog incorrectly setting to the Style setting

# Place a Window (or Door) in a blank new document.
# Right-click on the object and choose the *Create Plug-in Style from Unstyled Object* contact command.
# In the Resource Manager, Right-click on the new Style and select the *Edit Plug-in Object Style Options* context command.
# In the dialog, set the *Use wall closure* checkbox to be *By Instance* and click OK.
Also note whether the *Use wall closure* checkbox is selected or not.
# Right-click on the instance and choose the *Edit Plug-in Object Options* context command.
# In the dialog, change the selection status of the *Use wall closure* checkbox by selecting/deselecting it and click OK.
# Right-click on the instance and choose the *Edit Plug-in Object Options* context command again.
*NOTICE* the *Use wall closure* checkbox is set to match the setting in the style even though the setting is By Instance.

This issue seems to happen only when the *Insertion Location* setting in the Style is set to *By Style*. 		Christopher Graye
VB-186077

When a Structural Member is at an angle of 90 degree, the 2D representation is incorrect. This has been moved, this is going well in 3D.
Christopher Graye
VB-188379

Editing 3D Components of a Symbol always in Shaded

If the Default 3D Render Mode is set to Shaded, the editing of a 3D symbol doesn't always render in Shaded when switching from 2D to 3D. Sometimes it is still Wireframe even though it shouldn't. See movie for further explanation. Christopher Graye

VB-186672

Duplicated extrude (Mirror Tool) not displayed in edit mode

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When in Edit Mode of an Extrude that was created with the Mirror Tool Duplicate, its not displayed that same Extrude and another Extrude created with the Move Tool Duplicate.

How to reproduce the problem.

1. Open the attached Vectorworks file.

In the Vectorworks file we have 3 Cubes.

Cube 1: Created with the Rectangle Tool plus cmd+E for Extrude.

Cube 2: Created with the Move and Duplicate Mode from the Cube 1.

Cube 3: Created with the Mirror Duplicate Mode from the Cube 2.

2. When double-clicking Cube 1 and enter Edit Mode. We can correctly see all 3 Extrudes.

3. When in Edit Mode with Cube 2 we can also correctly see all 3 Extrudes.

4. When in Edit Mode with Cube 3, we can only see Cube 1.

Same problem happens with VW2021 SP5. 		Christopher Graye
VB-190988

Structural Member Covers Show Snap Points in the Wrong Location

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Structural Member that has a 1" Cover enabled for all four sides.

To reproduce, place the cursor over the outer edge of the cover geometry and acquire the "Midpoint" snaps.

Note that the snap points are offset 1/2" from the actual center.

It looks like the offset distance will always be half of the cover thickness (in cases where all four covers are the same thickness).

Christopher Graye
VB-189539

Structural member has rogue blue control handles off-object

As seen in the attached video and using the attached VWX file, the structural member has single "rogue" blue control handle floating off the object. When I ultimately reshape the object with it, several more rogue control handles appear.

The expected behaviour would be that control handles would only appear *on* this (straight) object and that any control handles that did appear would make sense in terms of their location and behaviour if the object was reshaped. 		Christopher Graye

1.) Fills the entire area enclosed area when zooming and panning

2.) Clicking on the fill area of the Structural Member does not select the object 		Christopher Graye
VB-191639

Structural Members with Rotated Profiles Take-On the Wrong Miter Angle When Mirrored

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Structural Members that have custom Miter angles. One has a Profile Angle of 0º and the other has an angle of 90º.

To reproduce, mirror the SMs as shown.

Note that the SM with the rotated profile takes on the wrong Miter angle.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-190797

Structural Member - Insertion Preview Doesn't Match Final Result When Profile is Rotated

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

- Activate the SM tool in linear mode and open the tool prefs
- Set the Profile Rotation to 90º and the Axis Alignment to "Top Right"
- Draw a member

Note that the preview seems to show the axis alignment correctly, but the resulting object is offset and its blue control handle looks like it's in the wrong place.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Christopher Graye
VB-188125

Specific document: structural member is causing issues for spaces

When you place a space object in the room indicated in the video by fill, Vectorworks will notify you that the space is not enclosed by walls. By "pick walls", a space will be created, but there will be some issues with the resulting space.

Vectorworks 2022: the space will seem placed correctly at first sight, but when you zoom on objects, you well see that the center of the space is located a few lightyears away
Vectorworks 2023: The resulting space will be displaced a few meters form the intended location

All these issues are non- existent when you delete the structural member which is surrounding the building. 		Christopher Graye
VB-191638

Structural Members Take-On the Wrong Bevel Angle in SP2 When Mirrored

The attached movie and test file show this in 2023 SP1 compared to SP2. The file contains a few Structural Members with custom Bevel angles.

To reproduce, in each version, activate the Mirror tool and mirror the members.

Note that this works fine in SP1, but in SP2 the bevel angle is incorrect.

This looks like it's related to the 673944 change, which fixed VB-190987. 		Christopher Graye

VB-184626

Structural Members Get Mirrored with the Wrong Rotation

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

-Activate the SM tool in Column Insertion Mode and place an object
-Open the Select Shape dialog and choose the "Angle" shape
-Now mirror the SM

Note that the mirrored copy takes on the wrong angle.

I see the same thing going back to at least VW 2020, but I couldn't find any duplicate reports in JIRA so maybe it's not a known issue? 		Christopher Graye
VB-186058

No layer selection for Wall Framing

It is impossible to clic in front of the layer name in the right part of the dialog box. Because of this, walls cannot be framed.

Tested in 2018, 2019. Able to select le layer name. Correct.
Tested in 2020, 2021,2022. Unable to select le layer name. Bug
Christopher Graye
VB-190564

Problem with Texture's Map type for Structural member

When Structural member is created it gets kParamSpaceKind_Algorithmic from SetParametricDefaultMapping, but OIP does not expect this option and asserts (there is a separate bug for this). It shows the first available option "Plane". This is not true, but this does not matter - if I change the map type rendering does not change.

This happens because StructMemb3D::SetComponentAttributes() always sets the type to kParamSpaceKind_SurfaceUV for internal geometry and ignores the selected type.

I believe there is a reason for this behavior, but this is misleading and maybe we should restrict the ability to change the map type for Structural members. OIP has generic code and I try to avoid adding special cases, so possible solution can be that Initialization and Reset should rewrite it back to Surface UV.   		Christopher Graye
VB-191461

Data Visualization Fails to show Overrides for Structural Member Materials

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a bunch of objects (including several Structural Members) that have Materials applied. It also includes viewports that show Data Viz overrides for Materials.

To reproduce, apply the "Materials" DV scheme on the design layer, or go to the sheet and update the viewports.

Note that the Structural Members fail to show their DV overrides.

The same thing happened in VW 2022. 		Christopher Graye
VB-190898

Structural Member Style Thumbnails Show Overall Shape When Created from Linear and Poly-Type Members

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains three unstyled Structural Members of different types (Column, Linear, and Poly).

To reproduce, create a new style from each object, then look at the resource thumbnail in the Resource Manager.

Note that the column-type member shows the profile shape as expected, but the linear and poly-type members show the overall shapes of the SMs.

Since any member type can be used with any style, it doesn't really make sense to show the overall shape in the thumbnail. Ideally it would always show the profile shape like it does with column-type members. 		Christopher Graye
VB-191120

Spotlight Cable Tools changing truss height wrecks cable layout.

Relating to VB-191119, changing the height of a hanging position/rigging object wreaks havoc with existing cables associated with the rigging system in question.

To test this, A Truss hanging position and adjust the trim height -60". Change your view to isometric, and you'll find considerable misalignment of cables. Additionally, the main cable run from the distro up to the truss has detached itself from its cable path.

This presents an unworkable workflow for production riggers and electricians working on drawings before the final engineering stage whereafter trim heights will no longer be changed. 		Kevin Linzey

(On one occasion the cable parts for all cables were blank, but cannot recreate)

Bumping the location of the breakout causes all cables to update 		Kevin Linzey

VB-188373

Spotlight Power planning palette property view power port phase column issue

In the new property view of the power planning palette the Power port phase column needs to display the ID of the device or object the electrical component is associated with.

For example in the attached screen shot you can see in rows 1 through 3 that the power port phase column has the exact same data in for each row, 'Harting In'. Each is from a separate breakout but there is no way to identify which breakout

This makes it impossible to tell what is actually connected to the port.

This should display the connection port using the same format as that of the power information connection drop-downs,

i.e ObjectID.ElectricalComponentName

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-189505

VB-190043

Ghosts drop on circular truss

Hello,

When I use the menu command "insert drop..." between circular truss under primary trusses, VWX is adding more drop than there are truss cross intersection. See my screenshots and file with those drops not necessary.

With those drops, Braceworks is unable to calculate the system, I have to delete thos unwanted drop before calculation.

In fact, the command "insert drop" on circular truss had a drop at each end of the circular section. If you got a circle in 8 pices, then there are 8 unwanted drops, 12 if 12 pieces, ...

This bug is effective in 2023 and 2022 too. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-186828

However, as seen in the attached screenshot and video, the results are unexpected as the bridal and hoists detach from the truss itself.

I had expected the bridles to adjust themselves so they maintained a usable system. If this is not possible with the demonstrated workflow, then perhaps a dialogue offering the user the ability to make the appropriate adjustments so the system is maintained. 		Kevin Linzey

The behaviour is mostly in an orthographic projection and only seems to be a problem when Orientate Loads in 3D is enabled in Spotlight Preferences. 		Kevin Linzey
