VB-186611

Spotlight Cable Tools user created Worksheets, Used Parts Sum field missing information

If a user creates a worksheet to count cables, the ='CableObject'.'UsedParts' does not work; UNLESS one has already run the cable tools Create Cable Report command.

Whenever the ='CableObject'.'UsedParts' is invoked, it should automatically collect the needed information.

In the screenshot attached, I ran the Create Cable Report command upon a single cable which resulted in showing three cables making up the cable run. I then refreshed my own worksheet and it properly displayed those three cables.

refreshing my column requires a multistep process each time a cable is added to a drawing. Rerunning the Create Cable Report and then refreshing the user created worksheets. 		Kevin Linzey

Vision MA-Net3 Version & Interface dialog boxes do not respond to Cancel or X

# Launch Vision
# Go to DMX>Select DMX Provider
# Select MA-Net3 from the drop down list, Click OK
# In the Select MA-Net3 Version window, try clicking Cancel or X in upper right/left corner
# Note: the window won't close, the only way out is by clicking OK and moving forward
# In the Select MA-Net3 Interface window, again try clicking Cancel or X in upper right/left corner
# Note: the window won't close, the only way out is by clicking OK and moving forward

VB-188407

Hello,

If you're in 3D top view, then when you use duplicate array on a truss (by example to duplicate a 3m truss 4 times at 3m distance) then duplicated trusses are not attached and are duplicated further than the chosen distance.

this bug isn't active when you are in 2D Top/plan view, duplicate array on trusses is working well. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-187469

VB-187418

Spotlight 2023 property and connection view sort order

In the new views of the power planning palette there is no way to achieve a usable or logical sort order of the inputs and outputs for distributors

the default sort order doesn't respect the order that the input and output connections display in the object properties, either reversing the order or randomizing it

if sorted by 'power port' inputs and outputs from the various distributors get split up in the list, which should not ever be possible

If sorted by ID the issue is the same as the default

if sorted by name again the same issue as by default

If the view is sorted using both the filter box and a sort by column the power port column still doesn't display in a logical fashion, the input is placed in the middle of the list rather than either the top or bottom

It has to either be possible to set multiple column sort orders, similar to how worksheets handle this issue,
or the sort order for the power port column has to be fixed in the same order as the inputs and outputs are displayed in the distributors object properties, without the ability to separate/split the power ports, so that they can't be sorted into a list where they mixed up  with the power ports of other distributors.

This can be tested in the attached file 		Kevin Linzey
VB-190949

Spotlight bridle automatic basket parts configuration error/warning message

Not sure if this should be a bug report or an enhancement
If a bridle is inserted connected to a house rigging point with undefined basket dimensions and the user then opens the bridle configuration dialogue its not possible to close the dialogue again without the message that the basket parts are too short displaying.

There is no info in the dialogue telling the user that basket parts have to be defined or that there is a minimum basket length needed.
This can make it hard for the user to understand why the error message displays wen exiting the dialogue when no changes have been made 		Kevin Linzey
VB-186601

VB-191484

Displacing truss on checked out layer requires check outs of objects on other layers

VB-184782

Spotlight Cable Tools place single cable ignores user choice and reads distributor connector

This bug deals with only the issue of a user's choice of a specific cable being overridden during the cable placement process.

I have attached two files. One from SP1 and another from SP3.
In SP1, the chosen cable I wished to place was placed as expected. In SP3, the cable read the output connector of my first clicked upon distributor and ignored my chosen cable. Edison jumper cables were placed rather than the Multi cables I had selected.

In SP1
* Choose the cable insertion tool.
* Select a Socapex Multi Cable
* Select the single connection mode
* Click on the Distro.
* In the popup, check the always use next free output box.
* Select Out.A.120 to choose the first multi-output and click OK
* Connect to Breakout #1
## This inserts a multi-cable as expected.
* Click on the DIstro again
* Click on Breakout #2
* Repeat again by clicking on the distro and then breakout #3
* All three cables match the selected multi-cable.
* No, the patch didn't work as desired. That's a different issue.

 

Repeating the above steps in SP3 results in the user's choice of cable being changed by the Distro output to which it is being selected.
In SP3...
# Choose the cable insertion tool.
# Select a Socapex Multi Cable
# Select the single connection mode
# Click on the Distro.
# In the popup, check the always use next free output box.
# Select Out.A.120 to choose the first multi-output and click OK
# Connect to Breakout #1
## This inserts a multi-cable as expected.
# Click on the DIstro again
# Click on Breakout #2
## This inserts an Edison Jumper instead of the expected multi-cable
# Repeat again by clicking on the distro and then breakout #3
# Open the power planning web palette and note the connections. Breakout #1 is connected as expected. #2 & #3 are both connected to Edisons on the Distro and Multi on the breakouts.

As discussed in our spotlight meeting, this behavior is due to the three different connectors in the distro and the cable reading the "next" open connector. This will be added as a new VE. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-188725

Braceworks calculation of visible or selected only lists all hoists in the file in Hoist Workload column

Hello,
I enclose a file and a movie explaining this. As you can see, only one layer is visible and if a Braceworks calculation is done either by 'selection or visible only' it will list *all *the hoists in the file. This is in the 'Hoist Workload' column. This is highly confusing for users.

Even though the value of KN is listed as '0' they are all in red understandably. The bug is that those hoists not taking part in a calculation should *not *be listed.

Peter 		Kevin Linzey

VB-190771

Speaker Array hoist to truss in Braceworks

Trying to connect a hoist from a speaker array to a truss. 'insert connection' fails, as it won't recognize the bumper. 'Insert drop' fails if the bumper is set up to only use one hoist. If its set for two hoists, it only inserts one. If it's set for multiple hoists, it inserts three, but in all cases, braceworks fails. This is a common scenario, where a line array is hung on one motor from a lighting truss. I also tried with a generic bumper. a-la VB-176358, but that also fails. Kevin Linzey

VB-191374

Hi! I did a daisy chain connection from a distributor object to 3 lighting fixture:
* From LoadID A to fixture 201 (Alpha Profile 1200) - CableRunID: A1
* From fixture 201 to fixture 101 (Alpha Profile 1200)
* from fixture 101 to fixture 301 (Robin 600 LEDWash)

On all fixture I put
* 1 Electrical Component Tool in output mode PowerCON True1 TOP 
* 1 Electrical Component Tool in consumer mode PowerCON True1 TOP

On CableRunID A1, I put an adapter start from 16A-1phCEE to PowerCON True1 TOP

VB-190651

Spotlight Cable Tools Component Graph missing info when device inserted via RM

If I double-click on a distributor object in the resource manager and insert the object using the distributor insertion tool, the component graph is missing the component information of the inserted object. Only if I use the resource selection tool that the component graph populates properly. The end result is the power planning calculations fail.

To test this, open to blank documents.

In document A, use the resource selector tool to select a power source and a distributor and then connect them with the cable.

In document B, select the same power source and distributor, but use only the resource manager to make your selections. After inserting both devices, connect them with the cable.

Compare your results in the component graph inside both documents.

I have attached a video of my experience doing the above.

This is related to https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-182089 		Kevin Linzey
VB-188929

Spotlight Cable Tools copy and past lighting system loses all power planning info

If I copy an entire system of lights with their generator, distributors, cables, etc. into a new drawing, non of the power info comes with it.

To test, open a blank document.

Copy a working system from an existing drawing into the new blank document.

Open the Power Planning Web Palette. You will see only the generator. All connection information has been left behind. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-189030

Bridle: Undo is out of order after a view change

Please watch attached video, the bridle is placed in a Top/Plan view, then the view is changed to a 3D view

Some undo commands are made, but the bridle is "undone" before returning to the Top/Plan view. This is incorrect. The Top/Plan view should be restored before the bridle is undone. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-191115

Spotlight Cable Tools cable content styles need Data Tags reset of some sort

I had edited my cable.vwx file (attached) to automatically add Data Tags when inserting cables. With the current 28.0.2b build, the data tags were not being attached. 

To fix the issue, I had to edit the style and change the instance of the tag to By Style, save, re open to edit again and change the Data Tag back to By Instance. Once I did this, the data tags were placed as expected. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-192237

Spotlight hoist not connecting correctly between a hanging position and structrual memeber

When a truss object is hung from a structural member with a hoist, the hoist will correctly connect to both (possibly with a dead drop bridle if the hoist chain is too short),
However if the truss object is converted into a hanging position this will no longer function correctly. The hoist seems to no longer correctly link to the truss inside the hanging position (should insert at the truss center line), instead it inserts onto the bottom of the hanging position. This is both inconstant ,and breaks several features including adding a pick up symbol, altering the hoists load trim parameters and Change trim height of system command 		Kevin Linzey
VB-185464

Spotlight truss symbol import problems

PW comment: The following part in the box was extractedt to a VE.
{code:java}
When a user is importing truss symbols in an existing file, truss objects do not correctly refresh to reflect the new symbol definition. This affects both the truss objects displayed properties in the OIP and attached records.
The truss symbol definition in the file resources will correctly display the changes but all existing truss objects in the file will not have their OIP properties updated to reflect the changes, both in the shape pane and in the data pane.{code}
Any new truss objects drawn using the newly imported symbol definition will display any changes to the truss record (and any new custom records) in the data tab correctly but the shape pane will still not display the updated properties.
In both cases selecting the truss object and using the customize truss symbol data command shows that the truss properties have been correctly updated with any changes from the imported symbol definition

Additionally the Braceworks load overview dialogue will not display the changes to the truss properties.

original forum thread

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/92871-updating-truss-in-old-files/]

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-188324

Spotlight cable tools power planning palette missing distributors in Property view

in the attached file I have three distributors and a generator/company switch. I have run a cable from the company switch to the first distributor and then another cable from the past through to the next distributor and the same for the third distributor (dimmer pack.)

the device graph shows all four objects connected with cable lines. The property view, however, only shows the company switch and the first distributor. It is missing the second distributor and the dimmer pack.

please see video and  file for reference Kevin Linzey
VB-188797

Spotlight Cable Tools overrides user chosen cable for 2/0 & 4/0 feeder

Even though I had a 2/0 cable selected, the cable tool inserted a feeder cam Lock 4/0 cable. The distributor has 4/0 connectors which will accept 2/0 cable. Therefore, when I choose a 2/0 cable, the 2/0 cable should be used for the connection.

To test,
# open the attached file.
# delete the two feeder cables connecting the three devices.
# using the cable tool, select a 2/0 feeder cable for use.
# connect the company switch to the first Sensor3 dimmer rack.
# note the cable it a 2/0 in the OIP.
# With the 2/0 cable still selected for insertion, connect the first dimmer rack to the second dimmer rack.
# Note that the cable in the OIP is now a 4/0 cable. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-186624

To test, open a new document.

Place a 100' cable
Note the voltage drop reads zero in the OIP.
Make an edit to the cable.
Now the voltage drop reveals itself.

Voltage drop should appear at first placement of the cable. If one never edits the cable, the voltage drop will never show itself. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-186163

Spotlight Cable Tools duplicating a breakout gives incorrect ID name.

Making a duplicate of the #3 Truss and all its parts gives us a new breakout that should be numbered ML-4. Or, at least ML-3-1.

Instead, it gives BO-B which is likely due to the last breakout placed in the drawing being BO-A. It appears the duplicate command is calling the auto-numbering function which had the last breakout name stored. Rather than checking the currently selected breakout for its name instead.

Same happens in 2022 		Kevin Linzey

ID Fields:

For a truss, the ID field is not copied at all.
For a distributor object, the ID field duplicates and increments as expected. However, the label showing this information does not update in the drawing until another change is made to the distributor object in the info palette.

VB-186632

Spotlight Cable Tools Pasting distributors from one drawing to another loses ID field info.

If I place distributors in one drawing with appropriate ID information and then copy them to another blank file, the ID info is removed.

I had expected them to retain the ID information.

Users who build events based on prior events will often use a favorite file from which they copy pre-built systems into new drawings. All the info needs to remain intact when copying and pasting. Unless conflicts occur. Then a conflict occurs, normal VW practice of adding a -1 to the duplicated item should be followed. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-190872

Spotlight Cable Tools specified error message is missing when no outputs are free

[https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/Cables/Drawing_cables.htm#h1] states, "When no outputs are free, an error message displays. Select a different distributor with free outputs to create the cable run."

This error does not reveal itself when circuiting lights to a breakout.

To test this, place seven lighting units in a drawing.

Place a generator, a distributor, and a six-circuit breakout and connect them as usual.

VB-187937

Using Change Trim Height of System on Hanging Position doesn't change Z value

# Start with a New/blank document
# Insert Truss symbol using Truss Tool
# Give Truss a Z value of 10' (not required, can stay at 0')
# In OIP for Truss, Click - Convert to Hanging Position
# Use either Symbol or Geometry (example Geometry)
# In OIP for Hanging Position, Change Trim Height of System... 
# Use either Absolute or Relative (example Relative 5')
# Notice the Z value of the Hanging Position has not changed (still 10')

I am seeing this going all the way back to VW24, so this might look like WAD.  However, in this example workflow, there is no easy way to know the trim height of the Hanging Position.

Added observation that can be seen in the video:
* Lighting Devices placed on this Hanging Position have a Z value that reflect the true trim height, even when placed before the Change Trim Height of System.
* The new 2023 Truss Tag-Hanging Position Info has a Bottom Trim value which shows the Hanging Position's Z value and not the trim value. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184846

Spotlight Cable Tools Cable ID auto numbering confusion, incorrect labeling.

Auto Numbering for cables is placing information in unexpected fields and result in mismatched worksheets, data tags, and OIP fields. Although the information is correct, the expected nomenclature is either missing a restriction during execution or is simply confusing 

This may be related to VB-184644 which reports cables can be drawn backward. Fixing this prior bug may solve the entire issue. If cables are restricted to be placed in one direction, the "source" and "target" issues will fall into place.

In the AUtomatic Numbering Preferences dialog box, we are offered the terms "Target" and "Source."
For electricians, these terms represent the source as to where the power is coming from and target to be down the line of distribution ending at the consumer.

Generator to Distributor to Breakout to Consumer.

When choosing a breakout distributor and patching its input back to a distributor output, Auto Numbering is reversing the source and target. Thus, the intended labels are being placed in the wrong places.

This also leads to incorrect information being inserted into the OIP of the cables themselves. A screenshot shows two cables that should have information that differs only by a single number. The result fields differ completely.

Worksheets reflect the same confusion with differing information in unexpected fields.

  		Kevin Linzey

User submitted a file where he draws a new stick of truss.  If he then deletes it, immediately truss crosses appear on already established trusses.

I have attached the file and a screen recording of my reproducing the issue.

I also found if I just delete truss already in the file, it will produce the truss crosses.

VB-184976

Compare GDTF and Vision/LIT in Vision: Virtual Colour Wheel

There appears to be an issue with the Virtual Colour Wheel in GDTFs when compared to Vision/LIT files of the same fixture type.

Attached is the VWX and MVR files used for this test.  An onPC Lighting Console will be needed for reproducing.  A video has been included to better illustrate.

The values in between the *FULL RGB* show as White on the GDTF fixtures (back/upstage row), while the Vision/LIT fixtures (front/downstage row) show the in between color values with expected results.

{Blue (17-55) Light Blue (57-95) Green (97-134) Yellow (136-174) Red (176-214) Magenta (216-246) Blue}

I then inserted eight more of them. The second one inserted showed <no ID assigned> even though "Mains-2" was assigned and shows in the ID field of the OIP.

Distributors 3, 5, 7, and 9 all appear with the proper ID.

VB-189682

Braceworks Connected System problems and calculation check issue with hoist chains and more

Hello,

Please excuse the nature of this report as it is not meant to be aggressive whatsoever and is probably partly to do to my ignorance. However some of these occurrences don't seem correct hence this VB.

In the enclosed file and movie you will see 3 identical rows of truss all supported each by 3 motors. Underneath spanning all 3 rows and connected to all are some lighting pipes.

If you select one bit of truss and in the OIP 'Change Trim Height of System...' and choose 'Entire System' everything is highlighted so the program can see that it is all connected. 
* Is it a bug that when a Braceworks calculation is performed there is only one red influence line (Mby) drawn on one truss and not the other two? When one disconnected motor is attached to the truss the Braceworks calculation is completely different (ie correct).

 
* Is it a bug that when a 'System Check all Objects' is done the one motor that is not connected to anything does not have a warning label and the Calculation Overview has a green light?

 
* Is it a bug that when the Clear Calculation Results is run the motor's chain disappears and can only come back if re-generated via checking the simplified chain option?

 
* Is it a bug that when in the OIP you click Select System Objects only each run is highlighted not the entire connected system?

 
* Is it a bug that when each lighting pipe is selected and in the OIP the Select Truss System is clicked only the pipe and truss crosses are selected and not the entore connected system?

 
* Is it a bug that that the truss crosses don't appear to determine whether the Change Trim Height of System recognises that the entire system is connected together or not? Also when doing a Braceworks Calculation? (If not what is their purpose regarding pipes and trusses?).

The was originally a 2022 one but has been converted.

Cheers,

Peter

 

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-192132

Spotlight Hoist dimension arrows no longer rotate

The Spotlight legacy hoist dimension label arrows automatically rotate in relation to the assigned hoist origin. This provides an intuitive visual cue towards the currently assigned origin, for anyone reading the rigging plot.
The new Hoist object dimension label arrows do not do this, I'm unsure whether this is a regression bug or should be an enhancement request

forum thread
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/103375-hoist-tool-dimension-arrows-dont-rotate/#comment-452291 		Kevin Linzey

VB-190656

Spotlight Cable Tools Breakouts do not show loads in L1 L2 L3 as expected

From our current Word document:

"Each Power Source, Distributor and Consumer must report the load applied to each leg. The leg reported must always be referenced to the leg of the power source. No matter what pin it is on for an input connector, output connector or consumer, the load assigned to a leg must always reference the leg of the power source."

The distros are working, but the breakouts are not.

VB-186569

VB-192098

Spotlight Cable Tools inserting cable style is inconsistant depending on mode

When inserting cables between distributor devices, the resulting cable style is inconsistent when using the various insertion modes.

The Single Connection Mode listens to the distributors being clicked upon and places the appropriate cable regardless of the cable style specified in the cable style selector box. This is desirable.

When using the Distributor and Schematic Distributor modes, the selected Cable Style in the cable style selector box is considered. If the cable selected is incorrect for the distributors being connected, an error appears informing of the need for an adapter.

If the proper Cable Style is selected and matches the connectors of the distributors being connected, the appropriate Cable Style is inserted, and no error appears.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-184882

Hoist heights incorrect for layer elevations

The hoist heights in the Geometry widget are giving an absolute height from ground level regardless of layer elevation Kevin Linzey
VB-192387

Braceworks doesn't calculate system yet Entire System can be controlled by Trim height

Hello,

We have a rigging user who complained that it was impossible to have just one point load hanging off one motor. He says he does it all the time for speakers, set elements and other technical things. I reminded him that the only way to do it was to have 2 x motors and a rigging object. Obviously this is not how it is rigged in real life for him so that workaround is no good.

I then created a custom piece of truss which was a Sphere from the 3D toolset, This allows one motor and a point load to be connected. The point load could then be replaced by a symbol in the OIP and it this worked it would be a far more real life workaround for him.

Everything works perfectly. As you can see from the video the systems appear correct and when the entire system's trim is changed in the OIP everything is connected and moves together accordingly.

The point of this report it to observe that when a Braceworks calculation is done an error comes up saying that the point load is not properly supported and so nothing else can be calculated.

Why if all is recognised as being the entire system does this error occur and thus I say it is a bug. If this could be fixed then this at least could be a workaround for hanging a load off one motor.

 

Cheers,

Peter

 

 

 

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-184740

Spotlight Cable Tools includes incorrect cable when offering choices of cable

Though the cable is being placed properly, the cable configuration window is offering me some incompatible cables. I choose a 2/0 cable and the list includes 2AWG cables, which are 100amp instead of 200amp. Thus, an issue that can't be ignored.

Open a new blank file and draw a 200' plus long cable using Camlock 200 Amp 2/0 AWG cable.

Open the Cable Configuration dialog via the OIP.

Check the Only show compatible parts check box.

The results offer both 100 amp #2 and 200amp 2/0 cable. #2 cable can not be used in a 200amp circuit.

What can be used, but is not offered, is the 400Amp 4/0 cable.

What should be happening:

Choosing a 200 Amp cable should offer 200 amp and higher cable. Thus, 2/0 & 4/0 cables. It should not offer a lower capacity cable; 100 amp

  		Kevin Linzey

The electrical load is correctly passed along to the distributor that supplies the consumer and the consumer displays the correct total load just not the load on phase 3.

In the attached file I placed feeder cable between the generator and dimmer packs. When pressing on the configure cable button, a 4/0 cable is not being shown as being used. Kevin Linzey
VB-189020

Spotlight Cable Tools Select Power Source button in OIP doesn't do anything

The Select Power Source button in the OIP doesn't do anything. in my files. I've attached one file for testing. Kevin Linzey
VB-186180

Localization_Truss creates unlocalizable zNested Record folder and Rigging Object Info record, and leaves garbage resource when undone.

Japanese version only:
When a truss is placed, it creates zNested Record folder in the Resource Manager.
The folder contains Truss Record, but it also creates Rigging Object Info record at the same time.
In Japanese version, the zNested Record folder name is usually localized, and when a truss is placed, it creates two zNested Record folders, one is localized and the other is unlocalized.
The Truss Record is placed in the locailzed folder, but the Rigging Object Info record is placed in another zNested Record folder with unlocalized folder name.
If a user undone the placement of the truss, it deletes the truss symbol and the localized zNested Record folder from the RM, but leaves the other zNested Record folder and the folder name becomes empty. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-188941

Cable Area disappears if you name the object via OIP

1. Insert a Cable Area.
2. Enter a name in OIP.
3. Notice that the shape of the object disappears. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-192051

Spotlight - Braceworks - Convert Symbol to Truss

Hej Guys 

 

When converting the 2-D/3-D symbol "Truss Prolyte H30D-300-down"  in class "BR-Prolyte-H30D" to a Truss, it takes a very long time. 

As soon as you remove the Truss from the chain hoist, the process works as usual medium fast.
It looks like the connection between the hoist and the Truss is slowing down the conversion process.

To do this, select the symbol "Truss Prolyte H30D-300-down"  and convert it to a Truss. You can watch how piece by piece is converted.

If you undo this process, remove all chain hoists and repeat it, the speed will be as usual.

File Attached 

 

Martin  		Kevin Linzey

# In a New document, Edit Design Layer-1 Elevation (video shows 200')
# Activate Truss Tool _(*Must use Distributed Insertion*)_
# Go to 3D View _(Issue also found in Top/Plan - just easier to see both issues in Isometric view)_
# Draw length of truss
# *Issue 1* Note the {color:#FF0000}Red{color} Highlight line shown at documents Z: 0', but when completed, the truss symbols are drawn at Design Layer-1 Z: 0' _(Elevation 200')_
# Next draw a connected length of truss to existing truss
# *Issue 2* Note the {color:#FF0000}Red{color} Highlight line shown connecting to the existing truss, but when completed the truss symbols are 200' above the exiting truss

These two issue don't appear if Single Insertion mode is used for the Truss Tool.  

This might be related to the fix made for VB-185242.  This was found when testing to verify.  That issue looks to be fixed, but these new issues were not present when looking back at SP3 builds.  I tested Vectorworks 2022 SP3 Build 646432, this did not have the issue being reported and still had the issue for VB-185242. VB-191258

Hanging Position Truss Edits Failing

Editing Truss layouts in Spotlight Hanging Positions fails in 2022 and newer.

Open "HP 2021," which contains 2 Hanging Position objects.  Double-click on one or the other, entering the editing environment.  Double-click on the Truss Symbol in the Resource Manager and click on one of the ends of one of the Truss runs, adding the Symbol to the run.  All will work as-expected.  Also, while in the editing environment, duplicate one of the existing Truss instances and snap/drag it to one of the ends of the run.  The Truss will attach as-expected.

Open "HP 2023," which also contains 2 Hanging Position objects.  Double-click on one or the other, entering the editing environment.  Double-click on the Truss Symbol in the Resource Manager and click on one of the ends of one of the Truss runs.  The new Truss instance will not attach and will be placed away from the existing run.  Also, while in the editing environment, duplicate one of the existing Truss instances and snap/drag it to one of the ends of the run.  Again, the new Truss instance will not attach and will be placed away from the existing run - even though the "ghost" placement indicator shows that the shifted Truss should attach correctly.  This behavior can be seen when editing either of the Hanging Positions. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-185275

Spotlight LED tool: Contextual 'Attach to Rigging Object' command fails to attach correctly

Hello,
In the attached file and movie you can see some LED Screens made by the LED tool and a Hanging Position (HP) above.
When the LED objects are all selected the contextual menu item "Attach to Rigging Object" is available. When the HP highlights in red you click but note the following:

1. One LED remains on the ground.
2. The others attach via their 0 value and at the height of the truss so they draw above the truss.
3. Some change in the Left/Right dimension and there are overlaps and gaps whereas they should all be butting up against each other.

Kevin Linzey
VB-188817

Spotlight Cable Tools Draw Output Lengths of Break Outs doesn't do what it should

this is a repeat of VB-182225 which tells of the missing connector length fields of the OIP for distributor objects. This seems to be the root of the  problem for 
# VB-188814
# VB-188816

it is essential that we have the capability to allow users to specify the lengths of their breakout tails. In the attached screenshot, I show several versions of break outs with both staggered and constant breakout lengths. In the 2021 version of the current cable tools, the OIP had user specifiable length fields.

users here in the US will often specify a staggered breakout instead of jumper cables. If they have a 60 foot staggered breakout, that gives them a connection point at every 10 feet for six circuits. With a twofer at each connection point, that handles 12 lights on a truss with a single multicable and attached breakout. Thus, avoiding the weight and labor needed for those six jumpers. Multiply this by five truss runs, a production removes 30 jumper cables.

During the meeting sometime back when the above bug reports were submitted, [~mstaffel] indicated these fields would return.

As these fields were present in 2021, I've marked this as a regression. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-186136

Truss Content 3D Simplified Truss affected by Insert Point Class

This issue has only be found in CLS Australia 400mm Heavy Duty Box Truss>Straight symbol library. 

It appears that the 3D Simplified truss is affected/attached to both the Insert Points & Simplified Classes. Both Insert Points and Simplified Classes will turn the 3D Simplified Truss visibility off.  As can be seen in the snapshot of one of the trusses in Edit 3D, the class is set to Insert Point.  Other trusses have it set to Simplified.

Snap Shots and Video has been attached.  Also included a copy of the Symbol Library Vectorworks file that was used in the video. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-186140

Truss Cross Ends, can not turn off visibility (None Class) & renders in some modes outside of Wireframe

This isn't a recent bug, it can be seen going back to VW2021.  Recently reported in VB-186115, I wanted to simplify and provided more info and testing.

In the attached video and snapshot, it can seen that the cross ends of truss symbols are visible when all Truss Classes are turned off.  These cross ends do not exist in the Truss Symbol 3D Component, but it seems to be assigned to the None Class.

These cross ends are also rendering outside of Wireframe in the modes listed below and demonstrated in the attached PDFs.  To my understanding, these should behave similar to the Insert Points, and even when visible do not render outside of Wireframe. 

Since to me it is unclear if just the Class needs to change or something additional has to be done to correct the rendering issue, I put these issues in one VB.  I can easily change that or file an additional VB if this requires separate fixes or engineers.

# Hidden Line
# Dashed Hidden Line
# Unshaded Polygon
# Shaded Polygon
# Final Shaded Polygon 		Kevin Linzey

VB-190442

Hoist Origin tool concatenates number

The number is being concatenated instead of replaced. In another language the number might need to be in a different position of the string, instead of at the end, so translators should be able to place the number where needed in the translated string.

Use something like "Spot #^0" and replace "^0" with the number. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-187034

SetDefaultTextureMapping does not set fInitialized to true

If you call SetDefaultTextureMapping followed immediately by a call to GetTextureMappingInfoN, you will see that fInitialized is still false.

[~daved] suggested that this is likely incorrect and that once SetDefaultTextureMapping is called, fInitialized should be set to true. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-189808

Not all gobo content has an image shader

With 2023, textures can be applied to render lights, which will render full color in OpenGL. Not all gobos in the content library have an image shader, so colorized gobos do not appear correct.

143008 Flag, USA is one example (the first color gobo I found).

In theory, there can be a script that checked all the gobo textures in the content library, and copies the transparency image to the color image if none exists. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-186537

Cineware launch takes ~5 minutes on macOS Intel from Xcode

Developers are seeing this when launching from Xcode.  Not seeing this when launching autobuilds when double-clicking.

 

Those reporting it include Josh, Hernan, Rick, and Ian.  Previous reports from a couple months ago were from Lada and Miriam, before R26 upgrade and code changes.  Josh reports this problem started for him with R26 merge.  Josh also reports that the C4D app in the Cineware folder launches OK if he double-clicks on it, and autobuild launches fine.

 

I suggested upgrading to Xcode 13 but that didn't fix this for Josh.  Selin is not seeing this with macOS 11.6 and Xcode 13.

 

Some ideas are that this is very slow security checking like we see with our own plugins on launch.  It also might be a dependency on protection/activation events and timing, which might be why some are seeing it and others might not.

 

The initial launch with Cineware app would call a function to launch and then check later if it was available.  Doing this with Cineware (DLL) now doesn't work, the code we have from Maxon is a while loop until it is fully launched.  Perhaps not looping would starve the launch thread.

 

Further comments after trying some things yesterday:

Not sure why Cineware is slow to launch, findings are that OnIdle is not called during this >1 minute, and the wait while loop doesn't iterate more than once during this time either. Several messages are shown in the output window about Metal during this time, perhaps the OS is compiling Metal shaders for Maxon. Another likely candidate is security checking because every plugin is also slow to load, and because Cineware has many of its own files and libs involved. I disabled almost all Cineware modules in the startup config and it didn't eliminate any of the pause I am seeing. I am on Xcode 12.5.1 and macOS 11.6.1, Intel. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-185399

Attached Project Share file crashes VW everytime

Opening the attached and saying NO to the dialog about locating referenced file results in VW crashing every time.

The original user does not have this problem as he has the referenced files on his local machine. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-187824

Paul DSTOP External ᣏ has no main entry point!

I've been seeing this for a while, I only see it on Windows.

Happens when I quit Vectorworks. If I continue past the assert, I get an exception. Although the exception call stack looks like it has something to do with maxon, Dave Donley removed maxon from his build and it still happened.

To repro just bring up Vectorworks, new blank document, and quit. Doesn't matter whether home page comes up initially or whether default is set to not show home page and prefs set to open new blank document. Doesn't matter whether quit is using X on top right or File>Quit.

I tried deleting User folder, removing Output folder from workspace, deleting it, and sync'ing. It still happened.

On Mac when I quit I get the "An extension file has not been released" assert, but I'm not seeing that on Win. Don't know if that has anything to do with what's happening.

This bug probably needs to get sent to Vlado, or whoever deals with plugin interface. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-189377

Editing mesh causes texture to disappear

After editing a mesh, the texture disappears. We quite often need to edit meshes. 

(this may be 'as designed', but it is no good for us users)

!image-2022-07-29-03-17-08-045.png!!image-2022-07-29-03-18-15-042.png! 		Justin Hutchison
VB-185129

RW Camera: "Match Current View" should change Camera Height, not Z value

When you place a RW Camera and then click "Match Current View" one would expect the "Camera Height" field to change accordingly, with the Z height remaining at what ever it was (typically 0").

Currently, the "Camera Height" field stays constant and the change in view is instead reflected in the "Z" height. This is not useful and is the opposite of expected behavior (from a user's perspective that is, though perhaps it's currently "WAD").

As an example scenario, I'll often be flying through a 3D model of a film set with my SpaceMouse while a Director watches over my shoulder. They'll commonly ask "what's our camera height right now" - so I insert a camera and Match Current View. But then I have to do math because instead of just telling me the Camera Height, Vectorworks includes a Z offset instead.

For context, the Z height field for Cameras is useful for when you're on a raised platform of some sort. You manually set the Z height to match that surface, so it becomes a sort of datum level. After that, everything should be IN RELATION to that Z datum you've set, meaning as you change the view the "Camera Height" should be changing, not my "Z" height. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-185196

Defauld 3D View Render Mode: not complied with for groups

Hi Vectorworks

If the render mode "shaded" is set as the default display type in 3D, this is not adopted when you edit a group via Top/Plan and switch to a 3D view. Subsequently, the wireframe model is shown and you have to change again.

I've attached a test file and a screen movie.

Best regards, Denis 		Justin Hutchison
VB-185124

Clip Cube issue with 0" thickness extrudes

I've been experiencing this bug in different files for a few weeks now, where turning on Clip Cube causes extrudes that are 0" thick to display strangely. They take on the Clip Cube Solid Fill color, and display in front of everything else. I can only get it to display correctly by giving the extrude thickness (which is not ideal for other workflow reasons).

 

See attached screenshots and simple example file. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190902

Selecting "Undo" after using a tool while in the Surface Sculpting mode makes exit from the mode.

steps to reproduce.
1)Open the attached file. (12959.vwx)
2)There is a Site model and select it.
Then click "Edit Existing Surface" or "Edit Proposed Surface" on OIP.
3)Select "Sculptor" from Surface Sculpting tool set.
4)Click anywhere of the object and sculpt.
5)Select the Undo command or press Ctrl + Z key for undoing the operation before, that is undone but you get exited from the Surface Sculpting mode.

We feel the undo command should just undo the action or the change by tools, exiting from a mode makes users take extra time and effort.

Please refer to attached files and a movie. (12959.vwx and 12959.mp4)

Sanshiro Moriyama

VB-185255

Mesh smoothing crease angle field confusing

bug video [^2022-02-11 11-53-33.mp4]

-create a sphere
-convert to mesh
-look at crease angle field on Render tab of OIP for the mesh
notice it says 50 but actually it should say "—"  or "n/a" or "0" because mesh smoothing is disabled in vectorworks prefs.  This is confusing to user.

-change the Mesh Smoothing dropdown to None
notice the crease angle still says 50 when it should now say "—" or "0".  Basically the crease angle field doesn't update when the Mesh Smoothing field changes.

I shelved a small CL 632568 to address this bug but it seems like setting the crease angle field on OIP doesn't work when Mesh Smoothing field is changed.  Need shell help. 		Ian Lane
VB-186499

Wrong VWMarkerPopupCtrl behavior with SetByClass

There is a bug under Windows where the VWMarkerPopupCtrl behaves different then under Mac-OS.
If you set a SMarkerStyle in the Control, then set it by Class and remove the set by Class again. Under Windows the Selected SMarkerStyle is now the default SMarkerStyle. In MacOS it switches back to the first selected SMarkerStyle.

Code to reproduce the Bug:
Set a SMarkerStyle in the VWMarkerPopupCtrl that differ from the default SMarkerStyle.

Call following functions:
gSDK->SelectClassChoice(dialogID, componentID, true);
gSDK->SelectClassChoice(dialogID, componentID, false);

Under MacOs the SMarkerStyle that was set before these 2 Method is set again in the VWMarkerPopupCtrl
Under Windows it is set to the default value.

See attached Pictures 		Ian Lane

VB-191679

Mac - Vectorworks is inconsistent in showing dialogs on multiple monitors

This is not a new issue and is mainly a usability annoyance.

When you are working on a Mac with multiple monitors - such as a MacBook Pro with an external monitor - Vectorworks is not very consistent in where it shows modal dialogs. This can be a disorienting user experience.

For example in my current setup I have Vectorworks running on the attached 4K monitor, which its also showing the Dock. When I invoke File->New (command-N), the new document modal dialog does not show up on my current active window monitor, but on the other (MBP screen) monitor. However if I choose File->Open (command-O), the open file dialog shows up on the active window screen.

There are enough cases of this that it becomes somewhat unpredictable as to which screen will show a dialog. I think when all active Vectorworks windows are in a single monitor, that monitor should be used for all modal dialogs. 		Ian Lane
VB-191918

Xcode warnings that need to be fixed

As suggested by [~tfapohunda], I'm trying to record some types of Xcode warnings that we need to fix:
* Build-script-related warnings
* Deployment-target-related warnings
* Please feel free to add more...

I'm hoping that after these warnings are fixed, we're left with only code-related warnings from the Xcode projects, and so it may make sense to turn on the "Treat Warnings As Errors" setting for them. 		Ian Lane
VB-189059

Luminosity > Luminous Intensity unit in the field of the Custom PSets in the Data Manager

Could you please confirm if the 'Luminosity' unit shouldn't be rather called 'Luminous Intensity'?

Do you mean the following one? As we believe this unit is used for light source, it should be expressed in cd.

Luminous intensity | SI / Basic | candela | cd | CANDELA | LUMINOUSINTENSITYUNIT | IfcLuminousIntensityMeasure

According to this [BuildingSmart resource|http://docs.buildingsmartalliance.org/MVD_WSIE/schema/ifcmeasureresource/content.htm], there are various luminous entities, but none of them is called "Luminosity". Hence our confusion during translation. Could you please tell us which SI unit is associated with it?

String: IFCLibrary > ManageCustomPSetsDlg.vwstrings > Luminosity > Luminosity 		Mihail Rizov
VB-184631

IFC export: A wall bound to a non- existing stry level doubles its height

If a wall is bound to a non- existing story level on top, but do has a visible height because of a component top offset, the wall exports to IFC with the double of it height. Mihail Rizov
VB-188692

Wrong wall opening when exporting to IFC4

If you export a window with a lintel with an indent to IFC4, the wall opening will be too big. The width of the wall opening will be defined by the lintel's indent, while it should be following the window's width underneath. Mihail Rizov

VB-190768

Styled Hardscape Doesn't Take New Texture for the Border Component

I've attached a short movie that shows this issue.

-Open test file . This is a styled hardscape with both the Main Area Components and the Border Components textures set by component class texture. This works as expected so far

-Edit 'Hardscape Style 2" from the RM and click 'Main Area Components' then edit the component

-In 'Landscape Component Settings' dialog, change the texture from class texture to 'Texture'. Note this will set the desired texture

-Click OK to close both dialogs

-Now click "Border Components...' then edit the component

-In 'Landscape Component Settings' dialog, change the texture from class texture to 'Texture'. This will set the same default texture as the main area components.

-Click OK to close all dialogs

-Bug: Notice the Main area component took the selected textures but not the Border component.  ( see screen shot below...) 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-190282

VB-190947

VB-191695

VB-192210

Pathway Hardscapes/Site Modifiers Show Incorrectly After Filleting Longitudinal Profile Line

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Path-type Hardscape with a Transverse Profile added.

To reproduce:

- Edit the Longitudinal Profile
- Right-click the profile line and choose "Edit Profile Elevations"
- Activate the Fillet tool and fillet the profile line as shown
- Exit back to the design layer

Note that the Hardscape now has an unwanted indentation in the middle of the path (before and after screenshots are attached).

The same thing happ[ens with Path-type Site Modifiers.

I don't see this problem if I Chamfer the profile line instead of Filleting it. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-192412

Hardscape: When changing configuration from modifier to 'No Site Modifier' and vice versa, elevations do not sync

To test:
Open the test file, select the Hardscape and change the configuration from 'Planar Pad':
!image-2022-12-19-20-00-44-421.png|thumbnail!
to 'No Site Modifier':
!image-2022-12-19-20-01-27-126.png|thumbnail!
Note that the elevation changes.

Notes:

When changing the configuration from 'Planar Pad', 'Aligned' or 'Path' to 'No Site Modifier' the elevation of the geometry changes. Note that the *Hardscape in 'No Site Modifier' configuration is always flat and horizontal* at the elevation set by the 'Elevation' parameter of the Hardscape object.

The geometry of 'Planar Pad', 'Aligned' or 'Path' configuration is *entirely defined by the used modifier*.
Note that only 'Planar Pad' has flat geometry but could be sloped (non-horizontal), while the 'Aligned' and 'Path' in general have arbitrary non-flat geometry that is entirely defined by their profiles, alignments to adjacent objects, and internal surface modifiers.
Only the 'Planar Pad' and 'Aligned' have 'Elevation' parameter while the 'Path' has 'Start Elevation' and 'End Elevation' parameters.

Note that when changing the configuration to 'No Site Modifier', the geometry could only be preserved if the geometry of the modifier we are starting from is flat and horizontal!
However, *such a change is necessary to synchronize the elevations*.

*I'm thinking of the following synchronization:*

If changed from 'Planar Pad' or 'Aligned' to 'No Site Modifier', the 'Elevation' of the modifier is transferred to be the 'Elevation' of the Hardscape object.
And vice versa - if changed from 'No Site Modifier' to 'Planar Pad' or 'Aligned', the 'Elevation' of the Hardscape object is transferred to be the 'Elevation' of the modifier.

If changed from 'Path' to 'No Site Modifier', the 'Start Elevation' of the Path modifier is taken from the 'Elevation' of the Hardscape object.
Vice versa: If changed from 'No Site Modifier' to 'Path', then the 'Start Elevation' of the Path modifier should be taken from the 'Elevation' of the Hardscape object, and the 'End Elevation' = 'End Elevation' - 'Start Elevation' + 'Elevation' of Hardscape object. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185204

Braceworks not seeing both side-by-side projectors in Video screen

Therefore, all calculations are off by half the weight of the total count of projectors. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-188347

T02274 - Pad Elevation Resets to 0" When Translated to 2023 Format

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model and Grade Limits that were created in VW 2023.

To reproduce:

-Draw a Planar Pad modifier and set its Elevation to 5'0" or so
-Export the file to VW 2022 format and open it in VW 2022
-Run the "Reset All Plugins" command, then update the Site Model

Note that everything appears fine at this point.

-Now save the file in 2022, then open it in VW 2023

Note that the Pad's elevation changes to 0" during translation.

If I try this with an object created in VW 2022 I don't see the problem, so it looks like reverse-translating then forward-translating is causing problems. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-191702

Lighting Symbol Maintenance Command needs to be updated to support New Light Info Record fields.

The Lighting Symbol Maintenance Command only displays frame info for the Light Info M Record. 

The *Lighting Device* and *Instrument Summary* Objects now use the *Frame Data* from the new fields that are found in the *Light Info Record* that is attached to each Lighting Instrument Symbol.

Enclosed is a Sample file exhibiting the problem. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-189309

Data Viz Wall Filter shows doors, windows and other objects

Place some wall styles

Place some styled doors/windows in the walls

Create a Data Viz with:

'Type' 'is' 'Wall'

'Object Function' 'Object Style Name'

 

The results show the walls as desired but also show doors and windows

Even if you set the filter to specifically exclude doors and windows, or to only include the wall class etc

 

The customer is aware that they can remove the objects manualy but this is a pain for large projects and can easily lead to human error. They are using the data viz to make a key and it needs to be right

 

Originally raised in 2021, also occurs in 2022, 2023 the filter doesn't seem to work at all and everything shows up 		Rick Berge
VB-190925

Set/GetAppropriateFillStyle is called for types not inherited from AreaType

I combined these bugs into one as this is the same problem:

VB-187079, VB-187005, VB-187664, VB-189747, VB-186919.

VGMPlanarMeshArray constructor casts to AreaHandle and calls GetAppropriateFillStyle(dc, (AreaHandle)h) without looking at the object's type.

Reported unrelated types are kLocusNode (17), kLineNode (2), kLocus3DNode(9).

The problem is not critical as those types have a "fill" member at the same place in memory as AreaType, but this should be fixed anyway. 		Rick Berge
VB-186048

KLS: Data Vis does not override filling None correct

If an object has fill None and data visualization is defined to set fill Solid with a color, then the object still in fill None when data visualization is used.
I would expect this behavior when data vis is defined to Retain Original Fill, but not when I clearly define a solid fill.

(If this happens to be wads, then please log this as a wish.) 		Rick Berge
VB-186820

Data Visualization: Pen and Fill Opacity is applied twice for walls

To replicate (see video):

1) open document
2) change data vis to "Data Visualization 1"
--> both the rectangles and the wall components have now: no fill, pen in red with an opacity of 70%
3) edit "Data Visualization 1": fill none to solid, fill opacity check and from 100% down to 50%
--> the wall is now much more transparent than the rectangles despite both having the same settings
4) edit "Data Visualization 1": fill solid to none (but keep opacity override checked and turn down to 10%
--> somehow the opacity of the fill is applied to the pen opacity and is now even more transparent 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-187320

Structural Member - Profile Offset Causes Incorrect 2D Graphics

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2020 compared to 2021, since a regression appeared between the two. The file contains a Linear-type Structural Member with an End Offset of 5'0".

To reproduce, open the file in VW 2020 and 2021 and enter an "Offset Y" value.

In 2020, note that the start/end caps remain vertical in the 2D graphics.

In 2021, note that the caps become angled.

This also happens in VW 2022 and 2023. 		Christopher Graye

VB-188374

Symbols With 2D Screen Plane Components Fail to Translate Correctly : JBC

Open the attached Vw 2020 file in Vw 2022 and observe the rendered sheet layer section viewport displaying four symbols with 2D components. The file has a saved viewport cache.

1. Update the viewport and note that much of the geometry disappears, in particular anything that is a polyline. Also note the two symbols that were on the right now do not display at all. No amount of editing of these symbols will make them appear in the viewport.

2. Uncheck Display 2D Fills in the OIP for the section viewport then update it again. Now the line work reappears in the two left symbols, but without the fills the symbols are not displaying hidden line correctly. The two symbols on the right still fail to appear at all.

This company has 18 Architect seats on VSS and is just switching from Vw 2020 to Vw 2022. They are a very important customer for us so we really need to find a solution to this issue as they have hundreds of the symbols that have been developed over the years.

Obviously the issue us related to the removal of screen plane objects and all these symbol components were drawn with screen plane geometry. I tried switching all symbol geometry to layer plane, but that didn't really achieve a positive result (script below).

Please let me know if you need any further information.

Thanks.

 
{code:java}
Procedure T;
Function DoIt2(h1 : HANDLE) : BOOLEAN;
BEGIN
SetObjectVariableBoolean(h1, 1160, False);
END;
BEGIN
ForEachObjectInList(DoIt2, 0, 2, FSymDef);
END;
Run(T);{code} 		Josh Loy
VB-191725

KLS: Wall formulas in worksheet false because of wall end cap

See video. The wall formula in worksheet return n/a. Delete the wall end caps and recalculate worksheet, then it works correctly.

(See VB-191724 for the missing component in worksheet) 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-192313

Texture mapping: Generic solids and extrudes

The texture of Generic solid side cuts has wrong direction on some sides (default plane - Surface UV, history - geometry created with correct composition direction) - see {color:#ff8b00}Textures.vwx{color}

Steps I took to make it look correct (however, those are not suitable for complex plug-in geometry creation.)
- Correct if using mapping type "Auto-align plane" + manual rotation.
- Correct if using the texture tool to add/edit surface textures.
- Correct if using mapping type "Sphere" + manual insertion/scale/rotation.

-For comparison, Multiple extrude geometry looks correct.- (Edit: it does not. Apparently the multiple extrude I was testing with has customized texture mapping applied to make it look correct. After testing with with clean "multiple extrude" I see it looks the same as "tapered extrude", with misaligned textures.) 		Justin Hutchison

VB-191141

Railing/Fence - Posts rendered as square instead of round after Undo+Redo

# Create a blank document
# Create a Railing/Fence object with round posts
Note: Make sure the object has a fairly long path. I've noticed this issue doesn't happen with short paths. I was able to consistently reproduce this using a 20m line for the path.
# Switch to a 3D view and zoom in, so that you can clearly see the shape of the posts
# Tools->Utilities->Reset All Plug-Ins
Note: Obviously, the geometry doesn't change
# Hit Undo and, immediately after that, Redo

After these actions, the posts appear as if they have a square profile, instead of a round one. Sometimes it does not happen until after a few "Undo+Redo"s, but in my testing it always happened when using a 20m long path.

I could be wrong, but I don't think this is related to the PIO itself, but rather with the VW rendering system. Here's my reasoning:
* Opening up the Debug List View, you can see that the posts are actually highlighted as if they have a round profile and as if they have the handrail/guardrail subtracted from them (i.e. exactly how they were shown in the drawing before the Undo+Redo thing).
* Saving the document as it is now and opening the saved file reveals that the posts are back to having a round profile.

 

In case this is important, I'm on Win10 21H2, i7 10700k, GTX 1660 ti running driver version 512.15

Definitely not a new issue, I was able to reproduce this all the way back to VW2019 (I didn't try any versions prior to that)

See attached video 		Justin Hutchison

# Apply Texture to Extrude (Overall & Face Override using Texture Tool)

# Create a New VWX file
# Go to File>Import> Import glTF (This must be added to workspace under Debug)
# Notice the Textures do not appear as they do in the original document.

Export 3DS results in the same outcome as Export glTF.  This will also be filed in a separate bug and linked in case that is helpful.

Even thought Export glTF is not found in standard Export workspace, it is now the default backing for MVR exports, which is in standard Spotlight workspaces. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184858

Setting opacity for a wall on "Data Visualization", objects that are in the wall display with its opacity setting as well.

Steps to reproduce.

1) Create a wall.

2) Select the wall and click "Replace" from the OIP "Style" dropdown.

3) Choose any of a wall style and close the dialog.

4) Select the Window tool and insert a window into the created wall.

5) Select "Replace" from the OIP "Style" dropdown.

6) Choose any of a window style and close the dialog.

7) Click "Current Data Visualization" and select "New Data Visualization".

8) Select "Objects using Function" from the Colors dropdown, then select "Object Style Name" from the dropdown on the right.

9) Select the wall style from the Value column in the list and click "Edit".

10) Check "Override back color" and choose any color (Ex. yellow) from the dropdown.

11) Check "Override opacity" on the Fill group and enter "10" in the field.

12) Check "Apply attributes" and close all dialogs.

13) Check the window in the wall, it will be displayed with the opacity reflected, similar to the wall.

* Even though you check "Override opacity" of the Pen and enter "100" in the field, but the window display will not change.

*As long as I tried, I don't see this problem then Vectorworks 2021.

* Also, the opacity display is different in color depth between V2022 and V2021.

Please refer to a movie and a sample file I attached.

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-186491

If setting display resolution to lower, some parts of the setting dialog are not displayed properly.

We will report 2 cases.

The "OK" button and "Cancel" button of the setting dialog show in the preview frame and help strings show in different position than they should be.
Steps to reproduce.
1) Go to Apple Menu > System Preferences > Displays and select 1440 x 900.
(1440 x 900 is just an example. The problem might reproduce if selecting other resolutions as well.)
2) Launch Vectorworks.
3) For example, place a door.
4) Click "Settings" on OIP.
5) Look at the bottom of the door setting dialog. The "OK" button and "Cancel" button shows in the preview frame.
6) Also, help strings don't show in the position where they should be, they show and overlap with the pane frame and the General group area.

Please see an attached movie "12853 1440x900.mov" and image "Comparison.png".

B) If setting display resolution to lower and enabling the Dark appearance, the string of the "Cancel" button becomes invisible.
Steps to reproduce.
1) Go to Apple Menu> System Preferences> General and select "Dark" on Appearance.
2) Go back to System Preferences and go to Displays then select 1440x900.
(1440 x 900 is just an example. The problem might reproduce if selecting other resolutions as well.)
3) Launch Vectorworks.
4) For example, place doors and windows.
5) Click "Settings" on OIP.
6) Look at the bottom of the door setting dialog. The string of the "Cancel" button is invisible.

*The string of the button becomes invisible, but the button works if you click inside the button frame.
(We confirmed that the problem occurred on 1440x900, 1280x800, 1024x640 on Mac Book Pro and confirmed on 1600x900 on iMac.)
*The problem doesn't reproduce when setting the Appearance to "Light".

Please see an attached movie "12853 1440x900 Dark Mode.mov" and "Cancel button Dark Mode.png", "Cancel button Light Mode.png".

・Machine information 01
Mac Book Pro (13-inch,2018,Four Thunderbolt 3 Ports)
Processor: 2.7GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7
Memory: 16GB 2133 MHz LPDDR3
Graphics: Intel Iris Plus Graphics 655 1536 MB

・Machine information 02
iMac (Retina 5K, 27-inch<Late 2015)

VB-188444

Railing/Fence is created by Create Object from Shapes command in center offset only

Left, Right and Custom offset in Create Object from Shapes do not works. All modes give us center creation.

 

Steps to reproduce:

- draw polyline
- use command Create Object from Shapes
- choose Object Type: Railing/Fence
- check Offset: Left, Right, Custom 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-189007

Create Object from Shape: distorted walls

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When using the tool "Create Object from Shape" to create Walls from a Polyline, we can see in the video that the result from this action are distorted walls. Please take a look. 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-188559

Creating walls from polylines doesn't give an optimal result

When you create walls based on a polyline (Create objects from shapes), which only exist out straight lines and arcs, you get a sub- optimal result. While the polyline is very smooth, you get pointy corners segmentation, unnecessary fragmentation and gaps in the resulting walls. This is odd, because manually it is perfectly possible to draw such a shape with walls, without deviating from the original form. This proves that the command "create objects from shapes" is not functioning optimal for this purpose. Kostadin Ivanov

See attached movie
Draw Detail callout in 3D views
Note that leader line, drawing and sheet numbers preview show out of place 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-186016

Texture on aligned hardscape component by class: wrong alignment

When a texture on an aligned hardscape component is set by class, the alignment is treated individually per sub-surface, which results in a non- matching alignment. When the texture is not set by class, the alignment is correct. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-184575

Drip Outlet Flow is higher than expected in user's file

A user states that a Drip Outlet area (713 sq ft) has a Flow of 3.17 GPM for the valve, but when she ran the numbers and math by someone at Hunter (I don't have any contact info for this individual), they came to the conclusion that the Drip Outlet area should have a flow 2.2 GPM.

I've included a screenshot of her specific setup and her math as well as a test document with a roughly similar shape where I get about the same results.

I've looked over the math and I honestly can't say if she's right or not and would like anyone's input to determine whether or not her math/the Hunter representative's math is correct.

The user requesting more information on this is Torrey Slininger (torrey.kieseldesign@gmail.com), and I'm putting their information here in case we need to reach back out to them.

Any advice is appreciated. Thank you for taking the time to review this, and have a great day! :) 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185814

This is minor but worth noting.

In the video capture, I'm using the Existing Tree Tool in the Site Planning Tool
I'm doing the following steps.
-Placing Tree in the drawing area.
-Using the 3D properties for the 3D Canopy and 3D Trunk.
-Notice when I enter incrementing values for the Multiple Stems.
-As expected the 3D trunk will change it shape and the DBH value will change also from 1' to
to something else (depending on the value that I enter).
-The issue is, when I uncheck Multiple stem (option) and enter the DBH to original value of 1'.
-The Trunk doesn't revert to it's original shape.
-The more I uncheck /check the option enter the DBH default of 1'. The more the trunk
changes its shape. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-185389

Hardscape and Attribute Mapping Tool : Reset 2D settings

When you edit the Texture map of a Hardscape object with the Attribute Mapping Tool, it will not only change the texture map but also reset the 2D settings, which is not desired behavior. The 2D settings shouldn't suffer any change when editing the 3D texture, and vice versa. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185248

When selecting an irrigation Outlet with a rectangular pattern from the catalog, they get drawn as an arc pattern with a 0° arc. They should have a side strip pattern.

The selected Outlets in img01.png should have rectangular patterns.

The user can then use the 'modify catalog data' button in the OIP to free the data fields. When the pattern is then reset to 'side strip' the calculated values in the OIP show an error and aren't calculated img02.png

VB-189454

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the Viewport 103 EG_Digitalisierung Bestand #7 is displayed Section-Elevation Line objects. The text of this objects has the option "Adjust Flipped Text" active in the Viewport, without it will be displayed flipped. Although it is correctly displayed in the Design Layers.

When exporting that same Viewport to PDF, the text is flipped. Why is the text being flipped in the Viewport, despite being correctly displayed in the Design Layers? VB-189345

The Mac itself freezes when users of Mac Studio use Vectorworks. After that, the Mac goes to sleep or crashes.

The Mac itself freezes when users of Mac Studio use Vectorworks. After that, the Mac goes to sleep or crashes.
We have received 8 inquiries that such a phenomenon will occur.
Also, this problem is the operation when only Vectorworks is running.

〇This is an example of user information.
MacStudio2022
CPU: M1MAX
Memory: 32GB
OS: Monterey(12.4)

Two monitors are connected with a mini display port-USB C conversion cable, a drawing sheet is displayed on the main display, and a tool menu is displayed on the extended side.

・ Timing of occurrence
The moment you select an object (text, dimension, etc.), the main display becomes unresponsive.
The mouse cursor disappears and it does not operate.
Vectorworks has not been freezes. The extended display can be operated.
If you connect or disconnect the connector on the main display side, it will be displayed again and it can operate, but there will be a delay in operation. Using a Mac in safety mode reproduces the same problem.
When this happens, an attached PDF file-like appears on the main display.
Also, if you check the activity monitor, the CPU usage of Window Server will be significantly higher.
Attached PDF file : 12913.pdf

■ Remarks

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/97554-apple-studio-display-crashing-vw/#comment-434596]
-I confirmed that there is a similar post in the above forum.
-This problem occurs even when using a third-party monitor.
-I checked the operation of a Macbook air equipped with an M1 chip in a dual monitor environment, but confirmed that it was not reproducible.
-User said that problems will occur during work.

-We are currently inquiring about the crash log.

 

Hayato Wada

A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-189510

DWG Import: ODA Platform error

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

Import the attached .dwg to Vectorworks.

Result
ODA Platform Error. The file appears to be damaged or incomplete.

This Error does not happen with 2021, only with 2022, hence I have marked this report as a Regression.

I could reproduce this problem only with MacOS (Monterey 12.4) and not with Windows (tested with Windows 11).

It is possible to open the file with AutoCAD. By saving the file with AutoCAD and afterwards importing it with Vectorworks, the error does not pop-up anymore.

If it is possible to open the file with AutoCAD and the error does not pop-up with 2021, then something is happening with 2022 that should be taken a look at.

Thank you. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-191852

DWG Kludge calls for Undo functionality should be switched to using SDK interface Undo methods

In the DWG Library plug-in, the Kludge calls pertaining to Undo functionality should be removed and replaced with SDK Interface Undo methods, such as gSDK->SetUndoMethod(), gSDK->gSDK->UndoAndRemove(), and others.   Vasil Kitanov
VB-187416

This file contains georeferenced geometry: not possible to activate with saved settings

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Import the attached DXF to an empty document

2. Activate the option "This file contains georeferenced geometry" in the DXF/DWG Import Options

3. Go to Advanced...

4. Select the GIS tab

5. Select "Use the following coordinate system:"

6. Select EPSG/CRS Lookup...

7. In the Filder write dhdn

8. Select EPSG:31463 and click OK to exit the dialog

9. Save Settings and click OK to exit the dialog

Result: The option "This file contains georeferenced geometry" is not active anymore. If we re-activate the option, the Settings switch to <Active Settings> like shown in the video. If we switch back to the saved settings, the option deactivates again. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-190321

Tile still incorrect when exporting DWG

Casper reported:

It is a known problem with the export of a .VWX drawing in which Tiles are used that the export to DWG does not always go well. This is because AutoCAD has no tiles.

This does not mean that we as VW users like to use tiles. And run into problems when exporting to DWG. In this drawing rectangles have been placed in the tile, these represent the size of the prafab plates. Which must be placed exactly at this place. In the export to DWG, the complete rectangles are exported where the wall ends for instance.

It would be good if this was addressed again. So that our customers can continue to use Tiles and the export to DWG goes well. And it has the same views as we have in the .VWX file.

 

Also tested in 2022 SP4 		Vasil Kitanov

Bug?

VB-191830

Export dwg: checking and unchecking "Export Complex Line Types as Blocks" brings surprising results

Hello,
The enclosed Vectorworks file is from 2022. I am unable to test in v2023 as the file fails to convert: (VB-191829 _Vectorworks 2022 unable to be converted and opened in the v2023 format_.)

The Vectorworks file is 638 KB. With the option "Export Complex Line Types as Blocks" checked which it is by default, the result is that one dwg file is created and the size is a whopping 27MB.

If tried again but the "Export Complex Line Types as Blocks" is unchecked then the dwg file size is a mere 35KB!

Interestingly two other files appear which in this case are Shape files. So the basis of this report is why do the line types blow out the dwg file size so much as I thought Vectorworks could handle and convert ACAD line types but is it not true the other way around?
Secondly, how come the Shape files are not created when this option is checked but they are created and exported when it is unchecked?

Cheers,
Peter


Vasil Kitanov

-Open attached test file (SmallerTestFile3.vwx) which I reduced from its original size

-Export to DXF/DWG using default settings
-I imported the file into a new Vectorworks document and you'll notice the duplicated Grid Lines (AfterImport.png)

VB-187692

Geometry from Illustrator via DWG importing with incorrect curves

I have geometry in Illustrator that I need to get into Vectorworks accurately. In Illustrator I export a DWG or DXF, then import this into Vectorworks. However the Bézier curves are importing into Vectorworks incorrectly. See "BadCurves.png", in which the blue linework is the imported geometry from Illustrator, and the black linework is what it's supposed to be.

If I re-import the exported DWG directly back into illustrator it looks correct, so I don't think the issue is with the exported DWG itself (and I've tried different combinations of export options in Illustrator). Rather, Vectorworks seems to be interpolating the bezier curves incorrectly upon import.

Moreover I active the check-box to set the document's coordinate system to match with the import coordinates.

When exporting the attached file to DWG and re-importing it. We can see that the Dimensions scale has changed and the Polyline Image that is reimported as a Bitmap is defect (not being correctly displayed).

Please take a look at this. Thank you. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-190720

Issue only occurs in the current build. Previous build export works as expected. See attached zip for export settings and files.

VB-186857

Edit option in pulldown menus of reports and Data Tags

I'm not sure if this is related to the Space tool or if it's related to record fields in general. Nevertheless, the example in the testfile and the movie is a Space object.

 

In some pulldowns we are offering an Edit... option. The corresponding edit dialog isn't accessible through reports or Data Tags. If the Edit... option is chosen "Edit" as a value will be displayed instead of showing the desired edit dialog.

This becomes much more important with the replacement of the Space Labels with Data Tags in VW23 (T02240). 		Nikolay Zhelyazkov
VB-192484

Exporting a Graphic legend to the model space in a DWG: the result looks like it has no link geometrically with the original. Vasil Kitanov
VB-184774

DXF/DWG import problem with "unitless" file

The attached files show as being unitless when I open them in VW. The confusion I am having stems from when I import them by specifying the import units as inches, or mm, the objects come into VW the same size. So, it appears that there is something in the file that makes VW aware of its units. Usually when I switch the import units from Inches to mm and import the same file, the objects come in scaled by a factor of 25.4. Not so with these files.

The DWG file was sent first, then I received a scaled down version of the data in DXF format. They both import the same way, unitless, and both generate the same size geometry in VW regardless of the DWG-VW units conversion I select. 

*The files are confidential. Please don't share them outside of Vectorworks, Inc.*

Any advice you can share would be helpful. Thank you. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-184914

VB-187433

DWG Import: planar polys are from 3D block are not correct when block is converted to group

Use attached file and import it once with the default block conversion option (correct import) and after that with convert all blocks to groups (wrong import). See attached images for the correct and wrong results. Vasil Kitanov
VB-186386

DWG Export Issue

If the Vectorworks document contains multiple sheet layers, with multiple viewports, and more than one of those viewports uses the same design layer, when the file is exported to DWG that design layer will be duplicated multiple times in the AutoCAD model space. These duplicates will be stacked on top of one another and can add significantly to the digital weight of the file and make it difficult to work with in AutoCAD.

 

This has been going on for many versions now. I have also tested this issue with another beta tester and the issue was reproducible. We went through every export option we could think of but were unable to eliminate the duplicates in the DWG file. This has been a HUGE problem for cross platform communication in my office. I'm hopeful there is a way to tell the export process to not produce the duplicates.  		Vasil Kitanov
VB-184583

DXF import incorrect

I have a user using Moasure, creating a DXF and importing it into Vectorworks, however the geometry seems to be incorrect. See images from Free online CAD Viewer, Archicad, and compare to Vectorworks.  Vasil Kitanov
VB-187955

metric unit DWG only import in imperial

See the attached dwg survey file.

Import this dwg file into VW.

set the units to meters (which it is)

now measure the scale bar. Notice the dimensions is not correct but is 304.8/1000 's of the expected scale. This is the ratio of feet per meter.

Now try this in an earlier version of VW (2021 for instance)

The scaled dimension and scale bar will correspond. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-186902

When exporting to DWG Spotlight label legends text sometimes gets flipped upside down.

Spotlight symbols with label legends that have been mirrored or rotated have the legend text flipped upside down when exporting the DLVP to DWG.

See the attached VW file and DWG file I exported from it. I used the mirror tool to copy spotlight symbols which look fine in VW but their label text gets flipped in the DWG. VW should be able to compensate for this and everything should export as it looks in VW. 		Vasil Kitanov
