VB-189393

Angle parking broken

Are we really the only office using diagonal parking? :)

Draw a row of parking with the PARKING SPACES tool. Set the parking spaces to 9'x18', the 45° angle.

The spaces are incorrect size. The 9x18 area is supposed to INCLUDE any wheel bumper. Instead VW draws 9x18 from BEYOND the bumper...in other words, a space much too long! Turning the bumper on/off has no effect on the bug. 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-187707

Linear Material: long lasting issues

The Linear Material has long lasting unpredicatbility.
Please open the file and observe the edges and crossing of the generated polys.

It is also impossible to know in which side the Linear material will draw, as it flips autonomously.
Edit the side of the zig-zag poly as displayed in the attached file to see it flip uncontrollably. 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-189920

Workplane not always oriented correct

This is from one of our associated testers. He's a 3D power user.
Detailed Description is in the testfile.

Here the description in short (from this power user): Workplane is not always logically oriented correctly in 3D. Maybe this is WAD but the I do not understand the logic behind it.
When placing a workplane in 3D the following results should always be achieved(relative to the point of view in 3D space when placing the work plane!):X positive to the right,X negative to the leftY positive up,Y negative downZ positive towards the viewer,Z negative away from the point of view.
With a 3D cube,this does NOT work,in 2 out of 6 cases!Error rate = 33.33%. 		Josh Loy

VB-189776

Pathway Hardscape has incomplete fill when border is off at start and end

Create a pathway type of hardscape in a straight line, and choose a Flagstone, or Pavers-Grid, or Pavers-Running, joint pattern, and a border.
Notice how the center area fills correctly with the joint pattern.
Now turn off the Pathway Borders for the Start and End.
Notice how the center area only has a small strip of fill. This seems wrong.
If you turn on either the start or the end, the center area fills completely again.
Maybe this is how it's supposed to work?
It seems to work if the path has a bend instead of just being a straight line. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-189790

Hatch in the 2D plant representation changes dimension.

If you put a hatch in the 2d representation of a plant, and you activate custom mapping or, you modify with the attribute mapping tool, and you close the file, the hatch doubles in size. Here's the video.  Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-186990

VB-186402

It doesn't work to use a textrue by class for a texture bed hardscape

When you use a Hardscape as a texture bed, the textures are not displayed correctly in the next circumstances:

- The textures are displayed "by component"
- The Upper component has it's texture set "by class"

When the texture is set freely or by material, there's no issue 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185808

Plants Duplicated in Update Plant Styles Dialog When Plant Folders Used : JBC

# Open a new blank file.
# Import a handful of plant styles from any library.
# Choose Landmark menu > Update Vectorworks Plant Styles.
# Click Yes to proceed with the update.
# Note that in the Update Vectoworks Plant Styles dialog each pant is listed once.
# Create a new Symbol Folder in the file and move all the plants into that folder.
# Repeat steps 3 and 4 and you will now see each plant listed twice in the Update Vectoworks Plant Styles dialog. If you proceed at this point, then each plant gets added twice to the plant catalog.

This is one of those bugs that has been around for a number of versions, but it becomes very disconcerting for a diligent user who is trying to keep their files well organised through the use of a plant catalog and symbol folders.

Note the the bug also exists if one is using the Plant Database and calls the Update Plant Data command.

Thanks. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185250

Move Tool: Plants move to wrong position

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When moving the plants like shown in the video, they don't end up in the place that we click on. After changing the drawing scale, then its possible to move the plants to the wished position. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-185105

Plant Tool Dialog Buttons Fail to Reliably Appear for Plant Shadows : JBC

One of our users has reported an issue with the plant tool that we are unable to resolve or reproduce on Mac 10.15.7 or Windows 10.

If they edit a plant style or click the Settings button in the Obj Info palette with a plant selected, then click Plan View Effects, the radio buttons and and associated Document... and Custom... buttons fade in and out of visibility and making them almost impossible to be clicked (see attached video).

I had the user send us through the diagnostics from their machine (see attached) and noticed they had an external display. I got them to disconnect the display and reopen Vectorworks, however the problem persisted.

Please let me know if you have any suggestions for how to resolve this if you don't think it is a bug.

Thanks. 		Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-191559

When printing using "Adobe PDF", it is output in Porrtrait A4 size even if it is Landscape A3 size. (Windows only)

When printing using "Adobe PDF", it is output in Porrtrait A4 size even if it is Landscape A3 size. (Windows only)
Turning on "Rasterize print output(Very Slow)" in the print dialog may solve the problem.
If turning off "Use GDI+ imaging", I can't confirm the problem.

As far as the behavior is concerned, it is similar to the Fuji Xerox printer case (VB-163834) that I inquired about in the past, so there is a possibility that it is related.
In addition, it is possible to avoid this by disabling the option to use "Use GDI+ imaging" or exporting Vectorworks PDF, but some users are particular about outputting in Adobe PDF and cannot set this option. Please investigate and correct the problem.

 

Hayato Wada

A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-192127

Renderworks doesn't work good on our user's proxy environment.

Our user reported that Vectorworks freezes after ran any Renderworks rendering, it reverts soon but rendered as Shaded, not as Renderworks.

The problem seems to occur when they are behind their proxy server, they confirmed it doesn't occur if they disable the proxy.

And according to their investigation, Cineware.exe connects to IP: 138.201.129.41 via port 443 (the destination is "mx-inet05.maxon.net”) after ran Renderworks, it doesn't occur if they added the destination to the bypass list of their proxy.

We are also behind a proxy on our office, but we couldn't reproduce the problem.
We guess their proxy setting is extremely strict.

The user would like to know as follows
1) Does the inter-process communication between Vectorworks.exe and Cineware.exe connect via "mx-inet05.maxon.net"?
Because of able to use Vectorworks even offline, unlikely to think like this, but the user suspects it has something relation with "maxon.net".

2) Does Vectorworks.exe or Cineware.exe connect to ".cloudfront.net" and ".amazonaws.com" while running any Renderworks rendering?

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-186218

Marionette cannot reshape objects using rectangles as control geometry

Please see attached file

On the left, the Marionette Object uses a rectangle as Control Geometry

On the right, it is a poly

The reshape tool only works on the poly object

You cannot convert the CG in the script to a poly to get it to reshape

 

Rectangle sources should be reshapeable.

 

I originally thought this could be due to no screen plane, but it persists back until at least v2020 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-185071

Marionette: Move Node - vOffset input default must be tuple

By default the node has this written in line 14:

d = Marionette.PortIn( 0, 'vOffset')

When this port gets no input from the outside, 0 \[zero\] causes an error though:
_TypeError("'int' obj is not subsciptable")_
(see screenshot)

Changing 0 to (0,0) would fix this. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-186520

Marionette node "surface from curves" should have inputs

Because the Marionette node "surface from curves" has no inputs, the versatility of this node is very low.

Note: Tech support is already working on this issue.

Tech support answer:

"Hi Jeroen,

I had one of our Marionette experts look at this node and it does appear to be working in a way that I would not expect. Right now that node needs the curves to be selected, which Marionette networks can’t do unless they’re converted to menu commands. They are looking into re-writing that node to accept inputs.

One potential workaround could be to Select all the 2D objects and extrude them to 0”. Then use the following command to get NURBS surfaces.

Modify > Convert > Convert to NURBS

Thanks,

JOSEPH BLOCK
SENIOR GLOBAL TECHNICAL SUPPORT MANAGER
D: 443.542.0411" 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-185430

Some contours made by the marionette "contour" node are corrupted

In the added document:
If you create contour manually, all resulting curves can be converted to NURBS surfaces by the command "Model- 3D power pack- create surface from curves" without issues.
When you create identical curves with the "contour" marionette node, for some resulting curves, it doesn't seem to be possible 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-184995

Marionette: unlink Node fill and pen opacity attributes

To reproduce please watch the video.

In 27.0.2(627588) (current SP2.1 release) when you change the fill opacity, the pen opacity changes with it to the same value. You can drag'n'drop or manually type in some value, but it always snaps back to the value set by the fill opacity.

In 27.0.3b(630314) the pen opacity slider is grayed out, so you cannot even drag'n'drop it.

If using the Attribute Node (vs. Set Class Node) is for the purpose of setting a set of custom attributes, linking the pen to the fill opacity doesn't sound plausible.

Please unlink the pen from the fill opacity. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-189727

Please see attached file and screen recording. When the rectangles are replaced with circles, the bounding box isn't resized to account for their new bounds Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-187563

Marionette: Opacity functions are swapped for pen and fill

Documentation states that pen comes first, but in practice, fill is the first variable.

Nodes need to be updated and tested to ensure the appropriate values are being set. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-189746

Marionette: Get Poly Edge not correctly filtering for 2D objects

Use GetTypeN instead of filtering for boolean vars, 5 and 21 are 2D Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-189745

Marionette: Set Fill By Class has typo

Need to use () instead of [] for opacity Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-190923

Marionette: Get 2D Info kicks error if fed Symbol

there should be handling for cases where 2D objects are not passed to node Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-187250

Marionette: Group node copies input objects, but really should just change their parent

The current implementation results in multiple duplicates of the same object being added to the group and is an unwanted result. We should just change the parent of the object so that it maintains its settings (i.e. name, etc.) and does not cause multiple identical object to be placed within the group. Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-186911

Marionette: Incorrect name, Is Text Color By Class (should be style)

resource name incorrect. Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-186544

Marionette: Duplicate node should have the option to place the objects into the same container as the original object

Currently we are placing the duplicated objects into vs.Handle(0)

Users may want the duplicated objects to be in the same container as the original object

Additionally there is a new function CreateDuplicateObjN that should be used moving forward 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-186435

Marionette: Get Centroid 2D node converts object to a poly

Getting the value should not not force the existing object's type to change.

This node should make a copy of the object to query rather than destroy the existing object.

 

Discovered when running this command on a 3D poly object 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-189849

KLS: Download of BIMobjects not working with Vectorworks web browser but in external browser

Hi there,

using BIMobject customers could download object by an internal web browser.
but this does not work properly.
E.g. roof windows from Roto do not get downloaded.
If customer does the very same using an external browser, then it works.
Guess that's a bug.

The internal Vectorworks web browser should also download the BIMobjects. But instead there is a message, that the file format is not supported. along with a list ofile formats like vwx, dxf, dwg, skp and 3ds.
Okay, Roto does not provide vwx, but they provide 3ds.
So I would expect the Vectorworks web browser to download at least the 3ds files and not getting a message that there is no supported file format.

The current workaround is to use an external browser. But the Vectorworks web browser should also work. This is annoying for customers and they get the impression, that Vectorworks does not really work.

See attached video. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-185330

Attached is a file with some Spur Gears.

Red circles mark the spots where the objects edges overlap each other and shouldn't. 		Konstantin Lalkovski
VB-190901

Assert about bounding box appears when creating a chain extrude

In a blank file, draw a polygon. Then make the chain extrude tool active. Create a chain extrude. The following assert appears: EJKerr: outbSuccess || bMayFail. This is in bounding box code called at the end of MP_CreateNurbsCurve. It seems to try to access a cache for the bounding box and it is null. Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-184556

The vs.py file in the SDK, which is used for developing custom plug-ins, is missing a number of active definitions.

It also contains a number of obsolete and deprecated functions which I list here. I am not sure if they need to be there, since they cannot be used. I'd suggest to add the obsolete/deprecated status, should they need to stay in the list.

PS, this list is grepped from my own database, thus there might be a few imprecisions as of what is obsolete/deprecated.

VB-185990

KLS: IFC-Export objects displaced when created in rotated plan

Customer file, landscape, drawing in high coordinates. Landscape steps created by extrusions in an obviously rotated plan. You see this only when editing on of the extrudes. Export IFC and all those steps are displaced about a yard. If I create such a step with an polygone and command extrude without rotated plan, then no displacement.
Bug, feature, limitation?
Please have a look.
Regards Klaus
PS: Video and testfiles attached 		Mihail Rizov
VB-191888

KLS: Window based on symbol displaced on export IFC 2x3

Hi there,
objects in wall displaced when IFC export 2x3. ifc 4 is fine.
German window based on a symbol. It seems that the symbol loses its height and get export on height = 0. But it should be 0,4m.
Using ifc 4 is fine. No displacement. Only 2x3.
Customer would use ifc 4 but here he misses the export option "Export wall/slabs by components". 		Mihail Rizov

VB-192034

KLS: Wall Closures missing in ifc-file when exported by components

In data manager ifcwall, ExportOptions, Export by Components = True, then wall closure of the walls are missing.
But with Export Separate Instances = True the wall closures are present.
See Video and testfile. Also my exported ifc-files.

We had a discussion here at ComputerWorks and our ifc experts do have the opinion, that it is a bug that wall closures are missing with Export by Components = True.

What do you think.
Bug or WAD.
WAD that Export Separate Instances = True exports the wall closures.

Thanks and Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Mihail Rizov
VB-187943

Exporting a IFC .zip file do not warn of a preexisting file

As from Object, follow those steps:

1) open a file with a model well formed to export as IFC;

2) Export as IFC NOT compressed;

3) Export again in the same folder and notice that you asked if you like to replace the existing file;

4) Export as .zip IFC;

5) Repeat point 4)

6) observe that the already existing file .zip is replaced without any warning;

 

Observe also that the name suggested is without .zip, but the file written has the .zip suffix

A screenshot attached show the name misure-ance. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-190495

Data reorganization bug

Grzegorz reported:

A new button in OIP for walls, roofs and slabs "Data", which corresponds with the same field in the object style, does not transfer information to ifc tab, if it is placed from OIP. The only way to fill ifc values connected to Data fields is by editing style. See a clip for more info.

From user's perspective, I would expect that, by selecting a wall and filling Data fields from OIP, I get unique values in ifc tab for this particular wall.

The same problem is in roofs and slabs. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-187590

IFC: linking material properties to wall components doesn't work

If you want to link a material property to a wall component (IfcBuildingElementPart; Export by components) the property in the resulting IFC model will be the one for the outer component for all, or the property for the core if there's a core.

Watch the video for more information. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-189587

Turn off unified view checks itself

I've been seeing this on 2 different Macs.  This time I caught it on

Vectorworks 2022 SP4

Mac OS 11.6

MBP 16-inch, 2019

2.4 GHz 8-Core Intel Core i9

32G RAM

AMD Radeon Pro 5500M 8 GB

Intel UHD Graphics 630 1536 MB

 

Possibly related:  With an external monitor plugged in graphics card sometimes overheats when using VW.  In this instance I restarted the computer and opened ONLY VW w/ no external monitor.

Reopened file.  

Document Settings > Document Preferences… > Legacy 2D > Enable legacy 2D features was NOT checked

BUT

Turn off unified view WAS checked (and greyed out).

Made several design layers active and switched between layers changing views to verify that unified view was off.

When I went to File > Save As… to save a version of the file to submit it immediately turned unified view back on.  Verified by looking in Document Preferences. 		Josh Loy
VB-186017

ConnectCAD: Text Tight Fill checkbox unchecked not working for linked text in symbols in devices

See screenshots: i enter the device profile group, I double click the label symbol to edit it. I select the text object linked to device.displaytag. Set its width to 48 and select Wrap Text. Result as expected with Tight Fill unchecked.

Now I exit the symbol - text width fits the text only - Tight Fill is not respected. Same when I exit the device.

Note: in an ordinary text object i.e. not linked text in a symbol, if Tight Fill is not checked the fill extends the entire Width of the object. 		Conrad Preen
VB-185607

Not displaying entirety of viewport if Drop Shadows are applied

Hello,
The user has inadvertently had Drop Shadows on by default.
The section viewports that the file should open on will show these. If you zoom in and out you will see the entire viewport but when stopped it will not display everything in it's entirety.

You have to select to viewport and uncheck the Drop Shadow on the viewport. However once updated it still shows a Drop Shadow. If you go back to the design layer the model does not appear to have drop shadows applied. However you have to De-selct the objects then look at the Attribute palette. Here uncheck the Drop Shadow, update the viewport (that don't appear to need updating) and the Drop Shadow will go.

In 2022 turning of Accelerated Graphics fixed it. In 2021 none of the 3 Display options in the Prefs did anything.

Cheers,
Peter



Josh Loy
VB-189630

DLVP disappears when "Accelerate Graphics" is deactivated

In the attached file there is a DesignLayer-Viewport referencing an external file. If I switch the "Accelerate graphics"-option off, the viewports in the DLVP disappear. If I switch it on they are visible. Sometimes you have to close and reopen the file to see the effect. Josh Loy

VB-189346

Some Stair objects may appear red (colors that intersect the faces of the clip cube) in the clip cube .

Some Stair objects may appear red (colors that intersect the faces of the clip cube) in the clip cube .
Render settings: Shaded / Renderworks type

Stair setting example:
--Stair Settings> Construction tab> When “Stringer Extension at Stair Bottom” is set to “1” or higher, the boundary part of Stringer is displayed in red.
--Stair Settings> Construction tab> When “Riser Thickness” is “0”, Riser is displayed in red.

Reproduction procedure:
1) Open the sample file "12905.vwx". The Stair object is placed inside the clip cube. The rendering setting is set to "Shaded" and the view is set to "Right Isometric".
2) Select the Stair object and click "Settings ..." in OIP.
3) Open the Construction tab of the Stair Settings dialog, check that "Stringer Extension at Stair Bottom" is set to "100" and "Riser Thickness" is set to "0", and click the OK button to close the dialog.
4) When checking the Stair object, the boundary part of the Stringer at the bottom is displayed in red. Also, Riser is displayed in red.

Please also refer to the attached "12902.mov".

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-192070

Stair Guardrail Frame Bar inconsistent height on stair vs. landing

I was review VB-192017 for initiating when I notice an issue I couldn't resolve using the current Stair Settings.  Perhaps this requires a VE, but starting with a VB in case there is something I am missing....first to admit, I am not a stair expert.

I attached a Vectorworks file and some images.  I was trying to create the type of stair set up the user wanted in VB-192017.  Since the user required a guardrail bar to run at 21", I used the Frame section to create this.  As can be seen in the images and file, that guardrail bar does not meet/bend at the post like the Handrail and Guardrail between the stair and landing.  This is just one of the issues causing that may cause the bar to be at a different distance from the Tread to the Guardrail on the stairs vs. the landing. 

Also noticed the vertical height between the Tread and the Guardrail is different on the stairs vs. landing.  According to the diagrams/images in the Stair Setting, the Guardrail is measured vertically and the Frame measured at an angle.  This might also be affecting the change in distance between the tread and the Guardrail Frame bar.

Happy to discuss more if you have questions or need clarifying.

  		Christopher Graye

2. Select the Railing/Fence Tool and open Settings

VB-189616

Sloped fence gets flipped top rail

customer submitted a file to tech support where they have a 5"x2" top rail on a wood fence.  When the fence has no slope to it the top rail appears correctly.  As 5" wide and 2" tall.  As soon as the fence gets a slope to it, the top rail flips.  As 2" wide and 5" tall

I have tried saving the correct fence as a symbol but that does not fix it.

As soon as the slope is taken out of the fence, the top rail returns to its correct position.  User indicates that these were drawn with the 3D line tool.

I found raising the height of one end of the working top rail fences will not flip the top rail over.  In my screenshot, the fence that is not sloped can be raised on either end without issue. 		Christopher Graye
VB-191579

Space Labels Get Lost when Translating Older-Version Files

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022 and 2023, since the behavior's changed in each version. The file contains a Space object with a custom label symbol named "Space Convert", that was created in an older version.

To reproduce, open the file in each version.

In VW 2021, note that the label gets translated correctly (the "Space Convert" symbol is still applied).

In VW 2022, note that the label symbol gets replaced with a generic one named "Space Tag-Simple w/ Area".

In VW 2023, note that the Space has no label at all.

If I save the file in VW 2021 and then open it in 2022 or 2023 it works fine, so this only seems to happen when translating directly from the older-version format. 		Christopher Graye
VB-184567

It is not possible to create multiple Bitmaps at the same time with Render Bitmap Tool.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
Vectorworks2020～2022
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
It is not possible to create multiple Bitmaps at the same time with Render Bitmap Tool.

In Render Bitmap Tool, if another range is specified again with the render bitmap tool during the Bitmap creation process, the Bitmap creation that was being executed earlier will be interrupted, and an incomplete Bitmap will be created.

In v2019 and lower versions, even if you specify a different range in the middle of processing, both will create a normal Bitmap.

It is not possible to determine whether this behavior is due to a specification change or a malfunction.

Please refer to "sample12750.vwx","movie12750.mov","12750.png".

 

Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Justin Hutchison
VB-184828

Space Clipping: A fixed height + constraining Objects doesn't work for an bottom clipping

Hi Vectorworks

The bottom clipping with a fixed height with constraining objects does not work. The dialog will be completed but it will not create a bottom volume to the objects lying below.

I've attached a screen video with my steps and my test file.

Best regards, Denis 		Jürgen Keser
VB-189785

Mac text objects do not always refresh after OIP style changes

This may be a duplicate - I thought I had seen or filed this issue earlier, I am filing it again because I cannot find a similar issue in JIRA.

On Mac sometimes a text object will fail to update fully when a style change is made via the OIP. For example, a change of font, style, or size may change the bounding box of the text, but the text content will not actually redraw until the mouse is moved over the drawing view (or zoom or similar action forces a redraw).

I saw this quite a bit in the latest 28.0 acceptance test on Ventura, though it seemed to happen less the more I continued.

I am attaching a video which shows two occurrences of the bug.

The first, at 0:31, involves a text size change from 14pt to 11pt which changes the selection box size but does not actually change the appearance of the text until the mouse is moved into the drawing area.

The second, at 0:49, involves a font change from American Typewriter to Andale Mono. Again, the selection handles of the text object move as if it has been resized, but the text content is not actually re-rendered until the mouse is moved into the drawing area.

I have seen this occur with other changes too such as turning on bold or outline, and also on Undo/Redo of these types of changes. However as the video shows it is not consistent, sometimes the refresh works fine.

I do not believe this bug is new. 		Rick Berge
VB-186332

Dashed Line displayed in viewport hidden line render

The attached file is from VW2021 SP5.

After converting the file to VW2022 SP3 or SP4 beta then updating the Viewport, we can see that a dashed line is being displayed in the Viewport while using Hidden Line background render, which isn't visible with VW2021 SP5.

Viewport: A5An-Cx-SO50-0053. 		Hernán Stamati

VB-189450

Imported DWG doesn’t change the file units

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open a new blank document

2. Go to File > Document Settings > Units

3. Set Units to Millimeters in the Length group

4. Go to File > Import > Import Single DXF/DWG

5. Choose a “blocks_and_tables_-_unitless.dwg” file to be imported and click on an Open button

6. Set For unitless DXF/DWG file use drop down to Millimeters

7. Turn on a Change current Vectorworks document units to match the specified DXF/DWG file units check box

8. Click OK to close the dialog and import the file

9. Go to File > Document Setting > Units

10. Notice that the units change to Feet & inches

Please watch the attached video. 		Vasil Kitanov
VB-192383

"Center on objects after view change" broken inside Symbols, Solids

This hasn't worked for a while:

The VW Pref "Center on objects after view change" is supposed to center the view on your objects [either the selected object(s), or all objects if there's no selection] whenever you switch among standard views. It works fine inside Groups and when not inside any containers.

However, it currently does NOT work inside Symbols, or when inside Solid Additions, Subtractions, and other Solid types. This might also affect other container types too (?) 

This bug slows down work and makes designing feel quite "frustrating" since objects are constantly flying off the screen.

Example file attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-192421

VW23 does not start (possibly caused by cinerender.dll)

We have a Customer, which is Vectorworks 2023 installation does not start, Cineware freezes when trying to start Vectorworks 2023. After removing the cinerender.dll, its possible to start his VW23 installation, hence we believe that this .dll is causing the problem.

Since it is not a crash, there are no User Logs or .dmp files of use for this case.

All Anti-Virus are turned off and the Client uses Windows 10. Now he had informed us that this is happening in a second computer, as well.

We do ask for help with this case, as we do not know why the cinerender.dll is not letting Vectorworks 23 to start in both computers.

Thank you in advance. 		Dave Donley

VB-191169

In a blank document, make the railing/fence tool active. Create a railing/fence object. Wait 10-15 seconds. Three DSTOPS will appear: "Bruce: DSTOP: GetObject is being asked to handle an out of range SysName (-1 - legal[0,9]", then "Paul: DSTOP: Object of type 11 failed CheckObject validation. Would be deleted on file read.", then "Everyone: DSTOP: ## GetMethodValue: passed a non-existent group number!". Christopher Graye
VB-188118

Parameter Lists Differ Between Worksheets and Data Tag Dynamic Text : JBC

In both database worksheets and data tag dynamic text, one can choose a PIO or record to work with, and then get a list of all available parameters which is great. There is however, a seemingly inexplicable difference between these lists, which you can see in the attached screen shot for the Existing Tree tool.

The list in the data tag contains fewer items than the worksheet list, and the parameters that appear to be missing are those that are set not to appear in the OIP because their name begins with a double underscore, but their alternate name is NOT __NNA_DO_NOT_CHANGE or equivalent.

I used the Existing Tree as an example, but for me the problem arises in WinDoor where the user fields do not appear in the Data Tag list (see second screen shot). Because the user fields don't appear in the Data tag, the users are not aware that these fields are available, yet they contain some of the most commonly used information.

Thanks. 		Kostadin Ivanov

VB-191913

KLS - Data tag does not increment value when additional tag data

Data tag consists of an increment value and one user-entered field.
Option "Always display the Edit Tag Data dialogs" is active, because customer wants to type in text to moment he inserts the tag.

What happens is, the there is no increment. But you can type in text. This is when option "Always display the Edit Tag Data dialogs" is active.

So customer deactivates that option.
What happens is, that there is a increment each time a data tag is placed into the drawing. But no window opens to type in user-entered field.
Customer has to do this afterwards which means more clicks and is annoying.

See video and testfile.
Kostadin Ivanov
VB-190689

The File menu commands are sometimes all disabled when Home Screen is displayed

Per the Home Screen acceptance test, the New, Open, and Close commands should be enabled in the Vectorworks Mac menu when the Home Screen is open.  They usually are, but I have seen them disabled multiple times (screenshot attached). I have not found the correct steps to reproduce reliably. 

 When the menu commands are disabled, the corresponding keyboard shortcuts are also disabled.

 

Update: I can reproduce this in 706528. Previously, the cause was found to be the Preferences dialog in the Message Center pane, but I can also produce it after opening the help dialog. That dialog is displaying now because the 2024 online help is not yet available. Please see 706528.mp4. 		Payne Chang

** Process on: Vectorworks Cloud

VB-186653

one Railing thumbnail does not change in the settings(German Version only)

The video shows the problem being reproduced.
This only happens with the German Version. I could not reproduce this with any of the Railing objects in the US Version.

1. Open an empty file with the German Version.

2. Select the Geländer/Zaun Tool (Railing/Fence) that is in the Architecture section.

3. Open Geländer/Zaun Settings.

4. Go to Basiceinstellungen and in Vorgaben Kategorie select the "Staketengeländer ohne Pfosten".

Result: The Settings Thumbnail image on the right will not change to that one. All other Railings work correctly. 		Christopher Graye

VB-191429

alpha numeric sorting needed for Graphic Legends

Graphic Legends:
So in numbering doors we have to use " D01, D02, D03..."etc instead of "D1, D2, D3" so that the Graphic Legend will keep them in numeric order. Otherwise we get D1, D10, D11, D2, D3....

The default program code should accommodate normal human numbering sequence. 		Hernán Stamati

If you change the direction of the polyline (counterclockwise), the arc length dimension is right.

Same problem also occurs in Vectorworks 2022. 		Rick Berge
VB-192010

System configuration: MacBook Pro 16 (2019, Core i9, 2.4 kHz, 64 GB Ram, AMD Radeon Pro 5500M 8 GB), Monterey (12.6.1), latest Wacom driver: 6.4.0-9Wacom Cintiq pro 16, Wacom Cintiq pro 32, Wacom Intus BT M

Here the report from a customer:
"Unfortunately, there seems to be a problem with Mac (system Monterey) in interaction with Wacom products: If I go with the pen to a tool in the tool groups and want to call a "sub-tool" (nested tool) there, it does not work. Example: Go with the mouse in the tool groups on rectangle &gt; hold down the mouse button on the rectangle &gt; a small window pops up and you have the choice to select between "rectangle" and "radius rectangle". Works also with the trackpad (hold down). But not with the Wacom pen. No matter which Wacom (see above) is tested.The whole thing I have tested both with VW2021, as well as with VW2023. So far I have worked in the same hardware configuration with 10.15.7 (Catalina). Here this error does not occur. (VW2019 - VW2022)With all other installed programs, this error also definitely does not occur (Affinity-Designer, -Photo, -Publisher, Cinema 4D (R21), Capture One 22, Rhino 7, Moment of Inspiration 4.0, Adobe-Photoshop, -Illustrator, -InDesign etc.)This error demonstrably occurs exclusively with Vectorworks + Monterey. Various attempts with system restart, parameter ram reset, SMC reset, safe system start etc. do not lead to a change of the situation."

Could you please help?
By the way, customer still has SP1 because we haven't released SP2 yet.

Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Ian Lane

VB-185911

in worksheet Style.'xxxx' returns all linear dimensions in mm

When using a worksheet database to edit style parameters dimensions are always shown in mm, rather than document units.

Entries in the data base cells in document units are accepted correctly and displayed in the record.xxx cells in document units.

See example.  Style.width returns mm dimensions. It accepts unit dimensions.

door.width returns document units. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-192290

Import then Delete a texture causes the next imported texture to display the wrong texture

Screen recording is attached showing these exact steps.
# Have a textured 3D object.
# In the RM, double click a texture from some other file to apply it to the object.
# Navigate to the Open File in the RM.
# Right click and delete the texture you just brought in. Don't replace it.
# Navigate back to the other file in the RM and double click some other texture to apply it to object.
# This second texture displays incorrectly: it instead shows the first texture that was just deleted.
# Additional textures import fine, it's only that second subsequent texture that's wrong.

Note that the thumbnails in the RM and the Render tab are correct, it's only displayed incorrectly on the object itself.

Closing and re-opening the file seems to "refresh" the textures and then it works okay.

I'm also attaching the file I recorded this in, plus a secondary file with the textures I used (but I don't think the bug is related to any specific files or textures). 		Justin Hutchison

VB-192185

Radial dimension unreliable on VP annotation poly with multiple arc segments

In the attached file, there's a polyline with two arc segments. The file should open to a sheet layer, with a Viewport that shows the polyline as it lives in the Design Layer, plus a duplicate copy of this polyline pasted into Viewport Annotations.

Notice in the recording, that for the Design Layer poly, I can easily add a Radial Dimension to the smaller arc segment. However, when I try the exact same thing on the Annotation poly, the Radial Dimension is place on the incorrect arc segment. No matter what I do I can't get it to dimension the smaller arc segment; it always sticks to the larger arc segment even though I'm not clicking on it.

 

As I'm troubleshooting, I just noticed: if I switch the poly's FILL to NONE, then the issue goes away. It's almost like the Radial Dimension tool is "seeing" the white pie-shaped fill of the large arc segment, even though it's not really there since the arc is composed into a polyline. This might be causing it to "see" the larger arc segment as being "in front of" the smaller arc segment? Screenshot of this hypothesis attached as well. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-192965

Tooltips in concatenated strings are confusing

Many tooltips that appear on mouseover show what a tool mode or function is, which is highly useful to the user. However, many of these tooltips are concatenated strings. For instance, mode-indicating tooltips are composed of tool name + mode, which works fine in English. Not in Spanish, where many mistranslations occur.

For example, in the below screenshot, the tooltips for the three Polygon tool modes are shown: *Inscribed Mode* ({color:#00875a}*Modo Inscrito*{color}), *Circumscribed Mode* ({*}{color:#00875a}Modo Circunscrito{color}{*}) and *Edge Mode* ({*}{color:#00875a}Modo Borde{color}{*}). The current Spanish translations for these modes cannot be edited or improved because the strings making up these tooltips are concatenated. The desired translations, {color:#00875a}*Modo polígono inscrito*{color}, {*}{color:#00875a}Modo polígono circunscrito{color}{*}, {color:#00875a}*Modo borde definido*{color}, respectively, are more informative translations for the user . Concatenated strings are _*not*_ a best practice for localization purposes and should be discontinued. 

*Recommendation:* replace {color:#4c9aff}_*all concatenated strings*_{color} for tooltips and similar mouseover texts with full strings so that they can be properly localized for a better user experience.

We understand that this may be a significant undertaking (hundreds of tooltips) but it has to be done to improve the Spanish user interface of future versions, as well as provide a better English UI for localization into the other languages served by Vectorworks. 		Payne Chang
VB-190182

A formula set in the Field Mapping doesn't show on the Define Mapping when switched IFC language to "Localized" in the Data Manager dialog.

Localized version only.

Steps to reproduce.

1) Go to Tools > Data Manager... .
2) The Data Manager dialog opens. Make sure IFC language is "Original".
3) Expand "Plug-in Objects(Built-in) list in "Objects" group.
4) Choose any Object type or Object Name. (Ex. Break Opening CW)
5) Select any Data Set or Field that is set a formula in Field Mapping already in "Data Sets Attached by this Mapping".
6) Click "Define Mapping" button and "Define Mapping" dialog opens. A formula that is set originally shows. Make sure "Expert formula" is selected on the radio button above.
7) Click OK.
8) Switch IFC language to "Localized". Then click "Define Mapping" again.
9) "Define Mapping" dialog opens, but the formula doesn't show. "Simple formula" is selected this time.
10) Even selected "Expert formula" on the radio button above, but the original formula doesn't show.

Best regards,
Hitoshi Takeuchi
A&A 		Mihail Rizov

* set the top view pane to be 2D/Plan view
notice the bottom view pane shows the text wrong.  Something is confusing the textures used for the bottom view pane, somehow

 

ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION

=============

Hello,

In the enclosed file and movie you will see a library file of some Hoists. Multi View is used with different visibilities. Top window is in Top Plan and the bottom an isometric in a Shaded render. Each Hoist has a Data tag (DT) attached.

This report +was+ going to be about the fact that the text in the Shaded render suddenly didn't read and were all a grey box. After restarting the computer it still happened.

Playing around with Wireframe and Shaded revealed something else. If the Top Plan view was changed to 3D and rendered in Shaded the text appeared correctly in the bottom rendered window. Mostly, although some lines in the DT were solid.

If the top window that was Top Plan, then Shaded went back to Top Plan the bottom window shows the Dts now with totally different outputs to the same ones in the Top Plan view. It bizarrely means the data tags text is totally incorrect in one window.

It seems that this is something to do with Multi Views, Shaded rendering of Text and Data Tags themselves. I'll leave that up to you!

Cheers,

Peter

 

  		Justin Hutchison

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When the OI's Lock Profile Plane is active, the Extrude Along Path are incorrectly displayed. 		Josh Loy

Note also that the rasterized crop itself is wonky (even though it shouldn't be there in the first place). The clipped portion of the polyline is shifted and scaled. 		Josh Loy

VB-187219

VB-191881

Spotlight Speaker Tool Snap to Lighting Pipe Inconsistency

When inserting speakers while snapping to a lighting pipe (or straight truss), the speakers are inconsistently inserted either at the height of the hanging position (expected behavior) or at z=0 (the floor), while remaining "connected" to the hanging position ("Position" will report that they are on the hanging position in the OIP) and the speakers will move in x, y, and z planes when the hanging position is moved.  While testing, on 4 separate occasions a crash was triggered while inserting a speaker (logs attached): crash occurred while testing both 2023 SP 1 and 28.0.x (SP3).
h3. Steps to Reproduce Bug
# (Optional) Start from reboot
# Launch Vectorworks 2022 or 2023 (occurs more frequently in 2023)
# Create a new blank document
# Change to Spotlight Workspace if not already there
# Reset all Snap Preferences to defaults
# Use the Lighting Pipe tool in the Rigging Tool Set to insert a Lighting Pipe long enough to insert multiple speakers (longer than 15ft.) and with a z-height greater than the height of the speakers you will insert (greater than 4ft.)
# Select the Speaker tool from the Event Design Tool Set
# Select Insert by Symbol Mode (selected by default) in Mode Bar (though behavior also occurs in Insert by Catalog Mode)
# Select a speaker symbol from the pull-down menu in the Mode Bar (or use Default/Generic Speaker)
# Insert multiple speakers along the lighting pipe, clicking when the red diamond-with-crosshairs cursor aid indicates that the speaker will be "hung" on that position
# Observe the z-heights of the speakers, either in the OIP or in a 3D view
# (Optional) Repeat steps 6-11 with Straight Truss tool instead of Lighting Pipe tool

h3. Notes
* It's hard to consistently reproduce the unexpected behavior, but it seems like the "snap to hanging position" criteria are different than other snap criteria. Moving the cursor within the "snap to hanging position" reticle while not directly over the hanging position can sometimes cause the unexpected behavior. Possibly easier to reproduce when more zoomed out.
* Unexpected behavior occurs in both Insert by Symbol Mode and Insert by Catalog Mode
* Builds tested:
** 2021 SP 5 (622768) - all speakers insert at z=0 but are connected to lighting pipe/truss, move when lx pipe/truss moved.
** 2022 SP 5 (664120) - some speakers insert on lighting pipe/truss, some insert at z=0, all are connected to lx pipe/truss and move when lx pipe/truss is moved
** 2023 SP 1 (672648) - some speakers insert on lighting pipe/truss, some insert at z=0, all are connected to lx pipe/truss and move when lx pipe/truss is moved
** 28.0.x (678727) - some speakers insert on lighting pipe/truss, some insert at z=0, all are connected to lx pipe/truss and move when lx pipe/truss is moved. This build seems most inconsistent.
** 27.0.6 (680324) and 28.0.2 (680333) on Win 11 (64-bit): similar behaviors as above 		Kevin Linzey

Some issues:

-1. When printing, some data tags do not scale properly when the Text Scale in Advanced Properties of the viewport is selected. They do show properly on screen.- Moved to VB-193522

2. When copying and pasting some objects with data tags attached, the data tag does not copy with it.

{-}3. When option-copying or copy and pasting existing data tags for a space object without the leader line selected to be on, you cannot re-associate the data tag - it disappears when trying to click on it to re-associate{-}. Moved to VB-192458.

4. On occasion, data tags for space objects will disappear after printing. This is the same issue as VB-188614. 		Jürgen Keser
VB-191181

Move Stairs performance is worst with Windows

The attached videos shows the problem being reproduced.

When using the Move Tool to move 250 Stair Objects, with Windows is visibly slower than with Mac.

1. Select all Stair Objects

2. With the Move Tool, like shown in the videos, move the stairs 1000 units to the right.

With VW19 Win10 needs 47 seconds.
With VW23 Win10 needs 60 seconds.
With VW23 Mac1.6 needs 47 seconds.

The performance with Windows has been decreasing and it should at least remain in pair with previous versions or actually improve. Please take a look at this.

QRT: Part of performance tests for Knapp AG (about 400 licenses). 		Jürgen Keser
VB-190279

VW2023SP0 Shaded with 'Draw edges' on and in perspective, produces prolific graphical anomalies

This relates to [this Forum discussion|https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/87645-vw2022-shaded-view-flickering-hatches-patterns/] which has been contributed to by both Vectorworks staff Joseph Block and Dave Donley.

This issue was present in Vectorworks 2022 and continues in Vectorworks 2023.

While using 'Shaded' render mode with 'Draw edges' ON in Design Layers, object surfaces display with graphical anomalies all over them. The following are factors in whether the lines appear at all and to what degree:
* View must be:
-- In perspective
-- Rendered in Shaded
-- …with 'Draw edges' ON
-- At an angle between ~30 and ~80 degrees off the surface(s) in question. 
-- At a particular distance from the object(s) in question. 
* Larger crease angles (in 'Shaded Options') makes them disappear and smaller crease angles make them more likely to appear and increases the number of graphical anomalies that appear. (See attached video).
* [Suspected] The more geometry present, the more readily they appear, *but* you can start to see them when only a single, short wall is present, but at the right zoom level. 

This problem must relate to the graphical representation of edges ('Draw edges') because increasing the 'Edge thickness' in the Shaded Options dialog will increase the thickness of all graphical anomalies. 

If you have any Vectorworks-vindicating or hope-inspiring findings, please take a moment to contribute any appropriate news/progress/information to that discussion as some high-profile users are engaged with this matter and the OP 'line-weight' is fatigued by Vectorworks issues which he seems to encounter more often than most users.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-191713

Filtered Textures not exporting to OBJ correctly

bug video: [^2023-02-07 12-37-08.mp4]
* open [^simple_v2023.vwx]
* export obj
* import the obj that was created in previous step
Notice colors are wrong. Filter color (and possibly other parameters) of a Renderworks Texture are not included in the exported texture images.

 

When exporting an OBJ, textures that have a "Filter" color in the Color Shader are not incorporating that color into the exported texture image. Only the grayscale version is being exported (see attached screengrabs). In this example, the texture image is a subtle "paint" texture and the filter color is being used to determine the paint color. However, the exported OBJ looks white because the OBJ textures contain none of that color information.

This is *catastrophically bad* for sharing models with VFX vendors in the film industry.

This problem was already addressed for FBX (VB-177018) and Datasmith (VB-177018) but now the same fix needs to applied to OBJ. Please check all other export types too since this needs to be consistent.

Example files attached. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-190396

Spigot Straight Truss 2D and 3D do not line up when joining two pieces

This is not a new issue, seeing it going back to Vectorworks 2021 and probably much farther.  Maybe WAD or won't fix...

When using the Spigot Connection on Straight Truss, there is an issue with the 2D and 3D not lining up when connecting two pieces of truss.  So when the truss is connected as expected in 3D, there is a gap in 2D.

Then a length of spigot truss is drawn with smaller connection intervals than the length, this doesn't look as it should (spigots are overlapping too much).  However, the 2D and 3D match up.

Images, and file have been included.  Video will be added shortly.

I understand Straight Truss is not the recommended Truss tool, but in case this can be easily fixed I wanted to make note of the issue. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-191714

Hanging Positions Text Alignment Problems

Hanging Positions have 2 problems relative to Text Alignment:
# When edits are made to HPs, the HP Name/Label Text takes on the default alignment settings instead of retaining those settings as set when created.
# With a selected HP, settings changed in either the Format Text... dialog or the Alignment menu items have no effect.

In the attached file is a HP created when the default alignment settings were Center/Center.  With nothing selected, change the default alignment settings using either the Format Text... dialog or the Alignment menu items.  Select the HP and edit the Position Name.  The Text alignment will adopt the default alignment settings instead of retaining the desired settings.  Then, with the HP selected, change the alignment settings using either the Format Text... dialog or the Alignment menu items.  Changes made will have no effect. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-191938

Seating Section Curved Boundary adjustment

The boundary path of the Seating Section PIO in the attached example file uses a curved boundary with 4 corners and 2 radius points. I was working on the file to assess the capacity and size of various curved options. I adjusted the boundary with the Reshape Tool, checked the seating numbers, and then adjusted the boundary again. On every occasion, the boundary path would inconsistently appear as paths with many control points making the adjustment of the boundary on a radius difficult and time-consuming.
If I altered the control points by deleting the extra control points back to a single arc control point, it would revert the next time it was opened, but not always.
The layer with Option B has single a radius to each curve, Options C and D have morphed into having multiple control radii. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-192357

Using Multi view breaks Spotlight label legend manager edit layout 2D

If the use multiple view pans view option is enable it is not possible to edit the 2D layout of a label legend. The edit 2D layout will open in 3D top view mode and none of the label legend components will be accessible Kevin Linzey
VB-190889

Tape Measure gives erroneous results when inside Annotations and snapping to other viewports

When you're inside the Annotations of a Viewport and use the Tape Measure tool to measure something that resides in a different viewport (of the same scale), one would assume that you should get accurate measurements, since measurements are world-based when inside Annotations.

However, in this scenario you get niether accurate world-based measurements NOR the corresponding page-based measurements. What you get instead are nonsensical measurements that are much larger than they should be. I believe that the scale factor of the viewports is being factored in TWICE. For example, when inside a 1:16 viewport, then snapping to geometry that's inside a different 1:16 viewport, the Tape Measure readings are 16x what they ought to be.

I believe this issue first began a couple versions ago when the ability was added to use the Tape Measure while directly on a Sheet Layer to take world-based measurements from a viewport (when not in Annotations). This was a great improvement, however the code seems to have infiltrated to inside Annotations as well, leading to these erroneous Tape Measure measurements.

Screen recording attached. 		Josh Loy
VB-191388

direct link is not sending textures in spotlights

In vectorworks we can attach textures to project in spotlights. This is also supported in Unity but currently we are not saving the texture data in spotlights for either direct link or datasmith files. Justin Hutchison

observe the ids for the lights
disconnect, (don't make any change) reconnect using direct link. Observe that the lights now have different ID.
Please notice this problem only happens to lighting devices. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-186669

Tape Measure Tool Alt+M shortcut doesn't work with floating view pane

This happens only with the German Version, as the Alt+M shortcut is a German Version shortcut. This is a Windows only problem.

As the Summary indicates, the shortcut Alt+M that activates the Tape Measure Tool does not work when working in a floating view pane OR having the drawing detached from Vectorworks and active in a second monitor instead.


How to reproduce the problem:

1. With the German Version open a blank document.

2. Draw a couple objects, doesn't matter which.

3. Activate the "Mehrere Ansichtsfenster" (Multiple View Panes).

4. As example, right click on the Right Top Pane and select "Ansichtsfenster im Eigenem Fenster" (Create Floating View Pane).

5. Now press Alt+M to activate the Tape Measure Tool. Nothing happens.

6. Click the "Mehrere Ansichtsfenster" (Multiple View Panes) Off and back On again.
Now Alt+M works. 		Ian Lane

VB-185927

Reshape Tool Marquee Gets Constrained in 2022 When Selecting Multiple Vertices

The attached movie shows this in VW 2021 compared to 2022.

To reproduce:

-Open the file in VW 2021
-Double-click the surface to activate the Reshape tool
-Draw a selection marquee around a few vertices
-Now hold-down the Shift key and draw another marquee around another set of vertices

Note that the marquee can be drawn with any size, as expected.

-Now try the same thing in VW 2022

Note that now the marquee gets constrained and can only be drawn with certain shapes. This makes it really difficult to select the vertices that you want.

This happens even if all snap constraints are disabled.

The same thing happens going back to 2022 SP0. This also happens in Mainline.

VB-190959

Hidden Line Smoothing Angle not reliable in Perspective - omitting lines beyond smoothing angle

In the attached file & screengrabs, you can see the geometry has numerous 90° corners. Pretty basic. However, when rendered in Hidden Line, some of these 90° edges are not being drawn. I have my smoothing angle set at 30°, so there's no reason these edges shouldn't be drawn.

I believe this problem only affects Perspective projection, as it seems to behave more reliably in orthographic projection.

This has been an issue for a while, and it makes it quite challenging to create clear, legible viewports since geometry is missing. In many cases if I lower my smoothing angle I start to get extra edges that I don't want elsewhere, so that's not a solution.

Vectorworks needs to properly calculate smoothing angles based on the geometry, irrespective of POV or projection. 		Josh Loy

VB-188398

Setting Text Vertical Alignment to Bottom Baseline fails when Line Spacing is set to 1-1/2 or Double Spacing

When the line spacing for a selected text block is set to 1-1/2 Space or Double Space in the OIP Spacing menu, setting the Vertical Alignment to Bottom Baseline yields an incorrect result.

When Spacing is set to Single Space, ALL Vertical Alignment settings yield correct results.

When the line spacing is specified by setting the Leading using the Set Spacing... option in the OIP Spacing menu, ALL Vertical Alignment settings yield correct results.

Setting the Vertical Alignment of a text block using the VectorScript call SetTextVertAlignN() yields the same results as setting the Vert. Align manually in the OIP.

Setting the Vertical Alignment of a text block using the older VectorScript call SetTextVerticalAlign() moves the text block incorrectly for Bottom Baseline (4), but all other settings (1-3, & 5) yield the expected result.

 

If you select a text block and run the attached script "Show Vert Align Y", it will place a Locus on each of the Vertical Alignment locations and create a text block showing the X&Y values for each of the 5 alignment points.

This problem even exists for single lines of text when the line spacing is set to 1-1/2 Space or Double Space and the Vertical Alignment is set to Bottom Baseline, even though these configurations are somewhat meaningless.

I've observed this problem exists at least back to VW 2015, but it worked correctly in VW 12.5 and earlier. 		Rick Berge
VB-189598

T02121 Cropped perspective option is very difficult to access with legacy 2D options

While most work benefits from having Cropped Perspective off, a handful of use cases still benefit from it, particularly sightline, camera, projection, or lighting studies where you need the ability to pan and zoom the image to analyze exactly what is in view from that perspective point.

In files created in 2022 and above, this is the procedure necessary to turn on cropped perspective:
- Open Document Preferences
- Switch to the Legacy 2D tab
- Turn on Enable Legacy 2D Features
- Close the dialog with OK
- Re-open the dialog again
- Switch to the Display tab
- Enable Cropped perspective
- Close the dialog with OK

For someone truing to turn on cropped perspective, this is a very circuitous route, and less than ideal UI.

At the very least, enabling legacy 2D should immediately make Cropped Perspective visible without relaunching the dialog. Also, Cropped Perspective does not seem to depend on the Legacy 2D preference actually being enabled — it merely controls the visibility in the dialog, which is a bug.

I would advocate for one of these options, however:
- Move Cropped Perspective to the Legacy 2D tab. Again, Cropped Perspective does not actually depend on the Legacy option, so it would always be visible and editable. (I prefer this option)
- Have Cropped Perspective grayed on the Display tab, with a note that Legacy 2D be enabled to use cropped perspective. In this case, Cropped perspective SHOULD be changed so it is dependent on the legacy 2D option. 		Josh Loy
VB-191586

When Home Screen is active, cannot close Vectorworks via right clicking Dock icon

Normally you can close any app on Mac OS by clicking its icon in the Dock and choosing Quit. However, when the Home Screen is active in Vectorworks, this doesn't work. Ian Lane

VB-192487

VB-191907

VB-191597

Fill material is not assigned correctly to imported slab style

When you edit the 2D fill of a material from the library in your active document after importing, the material is different from is version in the default libraries. When you import a slab style from the library afterwards containing that material, you get a name conflict alert.
In case we choose "do not import, use current", you'd expect the material in the slab component to have the 2D attributes as set in the material. Unfortunately, this is not what happens. The slab keeps its default 2D fill, until we unlink the material from that slab component manually and link it again. This step shouldn't be necessary in order to make things function as expected. 		Christopher Graye

Twinmotion-Direct Link Spotlight issues

This one is all about bringing attention to the multiple mix settings that are not coming correctly into Twinmotion.
Color
Attenuation (distance)
Intensity in Lumens
Shadows
Haze


I made a recording in order to super explain the issues. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-192496

"BUG": Unit-Setting for Length (no Space between No. and unit)

Hi VW-Team,
greetings.

Attached you find a VW 2023 Beta SP3 file with further instructions.

There is a small but disturbing little thing with the unit settings.

All “Length” don't have a space between number and unit.
“Area” and “Volume” aren't affected.

Affected are:
UI, input fields, Worksheets, …

You can help yourself with a "Custom" setting, but this
make problems with SIA-Dimensions (and maybe other stuff)

I think a consistent way will be the best,
so “Length” should also get a Space between number and unit.

Greetings from Germany and Merry Christmas
Tobi 		Rick Berge

VB-186474

When the shortcut key for selecting some tools is pressed in Design Suite or Landmark of Workspace, the highlight indicating the selection status of the tool may not be displayed in the Tool Set Palette.

If Tool Set of "Building Shell" of Tool Set Palette is selected in Design Suite or Workspace of Landmark, when the shortcut key to select one of Wall Tool / Round Wall Tool / Wall Join Tool is pressed, the tool selection status is not highlighted on the Tool Set Palette.
*If the shortcut key of those tools is pressed while the toolset of "Site Planning" is selected, it will be highlighted without any problem.

Target shortcut key:
Wall: 9
Round Wall: Option + 9 (Mac) / Alt + 9 (Win)
Wall Join: Option + J (Mac) / Alt + J (Win)

Reproduction example:
1) Switch Workspace to Design Suite or Landmark and select Selection Tool.
2) Click the "Building Shell" icon in the Tool Set Palette.
3) When the shortcut key "9" is pressed, the Wall tool in the Tool Set is not highlighted. Even in this state, the Wall tool is selected. This is the problem.
4) Click the "Site Planning" icon in the Tool Set Palette. The Wall tool in the Tool Set is not highlighted, but if the shortcut key "9" is pressed again, it will be highlighted.

Please also refer to the reproduced movie "12854.mov".

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno

VB-191102

Vectorworks uninstaller is not signed

Uninstalling via Add/Remove programs produces a warning that the uninstaller is not signed : "Do you wish to allow this program from an unknown publisher...".

This is of course a security risk, as the user cannot tell whether the uninstaller they are running is the provided by Vectorworks, or one that some evildoer has sneaked in after Vectorworks was installed.

Furthermore, some Windows 10/11 users will be unable to uninstall Vectorworks at all, if the security policies are enabled that prevent unsigned executables from being given the elevated permissions required to uninstall.

This is particularly serious for Windows 11, as these policies appear to be enabled by default.

I believe this affects all versions of Vectorworks. 		Tim Ardoin

With the current content, a difference is not seen until the 19th result when applying the filter. The same rows are captured from an instance of clicking New Features on the Home Screen. A comparison of the two shows the results are different starting at the 19th item.

When clicking New Features on the Home Screen, the URL contains text to filter the results, but it sometimes changes to the default course link before the content is loaded.

Specifically, the initial link of [https://university.vectorworks.net/course/index.php?mycourses=0&tagfilter%5Btype%5D=content+type-1-new+features&medium=vectorworks_software&source=homescreen&content=learn]

VB-192397

Wall lines of "Interior Elevation Viewport" may not display when "Length Range" is set to "Limited by Section Line Length".

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2022, v2023
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
Steps:
1) Open the sample file Sample221028-1.vwx.

2) Select one of the viewports and go to "Advanced Properties" > Extent tab.
   Please check the Length Range is set to "Limited by Section Line Length".

3) Switch the active layer to "aaa".

4) Select the Interior Elevation Marker and click "Edit Section Lines" on OIP. Please check that every endpoint of section lines is drawing until wall edges. Then go back to the sheet layer, the wall line on the left doesn't show on #2 and #4 viewports.
(*2022_1.png)

5) Switch the active layer to "aaa" again.

6) Delete the door and go back to the sheet layer. 
(*2022_2.png)

7) Select all viewports and update.

8) The left wall line of #2 become to show, but the one of #4 is still invisible.
(*2022_3.png)

Please refer to the attached movie.(movie13031.mov)

*Remarks*
*It depends on Vectorworks version, which viewport lines don't show after deleting the door.

In Vectorworks 2023, the line one the wall on the left of #2 still doesn't show even deleting the door.
(*2023_3.png)

*This problem reproduces even though creating from a new file.

Rie Ichimura

VB-192108

- Drag it with the Selection tool

Note that the interactive preview shows correctly at this point.

- Now zoom-in on the poly as shown
- Drag it again

Note that now the interactive preview either fails to show or gets stuck.

This only happens when the poly is on a 3D plane.

This happens even when "Accelerate Graphics" is disabled.

The same thing happened in VW 2022 but not in VW 2021, so this looks like a regression. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192288

the line thickness is in mili-inch and not millimeter

The value must be expressed in 100th of millimeters rather than being converted from milli inch to millimeters. Because of the conversation we have a difference of 0.03mm per mili inch (the precision of the order 3 hundredth, whereas it must be of 1 hundredth). We have this error message "values exist in mils, the thickness is stored in mils". See the video  Rick Berge

VB-192235

BUG: Rendering Transparency Datavisualization of 3D-Symbols (with/without Autohybrid)

Hi VW-Team,

it seems that the transparency settings are not working as they should,
in combination with Datavisualization + 3D-Symbols (with / without AutoHybrid).

We have two different settings for Transparency:
* lines
* fills 

 

It seems that the settings for fills, also affects the transparency
of lines for 3D-Symbols.

 

You can set a value for line-transparency, and it gives you the right
feedback, but only without a setting for fill-transparency.



If you set a value for fill-transparency and no line-transparency,
the lines get a transparency too.


I have not checked if other 3D objects are also impacted.

Attached is a test-file: VW 2023 SP2

 

Greetings from Germany
Tobi 		Rick Berge
VB-192267

objects move when dimensions move

This has been a feature in VW for a while, but I've never been as bothered by it as just now - when dimension strings in the annotation layer move, as in changing the offset distance from the dimensioned object, this is likely to move the object being dimensioned - 

!image-2022-12-09-17-58-37-518.png!

in this screen shot, I move the dimension string that is now 3'-4" to the right of grid line 3, to adjust the location of running string away from the walls it is dimensioning - in other words, not the dimension leader lines, just the offset.  the dimension string is in the annotation layer.  this caused the walls being dimensioned to unexpectedly move.  this is bad - I didn't notice this had happened when I first made the edit, but luckily I noticed it before sending the drawing out.

In my opinion, adjusting elements in the annotation layer should never affect the location of elements in a design layer - 

See sheet layer A2.1 in the attached file -

This is what it was before the dimension string move, and what it needs to look like -

!image-2022-12-09-18-09-57-447.png! 		Rick Berge

VB-192136

KLS: Clip Cube renders error with stair

See Video.
3D-View, Shaded and then clip cube and one of the stairs get a false representation. 		Christopher Graye
VB-189547

In Full Window mode, floating palettes once hidden do not come back

On the Mac I use floating palettes. If VW is set to use Full Screen, closing a floating palette causes it to stay hidden. If a palette is docked, then it can be closed and reopened easily with the keyboard shortcuts or the menus.

If the workspace is changed then floating palettes are able to be shown once (if they were hidden), but they will not reopen again if they are subsequently closed.

If the VW window is set to not be Full Screen, toggling floating palettes returns to normal operation.

To reproduce:
1) Set VW to Full Screen mode, either with menu Window > Use Full Screen, or click the green button in the upper left corner of the VW window.

2) Assuming the Resource Manager (RM) is already floating, toggle the the RM's visibility with CMD-R, or menu Window > Palettes > Resource Manager.

3) Once it is hidden, it will not reopen with CMD-R, or the menu, until you either exit Use Full Screen mode, or switch workspaces.

4) Return to Full Screen mode.

5) If the OIP is docked, toggle its visibility with CMD-I, or the menu Window > Palettes > Object Info. It will close and reshow as expected.

6) Detach the OIP so it is now a floating palette. Toggle its visibility with CMD-I and note that once it is hidden, it will not reopen. 

7) Leave Full Screen mode and all palettes will toggle visibility with their keyboard shortcuts, regardless of whether or not they are docked.

This problem exists regardless of the "Use Application Window" menu setting. There may be other factors that affect this behavior, but I have not found any yet.

I first noticed this in VW 2022, and then verified it persists in VW 2023. I just now opened VW 2015 and the problem exists there as well. 		Ian Lane
VB-192156

Reported by Grzegorz:

For both objects one side is overwritten by Texture tool and rotated 90deg.

In both cases texture renders correctly in the shaded mode, but fails to render hatch on faces where "texture tool" is used.

See attached files 		Rick Berge

VB-188652

Multi Views: Create a sheet layer viewport when one panel is active, and when you return to it, the view will have changed to Top Plan

Hello,
In the enclosed file and movie you can see the file has two panels using Multi View. The top view is in a Shaded rendered perspective.

Once that panel is active and a viewport is made onto a sheet layer, users are taken to that sheet layer.

The bug is that if you make a design layer active to view as before, the entire view has changed to Top Plan and not remained as it was.

If Multi Views are not enabled and you repeat the process, when you return to the design layer(s) the view remains as before and has not changed to Top Plan but it does if Multi Views are enabled.

Cheers,
Peter 		Josh Loy

VB-192073

Clip cube produces odd sectioning artifacts

bug video [^2022-12-05 11-26-58.mp4]
* open [^simple.vwx]
* fly around
notice the stair object shows artifacts with Clip Cube.  The landing mesh is non-manifold and that causes issues with clip cube rendering technique.

====== ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION =======

Oftentimes, the clip cube produces unexpected artifacts. They seem to be floating polygons, always red ( the color of the section plane) and unpredictable. In the attached file, activate the "perspective" saved view; everything renders as expected. Now activate the "clipped" saved view. There are two red rectangles that do not correspond to any model geometry. See annotated screen shots.

I've seen this behavior for years and may have reported it before. 		Christopher Graye

VB-191836

Section Viewport: Heliodon shadow not displayed class AR-BIM-Raum-Bauteil is not visible

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

In the attached Vectorworks file we have a Section Viewport named "Ansicht West", in which we can see a building and a shadow generated from a Heliodon. The Heliodon is using the class named "AR-Sonnenstand_W_N", like it is shown in the video.

In the Section Viewport Class Properties, if we deactivate the class "AR-BIM-Raum-Bauteil" visibility and update the Section Viewport, the shadow of the Heliodon will disappear. Despite the class being used by the Heliodon is not the same. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192030

Problem exporting a rendering as an image

Please try this:

Open the file we are attaching.
Launch a rendering process, for example Custom Renderworks and have a look at the resulting scene.
Now call the command Export Image file and have a look at the image gotten. There are evident differences between the r3sults of the two procedures, as you can see even in the images we are attaching. 

As a result, even the command Create Batch Render Job gives unexpected outcomes when you export the image.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-192092

render options plugins need updating, for locations other than main header

The get/set for all the individual render mode options are implemented as plugin functions, and they only work with the single location that is the node/global for the active design layer environment.

Which brings us to methods like GetViewportHiddenLineOptions that play a shell game of rearranging nodes to get the viewport settings into the global and back again. For Change Tracking we want to reduce or remove these sorts of unnecessary document changes. 

We could add a handle param to the existing function so it can work directly with different locations like a layer or viewport.  But some of the flavors of render options are also pushing up against the limit on the count of params that can be passed so that would require the argument count be reduced by combining bits or moving data into a struct. Or the pio API dropped.  		Justin Hutchison
VB-192069

hidden line render - VW crash

See the attached test file and crash report.

The current view should be in shaded render. I Changed the rendering to hidden line.

That seemed to take a long time.

During the rendering process, I used the mouse wheel to zoom out.

I zoomed out, stopped and VW crashed.

Tried to duplicate - it did not crash again. Maybe, you'll be able to see what happened.

Stop the presses ! I got another crash while waiting for the test file to load.

The second crash report is attached. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192074

3D KML Export position incorrect in Google Earth

Exporting a 3D KML from Vectorworks creates model in KML file approx 100m out of position. Justin Hutchison
VB-192075

Worksheets that use DatbaseByScript() do not SUMMARIZE the list properly

In order to build a complicated list of objects that meet a user's criteria, I used DATABASEBYSCRIPT() in the Database Row Formula. This works perfectly to build the list, but only when all items are listed, each on its own row. When I click the SUMMARIZE option in one of the column headers for a database row, the first item in the stacking order is set in its own summary group. All other items are summarized correctly. 

The problem can only be seen when there are multiple item of every type and the first item shows a quantity of "1" and somewhere in the list more items, similar to the first, are grouped into their own summary group. They should be grouped with the first item.

I have attached a VW file that has multiple rectangles, ovals, and lines. It also contains two Worksheets, one that use SUMMARIZE and one that does not. In each worksheet, there are two database rows. The first database row uses =DATABASE(ALL) for the database row formula, and the second database row uses =DATABASEBYSCRIPT('All Objects'), essentially doing the same thing as the first database row but with an external script. 

When all items are listed in the database rows, i.e., no SUMMARIZE option is selected, the lists in each database row look identical. This is worksheet "WS No Summarize".

When all items are summarized in the database rows, i.e., the column headers have the SUMMARIZE box checked, the list in the first database row looks correct but the list in the second database row has an extra entry. This is worksheet "WS Summarize". Note the first line in the second database row has its first entry showing a quantity of "1", while the same objects show later in the list with a quantity of "2". They should all be in the same summary row and show a quantity of "3".

 

To observe the problem:
Move objects around on the drawing by changing their stacking order, then Recalculate All Worksheets. Note that the item on the bottom of the Stacking Order is the item that is isolated in the first database row that uses DATABASEBYSCRIPT() in the Database Row Formula, and has Summarize checked in the first column.

 

This anomaly makes Worksheets useless that have to use the SUMMARIZE feature, and also need a custom script to build the database list.

 

VW file and screen shot attached.

  		Rick Berge
VB-191903

Auto-Hybrid draws wrong 2D geometry on this extrude containing clipped poly

In the attached file there's an Auto-Hybrid containing a single Extrude. This extrude is a single polyline, which has an interior clipped out portion (negative space).

The Auto-Hybrid is drawing that negative space as the "sectioned" geometry, rather than the positive space of the extrude. 		Christopher Graye
