VB-191692

KLS: Text size suddenly multiplied by layer scale when switching through view panes

Hi there,
attached is a customer file in which the slab drainage has a very bis text size. Guess it is multiplied by the layer scale.
We do have this regularly from our customers. Not too much to be alarmed, but too often to ignore this.
It mostly happens when customers work with multiple view panes and at least one view pane shows a sheet layer. Maybe clicking and working through these panes with different layer scales (1:1 by sheet layer and 1:50 or more by design layer) gets the text size confused.
In this case the slab drainage has a far too bis text size. Of course it can be repaired. Sometimes easy peasy and sometimes more difficult.
Maybe you heard of this from your customer? Or seen it in your support?
We are gonna ask the customer if he knows the steps to run into this.
I tried it on my own but could not run into it myself.
See testfile and video. 		Josh Loy
VB-191716

Problem setting working plane in a Multiple View Plane

Working in Multiple View Plane mode with Top/Plan view and other three 3d views, it occurs the following problem:

If I want to draw a circle in a certain high in one of the 3D views, by previously setting a new working plane at that height, If I intercept with the cursor the top/plan view after chosen the basic tool, the working plane switch to layer plain.

Otherwise, If I avoid intercepting the Top/Plan View, and run the cursor through the other 3D views the problem doesn't occur.

VB-190087

Images applied to render lights overscan, making precise alignment impossible

The corner pixels of a spotlight's projected texture are clipped out.
* open [^PV Image Size.vwx]
* look up close at the corner of the projected texture on the extrude

notice the corner pixels are missing

 

===== ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION ===========

See the attached file. There is a single render light with and ImageDef node attached to create a projection. 

The original image is pasted in the layer plane. You can see that an inscribed circle perfectly meets the corners of the rectangle.

Also pasted is a shaded bitmap render of the projected image. You can see that the corners are getting clipped, making precise alignment of the image impossible.

Renderworks and Redshift produce similar results.

If this is by design, as a safeguard from an errant halo around the image, then this extra scaling needs to be documented. Better yet, the image projection routine should add empty pixels around the image rather than scaling it.

!image-2022-08-31-10-31-19-908.png!

!image-2022-08-31-10-31-43-414.png! 		Justin Hutchison

When I copy paste the symbol into a new document (NewDocumentDesignLayerOnly.vwx) then no displacement.
When I copy paste the symbol into a new document with story related design layers (NewDocumentStory.vwx) then also no displacement.

I dont know what's happening in the file SkylightDomedNURBS1.vwx. How has this displacement evolved? I have seen such displacement before and always with stories and 3D-symbols.

Maybe you can find out how this displacement was created? And also tell me a way how to get this repaired.

VB-191893

Convert Section VP from VW2022 to VW 2023 changes hatch background

VB-187256

Mac - inserting Emoji and Symbols can cause bad text rendering and state

-I cannot 100% reproduce this, but did manage to get into this state twice testing VW27 SP4.-

UPDATE: I was able to reproduce this in VW2021, and have attached a file that exhibits the bug.

If you insert multiple, different extended characters into a text object by choosing *Show Emoji & Symbols* to launch the popover from the Mac text input menu, you can get into a state where the normal rendering of the text gets messed up (see screenshot). This looks like it might be another aspect of the general character-by-character unicode rendering vulnerability our Mac code has.

Also however this can result in a bad keyboard-input state in general, where attempting to exit out of text editing, invoke a keyboard shortcut for undo or copy/paste, etc., causes a beep and has no effect. I think what may be happening in that case is the Emoji and Symbols popover is somehow going offscreen (behind the window?) while still being active, so even though we can't see it it is preventing additional keyboard interaction. Switching to another document/layer/application seems to get one out of this bad state.

One additional aspect, the two times I saw this I also noted that as I typed space after inserting an emoji, a period got inserted into the text which I didn't type. This may also be a sign of some multi-byte unicode input problem.

I will keep trying to determine a 100% reproducible sequence, and also determine whether it's a regression (I suspect not). 		Ian Lane
VB-185676

Main Menus not clickable requiring restart of VW

The attached video shows that I cannot click on any of the top menus. Keyboard shortcuts work. Restarting VW resets something and the menus then work.

This happened to me about a month ago and I had thought it was just a system failure. After restarting my mac, all was fine. About a week later a user posted the same issue in a Facebook forum. The issue hadn't appeared for me again until today.

Of special note about today: I had to activate my installation of VW this morning. No idea why as I was using it fine last night. 		Ian Lane

VB-191776

Image prop issue from rawpixel download

User submitted an image that he claims is 16 bit and will not import as an image prop in 2023 on mac.

I have attached the image and a screen shot of how it looks on the PC in 2023.

As mentioned on a mac in 2023 the image prop command will not bring in this image as is at all.

I found opening the image in a photo editor and exporting as a png with 32 bit color allowed the image prop to be created and an alpha mask was available. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-191746

Vectorworks refers to Design Layer Viewports as ye olde "Layer Links"

When importing Design Layers + objects - that included *one* Design Layer Viewport - from one file to another, Vectorworks 2023 SP1 presents an alert saying, "A Layer Link cannot be pasted into a different document. Any other objects in the clipboard will be pasted." 

Layer Links are a legacy function in Vectorworks, but they are still supported. The object I included in the source file was a Design Layer Viewport. There were no Layer Links at all. 

Vectorworks should call Design Layer Viewports by their name to avoid confusion and to differentiate between them and Layer Links when they are present. 

See attached .vwx file and my screen recording. 

 

Cheers, 

Jeremy 

 

!image-2022-11-15-15-05-43-816.png! 		Rick Berge
VB-191677

Text Orientation in Rotated ViewPorts

The attached file will open to an active Sheet Layer.  On it is a ViewPort.  I wanted the VP rotated {-}90° so that things could be read right{-}side-up if the resulting print-out of the sheet was rotated counter-clockwise.

Multiple things:
# According to the OIP, the VP is rotated 270°, instead.  This may or may not play into the next issue.

# If in the VP advanced Properties dialog "Adjust Flipped Text" is NOT selected some of the text (Hanging Position labels, Lighting Device Label Legends, Focus Position text, etc.) reads correctly (when the resulting print-out is rotated) and some does not - seemingly dependent on the rotation of the given element.  If "Adjust Flipped Text" IS selected, all of the text reads upside-down when the resulting print-out is rotated. 		Rick Berge

- Now edit the Wall style and click OK without making changes
- Save and Commit
- Close the WF, then open the PF to create a new WF

VB-189694

VB-191623

Markers problem in Section Viewport

In the attached file, you can see some strange markers in the Section Viewport.
This is an unwanted effect but we suffered a lot to find the reason that force them to appear.
Actually they came from the default document attribute.
For a unknown reason, when you update the Viewport, it uses the document attribute and the strange markers show off.
See the movie for a better explanation. 		Josh Loy
VB-191480

Walls with sloping top/bottom edges doesn't support every form of Wall End Caps

Hi Vectorworks

If you have walls with sloping top or bottom edges the wall end caps are in a few situations wrong / not sloped. For the bottom edge, a cut wall end cap might be correct, since there may be a bottom there. But what if the wall is in the air (like a joist). From my point of view, a wall with only 2 modification points should take the angle from below. If you add more modification points, you would always have to use the angle of the last partial element.

Best regards, Marc 		Christopher Graye
VB-191496

Shaded can't render object reflections and transparency at the same time

When a texture has transparency and reflection settings, object reflection are not shown in a shaded render. Justin Hutchison

VB-191577

Viewport not rendering properly

In the attached file update the VP labeled 7 on sheet A0, this is a duplicate of VP1 (now VP7) You get a correctly rendered hidden line but it failed with the shaded. I duplicated that (now VP8) and switched to final renderworks and it rendered both properly.  I created a new VP on a new sheet layer and got the same undesired behavior.

But if I open the file in Build 673231 and update VP1 I works properly.  But If I update VP7 which had already been updated with the undesired behavior I still get the undesired behavior.  I have isolated the problem to the floor on layer 1 Site.  If I delete the floor the malfunction goes away. But if I create a new floor of similar size the problem comes back.

In VP9 I have just the 1 Site layer on.  If I shrink the size of the floor to 40'x40' all is well but if I increase the size to 80'x80' it malfunctions.  I tried creating an 80'x80' roof face, still malfunctions but a 40'x40' roof face works fine.  I tried an 80'x80' extrude, no luck but again 40'x40' works fine

I put the large floor, now contained on layer "corrupted floor" on a new layer, added it to an existing layer and got the same malfunction.

One last experiment, I turned off the texture and the problem went away.  So thinking I had a corrupt texture I imported a new texture from the VW library (Landscape Grass Dead RT) and I still get the problem.

So the problem seems to be with a large textured object, not the object type, layer or specific texture 		Justin Hutchison
VB-191576

Need useful progress message during Redshift shader compilation

On Ventura the first time Redshift is used, shaders are recompiled and this can take minutes.  There will be a new Redshift plugin to fix this problem for SP3 but this problem can crop up again at any time, at the discretion of the OS video driver.

 

VW needs to show a progress message during first Redshift rendering of the session, similar to C4Ds.  On my Ventura I am seeing "Rendering" and time elapsed, it would be better to mention shader compilation may be happening during this first render.

 

Maybe the special message string could go away once rendering progress is >0. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-191549

Attribute Mapping Tool doesn't work when texture has image in Transparency Shader but not Color Shader

In the attached file, the object has a texture applied, and this texture uses Image Mask transparency. The mapping is set to Plane. A user should be able to map this texture using the Attribute Mapping Tool since the texture uses an image. However, since that image is not in the Color Shader, the tool thinks it's not an image-based texture.

This sort of texture is commonly used for CNC panels, wire meshes, screens, etc.

This needs to be fixed so that Textures with Image Map transparency can be mapped with the Attribute Mapping Tool.  		Justin Hutchison

-Open test file 

-From the Visualization palette, turn ON the first two lights (101 PRG - 102 PRG) then render the document in "Spotlight Preview"

-Notice the rendering takes effect but the lit fog is not visible.

Note: Lit fog is enabled here ( Spotlight> Visualization> Set Spotlight Rendering Options...)

-Switching to Wireframe and back to 'Preview Spotlight' doesn't seem to fix the problem.

 

This bug could be related to VB-191430

When you go to Menu "File ; Spotlight Preferences;Universes", you can change the Label

of how each universe is displayed.

first character of your new name again!

For example:

 Default is "1", if I change to "Univ. 1" I can change every other character

later, but the first letter "U", so I can’t make it “1” again.

 The solution is to delete that universe and re add, but still is not the

desired behavior.

VB-191551

Worksheet ObjectVariable(101) function returning wrong value

=OBJECTDATA('OBJECT VARIABLE', 101)

The worksheet function above is returning the wrong value.

In a worksheet database consisting of scaled symbol, Object Variable, 101 should return the type of scaling, 0 for none, 1 for symmetric, 2 for asymmetric. Instead it is returning a very large positive or negative integer in the tens or hundreds of millions.

Object Variable 102, 103 and 104 return the correct values for the X, Y, Z scale factors.

The attached file contains three instances of a symbol. One unscaled, one symmetrically scaled, one asymmetrically scaled. It also has a worksheet showing the dimensions of each instance (assuming you are in an orthogonal view), the X, Y, and Z scale factors for each object, and the last column should show the scale type, but instead gives a very large number.

 

Please fix the ObjectData('OBJECT VARIABLE', XXX) function to return the proper values for XXX=101 and all other selector options. 		Rick Berge
VB-191076

When you want to edit the graphical setting of a class in a section viewport, nothing happens.
Note: it works in a normal viewport. 		Josh Loy
VB-191568

Wall Closure at Inserts Dialog Preview Image Shows Incorrectly in 2023

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023. The file contains a few in-wall Windows that have Wall Closures enabled.

To reproduce, in each version:

- Edit the Wall Style, then edit the Wall Closure at Inserts
- Change the Edit Edge option to "Top" or "Bottom"
- Change the Exterior Shape Type to "Splay" or "Round"

Note that the preview image shows the correct location for the insert in 2022, but in 2023 the image seems to be shifted and the splayed/rounded edges show incorrectly (see attached screenshots).

The actual closure geometry shows the same in both versions, so this only affects the dialog preview.

This happens with the top, bottom, left, and right Edit Edge options.

The same thing happens going back to SP0. 		Christopher Graye
VB-187835

Capped Join operation doesn't work with walls that have mitered ends

Please see attached file for clearest explanation.

I have a 8" CMU exterior wall.

I have 2x4 Duct shafts on the interior. One on each side of the building. I created the first shaft, and joined it to the interior furring. I mirrored the shaft 2x4 walls to the other side of the building. I attempted to perform a capped join to the CMU wall. The join tool did not remove the miter, and simply extended the center of the miter to the center of the CMU wall.

If I use the Wall Heal tool to remove the miter first, the tool works as expected 		Christopher Graye
VB-189650

Walls join incorrectly and don't register as joined

I have been updating this file from a previous version and editing wall styles. In a previous beta, I was able to join these walls together correctly. Then I editing the wall closers of the exterior wall and I found that these walls were now joined incorrectly. I tried removing wall breaks and then rejoining them with the same result. The entire partition wall appears to join to the center component of the exterior wall even though that is not the core component. Then I tried editing the component joining and I get an error saying the walls are not yet joined. Video and file attached. Christopher Graye
VB-190916

SBE: Styled Window PIO dragged from resource palette into wall has wrong insert location

Please watch attached movie. The insert location of the window style is "Wall Closure - Insert Location".
After dragged into the wall, the window's insert location is "Wall-Centerline" instead.

My tests revealed that at the beginning of the RegenSink::RecalculateHandler() gSDK->GetWallInsertLocation() returned 7 (= Wall Closure - Insert Location) for both symbol definition and PIO (RegenSink.fhObject) which is correct.

However, gSDK->GetObjectWallInsertMode(fhObject, wall, insertmode) returned insertion mode 0 (Wall-centerline).

So it seems that Vectorworks assigned an incorrect insert mode to the symbol break. 		Christopher Graye

VB-190882

Walls with Story-Bound Components Can't be Click-Selected After Undoing Style Edit

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Walls with Story-bound components.

To reproduce, in each version:

- Right-click on any Wall and edit the style
- Click OK without making any changes
- Now Undo

Note that now the Walls can't be click-selected, even if you adjust the view or select other objects.

If you do an Option+marquee selection (ALT+marquee on Win) the Walls can be selected, and at that point the click-selection problem goes away.

This only seems to happen when the Wall uses Story-bound components.

I see the same thing in VW 2022 but not in VW 2021, so this might be related to Wall Modernization. 		Christopher Graye

VB-187788

T02172 - Graphic Legend Text Fails to Update Fill Name After Material is Edited

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Wall with Materials applied to its components, that use each of the different resource-based fill types (Hatch, Tile, Gradient, and Image). The file also contains a Graphic Legend that shows the fill names through dynamic text.

To reproduce:

-Note that the fill names show correctly at this point
-Now edit the "Hatch Fill" Material and change the Hatch
-Update the legend

Note that the name updates as expected.

-Now edit one of the other three Materials (Tile, Gradient, or Image)
-Again change the fill, then update the legend

Note that now the fill name fails to update.

This may have to do with the way the dynamic text is set up with multiple functions, so that it'll show a resource name regardless of the fill type. 		Christopher Graye
VB-188843

Vectorscript / Python - GetWallCompStartPts & GetWallCompEndPts return wrong values

If a wall has cap-joined components, the results of these calls on the capped components are wrong.

I used this script:

{{hWall = vs.LSActLayer()}}
{{iCore = vs.GetCoreWallComponent(hWall)}}
{{lPts = vs.GetWallCompStartPts(hWall, iCore)}}
{{vs.Locus(lPts[0])}}
{{vs.Locus(lPts[1])}}
{{vs.Locus(lPts[2])}}

{{lPts = vs.GetWallCompEndPts(hWall, iCore)}}
{{vs.Locus(lPts[0])}}
{{vs.Locus(lPts[1])}}
{{vs.Locus(lPts[2])}}

 

If this script is run on a wall with a cap-joined core component, the loci won't be in the correct place... 		Christopher Graye

VB-189853

VB-185609

Texture created with VS/Python gets corrupted after import in other document

An image based texture created by Vexctorscript/Pyhton gets corrupted after importing this texture to another document (usual for creating own libraries): after import in another document the initial image gets extracted from the texture as a separate resource and the texture will not use this image anymore.

the solution could be in two ways:
* solve this bug as is (having the image stick to the Texture) *OR*
* give scripters a proper functioncall to attach the image (IMO it could be the same as the SDK function *CreateImageFromPaint*) and make it eassier for scripters (and Marionnette users) to create a texture this way.

Also the [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/72877-create-a-texture-resource-from-image-in-a-folder/] mentions this problem. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-187689

Surface Hatches not displaying correctly aligned to their textures

This is a serious issue because the location of surface hatches is critical in order to get correct drawings.  The problem is surface hatches display on the screen incorrectly with or without the "Accelerated Graphics" option.  They do, however, appear to display correctly when panning when Accelerated Graphics is on.  They also appear correct (in the bitmap) when copying and using "Paste as Bitmap".

Please see attached video and VWX file. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-189891

VB-190056

No use of Renderworks when User profile is located on server

Hey guys,

yesterday I had a quite long call with a school.
They are using InteriorCAD and have about 80 licenses.

The teacher, I had the call with, was complaining, that every single PC is not able to use Renderworks or Renderworks-Features (like working with textures).
The process itself pop-ups within the task-manager.

After a while, I checked the path, the userfolder should be located at.
The path started with "\\Server-Name\". This means, the Userprofile of each user is on a server and will be downloaded by logging in.

If I remember correct, there are a few Problems Vectorworks has, when the User folder is not located on the Computer directly (e.g. Not able to log into accounts at start up).

To proof that this fact is leading into problems of using Renderworks, we created a new (local) Account on his computer with administrative permissions.
We started Vectorworks and Renderworks and Renderworks-Features were working perfectly fine.

This leads to the conclusion, that Renderworks isn't working proper when the userfolder is not located locally.

Because the user is using InteriorCAD, the Version he used was SP3.0.1-F3.
In the future, server based Userprofiles will increase in popularity; that's why I am reporting this, so you are aware of potential problems ins the future.

Afaik Renderworks will be implemented into Vectorworks directly, right? Will this Circumstance still be relevant in 2023?

And a side-effect I want to mention here: They were working with i7 10700 and nvidia geforce 1050ti, but the performance was very poor until we used the new created profile with local user profile (Means that server based user profiles could have an impact on performance).

Thanks in advance.

Best
Alex

  		Justin Hutchison

Fredi 		Justin Hutchison

VB-189909

Task T02271 Shadows, Reflection and combination of light angles, doesn't always work in shaded.

-Open the attached fiile.
-Notice it's rendered in Final Quality Renderworks.
-You see the reflection and the shadows of the object.
-Before switching to shaded, make sure you have the options
Check in.
>Textures
>Colors
>Anti-aliasing
>Shadows ( uncheck "On ground only")
>Environment Lighting
>Environment reflections
>Object reflections
>Details Very High
>Shadows High
-Now render it in Shaded, notice the shadows doesn't show with
reflection. No resemblance with Final Quality Renderworks.
-While still in Shaded rendering mode, change angle of the light, now there is
some resemblance of a show with a reflection. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-191396

Export to Cinema 4D should use a more modern ID scheme

The "Export to Cinema 4D" uses an antiquated ID scheme of using a tagged data counter in the document header to assign IDs for exported lights and Renderworks cameras.

With Project Sharing, it is possible to manipulate commits to have multiple lights and Renderworks cameras share the same ID from the tagged data UserData node in the document header since it is not synced to Project Files.

This ID scheme should be updated to a more modern scheme such as UUIDs. 		Justin Hutchison

Set the background render to ' Redshift Interior Fast ' and update 

Notice the rendering gets stuck. One viewport shows a black fill.  		Justin Hutchison

Hi there,

VB-186034

T roadway with rise has issues with sweeps less than 90

If you have a T roadway that has a rise and a sweep less than 90, there will be a gap where the two sections of roadway do not physically meet.  Only happens when there is a rise.  See attached video. Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-190743

VB-191353

Destination Path of Imported Resources is unexpected when folder names are already used

# Open attached "Folder Import Destination.vwx" file.
# Open the Resource Manager. Notice it has an empty folder at the root level called "Stuff" which contains an empty folder called "Shapes". It also has an empty folder at the top level called "Things".
# Navigate in the Resource Manager to the other file "Folder Import Source.vwx". 
# Right click on the "Shapes" folder in the root of the Source file. Select Import to import that folder and all its contents (three symbols) to the "Destination" file. 
# In the "Import Resource(s)" Modal, choose "Select Destination Folder" and select the "Things" folder at the root.
# Click Ok to execute the import.

Expected: The symbols (and their parent folder) appear within the "Things" folder since it was the destination I selected.

Actual: The symbols appear in the Stuff/Shapes folder because that folder was named the same thing as their parent folder in the "Source" file.

I understand _why_ this is happening since we can't have two symbol folders in the same file with the same name. But it is pretty disorienting. In complex files, it is easy to forget I have s sub-folder buried somewhere else with the same name as a folder I am trying to import to a different location. I just spent a while on a real project trying to figure out why my import wasn't working when actually it was working, but it was just dumping the symbols in a subfolder I couldn't find.

Some options of solutions to this:
# I think the ideal solution would be for VW to start supporting multiple folders with the same name as long as they're at different paths. But maybe this is too big of a change.
# The parent folder from Source gets renamed as "Shapes (2)" or something and placed in the "Things" folder as I intended.
# The resources within the Shapes folder end up directly in "Things" and get stripped of their parent folder but at least I can find them.

One way or another, I want these resources to end up in the folder I selected from the "Import Resource(s)" dialog.  		Rick Berge

VB-191289

Style-to-drawing object param transition is limited by doc units precision

# Set document units to have short (or none) delimeter precision.
# Create a styled object.
# Edit the style - change a dimension parameter (e.g. 100 to 100.4).
# Exit the 'Edit Style' dialog with OK.
# The styled objects in the drawing will be updated with rounded value (100 but not 100.4) - this could result in plugin issues when geometry logic needs correct precision (both in style dialog and in-drawing geometry). 		Rick Berge

VB-191135

Link with story is not maintained when duplicating a design layer

When you duplicate a design layer which is linked to a story, the link with the story is not duplicated together with that layer. All parameters are duplicated, except "story" and "story level". For "story level", I understand it gets unlinked, bacause a story level can create just one design layer. But for stories, this limitation doesn't exist. It is important to maintain the link with the story, so story bound objects keep their geometry and z-height. Rick Berge
VB-191266

Screen Aligned Plane Can't be Activated Inside Viewports' In-Place Edit Mode Until View is Changed

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Section Viewport.

To reproduce:

- Enter the Section In-Place mode for the viewport
- Activate any 2D drawing tool

Note that "Layer" plane is active in the mode bar and can't be changed to "Screen Aligned", so any 2D objects drawn in the current view will get placed on the Layer plane.

- Now switch to any other 3D view
- Switch back to "Viewport View"
- Activate any 2D drawing tool again

Note that now the "Screen Aligned" plane gets activated and you can freely draw objects on the section plane.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Josh Loy
VB-191022

Note that the object with Plane mapping shows the Decal correctly, but the object with Surface UV mapping shows it as flipped (see attached screenshot).

VB-191087

"Update all Viewports" menu command doesn't work on the only viewport in the file

-Open attached test file
-You'll notice the Viewport is already said to be up-to-date, according to the, "Update" button in the Object Info Palette
-Go to View > Update All Viewports and nothing happens and perhaps this is correct because the Viewport is said to be up-to-date
-Now, click the, "Update" button in the Object Info Palette
-You'll notice the section fill will appear in the Viewport, for the top-most objects
-That's because a bug had been resolved and the Viewport needed to be updated, to see the bug fix. However, the menu command, "Update All Viewports" wasn't enough refresh/update the viewport and required a force update via the Object Info Palette. 		Rick Berge

VB-191136

Surface UV texture mapping on an extrude: Surface hatch is aligned wrong with texture

When you apply a texture with a surface hatch on an extrude, which is mapped by default by "surface UV", you will see that the surface hatch is rotated 90 degrees if you compare the "shaded" render with a "hidden line" render. Other mapping types don't have these issue. Rick Berge

VB-189586

When adding vertical or horizontal bars on door or window, unwanted lines show on the stiles when running the Shaded rendering.

bug video [^2022-10-26 15-29-26.mp4]
* open [^12917_Door.vwx]
* zoom up close on the door

notice the z-fighting
 

====== ORIGINAL DESCRIPTION =========

Steps differ between Doors and Windows each.

Steps for Doors

1) Place the Door with the Door tool.

2) Click Settings on OIP.

3) Click the "Leaf" from the left pane and choose "Glass" from the Leaf pull-down.

4) Enter any value to the Vertical Bars and Horizontal Bars fields each. (Enter 1 each, for easy to see the problem, this time.)

*Or, you can reproduce this problem if you enter values to the Vertical Bars and Horizontal Bars fields on the Muntins group in the "Lights" as well.

5) Close the dialog with OK. And run the Shaded rendering.
Then, unwanted lines show along the inner frame of the stile.
It looks like the glass is interfering with the stiles.

Steps for Windows

1) Place the Window with the Window tool.

2) Click Settings on OIP.

3) Click the "General" from the left pane and choose "Picture Window Slider" from the "Sash" pull-down.

4) Click the "Muntins" from the left pane and check "Bottom sash".

5) Enter any value to the Vertical Bars and Horizontal Bars fields each. (Enter 1 each, for easy to see the problem, this time.)

6) Enter 1 to the Bar Width field.

7) Close the dialog with OK. And run the Shaded rendering.
You can see unwanted lines on the inner frame just the same as doors.

*Moving the view by the Flyover tool, you can see the problem easier so that the unwanted lines will move.

*As long as I tried, I see this problem also Vectorworks 2021.

Please refer to the attached files.(12917_Door.vwx, 12917_Window.vwx, 12917_Door.mov, 12917_Window.mov and 12917.png)

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Christopher Graye
VB-191228

KLS: Single Dim and Chain Dim different behavior with class opacity

Hi there,
a single dimension and a chain dimension have a different behavior with class opacity.
The class is set to have a fill opacity and not a pen opacity. E.g. fill opacity 30% and pen opacity 100%.
A single dimensions has opacity 100% like set in the class settings. A chain dimension has opacity 30% like the pen opacity is locked to the fill opacity.
Is that intended?
Guess it is a bug. Please fix that.
Gruß, Klaus Lüttich 		Rick Berge
VB-189597

Profile group lights behave differently between Shaded and Renderworks/Redshift

I first reported in VB-158622, but starting new because the momentum on that seems to be lost and now Shaded and Redshift are in the mix.

The attached file contains two Marionette PIO's. Both have render lights in their profile group (the Marionette definition). The one on the right also has a render light in the geometry, which duplicates the light in the profile group.

Note, profile groups are the method we have for having a light in the PIO appear in the visualization palette. It also has the benefit of any user-overrides preserving between generations.

In Shaded, the profile group light does not render. The object MUST duplicate the light into the geometry if it's to support Shaded rendering.

In both Renderworks and Redshift, the light renders directly from the profile group. I believe that the Shaded behavior is a bug, for the following reasons:
1. Duplicating the light into the object geometry means that the light is twice as bright in RW/RS than in Shaded renders
2. Having the light render from the profile group means that it responds to viewport lighting overrides with no additional coding. The light in the geometry does not respond to overrides.
3. In addition to the VP overrides, synchronizing the light between the profile group and the object requires more code and thus more opportunity for bugs and inconsistencies. For VW objects, this affects (at least) the Helicon and the Lighting Device. Replicating the RW/RS behavior in Shaded means the light's appearance is handled by the core. (To wit, I once asked how the Lighting Device accomplished VP overrides, and was told it's so convoluted and inefficient I don't want to try it).
Justin Hutchison
VB-189658

slow file with high use of ram

Attached is a file which is very slow to work with and in general to navigate. Quickly after opening was using almost 17 GB RAM. Please take a look at this. Thank you. Justin Hutchison
VB-189709

Shaded Render Results not matching between M1 Mac and Intel Mac.

Loading the same files between two different machines, one is an M1 MacBook Pro the other is a 2018 MacBook Pro.
I've included some renders in the test file for showing how the lit fog is different on the M1 Macbook pro, it occurred on 28.0.0b(661996), On build 28.0.0(664498) the lit fog appeared corrected but the resolution was much lower, as far as I know I had all of the settings on both machines identical including the application preferences and in the shaded mode the quality was set to very high on both machines as well as all of the other settings. The line weights were much thicker in the MBP M1, toggling the zoom line thickness pref didn't seem to do anything.

Please also notice the texture Z fighting in the blue wall around the steps, this was shown on the MBP M1 on build 661996 only 		Justin Hutchison
VB-187573

When creating a Wall End Cap in a layer that enabled cut plane opition, a part of its line shows even though the wall height is lower than cut plane height.

This problem only occurs on walls that are lower than the height of the Cut Plane.


Steps to reproduce.

1) Create 2 walls. Create one wall with 900 height and another one with 1100 height. Create one wall with a height of 900 and the other with a height of 1100.

2) Select the two walls, Select "Replace" from "Style" drop-down list on OIP., and select any style.
(For exmple : _Imperial Story Bounded Walls.vwx>Int Wall-2x4-Gyp Bd 5/8in)

3) Select "Components..." of OIP, select all the components in the "Wall Components" dialog, and click "Edit".

4) Set to "Relative to wall" for both "Component Top" and "Component Bottom" and close all dialogs.

5) Select the "Wall End Cap" tool and create Wall End Caps for both walls.
(Create a End Cap in wall for the another it as well as.)

6) Go to Tools > Organization > Design Layer Tab. Then select "Design Layer-1" and click Edit.

7) Enable "Enable Cut Plane at Layer Elevation" and make sure the value in the field is "1000". Then click OK.

8) Check the 900 height wall. An unwanted line shows between the edge of the wall end cap and the wall.

We think this line is supposed to be invisible, because the wall height is lower than the cut plane height.

*As long as I tried, I see this problem also Vectorworks 2021 and Vectorworks 2020.

Please refer to attached files. (12870.vwx,12870.mov and 12870.png)

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Christopher Graye

VB-190256

VB-189809

Textures with an image transparency are utilized for projections

See the attached file. According to the new feature video, render lights should use the color shader when projecting a texture.

In this case, the transparency shader also contains the same image, producing unpredictable results.

I could see using the transparency shader to support legacy textures that may not have an color shader, however, Vectorworks should only look at the transparency shader if the color shader is not present. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190275

Redshift rendering is overly susceptible to distance falloff

See the attached file and PDF. With render lights of a large beam spread, Redshift is considerably more sensitive to distance falloff compared to Shaded and Renderworks.

Turing off distance falloff makes them more comparable.

Using an emitter does not improve the discrepancy. One would expect that when using an emitter, Renderworks and Redshift renders should have similar brightnesses. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190868

Default 3D render mode doesn't function as expected when entering and exiting group

When shaded is set as the 3D default render mode:

The default 3D render mode doesn't function as expected when entering and exiting a group following the next steps:
- enter the group from a top/plan view
- Go to a 3d view inside that group (shaded is applied)
- exit the group.

You are still in a 3D view now, but the render mode did switch unexpectedly to "wire frame". Possibly this comes from the fact that a top/ plan view is in wire frame by default, so the render mode "returns" to wire frame when you exit the group. Following that logic, it technically makes some sense, but for the user this feels inconsistent. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-190869

Default 3D render mode doesn't function as expected when entering a symbol's 3D part

When your default 3D render mode is set as "shaded":

If you enter a symbol's 3D part from a top/plan view, the content of the symbol is shown in wire frame. It should be show in "shaded" as set in the Vectorworks preferences. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-190621

Saved view in group

Reported by Vicky:

When you save view when you're in a group and only check the classes, the view inside the group is also saved. 		Rick Berge
VB-190059

Incorrect texture mapping for grass shader

ncorrect texture mapping for objects uses grass texture. Wrong texture is made from Grass Shader with image chosen eg. [TE]Trawnik.

 

Problem is more visible If you use higher geometry quality in render style preferences or bigger texture scale in OIP. Texture for testing should be created from Grass Shader with image chosen.

 

There are a few factors, which have to be present at the same moment, to make this bug visible:

- the base shape must be an irregular (extruded) polyline, circle etc. (for rectangles it works fine)
- the rendering mode must be different than Shaded (for Shaded it works fine)
- the Renderworks texture must be [TE] Trawnik 
- The Color Shader must be Grass
- Grass Shader must have a image of grass available

Some remarks
The grass image seems to cause a problem. Why?
1. When you delete this image from the Edit Grass Shader dialog, the problem won't occur.
2. When you use a preview rendering style (e.g. [RS] Exterieur Snel), the problem won't occur either, because this style doesn't use shader image for rendering.
3. When you use a final rendering style (e.g. [RS] Exterieur Finaal), the problem WILL occur, which migth prove the Robert's hypothesis...

To really see this problem, you must increase the scale of this texture (in the OIP) significantly or zoom in a lot.

In 2021 it looks fine to me (scale = 50, the same texture is used, with a Grass Shader and Shader Image of Grass, Rendering Style = Exterior Final)

It seems that the problem is in the texture but we don't know why. Can you take a look at it?

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-190907

Curtain wall: frame stile is not created in specific situation

If you add control points on top of a curtain wall, the first frame stile on top is not created if the first control point is place too vertically. Christopher Graye
VB-190469

Font Mapping does not preserve applied style of font variant

The initial problem here is found when bringing a file with styled fonts from Mac to Windows. (TBD, also see if a parallel issue exists in the other direction).

To reproduce:
# On Mac, create a Vectorworks file with a text object.
# Set the font of the text object to Helvetica Neue Bold‡, and save.
# Transfer the fonts to a Windows PC.
# In Vectorworks, open the font, and you should get a font substitution dialog‡‡
# Attempt to map the font to Arial Bold

EXPECTED: since there is no 'Arial Bold' listed in the substitution drop-down, you can pick 'Arial' and the mapping will automatically apply Bold

ACTUAL: when you map to Arial, the bold quality of the original font is lost; hence, there is no way to establish a mapping from Helvetica Neue Bold to Arial Bold.

‡Note, this is the actual font named "Helvetica Neue Bold", _not_ a regular Helvetica Neue typeface with the Bold checkbox applied.

‡‡If you do not get a dialog, the computer may already have a font mapping in place for this font; delete local app data/prefs, and/or use a different font, so long as it is a Mac font not available on Windows and you choose a 'Bold' font variant.

*Font system difference detail*: this issue partly stems from different OS font handling and presentation. On both Mac and Windows, there actually _are_ separate font family variants for Arial and Arial Bold. On Mac these are shown as separately selectable fonts in System font menus (sim. for Helvetica Neue and Helvetica Neue Bold, etc.), while Windows font menus tend to only show "Arial". Since we know this, our code should be more intelligent about mappings such as this; if we are mapping a bold variant of a font to a Windows typeface (Arial) which also has a bold variant, we should automatically map to the similarly-styled variant. Or, we should provide a custom font menu that permits a specific variant (like Arial Bold) to be selected on Windows. 		Ian Lane

Hi Vectoworks

Best regards, Marc 		Josh Loy

VB-187335

The symbols have been edited with the Generic Solids have only the 'Low' level of detail settings checked in the OIP. The Magnets and simple extrude around the geometry are left as they are by default to have Low, Medium and High levels checked.

This was done because of trying to work out this insufferable problem of the 3D previews in the RM not showing the truss geometry - rather it shows when rendered Shaded or HLR to show the simple extrude, thereby obscuring the geometry. This comes from the following VE I have done:


VE-100654
Spotlight Truss libraries have to have rendered thumbs and previews without simplified box obscuring
https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VE-100654?jql=text%20~%20preview%20ORDER%20BY%20created%20DESC

However when viewed sometimes you only see the truss 'connector crosses' which are always visible. It seems that it might be a VGM issue because in some instances they do not show.

If the document preference 'Auto display detail levels for design layers ' is checked sometime they appear yet others not. I do not think this is because I have the scale of the design layer incorrectly checked.

The bug is that the RM preview should only show details that are set to Low, yet in wireframe it is blank. Also the actual thumbnails don't show. I'm not being very clear here and apologies about the rambling movie but it seems this is not just a VE but now a VB when these settings are changed the previews and thumbnail are are wrong or don't show at all.

Cheers,
Peter

VB-189283

Geo-image: If Publish/Export to PDF is done in a Top view PDF is 160 times bigger in size than if exported in Top Plan!

Hello,
The enclosed file is geo referenced. Click the Geo Image tool to view the image on the page.

If you run the Export to PDF in a Top view the PDF is 166.8MB.
If you run the Export to PDF in a Top Plan view the PDF is 1.1MB.

No compression in the PDF settings. Note that the file has NO 3D objects, or symbols. Just lines. circles, rectangles and polylines etc.

Josh Loy
VB-186839

Hidden Line Render (HLR) for Surface hatches inconsistent on certain solids

Hello,
In the enclosed file there is a WW2 Nissan hut being modelled for a TV drama. The material is corrugated sheets of iron. Typically the groover run vertically.
This report is about how the repetitions of the Surface hatch when in HLR do not match up and make continuous grooves.
Also that if changed to running horizontally it is not a case of simply changing the texture's rotation in the OIP, but that the mapping of the element also has to be involved, sometimes to Surface UV sometimes to Auto Align. Sometimes the rotation has to be 90º other times 0º.
Then when looking at how these work when looking at the grooves in a Shaded render often the HLR and the Shaded render -Architect- are 90º to each other when they should be the same.
If all objects behaved the same then users could work out the logic, but alas not all do perform the same. This report is to highlight this as a bug as the rendering appears inconsistent when using Surface Hatches in HLR on curved solids.

Cheers,
Peter

Josh Loy

VB-190086

VB-190694

Mac - entering Japanese or similar text is inconsistent due to enter/esc key handling

When using a Latin or alphabetic text input system with Vectorworks, you can always get out of editing mode in a text object (applying any changes) by hitting either *enter* or *esc* key.

When entering Japanese text on Mac OS 12.6 with typical settings, hitting *esc* will not end editing. Also, one has to hit *enter* twice to end editing.

The situation is somewhat worse on Ventura with default settings (which do not show a drop-down of candidate glyphs for Japanese input) - here, *enter* will not end editing, it will instead change the existing text. *esc* also does not end editing. (In my testing I've actually gotten in the habit of switching back to US input just so I can hit esc/enter reliably to end editing).

EXPECTED: even in non-Latin/alpabetic text input modes, *esc* and *enter* still behave the same way with regard to our text objects in edit mode - they both exit out of edit mode in the current text object. 		Ian Lane

VB-190706

VB-190205

EJKerr DSTOP Duplicate! - spurious assert on resource import

This issue is with the DSTOP statement at DocumentColors.cpp:2258, I'm filing this for discussion for [~ejkerr] since I'm not sure of the full scope or intention.

This DSTOP on duplicate color gets triggered every time for a basic texture resource input in a new document. To reproduce from a debug build:
# Create a new, empty document
# Open Resource Manager to Vectorworks Libraries/Visualization/Materials/zNested Textures
# Right-click and choose *Import* on one of the textures

EXPECTED: the texture gets imported without any asserts

ACTUAL: the DSTOP at the source line mentioned is triggered. The call stack shows that this AddColorToCaches() call comes via TDocumentColors::SetUp() ultimately from CResourceContent::ImportResourceItems(). I'm not following exactly what's being attempted but I think the existence of the color record is actually expected here (it happens every time on resource import).

I think probably the correct fix is to remove the DSTOP but I'm not certain about the surrounding logic and context. 		Josh Loy
VB-190135

Deform: Bending a Solid to full 180° makes it hollow

To replicate (see video):
1) open document "Deform.vxw" (this is v2022)
2) select tool "Deform", then "Bend Solid Mode"
3) select the object
4) pick the mid point (I used a solid intersection to get end points to snap to)
5) pick the outer edge of the object
6) bend the object 180°

--> the resulting object is bend, but hollow

When bending less than the full 180°, the object stays solid.

Sometimes you will get an error message "Deform failed." I'm not exactly sure why. It may have to do with the point you click on in 4). 		Josh Loy

VB-190605

VB-190449

OIP shows 2 objects selected when Lasso selection includes an PIO and its proxy

This is a long-standing bug and still exists in Mainline. Open the attached file or create a stair with a proxy. In Top/Plan, with layer options Show/Snap/Modify others, do a lasso selection of the stair. You will see that OIP reports 2 objects. Technically that's true, but to the user, the  proxy and the stair are the same object. 

Also notice that when you have the selection tool active (not dragging) and you hover over the stair, you'll see the coincident object indicator.

I'm writing this up so we don't lose track of it. 		Rick Berge
VB-190573

This came in via a German user who found the behaviour of the "Note" part of the dim unexpected. I am hesitant to suggest a better position but the way it works now is very unusual. See video and example file.

I can see two ways of improving this:
* Leaving the note underneath the section dim line
* Moving the note with the dim value

I am not expert on proper dim standards though. 		Rick Berge

0.05 – succeed

0.09-- failed

0.1 succeeded

VB-190389

Joining walls in the test file causes many asserts

Four others appear which seem to be Parasolid related: "AndrewB: body.IsSolid()", "AndrewB: PkBodyIsSolid(body.body)", "Biplab: PkEntifyValid(body)", and "AndrewB: ! setmember(function, PK_boolean_subtract_c, PK_boolean_intersect_c) || PK_BodyClash(blankBody,toolBody)". VB-190186

Export PDF image fill

Hi Vectorworks

Initial situation: Image effect edited by Image Fill in Accessory Manager. (In the example file "Beton-Schalung Holz 02 BF").
Goal: Facade design with concrete image fill -> Export as PDF.
Problem: Image effect not visible after export PDF. Only if PDF is exported rasterized.

Cause:
As soon as the texture is scaled with "Edit Fill and Texture" so that the image starts to repeat once, the image effects are deactivated

Feature: Only if the texture is scaled with this tool, the effect occurs. If a large rectangle is drawn and the texture is applied so that it repeats without texture scaling, the image fill is exported correctly.

Greetings 

Fredi 		Josh Loy

When you draw new walls, their heights are ok. Selecting the copied walls and then the new walls will show the exact same parameters in the OIP and both walls are also sharing the same wall style. VB-188208

Windows - paste of styled text can produce badly formatted separate text objects

UPDATE: after encountering again in acceptance testing I'm updating this bug with new fixtures. Pasting a particular document's text in while not in edit mode result in very badly formatted results. I'm adding screenshots of the source document selection in MS word and the result of pasting into Vectorworks. Also adding the source MS Word document and the resulting .vwx file (from VW28 b6). I think this result is so bad that the customer would think the product had a serious flaw; it may depend somewhat on the source styled text.

---

Some odd behavior happens when pasting in styled text on Windows in certain active-tool scenarios. The behavior does not happen on Mac, nor with all types of styled text clipboard content.

This isn't an acceptance test blocker, I'm fairly sure this is not new and it seems low priority.

To reproduce:
# Create a new Vectorworks document
# Open the sample-source-text.rtf document in WordPad.exe
# Select and copy all the text in WordPad
# In Vectorworks, create a new text object with insertion cursor and paste - note that the text all comes in and some style info is saved (though it does lose a little formatting)
# Now end editing and activate another tool - selection should work, or rectangle, etc.
# Paste

EXPECTED: the paste creates a new text object, with the copied styled text content

ACTUAL: the paste creates multiple text objects, each individually styled. While in some ways it looks okay there are some very strange things including the font size (which is much smaller, e.g. 8.3 pt or so). 

Maybe it is in some way intentional in the Windows-specific clipboard handling code or text system, but it seems to be a bug to me because 1) it does not behave the same on both OS's and 2) I don't think the Windows behavior is standard even on windows - I think when a customer copies and pastes a whole passage of text, they want a single text object, and something like a normal size for the text.

  		Rick Berge
VB-189855

wrong rotation conversion from vectorworks to vision on floor fixtures

As you can see on the picture attached, I've some robe robin 600 on floor. 
I see them right on vectorworks with display oriented to the foh.

I exported mvr file with gdtf but on vision I've to modify y rotation to 0 to see them correctly.

no problems for the fixtures on the top trusses

VB-190167

Specific drawing is extremely difficult to output

This is a small drawing from a customer. The customer encounters a lot of issues with printing/exporting this file.
The 2D graphics in this file are rather complex: a lot of layers of gradients and high- resolution images on top of eachother, lots of transparancies. It doesn't seem to be sufficient to just lower the resolution of some images of get rids of a few transparent layers, you seem to need to strip down the whole dawing to 1 non transparent layer in order to be able to output this drawing in a normal way.

Lately we seem to see a rise in issues with outputting drawings with a lot of images and transparancy, especially when they're embedded in tile fills. I don't know this is because there's a flaw in VW 2022 or because users are creating more and more complex graphics.

Answer Tech support:

"If I choose "Rasterize PDF" in the Export PDF options, Vectorworks generates the file in 5 seconds.

If you wish, you can submit this to JIRA.

Regards,

Rob Nykolaishen
Technical Support Lead" 		Josh Loy

We have had a number of cases recently, where we have advised users to revoke their license in the Site Protection Server (SPS):

!https://desk.zoho.com/api/v1/threads/392273000035277012/inlineImages/edbsnf08ac8c3f0117feb562b991b9fd5a81af2ba6414760d9e4e772a8ae3f7bb10ee8754c87db7f42a9fda2e9f9c788528b74b7ed30a3e7e23fef7e4a15c36413f0a5c23ccaf09598e5323a8877f15a77678?et=1805616c21f&ha=8825ea0f2185de6b2fee96d45fcbab9d19edf0b7dc1fdd9c5aa8c364ca558be7&f=3.jpg|width=506,height=192!

in order to upgrade their license file to Vw 2022 or to shift the SPS to a different machine or in order to update the SPS. When this is done, the license file appears to have been deleted and no longer appears in the SPS > License menu: !https://desk.zoho.com/api/v1/threads/392273000035277012/inlineImages/edbsnf08ac8c3f0117feb562b991b9fd5a81af2ba6414760d9e4e772a8ae3f7bb10ee8754c87db7f42a9fda2e9f9c788528b77ccf50367da22be511c9d2337964a74cd5b1484e87d9da89e6022bae74fff91c?et=1805616c220&ha=5a1eee50395291aa45a8efbd6604fdad816c2d35da5909c29ba4e9f32e6aea17&f=1.png|width=508,height=320!

however when their activation key is entered on the new machine or again on the existing machine, they get this message:


!https://desk.zoho.com/api/v1/threads/392273000035239827/inlineImages/edbsn7627825b0505401f2791693377a3d5b457c756099bc711e3d5cafc884e864a63bb8a791b24201e4abc0e1fdfd12fe2d7dd10102612feb4a3f6a93a16561b7499bfe1f7165e9cb017d4734ddabf0ab51e?et=1805619a6c3&ha=e9f01b40a1f33897fa1e6342a185375abdfaf710468ec719e47d566a670775ab&f=2.jpg|width=432,height=129!

The only resolution is to create a new activation key on Partner Services web site and while this is easy enough, it is inconvenient for users because they can not operate Vectorworks until the issue is resolved.

In case it helps, in the most recent case the activation key that was revoked was: AC1-XK85PT-ZC-413703. I will be generating a new one in the morning.

Thanks. 		Tim Ardoin
VB-189983

Question: The 24-hour rendering time limit on Vectorworks Cloud Services.

We would like to know when the 24-hour rendering time limit starts.
Does it start when the rendering runs on VCS? or when a file is being started uploading to VCS?


Referring to the VCS help, there are the descriptions in each paragraphs below.

-----------------
-Preparing .vwx files for processing in the cloud
"If your sheets have complicated geometry and or rendering details, consider making adjustments to keep within the 24-hour rendering time limit."
-What causes a cloud processing job to time out?
"If a job is not complete within 24 hours, it times out."
-----------------

As long as we tested as we uploaded a file to VCS, it looks like the 24-hours limit countdown starts when the file status turned to "Queued..." .
(See the movie [Vectorworks Cloud Service Test.mov] I attached.)

Time index for the movie
0:55 : Published to the VCS folder.
1:58 : "Pending" status turned to "Queued...".
2:14 : Checked the duration time on the VCS desktop app.
It's already 16 seconds at this point.


Please let me know if you have any information.

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

VB-189879

VWShader<>::GetImage() looks for kPaintNode instead of kImageDefNode

The GetImage() calls look for a kPaintNode, however, textures now appear to use kImageDefNodes, so the method fails.

If some textures have kPaintNodes, the call should first check for a kImageDefNode, and if that returns null, check for a kImageDefNode 		Justin Hutchison

2. Now switch the rotation of the Viewport to zero and export it again to PDF. All objects will be displayed (see no rotation.pdf export result).

VB-189448

Class Keine inactive - light is lost, objects are dark grey.

VB-187755

Vectorworks blocks for half an hour by enabling "snap to geometry" for specific PDF

The complexity of the PDF itself looks rather average, so it looks like a bug.

Also re-opening the file takes an equally long time, so just letting it calculate during lunch break for once isn't a durable solution.

Answer Tech support:

"Hey there,

I am getting the same results on my end. There is a lot of linework in the PDF, but I don't feel like it is enough to warrant that amount of time to import. This seems like a bug to me, you should be fine to submit it.

Thanks!

NIK PEACOCK
TECHNICAL SUPPORT SPECIALIST
443.542.0411" 		Josh Loy
VB-186317

Re: screen plane deprecation – drawing VP crop in perspective view doesn't work

One of the aspects that hasn't yet been cleanly solved with the deprecation of screen plane is trying to draw a crop object prior to creating a viewport. In VW2021 and earlier, you'd simply make sure the plane dropdown was set to Screen Plane, then draw then crop, the create the viewport.

In VW2022, the intended workflow is to first click the "Align Working Plane with Current View" button, then draw the crop geometry, then create the viewport.

This works okay in orthogonal projection, but in Perspective projection this often fails, because the geometry is anchored on the document origin (I think?) which is often offscreen.

I was able to capture an example of this in the attached screen recording. Note that after I draw the rectangle I have to move backwards in space (I'm using a 3D mouse) in order to see the rectangle. Clearly this doesn't work for creating crop geometry.

I haven't yet found a way to make this work reliably in Perspective. The only workaround as far as I can tell is to just make an uncropped viewport of the entire screen, then add the crop afterwards to the sheet layer viewport. 		Josh Loy
VB-187951

Hardscape Issues when File is Opened in VW2023

I've attached screen shots that show how the hardscape appears in VW2022 and VW2023. 

 

Steps :

-Open test file in VW2022 then open it in VW2023

-Note the pink fill from the hardscape/modifiers 		Bozhidar Stanchev

VB-185251

Extrude Along Path with distorted result

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Select both objects (path and profile) like shown in the video and open the Extrude Along Path Tool.

2. Lock Profile Plane and Fix Profile are selected.
2.1. Click OK.

Result: We can see that the object isn't correctly displayed after the first curve. Its shape is distorted to something undesired.

3. With the object selected, go to the OI and deactivate the option "Lock Profile Plane".

Result: Now the object seems to be correct, but because the profile plane isn't locked, the opening that is wanted to remain on the bottom part of the object does not anymore. We can see it twists through the object, ending sideways instead of the wished bottom position. 		Josh Loy

VB-184539

Reversing helix direction affects profiles when used with extrude along path

In the attached video and file, I try to make the threads on a bolt.  I used the helix tool to create a spiral path, then extrude along path with an oval profile to make the thread.  After doing that, I realized the thread direction was incorrect, and reversed the helix.  It changed the profile orientation, which I don't think it should do.  I tried starting over from scratch(not in video) and reversing the helix before doing the EAP, but the profile was still tilted about 45 degrees from what it should be.  Checking the reverse option on the helix is what triggers this.  This goes back to at least 2020. Josh Loy
VB-188253

EAP oddity

I'm trying to help a user model some trim...this is what he gave me. See screen shot and file Josh Loy
VB-188309

importing solid step files results in exploded object with hundreds of nurbs surfaces

Importing 3 step files:

1 of 3 is after importing clean editable solid geometry (the 8m pool).
2 of 3 are 'exploded' groups made out of almost 1000 nurbs surfaces (the 9m and 10m pools).

Importing the same 3 step files in Fusion 360 results in clean solid and editable geometry.
Something in translation to VW seems to go wrong. 		Josh Loy
VB-187483

Wrong Horizontal Section

Hi Vectorworks

The round windows in the attached file leads to a wrong horizontal section on the sheet layer "100".In the section, the 3D representation is still visible in addition to the 2D representation. This is due to the fact that in the horizontal section the 2D representation is not 100% above the 3D geometry and, depending on the cutting height, parts of the round window geometry show through.

Best regards,Marc 		Josh Loy

VB-185343

Edit Section-in-place shows the wrong components when activated on the viewport

Activate Edit Section-in-Place on the selected section viewport. It will display the "top/bottom cut" geometry of the symbol, rather than the bottom geometry it should be showing.

Note that this file was created by editing down the "secvp from rot slvp-2d comp display.vwx" file from the automated image tests, and the original viewport that was sectioned to create the section has been deleted. This may be causing it to display the wrong geometry somehow, as it does not display the top/bottom cut in the original file. (The viewport is the one in the third column, second row of the "45-..." sheet layer. 		Josh Loy
VB-185468

Surface Hatches Show Incorrectly in 2022 When "Follow Longest Edge" is Enabled

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a solid with an auto-aligned texture applied.

To reproduce, in each version:

-Render in Hidden Line
-Select the solid and enable the "Follow Longest Edge" option in the OIP Render tab

The same thing happens going back to 2022 SP0. 		Josh Loy
VB-185384

KLS: Objects in wall missing in interior elevation section

Two objects in wall, which are a window and pillows on the window sill.
In an interior elevation section these pillows are missing. Only if the pillows are placed before the window and wall, they become visible.
In a normal section viewport the pillows are visible.
This also happens in Vectorworks 2021.

Background rendering of that interior elevation viewport is hidden line. Any other rendering like dashed hidden line also make those pillows visible. So it seems to be an issue with background rendering.

Please see video and testfile. 		Josh Loy
VB-186030

Round Wall in Section Viewport shows artifacts with Generate Intersecting Lines checked

This may be part of an existing bug.

When a section viewport [in Hidden Line rendering mode with Generate Intersecting Lines checked] cuts through a round wall the interior of the round wall shows artifacts that seem like random curves as well as vertical lines.

I haven't found that the Smoothing Angle matters at all.

Other rendering modes are not affected. 		Christopher Graye
VB-186135

Merge Structural objects missing lines

User has submitted a test file displaying different settings of merge structural objects in section viewports.

His notes:

"Steps: If I have a Slab which is Auto-Bounded to a Wall + in a Section Viewport I enable 'Merge Structural Objects with Same Fill', the relevant components will merge but there will be lines missing. If the Slab is not Auto-Bounded to the Wall + I instead edit the top offsets of the relevant Wall components manually, the components will merge as they should, without any lines missing."

 

User has highlighted in viewport 4 how his components when merged have gaps in the lines 		Christopher Graye
VB-185005

In Auto Hybrid, Hatch is not displayed in the Top/Plan view even though Hatch is set in Fill Style.

In Auto Hybrid, Hatch is not displayed in the Top/Plan view even though Hatch is set in Fill Style.
Confirmed the occurrence from VW2022.
Reproducibility procedure:
1) Draw a Rectangle in the Top/Plan view and set Fill Style to Hatch from Attributes Pallete.
2) With Rectangle selected, execute AEC menu> Create Auto Hybrid.
3) Rectangle changes to Auto Hybrid and Hatch disappears.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-185647

Wrong 2D fill in Auto Hybrid object

Auto Hybrid object build from extrude has wrong fill in 2D if you set Fill style in Attributes palette. This is Hatch, Tile, Gradient and Image issue only. Other styles works as expected. Bug don't occur if you set that styles by class.

Steps to reproduce:

- make extrude from simple shape
- select extrude and set fill style to Hatch/Tile/Gradient/Image
- create Auto Hybrid object form that extrude
- look at fill in 2D. It has no Hatch/Tile/Gradient/Image 		Josh Loy
VB-188159

Window CW: 2D components are not generated correctly

To replicate this (see video) you will need to download/unpack the German SP5 beta version.

Mac: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/hj2pw84javwrz1k/VW27.0.5b%28652868-17561%29_Mac.zip?dl=1]

Windows: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/g9885r0sihonjre/VW27.0.5b%28652868-17561%29_Win.zip?dl=1]

1) open attached file Fenster-2D-Darstellung.vwx
2) right-click the window CW style in the resource browser and choose "2D Darstellung bearbeiten" (edit 2D components).
3) select "Hinten" (back) and always confirm dialogs popping up with OK.
4) leave the 2D component edit mode
--> after updating the viewport in the upper right corner you will see that the window (back) moved quite substantially downwards.

According to our developers this is not an issue of our window. 		Josh Loy

VB-189765

Objects below section cut plane not visible in section viewport when object rendered in hidden line.

Reported by Ka Fung:

When walls are drawn with extrusion objects below section cut plane are not visible in a section viewport when objects below section plane are rendered in hidden line mode.

See attached file for examples

Steps to reproduce:

Draw a retangle 4000x4000. Offset retangle by 150. Clip surface. Extrude clipped polyine 3000 mm. draw some objects or symbols within the extruded (walls) polyline. Make a section viewport with a cut on 2 meters. all objects below the 2m section are not visible in the section viewport with following settings.
'display extents below cut plane' settings:
Background render: hiddenline render

Additional information:

Backgroundrender: shaded settings show objects below cutplane

When extrusion is replaced by wall. All objects become visible again.

Making an opening in the extrusion alos fixes the problem.

See attached file for different viewports.

 

  		Josh Loy

VB-184867

Section Viewport has to be updated everytime for hatch to be visible

1. Open file
2. Activate section viewport "5/L E3".
3. Section "Update"
4. File Save and Close
5. Open the file again
6. Section "5/L E3" looks up-to-date but the stakes have no hatching.

Section has to be updated every time for the hatch to be visible, even if no changes where made. 		Josh Loy

VB-184769

Update Viewport Memory Leak

The attached file contains several Viewports that when Updated it makes the used memory rise significantly.

Example:

Viewport 1/L E3
- Before Update VW is using a bit more than 4 GB (with the file open).
- While Updating peaks to a bit above 24 GB. The update lasts close to 5 minutes.
- Slowly decreases to 18,74 GB but never to the value before performing the update.

The other Viewports are as problematic in terms of memory used and time needed to update.

Note: We can also see that the Viewports are not visible when the file is opened (this happens with 2022 SP3 beta 628500, but not with 2022 SP2.1 R1). The performance problems also happen with SP2.1. 		Josh Loy

VB-187985

Horizontal section viewport doesn't work with graphical settings for objects above the cutting line

Using horizontal section viewports and setting the graphical attributes of the objects that are above the crop plane no longer work as they should.

Steps to reproduce:

First i do this in VW 2021 I draw a roof with a window in it. Then i make a horizontal section viewport through the roof and the window. In my viewport i go to the objects above the section line, in the list I choose the class 27 daken, because my roof is in this class. Here i give in the graphical settings and update my viewport. I get exactly what I expect.

I save this drawing and open it in a version 2022, i update my viewport and al the objects above my section line becomes equal black.

How ik can solved it to become that same result as in 2021 is:

1. Make a copy of the viewport.
2. In the original viewport unmark the settings of the objects above the section line
3. in the copy of the viewport unmark to view te object under the section line.
4. Select the whole roof and place it from class 27 daken to the class 47 dakafwerkingen-bedekking-leien
5. set all the other classes which are part of the roof on invisible
6. Make the settings above the objects in the class 47 dakafwerkingen-bedekking-leien
7. Update the viewport and you get the right settings of the roof
8. Now you have to find in which class al the parts of the window are in so you can also set these graphical settings in this class.

This is not a good workflow customers can not use the graphical settings on this way?

 

See movie and files in link below 		Josh Loy

VB-185019

Export HDRI does not appear to be working as expected

Steps:
# Open the attached file: [^SimpleRenderScene.vwx]
# Select file > export > Export high dynamic rage image (HRDI)...
# In the export image file dialog, select all objects and select save
# Save the image to the desktop
# Back in Vectorworks create a new renderworks background
# Select Image from the background drop down list
# Choose to import a file and select the file that was just exported
# Press OK until all dialogs are cleared
# In the resource manager, double click the newly created renderworks background

_Notice there is only a black area with a white box, no color data, and varying light data is shown in the image._

VB-185492

Specific computer: Vectorwoks 2022 fails to run normally

On a specific customer's computer, Vectorrks 2022 has the next issues:

- The login screen, which pops up at first lauch, renders white. Because of this the customer theoretiacally cannot start drawing in this version. I found a hack to resolve this for him, by creating a file "First Time Run" with value "0" in the registration folder in the registy. because of the presence of this file (which I see on computers where the log in succeded) Vectorworks seems to skip the log in screen. However the customer has to possibility now to work in Vectorworks 2022, he stil cannot login, so he misses out on the service select libraries.

- Another issue for this customer: he cannot use Renderworks. Whenever he tries to apply a texture or choose a renderworks rendering, all renderworks functionalities seem to disappear from his workspace. I tried already the next things:
- Re- install windows redistributables
- Update graphics card
- Disable security software
- Download Re- install Vectroworks while all security software is disabled
- Delete as much bloatware as possible from his computer
- End non- essential processes in the task manager
- After the advice of thech support, I tried to start "cineware.exe with a double click, but no error showed up
None of these worked

Maybe these two issues are completely unrelated, but can it be:
- That the same issue is creating these two problems?
- That the Renderworks- issue is provoked by my improvised

I added the properties of the computer in the attatchment.

Is there anything you can that might solve this issue?

Vectorworks 2021 works fine on this computer.

Thanks in advance for taking a look. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-185558

Ambient Occlusion renders inconsistently

I often find that Ambient Occlusion renders differently from one "Update" of a viewport to the next. Attached is an example where I've rendered the exact same viewport twice, without changing a single thing in between updates (except perhaps the zoom & pan of the screen). If you flip between the two images you'll see the stark variation in the Ambient Occlusion. Both renders are 50% AO at a size of 6".

These images were rendered today in 2022, but I noticed this same thing happen in 2021 and perhaps 2020. 		Justin Hutchison

Datasmith Direct Link too many updates

bug video [^2022-02-25 10-49-20.mp4]
* draw a sphere
* go to shaded
* Direct Link to Twinmotion
* click to start drawing a directional light in Vectorworks

VB-185583

KLS: XYZ in Status Bar

Hey there,
this is more like a question than a bugreport. Customer has asked question I regretfully cannot answer.

In Vectorworks 2021 there was a message bar at the bottom. Now in 2022 it is the status bar.
That message bar in 2021 displayed x, y, z, x', y', z', while the status bar only shows x, y, z. Why? Why taking away functionality from the customer? Or has it been placed somewhere else? I couldn't find anything.

The z in 2021 showed the current height from objects plus the layer height. In 2022 it seems to be the layer height only. Why? Maybe it was a bug before 2022? Or due to a wish or change of concept?

Of course I could answer the customer a nice story, but I personally like to know what happened.

Thanks and regards, Klaus Lüttich 		Josh Loy
VB-188456

Section Viewports ALL revert to 'dirty' during the process of updating only one

In the attached file (and accompanying video), during the update of a single section viewport update, all section viewports in the drawing become 'dirty' and report as needing update, even though they were previous in an Updated state. No modifications have been made to the model, this is something that is being triggered by the viewport update process alone and I don't think should be happening.

 

The video shows the testing process and the point at which the failure occurred. I could repeat  the issue, and got it to happen on a number of occasions, although not all the time, but it did seem to happen more when updating the viewports numbered 21315-13 or 21316-17. 

 

The file supplied has all the section viewports in a dirty state. Some should be updated, before trying those viewport numbers listed above. In my testing, the prior viewports had been updated individually.

 

In the video, you'll see the individual update process that I went through (this simulates how users often work).

Fast forward to 1m30s - you'll see that viewport 21315-13 is being updated - and at 2.35 you'll see at the exact moment that the viewport goes into background calculation mode, the earlier updated viewports all switch to registering as dirty.

 

Although I first saw this while testing 2022, I have also had one experience of the same thing happening on the same file and the same viewport in 2022 SP3. 		Josh Loy
VB-185846

Question: Direct link is not stopped automatically when entering a group or symbol. (T02262)

(Page 6, 5th line.)

But the direct link seems to be not stopped automatically, as long as we checked with entering into a symbol object.
We checked this behavior with the steps below.
We would like to ask you that our way was suitable to check or not.
Please let us know if it's incorrect.

The steps.

1)Open an attached file.(0314-1.vwx)

2)Select the Datasmith Direct Link tool.

3)Click "Direct Link Auto Sync " mode on the tool bar.

4)Select a symbol and double-click or select "Edit 2D Components" in the context menu.

5)Direct Link is not stopped automatically.

*Direct Link is stopped automatically when switching the current view to "Top/Plan" or navigating to a Sheet Layer.

VB-188121

Shaded rendering in a front viewport: edges should be shown

 

When you create a viewport from a shaded front view of a rectangular 3D object, the edges won't be visible in the viewport by default. This is confusing, the edges should be shown.

Ideally, the shaded- edges will be rendered, despite the tight crop. If this isn't technically possible, maybe this can be done by taking a small extra margin from the object by default.

VB-186774

Section Viewport: update performance and memory leak

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

1. Open the attached VWX-file. Vectorworks uses 3,75GB RAM.

2. Update Section Viewport "Schnitt-1".

Time Taken: 2 minutes and 32 seconds.
Memory in use after the update ends is 9,11GB, in the next second briefly jumps to 11,46GB and then to 9,99GB RAM.

3. Update Section Viewport "Schnitt-4". Right before updating the RAM in use was 10,07GB.

Time Taken: 4 minutes and 30 seconds
Memory in use after the update ends is 21,77GB RAM, a few seconds later goes down to 20,09GB RAM.

The RAM in use remains at around 20 GB RAm and the Section Viewports react very slowly when being reselected. The Object Info takes a long time to re-appear. 		Josh Loy

VB-185692

Export Cinema 4D: Wall components are exported as separate surfaces

When you export (or send) a wall to Cinema 4D from Vectorworks 2021, All components are exported as separate solids. This is the desired behavior.
In version 2022, walls and wall-components get separated into multiple (two sides and one empty) polygons. This is less easy to work with in cinema 4D, so can be considered as a regression. 		Christopher Graye

If you might have any information as to why this could happen, we would definitely appreciate it. Thanks for your time and have a great evening! :) 		Christopher Graye
