VB-185841

Wrapping Offset Values Don't Work Properly with Interior components

I've attached screen shots and a test file that shows the problem.

 

The offset seems to work as expected when only the outer components are wrapped. However, when the offset value for the inner component is similar or higher than the other components, things don't look right in Top/Plan.

 For example: if all three offsets are 1/2 inch, then this looks as expected

If all three offsets are 3/4", then the wrapping is incorrect

If the two outer offsets are 1/2" and the inner offset in 3/4", then the wrapping is correct. 

  		Christopher Graye

This is pretty unusual and this is the only user I've spoke to who specifically wanted to do this. For the record, their name is Gary Welsh (welshpe@hotmail.com) in case we need to reach back out to them.

Any further assistance is appreciated, and thank you for taking the time to look at this. Have a great day! :) 		Christopher Graye
VB-185930

Tile as 2D fill for Material in Wall component causes reference to not show fill or texture

When Tile is set to be 2D fill for Material and that Material assigned to Wall Component and placed into file, then referenced either via Layer or DLVP, that Component is not showing any fill or texture in target file. 

Same Material used in Roof or Slab components does not have the same issue, Extrudes and other free modelled geometry also don't have the issue. If Tile is swapped for another type of 2D fill, issue disappears.

There is no issue in source file, it only happens in the referenced file.

Issue is present also when Tile is used for 2D fill of the component without using the Material. 		Christopher Graye

VB-188259

Laubwerk plants don't render correctly

VB-188276

Simply navigating Interface Element colors in the Interactive Appearance Settings, adds those colors to the color palette

-Open a new blank document
-In the Attributes palette, click the Solid Fill Color to see only a few default colors found in the Active Document
-Now go to > Tools > Options > Vectorworks Preferences > Interactive and click, "Interactive Appearance Settings..."
-Click on various options found under the, "Interface Element" column, do not change any colors
-Click Cancel
-Click Cancel again
-In the Attributes palette, click the Solid Fill Color again and you'll notice colors from the, "Interface Elements" you clicked earlier have been added to your Active Document
-This also happens in Vectorworks 2022
-See attached video 		Josh Loy
VB-189670

vstanev VWParametricObjIsParametricObject( hParametric )

New blank file. Activate Plant tool. Select a plant from Resource Selector (I used Plant Basic Ground Cover 2, but I don't think the particular plant matters). You will get the assert.

Call stack attached. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-189289

Viewport gets out of scale when created on perspective views

Hi! 

 

If a viewport is created while in any type of projection that is not 2d plan or orthogonal the viewport scale will come up wrong. 

 

To reproduce:
* create a basic draw in the design layer on a 1/1 scale
* choose a normal perspective (or narrow or wide perspective)
* draw a rectangle on the top of the drawing 
* with the rectangle selected, create a viewport and use it as a crop
* place it on a sheet layer and use a 1/1 scale

 

Note the dimensions of the drawing in the viewport do not match the drawing in the design layer. And the same does not happen when the projection is set to 2d plan or orthogonal. 

 

Thanks! 

  		Josh Loy

When not inside that extrude I can snap to the nearby geometry as expected. 		Josh Loy

VB-187854

Depending on the scale, view, and projection settings of the design layer, Perspective Distance may be set to a very small value.

Depending on the scale, view, and projection settings of the design layer, Perspective Distance may be set to a very small value.
If the viewport is created in that state, if the viewport "Projection:" is set to "Perspective", the angle of view will change significantly due to the influence of the Perspective Distance.

Setting example to reproduce:
Scale: "1:50" / View: "Top/Plan" / Projection: "2D Plan"
In this case, Perspective Distance is automatically set to a very small value "0.1952".
*Not reproduced when the scale is "1:1"

How to check Perspective Distance:
View menu> Projection> Set Custom Perspective ...
*"0.1952" is set in "Distance:", and even if the OK button is pressed, it will be rejected.
Also, when the Cancel button is pressed, Projection is automatically changed to Normal Perspective and Perspective Distance is automatically changed to "9.76". Therefore, if this check is done before creating the viewport, run the Undo menu once, restore Perspective and Perspective Distance, and then create the viewport.

Reproduction example:
1) Open a new file, right-click in the drawing area> click Active Layer Scale ..., set the scale to "1:50" and create an Extrude.
2) Execute View menu> Create Viewport ... with the view set to Top / Plan and the projection set to 2D Plan.
3) Check that Projection is set to "2D Plan" and Perspective Dist is set to "0.195" (grayed out) in the Create Viewport dialog, and click the OK button to create a viewport on the sheet layer.
4) In the viewport OIP, check that Perspective Dist is corrected and set to "0.250". * In the case of the cross-section viewport, it is set as "0.195" without correction, but both "0.250" and "0.195" are still very small values.
5) As a result of comparing the angle of view by switching the setting of "Projection:" between Perspective and Orthogonal in the OIP of the viewport, it can be seen that the angle of view changes significantly in the case of Perspective.

Please also refer to the reproduced movie "12874.mov" and “12874.vwx”.

This Bug has been reported by a customer. I think it's a common case to change the "Projection:" setting to Perspective after creating a viewport. If this bug happens in that case, the customer will be confused without knowing what is wrong.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-185179

Copy and Paste strange in standard views...

Create a planar object (rectangle) in a new document in Top/Plan, copy that object then switch to front view and paste. Notice the rectangle is pasted on some arbitrary plane that is perpendicular to the view so only a line is realized, it should paste to the screen aligned plane. Josh Loy

VB-189500

Cannot snap to or pick Plug-in Objects on file open.

# Open the attached "NanaWall Tests v2023vwx" file,
You will see some Door, Window, and Cabinet Plug-in Objects in a 3D Front view.
# Hover the cursor over (and try picking) any of the plug-ins away from their insertion points (at the bottom of each object).
*Notice* the objects do not preselect highlight, the cursor doesn't snap to their geometry, and they cannot be selected by clicking on them.

Hovering over the Door or Base Cabinet's insertion point at their bottom will trigger that object to now be snappable and selectable.  However, the Window doesn't seem to work that way - my guess is because its insertion point is below any geometry in the Window.  Another way to trigger the snapping and picking for these objects is to marquee select them.  After that, they behave as expected.

This is a regression from VW27.0.4b(652867) 		Josh Loy

VB-188138

Adding Face Override changes mapping of faces that are part of Overall

In the attached file is an extrude that contains 4 polylines, and an overall texture of wood mapped with Auto-Align Plane. When I use the Texture tool to apply a texture to a face, the orientation of the wood texture on OTHER faces changes.

Face overrides should have no effect on the rest of the faces.

VB-188153

View Center and Page Boundary shift alternately when toggling between 2D & 3D views

When the User Origin is unmoved there is no problem.

When the User Origin is moved, toggling between 2D Top/Plan view, and any 3D view causes the view center and the page boundary to shift positions on the screen.

In the attached file, "View & Page shift.vwx", there are two small squares. The Green one is centered at the Absolute Origin, and the Red one is centered at the User Origin (2, 1). Units are inches. VW Pref "Center on objects after view change" is OFF. 

To see the effect:
1) Open the attached file.

2) The view is initially Top/Plan, so selecting Top/Plan from the Current View menu, or pressing the "0" key on the numeric keypad, will do nothing (as expected.)

3) Select the Top view from the Current View menu, or press the "5" key on the numeric keypad. The view shifts and the Red rectangle is now in the center of the VW window. The page boundary is, as yet, unmoved.

4) Select the Top/Plan view from the Current View menu, or press the "0" key on the numeric keypad. The Red square stays in the center of the VW Window, but the Page Boundary moves so the page is again centered on the Absolute Origin (Green square).

5) Repeat the sequence Top view, Top/Plan view, Top view, Top/Plan view..., and watch the colored squares walk off the screen. 

6) Any 3D view change (Top, Left, Front, Left Iso, etc.) followed by a 2D view change (Top/Plan) will walk the colored squares off the screen, each in its own direction, if repeated often enough.

 

This does not happen in earlier versions of VW. I've checked in VW 2022, 2019, 2018, & 2015. The view and page stay centered on the Absolute Origin in each of these versions when the view is toggled as described above. 		Josh Loy
VB-188643

Error in displaying perspective point clouds

In perspective display mode, the points of the point clouds are displayed as large squares, in Wireframe and Shaded rendering. This causes a loss of precision and understanding of the image.

They should be dimensionless points, which is necessary. The 2022 SP3B1 version was perfect for displaying dots.

The display with squares is done in the DesignLayer and in the viewports. Some old versions had this problem, but the viewports were beautiful. Since 2022 SP4, this is no longer the case, DesignLayer and viewport both display square cloud points. 		Justin Hutchison

Computer is an intel mac 		Justin Hutchison

VB-189001

Renderworks Camera: little area around centre destroys Camera Object

VB-189285

Simplify Mesh: 3D Polygons shrink and disconnect

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When using the option "Simplify Mesh", like its shown in the video, the 3D Polygons shrink and disconnect, independently of the chosen Quality. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-189375

Wall tool rethink

Wall finishes should not be integrated with a composite wall (that's not how walls are built in real life).

They should be ‘slapped/snapped’ onto the core like magnetic sheets… taking on door and window openings built into the core wall…

This also makes changing and controlling wall finishes (through classes) a lot easier. 

Further information and thoughts on that in this post from 2018 that I put up:

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/57884-wall-styles-to-reflect-real-world-construction/#comment-289118 		Christopher Graye
VB-189348

3D Symbols that become white boxes

We are attaching a file of one of our Customers.

He complains that suddenly one or more of the existing symbols in the project are transformed into white volumes which contain the symbol, be it small or large, when it is active Shaded Rendering.
The phenomenon is sudden and unexpected, but after having closed the application, when he reopens it,  everything is restored as before.
He points out that sometimes he also uses the 8GB Blackmagic external Egpu but the problem can return, as well.

You can see a couple of images, when the phenomenon is present and the same scene without the phenomenon.

He uses a MacBook Pro (2019) i9 8 core 		Justin Hutchison
VB-189390

Batch Render Takes Much Longer in VW 2023

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023.

To reproduce, in each version:

- Run the View/Rendering/Start Batch Render command
- Drag the render job to the right column and click OK

In VW 2022, note that the render takes about 30 seconds.

In VW 2023, note that it takes about 5 minutes.

If I just render in RW directly instead of using Batch Render, the speed in 2023 is about the same as 2022, so this look like it's specific to Batch Rendering. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-186271

3D surfaces turn solid red

See attached screengrabs which demonstrate a bug that comes and goes. Randomly, some surfaces will display as solid red instead of their actual color/texture. The issue seems to arise in the midst of heavy navigation (such as entering and exiting symbols and switching between sheet layers and design layers). It also seems to mostly affect solid additions / subtractions, and more frequently when the objects are flipped. Sometimes the red will flicker in and out and may even go away after flying around a bit. Most of the time the red stays until I re-generate the object (such as cutting and pasting-in-place, or double clicking inside of it).

 

Unfortunately when I try to save a file to submit with this bug, the red is always gone upon re-opening (which is probably a good thing anyways). Regardless I'll attach the file that the screengrabs were from, even though it may not be an easily reproducible bug.

 

This has happened in a few files this year. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-188698

Space object doesn't show all options in the OIP with specific settings folder.

Jeroen:

If you add the attached settings folder to the user folder, the space tool doesn't function that well anymore. The options in the OIP ear very limited compared to a normal settings folder. This issue only occurs in the NL version. When using this settings folder in a EN version, there's no issue

 

- These customers lost a lot of options in the OIP in when they started working in version 2022. So they call support to ask why the space tool has less capabilities in version 2022 compared to 2021. This was strange, because on my computer the space tool still had all capabilities in version 2022. I discovered, by renaming these customer's Settings folder, this issue was resloved. So I decided to report their settings folder, because something must have gone wrong.
- Both customers only used NL versions. I just tested this settings folder on the US version to check whether the issue is related to a specific language version or not. If it is a problem as well in the US version, I usually send customer- specific bugs to tech support first for more info, before I put it in Mantis. I show this manipulation with the US version in the video, to prove it is an NL specific issue, so it makes no sense to share this with tech support. The customer herself, wasn't doing this manipulation at all.

Long story short: this specific settings folder comes from a customer with a VW 2022 NL version who lost many options in the OIP. The content of this settings folder is causing the issue.

Nele: I don't know where to look to solve this. It seems to be a localizing issue. Do you have suggestions? 		Jürgen Keser

VB-189066

Converting this to a Hanging Position shifts the location

Open the attached file
Choose Spotlight>Object conversion>Convert to Hanging Position
Select the option to use geometry

The resulting Hanging Position moves, which is not good. Maybe related, but the label is very far away (Less of an issue, because I don't use the labels)
- The position is a group of 2D objects
- There is a user origin 		Kevin Linzey

VB-188791

Stairs in referenced file

Vicky:

One of our clients is having an issue with a file.
In the file 'Trap abonnement' there is a stair where some of the steps are hidden under the slab.
This file is linked as a reference in the file 'Abonnement bestand'. In this file, all the steps are visible.

 

Tech support answer:
I just tested this in a brand new blank file. I drew a couple floor and added stairs to the lower floor and made the stairs visible in the floor above. In this file everything looks as it should, just like in the model file.
I then referenced this file into another file referencing the layers in the old-style method and see that the stairs appear on top of the slab like in the file you sent us.
I even tried just doing the newer workflow of design layer viewport and the stair appeared above the slab there as well.
I would recommend sending this to JIRA to have a look. I had not encountered this before.

 

Files are from 2021, but the bug also happens in 2022 SP3 version. 		Rick Berge

VB-188653

Question: Why does libcef.dll have so many critical events?

Hi team, 

When using Vectorworks on Windows a few years ago, the Reliability History graph in the Reliability Monitor app would typically display an excellent trend line. A poor trend line used to be a good indicator that their files or installation needed something corrected. But with more recent versions of Vectorworks, Reliability History reports many 'critical events' most of which are not evident while using Vectorworks. Because the reported errors no longer correlate with noticeable problems: 

a) This graph can no longer be relied upon to get a sense of how stable a user's installation of Vectorworks is. 

b) I can't tell if these are false positives or if there are actual problems that need to be resolved - bugs, corrupt files/data, or a troubled installation of Vectorworks. 

One of the two most cited 'Fault Modules' is libcef.dll. -I want to learn more about this library/component but despite searching and manually looking in all the normal places it should be, I can't even find it.- - I've just found it. Duh! I'm at a loss to explain why it didn't show up in my use of the File Explorer search function.

I'm aware that just because a DLL is cited in an error report it does not mean it is the true cause of a problem. And I'm aware that libcef.dll is part of the Chromium Embedded Framework.

Can you please advise - or at least theorise - why libcef.dll is cited in so many "Critical Events" in Reliability History?

!image-2022-07-04-10-05-28-061.png!

!image-2022-07-04-10-05-38-436.png! 		Rick Berge
VB-188291

Twinmotion numeric precision issues

bug video [^2022-06-16 15-11-19.mp4]
* draw a sphere
* put it's x coordinate at 1000000000" 
* stat Datasmith Direct Link
* go find the object in Twinmotion

notice the object is glitchy because of huge coordinates. The Datasmith Direct Link Preferences needs a field to specify the export origin in order to shift the coordinates  in order to avoid floating point precision issues.  The user origin could be used but that wouldn't address large z offsets
  !image-2022-06-16-15-17-55-877.png!

this bug report was generated from [https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/97276-twinmotion-direct-link-should-work-with-user-origin-coordinates/#comment-434266]

  		Walid Remaili
VB-187287

Camera View Walkthrough Gamer Mode shows outside the building walls

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

How to reproduce the problem:

1. Open the attached Vectorworks file.

2. Select "Kamera-1" and in the OI Activate Camera View.

3. Switch Render to Shaded

4. Open the Visualization Tool Set and select Walkthrough Gamer Mode

5. With the left mouse button click on the drawing and move to mouse to the sides to look around

6. Change Perspective to Normal Perspective.

7 Repeat step 5.

One of two happens during this actions: while rotating the camera to look around it will show the outside of the building, it is expected to show only the inside since the camera is inside. Other times also happened that the camera stays completely outside showing the outside of the building. Both results are wrong. We expect that while rotating the camera, the outside will not be shown at all, doesn't matter how close the camera is from the walls we shouldn't see anything further the walls. 		Christopher Graye

VB-188503

Preventing inadvertently converting Pro files to Edu files

Hi team, 

A user's Vectorworks file has somehow been converted from a professional file to an educational file. It is now watermarked, 'Vectorworks Education Version.' I had explained to her about a week before how to avoid this, including not copy-pasting or importing any objects or resources from any educational files. All her files were converted from professional so she is not sure how this happened. 

I suspect she has used the Resource Manager to unknowingly browse an educational file she still had. She wants to avoid accidentally/inadvertently doing anything that might cause this to happen again. In order to do so, she has asked if we can identify what objects or resources she introduced (if any) to her file, that caused it to convert to Edu.

VB-188410

Speaker has "default speaker" weight instead of is own weight

Hello,

If you use the speaker tool, select a speaker in your catalog, and put this speaker on your plot, the weight is the "default speaker" weight (45,36kg) instead of the correct selected speaker weight. Then you have to change in the OIP the type of the speaker (with type scrolling menu) for another speaker, then reselect again the first you chose, and the weight is correctly coming.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-187984

To reproduce, render in Wireframe and note that the red pen from the modifiers often fails to show on some or all segments. If you adjust the view slightly you can sometimes then see the missing segments, but it's not consistent.

If you don't see the problem at first, try updating the Site Model while rendered in Shaded mode, then switch back to Wireframe.

VB-188140

Auto-Align Plane: Follow Longest Edge has issues with Extrudes containing multiple polylines.

In the attached file is an extrude that contains 4 polylines, and an overall texture of wood mapped with Auto-Align Plane. The "Follow Longest Edge" checkbox is also checked. The wood orientation should hypothetically follow the length of the four frame pieces, but notice it's not correct on some of the end frame pieces where the texture is rotated 90° from the expected orientation.

Attached is a screen recording which demonstrates this issue (starting around 00:15).

If I ungroup the extrude, the alignment fixes itself and the wood is correctly aligned to each edge. It should look this way without needing to ungroup the Extrude. 		Rick Berge
VB-187994

Duplicate along a path fails with Tab rectangle size

Found if you create a rectangle for a path, by starting the shape then using tab to input the length and height, then draw a second shape to use as the duplicate, The duplicate along a path will not place the selected object along the path.

If you repeat the steps but draw the rectangle by simply clicking the starting and end point, the duplicate along the path will work as expected.

I have attached a video 		Rob Nykolaishen
VB-185309

Files can accidentally be deleted when using export to STL

This happens when exporting a STL file, but could possibly happen in other exports where you are allowed to export only selected objects in the current layer.  I was making a change to an object in a file and exporting only that object to a STL file, and overwriting the previously existing STL file.  One time though I did not have any objects selected, and what happened was that the export failed, and deleted the existing STL file, loosing that file.  I think if the export does fail, the existing STL file should not be touched, just the warning dialog box displayed in Vectorworks.  I don't think we should ever delete files. Josh Loy

VB-188166

Rotating in 3D Perspective: appears to snap to arbitrary increments

In the attached screen recording I'm trying to rotate the selected geometry interactively using the Rotate Tool in 3D. I first do it in Orthogonal Projection and it works fine. Then I switch to Perspective Projection. Notice how when I'm trying to rotate the object, the cursor is arbitrarily snapping to certain angles / increments, even if I suspend all snapping options. (I don't think this issue is caused by snaps at all, actually.)

The problem is amplified when the cursor is near the fulcrum while rotating. There seems to be an issue with the screen resolution being used in the operation when in Perspective.

I first noticed an issue along these lines in Fall of 2020. It may or may not affect more operations than just Rotate; however, today was the first time I figured out how to reproduce the issue.

VWX file also attached. 		Josh Loy

you use a Redshift render, default sky background is created. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-187900

This is regression from 2021

VB-185946

When entering Korean text, the last character typed, will duplicate when SpaceBar is pressed.

This was reported by a user on the public Vectorworks forum. I have duplicated using both Win 10 and 11, going back as far as Vectorworks 2019. I'm unable to duplicate on the Mac. I have tried various keyboard input methods and have been unsuccessful. I tested in Windows' Notepad application and I don't see the same issue.

First you'll need to change the Windows OS system locale to Korean (See attached image)
-In your Windows OS, search for, "Language Settings"
-When the Language dialog appear, scroll down and choose, "Administrative language settings" or similar
-Switch to the, "Administrative" tab
-"Change system locale..." and choose Korean
-Apply the change and restart the computer
-Launch Vectorworks
-On the Windows TaskBar, toggle to the Korean (Hangul) input method
-Back in Vectorworks, select the Text Tool
-Type a few characters of text, then press the SpaceBar and you'll notice the last character you typed, is repeated, when Space is pressed (see attached video)

Josh Loy
VB-188062

The list browser losing its selection when opening dialog

The list browser losing its selection when opening dialog. This is a general problem for all dialogs on WIN. The problem exists only if the dialog is resized. You can see where the problem is if: you put a breakpoint in the function "CListBrowserEx :: SetCurSel" you will notice that all rows are deselected when the function is called by "TDialogAccess :: SetComponentPos", then the previous selection is not restored and the list browser losing its selection. Please see attached videos. Ian Lane

VB-187999

The "Follow Longest Edge" checkbox for Auto-Align Plane texture mapping is incredibly useful to get linear textures to "follow" the orientation of the geometry. However, I find that occasionally the textures on some faces follow an edge that is clearly not the longest. I've attached a file showing an example of this, where the texture on the top surface is aligning itself with the short "horizontal" edge rather than the clearly much longer "diagonal" edge.

-Update the legend

-Now edit the GL style and click OK without making any changes

VB-187148

VB-187193

VS commands SetWorkingPlane() and SetWorkingPlaneN() do not persist after script ends

My initial intent was to set a WP by script and have it persist after the script ended, but neither command effects persist beyond the end of a script.

At first I thought SetWorkingPlane() and SetWorkingPlaneN() did not work at all because the Working Plane (WP) was not active when the script ended. Then I tried using the WP while the script was running and found the WP was valid and I could draw on it but only during a single execution of a script. Both scripts produce equivalent workable results while a script is running.

The documentation for *SetWorkingPlaneN*() says:
*Description*
   Set the active working plane.

while the documentation for *SetWorkingPlane*() says:
*Description*
   Sets the x, y, and z offset of the working plane as well as the x-, y-, and z-plane rotational values.

Neither of the descriptions makes reference of the command's temporary nature.

Based on the behavior of commands like SetView(), SetViewVector(), SetVCenter(), and SetZoom(), I expected SetWorkingPlane() and SetWorkingPlaneN() to persist after a script finished. The current behavior severely limits the usefulness of these two commands, and there appears to be no workaround in VS to achieve a persistent result.

 

See attached file "SetWP & SetWPN v2022.vwx"

  		Josh Loy
VB-186792

Wall Constraints bug: they don't update with inserted Story

See the attached files. To reproduce:
# Open the bugfile. Go to Stories tab of Org dialog.
# Move the Roof story to 44'-0". Choose Move this Story only.
# Create a new story (Story-4) at 33'-0". The dialog will represent things correctly. Hit OK.
# Go back to drawing. Notice that walls on Story-3 are still constrained to their old ordinal level (i.e., the bottom of the roof.)
# (optional) Copy and paste walls from Story-2 to Story-4. See that the Story-3 walls are still too tall.
# Fix the walls by selecting all the walls on Story-3 and forcing a change on their top bounds. (This should happen automatically upon closing the Org dialog Story tab.)

See attached bugfile and vidcap. 		Christopher Graye

VB-186468

modWhen setting a render mode via View->Rendering or View->Renderworks Style menu items, I am seeing many asserts occur for several modes.

Note that render style appears to be applied successfully, but these asserts are having an impact on validation of work on the new view bar render drop-down - we need to be sure that changes are not introducing any issues, but it's difficult to be sure when there are many existing asserts.

Here are the asserts seen in the current Mac mainline build, based on which render mode is applied. I am just using a new document in Left isometric view with a simple extrude. I was also able to reproduce these issues on Windows.

+Fast Renderworks:+
fCRDocument == nullptr assert

+Final Quality Renderworks:+
fCRDocument == nullptr assert
VerifyValidHandle(texture) failed! Handle is nil

+Hidden Line:+
fCRDocument == nullptr assert (first apply only)

+Unshaded Polygon, Shaded Polygon, Shaded Polygon No Lines, Final Shaded Polygon:+
ClassHiliteState() on layer nodes assert

+Renderwoks Style->Artistic Brush Brown Thin:+
VWRecordFormatObj::IsRecordFormatObject ( hFormatHandle ) assert
...on second apply, also:
fCRDocument == nullptr assert

+All other Renderwoks Style items (after the first one applied):+
MenuManager::EnableMenuItem(...) assert, occurs 24 times
MenuManager::CheckItem(...) assert, occurs twice (or more, with subsequent attempts)
fCRDocument == nullptr assert
VWRecordFormatObj::IsRecordFormatObject ( hFormatHandle ) assert

VB-187150

VB-187149

VS command HCenter() does not work for 3D Planar objects after VW 2019

In VW versions prior to VW 2020, HCenter() returned the center of a 2D planar object relative to its Working Plane's (WP) origin. In VW 2020 and newer, HCenter() returns the absolute XY coordinate of the 2D planar object. This newer behavior breaks a lot of scripts I've written that work on 2D Planar objects.

The attached file is saved in VW 2017 format, and can be opened in all versions of VW from 2017 to the present. Compare specifically how the script runs in VW 2019 and then in VW 2020. 

Open the file in VW 2019 (or older) and run the script. Note the planar rectangle's center shows as (0.25, 0.25) relative to its WP which is centered on the left side of the extruded square in the middle of the drawing. 

Open the file in VW 2020 (or newer) and run the script. Note the planar rectangle's center now shows as (-0.5, -0.25) which is the absolute XY point (Z is omitted) in 3D space of the rectangle's center. The returned value is in no way linked to the WP on which the object is drawn. 

Desired behavior — for 2D planar objects, HCenter() should return the coordinate of the object's center relative to the planar object's WP origin. This is a regression.

See attached VW file and two screen shots from VW 2019 & Vw 2020.

  		Josh Loy
VB-187052

Working Plane changes when switching to BACK view in "WP View" mode

In the attached file I have a planar square drawn on a Working Plane (WP) placed on the left side of a 2x2x2 Extrude. When the planar square's WP is displayed and the "Working Plane Views" icon (pink planar icon) is selected in the View Var, selecting the BACK view changes the WP and rotates the view to Rotated Top (-90°). 

This does not happen for some objects on other working planes, but it is 100 % repeatable in this example.

I tried this in VW 2015 and get the same result, so if it is a regression, it is not a recent one. 

Open the attached file and follow these steps.

1) Select the white planar square on the extrude's left side.
2) Double click on it to show its Working Plane (WP.) The 
     WP appears as a semi-opaque pink square.
3) Select the Working Plane Views icon in the View Bar.
4) Use the keys on the numeric keypad to change the view
    relative to the selected object.
5) When you press the 5 (top), 1 (left-iso), 3 (right-iso),
     7 (back left-iso), & 9 (back right-iso) keys the pink WP
     displays a solid pink border as the view shifts.
6) Pressing the 2 (front), 4 (left), 6 (right), & 8 (back) keys,
     shows the WP viewed edge on and the edge of the
     WP takes on a dashed pink line appearance.
7) Press the 8 (back) key and note the WP now has a solid
    edge again. THE WP HAS CHANGED, and the view is
     now Rotated Top. You will have to double click on the
    white square again to reshow the white square's WP. 		Josh Loy
VB-185159

Lineweight displays inconsistently on planar objects in 3D views

See attached screen recording. The geometry is at a line weight of 8mil. When I zoom in and out, each line varies between displaying at 1px wide and 2 px wide, causing a subtle but distracting shimmer effect.

This doesn't occur in Top/Plan (except when zooming).

This is not file specific, I've noticed it universally in 2022. It wasn't an issue in prior versions. 		Justin Hutchison
VB-186320

Visibility Tool: incorrect red highlighting

The red highlight that appears when hovering over objects with the Visibility Tool is often wonky. This happens when sub-objects of symbols are on the same class as the object you're hovering over.

For example, in the attached file, most of the objects within symbols are on the None class. I've provided a piece of geometry on the None class to hover over. You should see that there are numerous issues with the red highlighting being displayed:

-Rotated symbols display an unrotated highlight.

-Some symbols display the highlight offset from the geometry location.

-The highlight is of the 3D part of the symbol even with hybrid symbols in Top/Plan.

-In 3D, a double highlight is displayed, both of the 3D part of the symbol (but in the wrong spot) and of the 2D part of the symbol (a highlight which ironically doesn't appear in Top/Plan)... look at the pianos, for example.

  		Josh Loy

VB-185730

Push/Pull Direction Gets Reversed on Sweep Objects

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Sweep object and a Solid Section that have the same overall shape.

To reproduce:

-Activate the Offset Edge tool in Edge Loop Mode, with both Push/Pull modes enabled
-Offset the edge on the top face of the Solid Section object, using a negative push/pull value to create a subtraction

Note that this works fine.

-Now try the same thing on the top face of the Sweep object

Note that now the push/pull direction is reversed (you have to enter a positive value for the shape to extend into the existing solid) and the resulting object is a Solid Addition instead of a Solid Subtraction, so the overall shape fails to change. 		Josh Loy

VB-186500

KLS: Custom SIA-dim in customer displaced in SLVP mit text schale 50%

Customer file which is an example from the customer to show us the failure with custom SIA dimension standards.
In a sheet layer viewport with option text scale 50% the dim values get displaced. But only when show elevation is used. When show elevation disabled, then no displacement.

No displacement when I create a new document and recreate the situation on my own. See my own testfile MyExample.vwx. I have created the dim standard MySIA in this file and it is working fine, which means no displacement.

I also created a dim standard MySIA2 in customer file Bemassung.vwx. When I use this dim standard, then I get a displacement too.

When I import dim standard MySIA from my testfile into customer file, I still get a displacement.
When I import dim stadard MySIA2 from customer file into my testfile, I get a displacement.

Could you please have a look?
Maybe it is only the customer file which causes the trouble. This would be fine.
Or the custom dim standards from older files do cause the trouble when they get converted in to newer files?
I think someone should look into this to clarify this issue.

Thanks and regards, Klaus Lüttich 		Rick Berge
VB-186051

2D objects with line thickness 0,35 or more: messy display in 3D

bug video: [^2022-04-18 16-49-20.mp4]
* draw rectangle
* give the frame .35 pen thickness
* zoom with interactive zoom tool

notice the frame flickers between 1 and 2 pixels wide.  I believe VGM rasterizes wide lines as rectangles.  vw2021 might have had GL_LINE_SMOOTH on for frame. We would have to do multisample, some AA, or clamp triangle vertices to pixel corners (for vertical/horizontal wide lines) to get seemingly consistent pixel widths.  [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/direct3d11/d3d10-graphics-programming-guide-rasterizer-stage-rules#line-rasterization-rules-aliased-without-multisampling] talks about dx rasterization

=====ORIGINAL BUG by bervoets=======

Whenever you view a 2D object with line thickness 0,35 or more in a 3D view, the line thicknesses are not displayed equally thick an all sides. This is a minor display bug, but it is a regression compared to version 2021. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-186273

Question - Is there an up-to-date document that accurately summarizes how to deal with the issue of VW2022 crashing due to a DirectX 11 conflict?

Is there an up-to-date document that accurately summarizes how to deal with the issue of VW2022 crashing due to a DirectX 11 conflict?

Such documentation is required as we need to provide official information to customers who are experiencing this issue.
*Currently, we are receiving inquiries from multiple customers who are experiencing this problem. And it is expected that the number of inquiries will increase in the future.

How this question came about:
On some customers' Windows PCs, Vectorworks2022 crashes when basic document window operations such as resizing the application window, switching between multi-file drawing windows, switching workspaces, and docking and undocking palettes occur.
Also, after the crash, the following error message is displayed.
"DirectX 11 graphics has been modified by an external application and this is interfering with normal Vectorworks operation. Please see Tech Bulletin. Vectorworks will now quit."

The following pages are linked from "Tech Bulletin" in the error message.
-Vectorworks 2022 crashing in DirectX 11 on some Windows systems --Tech Bulletins --Vectorworks Community Board
https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/articles.html/articles/tech-bulletins/directx11/

This page explains that this is a phenomenon caused by competing with utility apps of other companies that use DirectX 11, and gives an example of an app that causes this problem.
However, there are comments that the deletion of one example of the app that causes this problem does not fix it, or that the other apps have been deleted, so I do not know which information is certain and which information is uncertain.

In addition, we have received requests from customers to disclose information on this issue in Japanese.
However, since it is information that requires the name of other companies' software and it is difficult to disclose information with uncertain information, accurate information is desired.

Also, I have additional questions. Is there a plan to fix this problem with the SP of Vectorworks2022 in the first place?
If there is no plan to fix it, there are some concerns, for example, Dell's PC should be excluded from the target machines.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-186116

When a marker is edited in the "Edit Marker List" menu, the edited content is not reflected on the marker display on the Attributes palette. Windows OS only

When a marker is edited in the "Edit Marker List" menu, the edited contents are not reflected on the pull-down list of Line start / end point style of the Attributes palette. Windows OS only
*By the way, there is no problem if it is edited from "Edit Marker List" of the pull-down list of Line start / end point style of the Attributes palette.

Reproduction example:
1) Start the following menu. Tool> Options> Edit Marker List
2) Select the first line in the list of Current Marker Types in the Edit Marker List dialog and click the Edit button.
3) Change the Root Type from "Arrow" to "Hexagon" in the Edit Marker dialog and close it with the OK button. Next, close the Edit Marker List dialog with OK. *12846_step3.png
4) When checking the display of the pull-down list of Line start / end point style on the Attributes palette, the first marker is not updated to "Hexagon". *12846_step4.png

Please also refer to the reproduced movie "12846.avi".

Takaaki Mizuno

VB-186198

Nav Palette Layer Visibility Check Box not updating from script

When using the Vectorscipt function

SetObjectVariable Boolean (H1, 153, N1) when H1 is a handle to a layer and N1 is an integer

The visibility of the layer changes correctly, but the check box in the Navigation Palette does not update.  If the layer is visible and you pass N1=-1 it is set to invisible, if N1=0 then the layer is set to visible. This works properly. Only the Nav Palette update is incorrect.

Selecting the mislabeled layer in the Navigation Palette does not update the visibility setting. Selecting the mislabeled layer in the Data Bar Layers pull down menu does update the incorrect visibility settings.

 

This behavior is the same as in VW2021. 		Rick Berge

VB-185378

Stories: editing a story level reset the scale

As from the two attached screen shot, create a empty file IN METRIC UNITS and set all layers at scale 1:50 :

1) open the story edit dialog, change the name, eg. removing the initial part;

2) click ok

3) reopen the same story edit dialog and observe that the scale is changed from 1:50 to 1:48, i.e. as the drawing is in imperial dimension, not metric. 		Walid Remaili

VB-185981

Question: About Improved Object Labels.

The Task Overview Document (T02262) says "Object labels are changed to use user-supplied names whenever possible, to improve visual scanning and preserve semantic meaning from the Vectorworks model. Labels will be simplified for human readability, compared to 2022 SP0."
(Page 9, "Improved Object Labels" paragraph)

We placed the same door style in Vectorworks 2022 SP0(604624) and SP3RC2 (635820) and exported as a Datasmith file, but we couldn't see any changes on the object labels on Twinmotion.

We have checked with following steps as follows.
We would like to ask you that our way is suitable to check or not.

Please let us know if it's incorrect.

steps

1) Place a door with the door tool.

2) Select the door and choose "Replace" from "Style" dropdown on OIP.

3) Click the drop-down and choose "Hinged Doors Metric.vwx" from Vectorworks Libraries on the left pane.

4) Then select "Door Entry w Sidelights(BSI)".

5) Run "Export Unreal Datasmith (3D only)" and export to any destination.

6) Launch Twinmotion.

7) Click "Import" and then click the "GEOMETRY" tab.

8) Click Open and select the exported Datasmith file.

9) Click the left-pointing triangle on the upper right of screen and the operation panel shows.
Click the right-pointing triangle of "Scene graph" to expand the group, then click the right-pointing triangle of bottom.

10) Check the object label "Extrude_Glazing-Clear".

*Even though following above steps in Vectorworks2022 SP3 RC2, the object label is still "Extrude_Glazing-Clear".(SP0&SP3.png)
It won't be like images on the Task overview.

*Please let us know the way of confirming the improve.

 

Best regards,
Sanshiro Moriyama
A&A 		Justin Hutchison

VB-185693

STEP- file doesn't export solids

If you export a STEP- file from Vectorworks and the objects are solids in Vectorworks, the volumes in the STEP- file are exported based on surfaces. even when you uncheck "export volumes as surfaces". This gives issues in production software as for example "24/7 tailorsteel".

Answer Tech support:

"Hi Jeroen,

I haven't dealt with Solidworks in many many years. However, I believe that all "solid" objects in Vectorworks will only go out as surfaces. I think this is a limitation more than a bug. We do not handle solid geometry like some of these solid modeling applications. I am not aware of any way around this.

Thanks,

JOSEPH BLOCK
TECHNICAL SUPPORT MANAGER
D: 443.542.0411" 		Josh Loy
VB-185882

User is trying to reference a label legend and it seems to break other label legends that were in the file.  I tested it in my own files and got the same results.  The steps they took are:
# start in a blank file
2. create a test label legend to make sure 3D label legends work in the file
4. reference label legend from a different file
5. Go through a series of pop ups, the last one is the one about replacing the __NNA_SL_3DLabel_Record Format
6. switch the label legend of the fixture to the new reference label, see that it doesn't work, and the label is broken when switching back to the file's original test label

I have included a video that they shared with me.  I started testing in sp2.1 and sp3 is giving me the same results.  I didn't include any of my test files since it seems all files and label legends do it, but I can upload any if needed. 		Kevin Linzey

4. Exit the Edit mode.

VB-185563

Links in Mosa pattern resources are not clickable

In the Mosa pattern resources there is an URL to open the pattern product web browser, but the link in the tag is not clickable.
e.g. https://generator.mosa.com/patterns/edit/PT4082

If you change the string into:
[[https://generator.mosa.com/patterns/edit/PT4082]]
then it will be clickable
Josh Loy

VB-185209

# Open attached .vwx file
# Set Data Visualization to 'Data Visualization-1'
# Note - Data Vis Icon is seen for Fill and NOT for Pen
# Click in drawing space
# Note - Data Vis Icon is now seen for Pen
# Set Data Visualization to 'None'
# Note - Data Vis Icon is still seen for Pen while Fill is gone
# Click in drawing space
# Note - Data Vis Icon is not gone for Pen

VB-185306

Structural Grid Lines Not Showing in Section Viewport

# Open the attached "Kewn Residence-MGP.vwx" file
You will see one Plan Viewport and one Section Viewport.
# Note the Section Line for the Section Viewport is shown in the Plan Viewport's annotations toward the right between Grid Lines "B" and "C".
# While the actual Grid Lines (not including the shoulder or bubble) do not intersect the section plane, Grid Lines "B" and "C" should still be seen on the Section Viewport because the section is displaying the extents beyond the cut.
*Notice* no Grid Lines are shown in the section viewport.
# Select the Section Viewport and click the "Reverse Direction" button in the Object Info palette and Update the Viewport.
*Notice* the Grid Lines now show even though they're behind the cut plane. 		Josh Loy

VB-184753

Texture Replacement Gives the Wrong Result With By-Object Roof Face Textures

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few Roof Faces with by-object textures, where the "Paint-Tan" texture is applied to the Sides part. It's currently rendered in Shaded mode.

To reproduce:

-In the Resource Manager, delete the "Paint-Tan" texture
-Choose to replace it with the "Paint-White" texture

Note that the sides of the Roof Faces take-on a black texture/color.

-Now select a Roof Face and go to the OIP Render tab
-Re-select the "Paint-White" texture from the texture menu for the Sides part

Note that the textures now show correctly in the drawing.

I don't see this in RW so it only seems to happen in Shaded mode.

The same thing happened in past versions. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-185112

VB-185106

The angle of the cross section of Extrude Along Path may be significantly different from the version before VW2020.

Compared to before VW2020, the angle of the cross section of Extrude Along Path may be significantly different from VW2021 and VW2022.
Conditions that occur:
When creating an Extrude Along Path, if the Line of the path object is parallel to the Y axis and tilted with respect to the Z axis

Reproducibility procedure:
1) Open the sample file "12761.vwx" with VW2022. Polygon, which is a cross-section figure, and Line, which is a path object, are selected. Line is parallel to the Y axis and tilted to the Z axis.
2) Run Model menu> Extrude Along Path, make sure Line is selected as the path object, and click OK with the default settings in the Extrude Along Path dialog.
3) Looking at the cross section of the created Extrude Along Path, the angle is rotated 90 degrees. In the case of VW2020, it is rotated 34.14 degrees, so it is very different.

By the way, if the path object is tilted even slightly with respect to the Y axis, there is no difference in the cross-sectional angle between VW2022 and VW2020. A sample file "12761_Various_patterns.vwx" that can confirm this is also attached. In addition, the sample file output for confirmation with VW2020 is also attached.
And just in case, I will attach a video of the reproduction with VW2022.

The Vectorworks operation manual used by the customer already has a guidebook that considers the rotation of the cross section of the Extrude Along Path. In the first place, we do not understand the reason why the cross section of Extrude Along Path rotates.
Therefore, if it is a specification change after VW2021, please tell us the reason for the change.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Josh Loy

Select a viewport

select classes in the OIP

VB-184531

LAND Plant 3D graphics editing does not regard default Shaded 3D view render mode.

When attempting to edit a plant object's 3D graphics, the Vectorworks preference for default 3D view render mode should be maintained.

Whether I am in an existing file, or creating a new file, the plant object's 3D graphics edit mode does not maintain the Shaded setting I have chosen for 3D view render mode. It does render Shaded when I then choose it from my render settings pull down menu, but in returning to top/plan and then trying a 3D view it goes back to wireframe.

Users will want the shaded view to see the plant's rendered representation, especially if they are using image props, as this is the only way to actually see the plant image in 3D.

VB-184581

Multi-View - Floating View Pane Graphics Show Incorrectly in 2022 While Pane is Being Resized

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file has Multi-View enabled and uses a floating view pane.

To reproduce, open the file in each version and resize the floating pane.

In VW 2021, note that the graphics in the pane remain static while the resize is done.

In VW 2022, note that the graphics get stretched as the pane is resized, causing them to show the wrong aspect ratio temporarily.

The same thing happens going back to 2022 SP0.

VB-184924

Recently edited text object renders as gray block in isometric view

This appears to only happen when editing a file using the project sharing server (so I see it in acceptance tests, but cannot reproduce in a local standalone file).

To reproduce:
# In Preferences/Edit make sure *Edit text horizontally be default* is checked.
# Set up a file with project sharing, with some text content - the Platform/Text Edit test file can be used, or create a new file with a text object that has some wrapped text.
# Switch from Top/Plan to an isometric view e.g. via keypad 1
# Double-click a text object to edit it, enter some text, hit enter.

EXPECTED: after rotating for edit, the text returns to its orthogonal projection and appears as there along with the edit

ACTUAL: the text box is rendered as a solid gray block, you can no longer see any text. However if you force a re-render e.g. by dragging the canvas the text re-appears.

This appears to be a momentary 3D text rendering bug caused by project sharing. Happens on both Mac and Windows. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-184861

VB-184758

Network license - borrowed seats can't return after system upgrade

Several user encountered issues with borrowed seats from a network license.

When the user updates the operating system (even a small update), the user can't return the seat when he returns to the network. The user will have to wait until the borrowed period is over. 		Tim Ardoin
VB-184815

VS Python Documentation: vectors don't exist in VS Py, need to be called tuples

Vectorscript Pascal functions using variables of type VECTOR are documented everywhere for their Python counterpart also as using "Vectors".

This is not correct, there are no vectors in VS Python, meant are: tuples.
If we want to have a vector class, we must make one or use some external library.

This is totally confusing for the novice Python user, expecting vector operations to work out of the box. There is quite a number of clarifications in this sense in the Techboard.

We need the documentation to state the variable types as they are: tuples.

Please look here, for example, at a list of functions returning VECTOR:
https://developer.vectorworks.net/index.php?title=Special%3ASearch&profile=default&search=%22return+VECTOR%22&fulltext=Search 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-184595

Georeferencing an imported image

Please consider the ZIP I am attaching.

I will find:
# A TIFF image exported from QGIS, with its .twf file with georeferencing data.
# A .vwx file where our Customer put the image in the coordinates he expects to find after the import.

As you can see, when you import the image file, you find it in a far position from the expectation. We have tried every combination of the possibile parameters in the dialog Image Import Options, without getting the expected result.

In the end. in the ZIP file you can find the shot Sistema di riferimento coordinate QGIS.png that shows the Coordinate System used in QGIS.

Please, could you have a look and let us know what you think about? 
We find very strange that using Vw 2020 we can get the image put in a very close position to the expected one. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-184580

With overlapping site models a grade object reads elevation of wrong model

There seems to be no way to control which of the DTMs a grade object gets its elevations from when set to "Use Heights from Site Model." I realize this may not be a bug, but rather an enhancement request. ;) In this case, it would be very helpful if one could select which site model the grade object "listened to".

Problem found in v2021 file, also reproduced in v2022. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-184527

VB-189716

Unable to edit license files from the "Edit License Files" menu on the "Reprise License Server Administration" web interface.

Even you click "Update License File" after edited a license file, it shows something like an error message and the change is voided.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Open the License Server Administration interface.
2) Click "Edit License Files" button on the left list.
3) Click "Edit License File" button in the middle.
4) The content of the license file shows.
Enter "ISV vektorwrxport=1111" on the last line.
(This command is to change the ISV port number. The 4-digit number is optional.)
5) Click the "Update License File" button.
6) Something like an error message shows and the changes are lost.
(See the attached image "AdminIF.png".)
Even you reread/restart servers and, the ISV port number doesn't change.

Tested on v14.1.

VB-185766

WorksheetFailure DSTOP Stack underflow! when using functions as arguments to QTO functions

# Create a blank document
# Insert a wall object
# Create a worksheet with a database row with a "Type is wall" criteria
# Enter
{code:java}
=SurfaceArea('left net', 'component=1'){code}
This should evaluate to the the area of the left side of the leftmost component of the wall

# Enter
{code:java}
=Concat('component=1'){code}
 
That should evaluate to "component=1"

# But if you enter
{code:java}
=SurfaceArea('left net', Concat('component=1'))
{code}
You get a "WorksheetFailure DSTOP Stack underflow!" and a value of 0 (instead of #VALUE, #ERROR, N/A, or something similar)

Same thing happens for the ObjectData functions:
{code:java}
=ObjectData(Concat('component name'))
{code}
And it's also not limited to the Concat function.

The examples I gave here don't really make sense, but I'm trying to make it fail with simple functions. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-188409

Can't "select object of same symbol" on truss when trusses are group

Hello,

In a trssus group, the command "select object of same symbol" isn't active. It's selecting only the truss object you are clicking, not all other in the group of same symbol.

If you ungroup trusses, command is working well. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184623

Two English strings in Spanish 'Power Source' OIP

There are two parameter strings in the *Fuente de energía* (Power Source) OIP that appear in English in the Spanish Vectorworks product.
# In Braceworks workspace, select the tool set *Iluminación* (Lightning), then the *Componente eléctrico* (Electrical Component) tool. Select the *Fuente de energía* (Power Source) mode.
# Select a symbol instance in the drawing, choose *Edit 3D Component* from the context menu.
# Click the *Componente eléctrico* tool and the *Fuente de energía* mode as indicated before.

Notice the Object Info palette for *Fuente de energía*; towards the bottom, there are two parameters still in English:

_MaximumPower_

_Voltage_

The first, _MaximumPower_, requires a space to separate the words. It should read _Maximum power_.

I've been unable to find the precise UI strings for these two parameters. See graphic below for more context. 

{color:#4c9aff}*Recommendation:*{color} correct typo in MaximumPower; indicate if these are concatenated strings. If these are concatenated strings, *{color:#57d9a3}they should be replaced for full regular strings for localization purposes{color}*.

 

  		Kevin Linzey

VB-190208

Mac - Resource manager shift-selection behavior temporarily broken after drag

I encountered this while investigating VB-158319 - they may be somewhat related.

When viewing the current file's imported resources in the Resource Manager, you can select multiple resources by dragging the mouse or by using shift-click to extend the current selection.

You can also drag some resources into a folder. After you drop and those resources are removed from the current folder, another adjacent resource will be automatically selected.

This automatic selection is in a weird state. You can't shift-click to select additional resources.

It may not be obvious because if you change the selection by directly clicking on another object, by command-clicking, or using arrow keys, the problem is cleared up.

I found it first in Mainline, reproduced in VW2022 SP1.1.

I will look into fixing this as part of the other bug which also relates to selection after drag. 		Payne Chang

VB-191757

Zone of Visual Influence: missing help text

The parameter: "View Height above Site Model" doesn't have any help text in the settings dialog, whereas the user manual contains very useful tips:

!image-2022-11-15-13-19-07-382.png|thumbnail!

_*View height above Site Model* - Represents the view point elevation for the study. For example, 60 inches (152.4 cm) is often used as a standard eye level when standing._

Source: https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2023/eng/VW2023_Guide/SiteModel3/Zone%20of_Visual_Influence_analysis.htm

Would it be possible to add a help text for this parameter also in the UI?

Bozhidar Stanchev
VB-187299

Location field hidden in Softgoods

Vectorworks 2022 hides the Location field for Softgoods. Savvy Linesets relies on this field to store and display the lineset on which rigging objects and soft goods hang. In the case of soft goods, most drawings with pre-rigged line sets will not include the pipe (or other rigging object) in drawings, so this field is critical in indicating where the item hangs. This is distinct from Position, which has been added, and would refer to a named position.

The Location field was actually added to rigging objects at my request several years ago, and has worked its way into many users workflows. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-189447

Soft Goods Tool crashes Vectorworks when 3rd+ vertex is certain distance away from previous vertex

Easy to replicate bug:
# In Design Layer, in Top/Plan, select 'Soft Goods' tool.
# In the 'Soft Goods Style' dropdown, select resource, 'SG PandD Double Black Blue.'
# Click first vertex, click second vertex several meters away.
# Click third vertex a distance away that is _less than the maximum space between the poles_ of the soft goods object.
* On an M1 Mac running macOS 12.4, Vectorworks will start 'beach balling.' Force Quit is required.
* On an Intel Mac running macOS 10.15.7, Vectorworks will crash completely.
* Does not occur on Windows.

Screen recording / Demo is attached. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-185796

Symbol: different editing overlay for editing the 2D Components

Hi Vectorworks

A little detail in the editing symbol mask overlay. When you switch to 2D symbol editing via the design layer, you are shown a view from top with the auxiliary axes X/Y, although the current view says Top/Plan. When you edit the 2D components of the symbol via the resource manager, you are shown a current view as top/plan without the auxiliary axes.
I think the view without auxiliary axes would be the correct one, since these are only displayed in 3D.

Best regards, Denis 		Rick Berge
VB-189195

VB-190510

Resource Manager palette should not disappear with active search edit field

This is a usability issue. It is not a new issue. Happens on both Mac and Windows.

To reproduce:
# Make sure the Resource Manger window is visible and is set to auto-hide on mouse-out
# Click in the search field and begin typing to search
# While search edit field is still active, move mouse out of window

EXPECTED: while actively typing in the search edit field, the window will not collapse due to accidental mouse movements

ACTUAL: the window disappears requiring you to mouse back over the panel title bar in order to show it again and continue typing

Additional discussion:

I don't think there's a valid case for needing to hide the resource manager contents and see the document while in the middle of a search. If the user wants to stop searching so that the RM window will hide, they should be able to hit esc to exit the active edit field mode

OTOH it is very easy, particularly working on a laptop with a trackpad, to accidentally move the cursor while typing and then have one's search interrupted by the window disappearing, making this a usability bug 		Rick Berge
VB-190508

Resource Browser does not update downloaded badge after import of abstract person

Minor usability issue found in acceptance testing - I think this is likely not new, will also check on Mac. 

Precondition: person resources have not yet been downloaded (so "Abstract Person 1" will show a cloud-download badge on its icon).

To reproduce:
# In Resource Manager (icon view) type "person" and hit enter in search field to show person resources
# Find Abstract Person 1; it should not yet be downloaded and so should display the cloud-download badge on its icon
# Right-click the resource and choose Import; accept the import in the dialog

EXPECTED: the Abstract Person 1 resource is downloaded and imported to the document, and its icon in the content pane is updated to no longer have the cloud-download badge

ACTUAL: the Abstract Person 1 resource still has the cloud-download badge even though it has been successfully downloaded and imported. If you change selection to the current document in the Resource Manager organizer, you will see the Abstract Person 1 icon there without the download badge.

NOTE that this does not happen with all resources - for example when you download a texture, it seems that its icon will update immediately to remove the download badge, providing visual feedback that the download and import was successful

ALSO ON MAC: I tested this and reproduced the same issue using a different un-downloaded resource, from furniture, "Furn Knoll Generation Armless w/Casters" in Premium Libraries/Interior/Furniture/Knoll.

See attached screenshots. 		Rick Berge
VB-190118

PDF Export: Image is darker if edited with the attribute mapping tool

The attached VWX test file has a rectangle with an image, that is from a Customer file.

When exporting the rectangle with the image to PDF, it exports everything correctly. That is Test-File.pdf result.

When editing first the image with the Attribute Mapping Tool to increase its size and afterwards export it to PDF, the result displays the image still correct. That is Test-File2.pdf result.

...BUT... like its shown in the video, after increasing the image a certain size (more than the previous one), then the PDF result displayed the image darker than its original seen with Vectorworks. That is Test-File3.pdf result.

Please take a look at this. Thank you. 		Josh Loy
VB-189866

Deleting sheet layers changes the view location

Open the attached file. Enter the Layers dialog and delete every sheet except the active one. Exit the dialog. The view shifts to center on the page of the active sheet. Seems like an unnecessary shift. Kostadin Ivanov
VB-188443

ConnectCAD: Check Drawing gives signal type mismatch for passive sockets

[Conrad] Original title: Patchfield socket and signal type.
See Jess's comment below - in fact the problem is that he (and therefore other users) interprets the signal mismatch warnings as a fatal error and then gets into the trip of changing all the jackfield socket signal types. So in terms of what to do about this I think we should not flag a mismatch when one side of the circuit has passive signal type since in fact the circuit gets its signal from the non-passive side.

[Jess] Currently when inserting a patch field it is only possible to set the connector type for each side (left and right) in the tool preferences.
This means there is no way to set the type of socket (in, out, I/O) or signal for each side, you then have to manually edit the patch field sockets after creation to define this.

It would help streamline the insertion process by adding the signal and socket type settings to the tool preferences so users can set this at insertion and not have to go back an manually edit the patch fields afterwords 		Conrad Preen
VB-190500

kTolu: Invalid itemHit; It should NOT get here

Pressing Escape to exit out of any Alert dialog fires an assert on Mac:
{{kTolu: Invalid itemHit; It should NOT get here}}

Turns out pressing escape or clicking the X to close the dialog results in two messages being sent on the dialog handler on Mac:
kCancelButtonID (2) and kSetdownMessage

On Windows, this is very different. * When pressing the X, only kSetdownMessage is sent
* Pressing the escape key sends -1 (hardcoded, no constant exists) + kSetdownMessage



Most dialogs only process kSetdownMessage which behaves exactly the same on both platforms. The behavior of the other messages should be consolidated. 		Payne Chang
VB-192409

Vision does not accept referenced beam shapes from GDTF definition

If a  geometry is referenced from a shape in the GDTF definition, it cannot be highlighted into Vision.

I put a GDTF file with referenced shapes

RGB Strobe OFF are not referenced for Pixel 1 and Pixel 4 modes (They are actually working)

Other modes do not work 		Kevin Linzey
VB-185780

MA2 onPC continues to control Vision with Vision serial number and Dongle removed AFTER MA-Net2 connection established

*+Known Information:+*  When using MA-Net2 in Vision with a console such as MA2 onPC (used in testing) to send DMX Control to Vision, a Vision Dongle is required.

+*Expected Results:*+  If the Vision Dongle is removed after that connection has been set up with MA2 onPC and Vision, Vision should no longer be controlled by MA2 onPC.

+*Seen Results (without Vision Serial Number):*+  This works as expected if no serial number is present in Vision.  Vision goes into Demo Mode within a minute of the Dongle being removed, and MA2 onPC can no longer control Vision.  See screenshot No Serial Number.

+*Seen Results (with Vision Serial* *Number):*+   When a Vision serial number is in place, Vision does not go into Demo Mode.  I was able to continue using MA2 onPC to control Vision well after the Vision Dongle was removed from my machine.  Tested it for 20 minutes. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-189354

Title Block Border: Drawing stamp and North arrow - offset positions

* Create a custom TBB style.
* Set Drawing stamp and North arrow positions by instance at X=0/Y=0. Set larger scale and text size for them.
* With the TBB tool (using that style) insert an object into the drawing.
Notice that the tool preview and created object's geometry are inconsistent in Drawing stamp and North arrow positioning.

Note: You may need to adjust some specific Sheet size (e.g. ASME-A, ASME-C, etc.).
Note: In multiple pages insertion mode the created objects' geometry is correcly positioned. 		Nikolay Zhelyazkov
VB-190019

Export DXF/DWG: Getting asked twice if I want to overwrite file

In 2023, if you export a DXF or DWG via File > Export > Export DXF/DWG, then later export again to the same file name, you first get an OS dialog that says:
{color:#0747a6}"testname.dxf" already exists. Do you want to replace it? A file or folder with the same name already exists in the folder Export. Replacing it will overwrite its current contents.{color}

If you click Replace, you then get a Vectorworks dialog that says: {color:#0747a6}/Users/andybroomell/Dropbox/Export/testname.dxf This file already exists. Do you want to replace the existing file?{color}

You should only get one dialog or the other; not both. 		Vasil Kitanov

VB-189419

Marionette: inserting nodes in symbol with network created in different scale causes issues

This is pretty simple to replicate (see video):
1) open new empty document
2) insert two nodes with in and out ports, connect these
3) create symbol
4) insert symbol into design layer with different scale
5) edit inserted symbol and insert a new node
--> new node has different scale to already present nodes

To fix it you have to move all nodes in the network to reset their scale. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-186925

Default Python install not configured for tkinter

In VW2022 the python module tkinter appears to be included with the version installed in the app package on Mac, but does not appear to be configured properly.

There is a sample on the Developer web site that shows the use of tkinter and it will not run on a Mac.

 https://developer.vectorworks.net/index.php/Python_sample_to_Import_elevation

Download and open the SurveyEarchScripts.vwx file from the above link on a Mac and try to run the Import Elevations script. You will get an error message that tkinter is probably not installed.

There is a post in the forum back in 2016 that tkinter needs a special install on Mac.

https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/46794-vectorworks-and-tkinter/&do=findComment&comment=238234

If the sample scripts show the use of tkinter it should run.

Since it appears in the Python Framework inside the Mac app package it should be installed.

Expected behavior tkinter should be able to be imported into a Python script with no external library installation required. 		Vladislav Stanev

VB-191950

Data Tags don't like numbers with comma separators

However, for furniture that costs over 999.99 (thus, using a comma separator), the data tag reports the default value (0.00). VB-191425

One string reads the wrong term, benchmark elevation

The tool is {*}Elevation Benchmark{*}, but there is an errant string indicating {_}Benchmark Elevation{_}. The plug-in file is Elevation Benchmark.vso:

Plug-Ins/Elevation Benchmark.vso    Param   4 Default    Elevation        Benchmark Elevation

*Recommendation:* rewrite the erroneous term to reflect the correct tool name.

 

 

  		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-192403

Elevation Benchmark in rotated plan

Currently, if the user defined a Plan Rotation, the Elevation Benchmark objects in 2D mode will be inserted without any rotation (Plan Rotation will be ignored).

This makes sense because in 2D mode the Elevation Benchmark refers to the y-axis and  the Plan Rotation only rotates the view but not the axis itself. Therefore ther there is no sense in rotation the Elevation Benchmark.

But with a Benchmark Datum set to Control Point the Elevation Benchmark can be rotated and this will consider the new rotated axis (of the object itself) as height to display. In this case, the Elevation Benchmark should be inserted with the current rotation.

Please also see movie for futher explanation. 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-186041

0006996: file size when you draw walls with non-90degree corners

When you draw walls with non-90 degree corners, and you export this to pdf, the pdf is much larger thenn a pdf with 90-degree corners. This happends only when you use a wall with a insulation tile. see screenshot

Steps to reproduce:
- draw the wall at an angle >> export this to pdf
( use a wall with a insulation tile )

- draw a straight wall >> export to pdf

=> see the size difference of the 2 pdf's 		Hernán Stamati

VB-188903

However, the Mesh does show as having been selected in the OIP with all of the selection methods mentioned above.

This is most confusing when VW Pref "Enable selection highlighting" is disabled. When the pref is ON, there are still no selection handles. but the Mesh does glow with the selection color, though it still cannot be resized unless it was selected without the Option-Marquee method.

VB-192014

Mac - Text Format Dialog preview is not WYSIWYG with Shadow style

See screenshot for an example.

To reproduce:
# Create a text object and open Format Text dialog with it selected
# Change the size to something like 16 pt and apply the Shadow style
# Notice the preview appearance - it typically looks bad because shadow is offset too far making the text illegible.
# Apply the changes and notice the text object

EXPECTED: the text object appears like the preview in the dialog

ACTUAL: the text object generally looks better than the preview (smaller shadow offset)

The fix is to make the Format Text dialog's preview actually use the same shadow rendering technique as the actual text object will use, with the same resulting appearance. 		Payne Chang

VB-191231

Resource Manger icon selection shows odd behaviors on Mac and Windows

When the Resource Manager is in icon mode, if you select an item, Mac and Windows look different, and both have issues that may be considered bugs.

On Mac, when you select an item, the highlight will only extend as far as the text of the item label. If the text is short, this can leave a large gap of whitespace. One might expect one could click in this large gap to deselect the item, but that does not actually work (because you are still clicking in the item, it's just an unused area of the multi-line label). Perhaps the highlight should go to the edge of the actual rectangular cell so the user can see where its edge is, when looking for a place to click to de-select?

On Windows, when you select an item with a long title (normally truncated), it will actually extend to overlap an item below it.  This is probably by-design to solve the problem of additional whitespace, but it looks strange and if the icon of the item underneath is dark it will also obscure the text, making the feature useless. 		Payne Chang
VB-190711

Wrong offset in DialogBuilder after Resize

If the Dialog is resized the SwapControl is wrong positioned.

To reproduce this Bug start the DialogBuilder on the attached File and Resize the Dialog.

The SwapPane with the controlID "SubSwapControl" gets a wrong position. You can see a example on the attached video.

Bug only happens on Mac Version 12.4 and upwards.

Bug also seems to affect Data Manager (see attached video) and maybe other Dialogs using SwapPanes and offsets 		Payne Chang

VB-188569

Multi Cell Lighting Device Spotlight Numbering only in order when using Manual

# Place a Multi Cell Lighting Device (Light Instr USITT 4_Cyc Straight) in a New document (Recommend opening attached VWX since not all symbols have this issue)
# With Multi Cell Lighting Device selected, Go to Spotlight>Spotlight Number
# Check one or more fields (Like Channel or Unit Number)
# Under Number Direction>Primary Direction, select Left to Right
# Click OK
# Notice the Multi Cell Lighting Device is not numbered in order from Left to Right
# This can also be reproduced using Primary Direction>Manual & checking 'Single click manual numbering for multi-cell'

This looks to be an issue with the content itself and the order the cells were placed in the symbol. I tested a few different Multi Cell LD and they don't all have this issue.  Also some are ordered differently than others, but still not in the correct order.  Examples of some of these are in the attached vwx file.

Using Manual without the 'Single click manual numbering for multi-cell' can be used to correctly number a Multi Cell Lighting Device that have this issue. 		Kevin Linzey
VB-185038

Lighting Device color and FInd and Modify command

The Lighting Device color is not properly pushed to the geometry of a Lighting Device when the color is changed using the Find and Modify command. This is shown when the Modify Lighting Device color function is enabled in Spotlight Preferences.

Please find file and video 		Kevin Linzey
VB-191593

unable to create Lightwright xml file when "/" appears in path

I know it is probably bad practice but...

I have tried to "Perform a complete export on exit" to the 'Same location as file' from the Spotlight Preferences / Lightwright tab and the task failed without a dialogue, and the xml file was not created.  It did work with a custom location in my ~/Library/Application Support/... etc..

After playing around, I learned that the reason for the failure is that my vwx file was located within a folder called "2207 SDC 1/2/3 [S123]".  When the "/" was removed from the folder name, the xml was created as expected.

While I know it was probably dumb to put "/" in the folder name, I think VW needs to present a dialogue if such a task fails.  Or maybe the task didn't fail and the file is now floating around in my system hidden somewhere? 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184825
