VB-184670

Undo of Wrap text setting does not toggle checkbox in OIP

This is a very minor bug, showing a temporarily inconsistent UI state. Happens on both Windows and Mac.

To reproduce:
# Create a text block with multi-line text, including a mix of wrapped text and hard newlines.
# Double-click in the text box to activate the caret / editing state
# In the OIP, click the Wrap text checkbox to turn off text wrapping; the text object will resize
# Choose undo / command-Z

EXPECTED: the text wrapping state / size of the text reverts, and the OIP checkbox changes back

ACTUAL: the text wrapping state of the text reverts, but the OIP checkbox remains unchanged

This does not occur if you use the OIP checkbox and undo/redo when the text object is simply selected (not in active edit mode)

After you end editing, esp. after selecting a different object and coming back, the checkbox updates to the correct value to match the object state.

Note that this issue does not happen with other text-related OIP checkboxes; for example if you apply and then undo bold to a word while in editing mode, the OIP bold checkbox will correctly toggle with the undo to match the applied state.

  		Payne Chang

Please have a look at this.

Alex 		Kevin Linzey

VB-188006

Changing horizontal alignment during editing via dialog or menu not undoable

This may be partly related to VB-188004

To reproduce:
# Create a wrapped multi-line text object
# Double-click the object to enter edit mode
# Bring up the Font Dialog and repeatedly change the horizontal alignment, e.g. to right, center, left - and/or use the Text->Alignment menu to do the same
# After the last such change (while still in edit mode), try Undo

EXPECTED: you can undo these several alignment changes

ACTUAL: the changes cannot be undone

NOTE this bug is specific to using the dialog or menu _while in edit mode_. If not in edit mode (with text object merely selected), you can make multiple alignment changes with the dialog or menu, and they are undoable. Also in edit mode, you can make multiple horizontal alignment changes via OIP and undo works in that case. 		Ian Lane

VB-192068

Hidden line hatch is 90° to Shaded texture

See the attached test file.

This has been a bug since hidden line surface hatches were introduced. It has never been fixed. I reported this in VB-120429. It is not resolved.

In the test file, you'll see a column, a wall ,and a pillar object.

The texture "Interior Pine Siding RT" has a surface hatch that is oriented in the same direction as the vertical lines of the texture.

Notice for the wall, the texture and the surface hatch are oriented in the same direction.

For the pillar, the surface hatch on the sides is oriented horizontally ie. 90° to the shaded texture.

For the column, the surface hatch is correctly oriented on the column base and is turned 90° on the shaft and capital.

 

Can we fix this bug? It would sure be great to have the surface hatches behave as expected in all objects. 		Josh Loy
VB-192174

Surface Hatch renders inconsistently on Slab - Hidden Line

In the attached file I have a Slab object with  Surface Hatch-bearing Renderworks Texture applied to the sides (horizontal board-formed concrete). In Shaded render mode, the slab renders as expected. In Hidden Line, however, one edge renders correctly, the other shows the surface hatch rotated 90°. In other words, half the time the surface hatch and texture are misaligned by 90°. Josh Loy
VB-192128

Vectorworks is shown as Maxon in the Nvidie System Preferences

Hi Vectorworks

The App Vectorworks 2023 is shown as Maxon in the Nvidia System Preferences, but the icon is the one from Vectorworks. Vectorworks 2022 is shown as "Vectorworks" in the same dialog.

Best regards, Marc 		Justin Hutchison
VB-192141

Button to say "Exit Mesh" when inside mesh

Currently when you're inside a Mesh, the button in the upper right says "Exit Group." While I understand that a Mesh is essentially a special type of group that contains 3D Polygons, it would be clearer to users if this button said "Exit Mesh."

Users will often Group a Mesh in order to avoid accidentally moving individual vertices (i.e. there are 3D Polygons inside of a Mesh inside of a Group). So when you enter the Group the button says "Exit Group" and if you go all the way into the Mesh it should say "Exit Mesh." As it stands, I sometimes get momentarily confused which "level" I'm in since the buttons both say the same thing.

 

[The one complication here..... When you're inside a Mesh, you can select multiple 3D Polygons and "Convert to Mesh" which causes the parent Mesh container to become a true Group, containing the new Mesh and, separately, and remaining 3D Polygons. So this would have to somehow be accounted for.] 		Josh Loy
VB-192026

I am not seeing this issue on MacOS, Windows ONLY

I included a video to help show the issue.
# Start with a Blank New Document
# Activate Stair Tool
# Got to Stair Tool Preference button in Tool Bar (or OIP after Stair has been inserted)
# Go to Railing Tab
# Notice the Parameter windows shows/flashes alone first, then it disappears and everything else on the page fills in.
# It take moving the mouse over the Parameter window to make it reappear.

As can be seen towards the end of the video, if the mouse is moved over the window from the side or bottom, the reappearance is spotty, not all at once like from the top. 		Ian Lane

VB-191686

KLS: Boundingbox of symbols with dynamic text does not adjust itself

Symbol text can be linked to a database, so that you write a text and it automatically is displayed inside the symbol.
If the text is longer than the bounding box then the bounding box does not adjust itself to the bigger size.
Is that a bug or intended.
I do ask, because if you insert such a symbol inside a wall and the text extend the bandbox and the bounding box would adjust itself automatically, then the hole cut out the wall would grow too, which might be not wanted.
What do you think? Bug or intended behavior?

See testfile and video. 		Rick Berge

VB-189878

VERIFYHANDLE incorrectly returns false, which forces VWTextureShaderBase::GetShaderRecordFamilyAndPrototype to be false and ultimately renders VWTextureShader… useless

As far as I can tell, the only place VERIFYHANDLE gets used directly in the SDK is line 59 of VWTextureShaderBase.cpp.

Despite a valid handle being passed to the macro, which calls:

_VerifyValidHandle(toWhom,THIS_FILE,__LINE__,#h,(GSConstHandle)h,bytes)

the kludge invoked by _VerifyValidHandle returns 307 instead of 0, throwing an assert

VWTextureShaderBase::GetShaderRecordFamilyAndPrototype will always fail, and thus ::IsShaderRecordObject will always fail, so none of the shader classes function correctly.

If I change values in the debugger so that VERIFYHANDLE returns TRUE, all code functions as expected. 		Justin Hutchison

-Organization Dialog is difficult to see.

VB-191331

Editing 3D Label Legend after having applied a Clip Cube to main drawing causes Clip Cube to be applied to 3d Edit Layout View

If you have just applied and edited a Clip Cube on the main 3d drawing space, if you then go Spotlight > Label Legend > Label Legend Manager, select an already existing Label Legend and Click edit 3d Layout, the view will have a clip cube applied to it. (screenshot attached)

 

  		Justin Hutchison
VB-191431

Scaling the parent layer of a fixture results in giant/tiny fixtures

I thought we already handled this, but apparently we simply removed Scaling from the fixture UI; not thinking about how our kinematic/parent chains work regarding scaling transforms.

I think the solution to this issue becomes a little complicated as a result of the current functionality.

I've seen people suggest that they wanted to scale up via DMX so they could mimic fireworks. I've seen people suggest that they wanted to scale down via DMX so they could mimic kabuki drops. I've also seen people that want a truss to "disappear", and so they push it wayyyyy up on the Y axis so it's "out of view".

We apparently never stopped users from scaling a stick of truss and all of it's fixtures to zero to make it disappear like they would a firework or a curtain for a kabuki drop. I think we should try to find a way where we can still make fixtures "disappear" or become "not visible" if the parent layer "disappears" or becomes "not visible". However, we need to approach this solution carefully to avoid breaking backward compatibility with things like DMX XForms. 		Kevin Linzey

- Now resize the Bitmap so that its aspect ratio changes
- Open the Image Effects dialog again

VB-190262

VB-190162

Spotlight: After "create label legend from lighting device" complete, container rises to top AND the affected lighting device is added to the label legend edit window

While experimenting with "create label legend from lighting device" to compare to Lonnie's experience resulting in VE-103437, I remembered my own attempts to perform the same action. while i had no problem creating a new label legend from the lighting device, *every time* i performed the command, the result was the selected lighting device [with new label legend] BUT the channel data field AND channel container has been moved to FRONT, and covering the other elements of the label legend. [i made a movie and now i can't find the movie on my new hard drive...]

anyway, this happened *every time* I created a new label legend from an existing one. i could edit the label legend resource 2D component and send selected "channel" and "container" to back. but when i opened the edit symbol window, the lighting resource that was active when i created the new label legend is now ADDED to the 2D component window! yowsah!

if i can ever find the movie i'll add that to this filing. to review: 1] after executing the "create label legend from lighting device" the channel data and container move to the front of the label legend, and 2] the source lighting device 2D component is added to the label legend 2D component edit window. both of these issues should be addressed. thanks. VB-190129

Duplicate Along a Path using Spotlight Straight Truss: Preview equivalent to OK

# In a blank document, create a Path (circle, line, rectangle, polygon)
# Using the Straight Truss Tool (or Curve Truss Tool), create a piece of truss
# With both Truss and Path selected, Go to Edit>Duplicate Along a Path
# Put a value in Number of Duplicates (suggest 3-10)
# Any of the check boxes can be checked/unchecked
# Click Preview
# Click OK
# Notice the truss quantity multiplied the number of duplicates by itself. (depending on the shape and original placement, the truss might be stacked on top of each other.  check OIP for count if not obvious)

As seen in the video:
* When Preview is NOT clicked (skip Step 6), the command runs correctly with the correct quantity and placement.
* If Preview is clicked, followed by Cancel, the Previewed truss remains in the drawing space.
* If changes are made in the Duplication Along a Path window after click Preview, with objects other than Straight Truss, the Preview clears and needs to be clicked again (Expected Result).  This does not happen with the Straight Truss object, if Preview is clicked again, it reruns the command multiplying the number again by itself.  This can happen even when a change has not been made in the window.
* Using Truss from the Truss Tool (Symbols), shows the expected results and works correctly.

This is seen in Vectorworks 2028, but goes back as far as Vectorworks 2021 (and possibly farther) 		Kevin Linzey
VB-189654

When using a specific server machine that is not in a virtual machine environment, using an activation key for a virtual environment machine works.

When using a specific server machine that is not in a virtual machine environment, using a normal activation key does not work, but using an activation key for a virtual environment works.
Is the cause and solution for this problem the same as reported in VB-131262?
Is it still "RLM" that judges it as a "virtual machine" now?

■User's environment:
System Manufacturer: NEC
System Model: Express5800/T110j [N8100-2817Y]
Processor: Intel(R) Xeon(R) E-2234 CPU @ 3.60GHz (8 CPUs), ~3.6GHz

■ Remarks

・If you use the normal activation key used in this test on another PC, it will work without problems.

・RLM version is 14.1.

VB-189713

Bruce DSTOP GetObject is being asked to handle an out of range SysName (-1 - legal 0 4481

Open the attached file. You will get numerous asserts like the above, from looking at a field in a record node. I don't know if the -1 value is acceptable and it's just supposed to return nullptr without asserts, or it's a problem value. Rick Berge
VB-189913

Copy+paste, and style import, may not need to import classes from Graphic Legends

When a Graphic Legend is copied or imported (style) from one document to another, it imports the classes referenced in the source objects Graphic Legend Images. If these classes are not already in the destination document, then there may be no need to control their appearance in the Legend in the destination document, and they may not need to be created. There may be a lot of them and the user may not like having to delete the ones they don't want. (Julian was not expecting them when he cut+pasted).

Viewports experience a similar issue. Viewports can be copied from one document to another. Viewport styles may one day be implemented, and introduce the import path for them, like we have for Graphic Legend styles. The issue of resolving whether the classes are imported may arise with the design of Viewport styles.

We may need a resolver dialog that offers the user a list of classes that would be created as a result of a paste/import and allow them to uncheck the ones they don't want. We will need to see what users prefer when they start to work with Legends.
Josh Loy
VB-186801

Modify 3D Feature / Fillet: Can't add faces

Say for example you have a Fillet object, and you want to Modify the Fillet operation to add additional edges to be filleted. When you click the Modify button in the OIP, you can hold Shift to add edges to the existing selection of edges.

However, if you have the Fillet Edge tool set to "Select Faces," holding Shift to add to the selection does NOT work. Clicking on a face resets the selection even while holding shift, meaning you have to re-select all the existing faces.

This might be relevant to other features such as chamfer edge and shell, but I only tested on fillets.

Screen recording attached. (Note that I am holding Shift when I'm trying to add the missing face to the selection). 		Josh Loy

-Select the 3D object with brick texture.

the texture, edit the bump bricks shader.
-Notice the multiple preview. This will only happen
after working on the render and zooming in/out.

VB-188890

T02274 - Aligned Hardscape/Site Modifier Profile Lines Show Highlighting Incorrectly in 2023

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2022 compared to 2023. The file contains an Aligned Hardscape with a few Profile lines added.

To reproduce, in each version, select the Hardscape and toggle through the Profile lines using the controls in the OIP.

In VW 2022, note that each line gets highlighted in succession.

In VW 2023, note that all of the lines remain highlighted as you toggle through them.

This also happens with Aligned Site Modifiers.

I don't see this on Windows 10 but I do see it on multiple Mac versions, so it looks like Mac-only. 		Josh Loy
VB-188716

T02261 Renderworks Foundation. Fast Renderworks/Final Quality Renderworks doest refresh properly.

This happens in Fast Renderworks and Final Quality Renderworks.
-Start up Vectorworks and change the background to dark.
-Open the attached file.
-As you can see it's rendered in shaded.
-Change the background to light.
-As you can see the background color changes, and it didn't have to re-render.
-Change it back to dark and change the render to Fast Renderworks.
-After it finishes rendering, change the background to light.
-Notice the background color doesn't change.
-Now change the zoom value a little, notice the background color has change to
light and it's re-rendering.

I'm aware that shaded and Fast Renderworks/FQRW have different behaviors, once the background color is change, it would have happen dynamically. That use doesn't have
to change the zoom value. 		Justin Hutchison

VB-187794

"Centre on objects after View Change" inside container objects

VB-185269

Mac - Repeatedly changing horizontal alignment on text object results in momentary drawing glitch

This is a minor refresh/drawing bug with text objects. I see cannot reproduce it in VW 2021 so it seems to be a regression.

To reproduce:

1. Make a multi-line, wrapping text object.
2. Select the object; selection tool should still be active.
3. In OIP data pane, change Hoirz. Align. to different values several times - it may take 8 or 10 changes to see the issue.

When the issue occurs, you will see the object fail to reflect the new state (e.g. you may change align to Center but it will still show Left, or similar) and also lose the selction outline and/or the selection handles.

When you do something like move the mouse over the drawing area or otherwise prompt a redraw, the issue will be corrected.

This does not occur on Windows. 		Josh Loy

VB-185925

Window: 3D Detail edit choice is reversed in multiple selection

Use two window objects. with different bitwise operation flags for 3D Detail levels (1-2-4 for Low-Medium-High levels).
Edit in multiple selection: change the value of a non-determinate checkbox.
Notes:
* Selection order does matter!
* Edited checkbox value is correct only for the determined checkboxes and the non-determined checkboxes which are active of the first selected window!

*Example: Window A (1-0-0). Window B (0-2-0).*
* Selection order A, B:
Correct result for a checkbox Low=1.
Reverse result for checkbox Medium=2.
* Selection order B, A:
Correct result for a checkbox Medium=2.
Reverse result for checkbox Low=1. 		Judah Warshaw

VB-185290

VB-184921

Text style keyboard shortcuts do not work to set default style for new text

This is likely by design, but it is also an inconsistent user experience & a bug.

When you have no text object selected and the selection tool active, you can go to the Text menu and set a style (e.g. Font Style->Bold), and that style will be active when you then select the text tool and create a text object.

We have keyboard shortcuts for these styles on both Mac and Win - cmd/ctrl-B for bold, cmd-ctrl-I for italic, cmd-ctrl U for underline. These keyboard shortcuts work when you are actively editing text, but they do not work in the scenario described, to set a style as default for a new text object.

At least on Mac the normal behavior for menu items with keyboard shortcuts is to not disassociate them based on context - if a keyboard shortcut works for a menu item in one situation, it should work for that menu item in every situation where the menu item applies, otherwise the lesson to the user is that they can't rely on the keyboard shortcut. 		Ian Lane
VB-184926

Text style indicators for multiple styles indeterminate/inconsistent

When a uniformly styled block of text (or entire text object) is selected, the OIP and the Text menu will reflect applied styles consistently. E.g. if the entire block is bold italic, the bold and italic checkboxes are checked in the OIP, and also in the Text->Font Style menu.

If a block has words of differently styled text, the program behaves inconsistently. For example, create a text block that has one word bold, and one word italic. If (in edit mode) you put the cursor in the midst of each word or select each word individually, it behaves as expected - bold is checked in the bold word, italic is checked in the italic word.

If you select both words in edit mode, bold is checked (in OIP and in Text->Font Style menu) but italic is not.

If you end editing with esc, activate selection tool and select the object, the OIP again shows bold as checked but italic not checked, but the Text->Font Style menu applies three check marks to Bold, Italic, and Plain Text.

There are more inconsistencies that can appear with more combinations of different styles. In some cases I was able to get OIP to display a sort of half-disabled intermediate state for multiple-styled text, but I could not determine the logic, and it did not match Text->Font Style behavior (which would put checkmarks on multiple items).

EXPECTED: the OIP and Text->Font Style items are consistent with each other and also reflect intermediate states unambiguously, e.g. by using a dash rather than a checkmark for styles that only apply to part of the selection, permitting the user to make reasonable changes (toggling one style on or off amid multiple styles). 		Rick Berge
VB-185097

PIO text sizes not the same

These two files should be identical — I copied the object from the "Correct" file to the incorrect file. The only difference is I had previously pasted another object into the incorrect file, and then deleted.

Both files have been purged.

Is it possible to diff the drawing headers and see what's different? Some sort of hidden preference? 		Rick Berge

VB-185030

Compare GDTF and Vision/LIT in Vision: Shutter Effects

While running a test that compared GDTF and LIT, I noticed there were differences between the two when using the Shutter/Strobe channel.  This issue being reported is not new, this can be found using Vision 2021 and 2022.

Attached is the VWX and MVR files used for this test.  An onPC Lighting Console will be needed for reproducing.  A video & PDF chart has been included to better illustrate.

My recommendation is to open the PDF for review while watching the attached video.  The PDF is a quick chart that breaks down the different effects/values found in the Shutter/Strobe channel and the results seen for GDTF and LIT using the attached test file that is seen in the video.  In the video, the GDTF fixtures are Upstage (higher trim) and the LIT fixtures are Downstage (lower trim).  The fixture tested was Robe 800 LEDWash in mode 1.

  		Kevin Linzey
VB-184872

Vectorworks changes screens after minimizing and restoring

I just started noticing with 2022 SP3 build 629344 that when Vectorworks is running on an external screen and I minimize it, when restored it will switch to the laptop screen.  In this setup my laptop screen is the main screen, screen 1, and the external monitor is screen 2.  

Screen 1: laptop display, 3840x2400, scaling 250%, set as main display

Screen 2: External monitor, 2560x1440, scaling 125%

Steps to reproduce: 

1) Open Vectorworks and have it running on the external monitor.

2) Minimize Vectorworks.

3) Click on the Vectorworks icon in the system tray, does not matter on which screen.

4) Vectorworks will restore on the laptop screen.

I suspect this might be some sort of graphics driver issue.  All versions of Vectorworks on the laptop now do this, and I can reproduce it with 2021 SP5 as well.  Other apps on the laptop do not exhibit this same behavior though, it seems limited to just Vectorworks.  For example outlook, slack, chrome etc all restore correctly when minimized. 		Ian Lane
VB-184794

Parasolid Import and Export: Where is all the data in Vectorworks?

To reproduce, please watch the video file.

When exporting a parasolid file from TopSolid, we can tell that it comes with a certain structural hierarchy by opening the file in the eDrawings Viewer. From the structural names within the (text) file, we can tell where this information comes from.

When importing the parasolid file in Vectorworks, there is no telling where the information is stored: objects have no names and record formats don't exist. But we know information is conserved, because 1) there are nested groups within the model group and 2) when we export the model back to X_T and open the file in eDrawings again, we can see parts of the information remained in the model, but the structure is flattened all throughout the model.

This leaves us with two issues:
a) Where is the information stored within Vectorworks and why can we not access, read and change it?
b) Why is Vectorworks not able to export the model with the same hierarchy it was imported or a hierarchy that can be configured by nesting groups? 		Josh Loy

VB-191481

DOM: Reshape Tool slow because of selection highlighting

This File is from a customer (15 lic), which we made switching from Pointline/AutoCAD to Vectorworks before 2 Years. The start was very sluggish because they struggle against learning a new CAD Application. They management desided to just switch off the other CAD licenses and they switched to Vectorworks. Some of them like it some not.

However we try to support them as good as we can. At the Moment their biggest problem is instability. Beside that they try to continue some workflows they had with the old CAD and there it was the daily business, to reshape 2D Drawings.
It would be possible to reorganize the drawing, making symbols, connect single lines to polylines etc. Also hiding unwanted Objects etc.
Through the eyes of those users it just like Vectorworks can't handle the same drawing as the other CAD Applications. And I must agree, 3000 Selected Objects and 30'000 overall visible Objects should not bring Vectorworks go down in the knees. OK so far to join in that it is a workaround but not a good option to just reorganize the drawing till it works.

Vectorworks 2015 takes about 3 seconds to reshape the drawing. Vectorworks 2023 needs over 100 Seconds for the same action which looks pretty the same.

It seems to be a specific issue with the selection highlighting option. Even if there are just 200 objects selected it is very laggy. That brings me to the suspicion, that there could be a Bug in the reshape tool.

Maybe it could be a pragmatic solution, to track the amount of objects and then deactivate the selection highlighting in the tool temporary?

I know it is not a 100% Bug it is more a downgrade of speed. But in 2019 it is the same speed. We have to go back many years (2015 or 2016) to see, that there was a time it worked faster.

I would be very glad, if you could take a look at this issue. Thank you




Josh Loy
VB-191916

Site Model: Contours calculation is slow

Open file 'site-model-update-crashes-vw.vwx'.

Update the site model. It takes a lot of time.

The problem is in function {*}CClosingOperation::CloseContourOnBoundary(){*}. More specifically functions *VWPolygon2D::IsPtOnPoly2D_Fast* and *VWPolygon3D::GetPlanarPolygon* are slow because they are called many times due to the fact that the boundary of the site model has ~3000 points. 		Bozhidar Stanchev

To reproduce select one of the arrays and try to drag it to a new position 		Kevin Linzey
VB-186727

Viewport: Generic Solids: slow performance and memory leak

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

We have decided to mark this as QRT, because of slow performance and memory leak of a file that contains Spotlight objects and we are close to an Update (SP3.1) that has to do with Spotlight. Maybe this is worth to take a look and see if a fix / improvement can be included in such Update.

After opening the attached Vectorworks file and updating the Viewports that are in the file, we can see that the RAM in use increases significantly and does not go down after the Viewports being updated.

Afterwards, if we navigate the file (zoom, pan, etc.) the file drags a lot and the objects disappear and take a long time to reload. The memory also went up a notch again. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-191230

*Duplicate Array performance regression and crash -- bgfx::UniformBuffer::reset

https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?crashId=8957555
https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=107876&build=672648-vectorworks-win
https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?category=107876&build=681367-vectorworks-win

The attached videos show the problem being reproduced.

Duplicate Array 200x200 = 40000 Squares.

Square Extrudes:
- With VW2019 SP6 Windows 10 needs 3 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Windows 10 needs 65 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Mac 12.6 needs 144 seconds.

Mesh Extrudes:
- With VW2019 SP6 Windows 10 needs 3 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Windows 10 needs 7 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Mac 12.6 needs 20 seconds and Mesh result is wrong/broken.

Square 3D Polygons:
- With VW2019 SP6 Windows 10 needs 30 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Windows 10 needs 93 seconds and then CRASH.
- With VW2023 SP1 Mac12.6 needs 32 seconds.

Square Generic Solids:
- With VW2019 SP6 Windows 10 needs 22 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Windows 10 needs 105 seconds.
- With VW2023 SP1 Mac 12.6 needs 55 seconds.

QRT: Performance Tests for Knapp AG. 		Hernán Stamati
VB-184764

DWG Export - Big delay on examining document

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/91640-exporting-dwg-examining-document]

To reproduce the delay export sheet layers L-01-1-01 and L-01-1-02 from the attached document. (from the user: The material is a real project so please don't spread it. )

The problem is related to the creation of unique DXF block names (there are around 15000 IFC Entity objects). We have optimized the routine for Group objects, when groups are exported as named blocks, but we might need a more general solution.

  		Nina Ivanova

VB-190832

it is not uncommon to have about 100 doors in a drawing. The doors are labelled by data tag. This works pretty fine and is very fast.
But the moment the data tag writes data back to the assigned object, things do become very slow. See video.
I do log this as a bug, because I think the data tag becomes more and more important.
Tested also in latest 28.0.1.
There are two testifies. One with a regular data tag (100 US-Türen mit Datenstempel) which is pretty fast and one which writes data back to the object (100 US-Türen mit Datenstempel und Datenverknüpfung Tür) which is beyond slow.

Karthick Chilaka
VB-191395

Mac: Graphic Legends progress dialog and work on main thread kills event loop

On a complex file with graphic legends - such that making a change to recalculate will bring up a progress dialog - the dialog which comes up is implemented poorly in terms of event-handling and multi-tasking on Mac.

In particular, even though the progress dialog appears to be non-modal, it will block many user-invoked actions from completing and can also cause very awkward/non-professional looking UI behaviors such as disappearing or stuck menu items.

This is the general issue which caused ModeBar-branch bug VB-191129. A workaround has been implemented for that bug, but the general issue remains.

To reproduce:
# Open the attached file.
# Select the graphic legends object in the active Sht-11 layer.
# Make a change that triggers the re-generation of the graphic legends such as changing the dimension font size via *Text->Size* menu item
# While the progress dialog is regenerating the graphic legends, attempt to click on menu items and carry out other commands. (Specific items are mentioned below)

EXPECTED: the menus show, with available items enabled and others disabled; clicking on an enabled item correctly invokes its behavior

ACTUAL: the menu items sometimes do not show when you click them; when they do, they may go away as you move the mouse around, which makes the program seem very glitchy; when you succeed in choosing a menu command, it does not actually do anything.

SPECIFIC ENABLED COMMAND FAILURES:

*File->New, Open, Save As..., Project Sharing, Print* etc. are enabled, but selecting during progress dialog does nothing

{*}Edit->Cut, Copy, Undo, Redo{*}, etc. are enabled, but selecting during progress dialog does nothing

*View->* has many enabled items which do not produce any action, including {*}Zoom{*}, {*}Class Options{*}, {*}Look at Working Plane{*}, *Create Multiple Viewports...,* {*}Save View{*}..., ** etc.

Nearly every other menu also has items enabled that will do nothing: {*}Modify{*}, {*}Model{*}, {*}Tools{*}, {*}Text{*}, {*}Window{*}, and *Help.*

RECOMMENDATION: the easiest fix may be to make the progress dialog an actual modal which prevents interaction with the rest of the app until it's done; this is what we're actually doing, so this would resolve much of the appearance of glitchiness and unresponsiveness. Presumably the modal state will actually disable most menu items which are currently left enabled.

*A better fix,* recommended for the future, is to rewrite the way that we do this task and show this progress dialog. I think TProgressDialog's {{{}*DoYield*{}}}() approach to multi-tasking is fundamentally outdated and incompatible with the Mac OS event loop. All this work is done on the main thread, including the synchronous updating of the progress dialog, with DoYield() permitting occasional idle event processing; this is backward. The progress dialog should get asynchronous notifications to update its progress display, not get synchronously updated on the mani thread, and the main rendering work should not happen on the main thread. The menu items that cannot be invoked while this process is underway should be disabled; any enabled item should still trigger its expected behavior.

  		Payne Chang
VB-192217

Slow response of menus after referenced files are uploaded to project sharing

Open the attached file target.vwx

File/Project Sharing, create a server-based project file, create new folder.

At this point the program feels responsive. The menus respond immediatly.

Choose tools-organization. Create reference  to Source1.vxw, layers (Floor1, Floor), Absolute Path, all other options off.

Create reference to Source2.vwx (Eletrical). Absolute path, all other options off.

Close 'Organization'

At this point the program still feels responsive. Move around the menus, they open quickly.

Tools/Organization opens quickly.

Tools/Organization->references

Select both Source1 and Source2

Select Relative Path. Select the same folder used for project sharing above.

Close the organization window. Things are sluggish now.

Try to move around the menus. They are unresponsive.

Open tools/Organization. It takes a couple seconds to open.

From the References tab, 'Edit...' takes a couple seconds to open.

 

 

 

  		Rick Berge

VB-191379

VW2023 relatively SUPER slow to import, interpret or display PDFs

Importing PDFs into Vectorworks 2023 and 2022 takes *_four_* times longer than Vectorworks 2020 and 2021. 

Comparative Testing: 

Importing same PDF with lots of geometry into: 
* Vectorworks 2020 = 14 seconds
* Vectorworks 2021 = 12 seconds
* Vectorworks 2022 = 42 seconds
* Vectorworks 2023 = 45 seconds

This issue became apparent while examining and testing a customer's file to identify and report what opportunities they have to improve their efficiency with Vectorworks. 

At first I thought the problem only occurred when opening their file which had 16 embedded and cropped PDFs with quite a lot of geometry, but then I noticed similarly long delays when importing PDFs into a file new blank document and similarly long delays when switching _back_ to any of their Design Layers that had embedded PDFs so perhaps the issue might relate to either the process of interpretation or displaying PDFs. Then again, their file at times induces 27 GB or RAM on my 16 GB Mac, so perhaps the delay when switching Design Layers was due to memory handling processes. 

*The bottom line is;* Importing PDFs (perhaps only those that have geometry in them) takes _*four*_ _times longer in VW2023 and VW2022, than in VW2021 and VW2020._ Something to look at here for sure! 

See the attached videos and PDF

 

Cheers, 

Jeremy  		Josh Loy
VB-191437

Hardscape Objects Info takes too long to display in the OIP

Found while investigating VB-191105. I took all relevant information from that bug.

Please, use the attached file and do "Select All".

On my Mac in Debug it takes ~2.5 minutes for the information to appear.

Time profiling shows the majority of time is spent in CExtObjectHardscapeShapePane::Activate.

I understand that algorithm which collects the information for OIP contributes to the problem - we call TParametricTypeController::UpdateWidgets for each selected object and it takes time.

The purpose of this bug is to investigate if some optimization can be done in CExtObjectHardscapeShapePane::Activate 		Bozhidar Stanchev

active accelerate graphics: *±00:18.47s*
inactive accelerate graphics: *±00:01.68*

This results in a delay of 999.4% to the stopped 18.47s.

The time was *±05.76s*. The delay to 18.47s is here 220.66%

VB-189485

There was a bug VB-153827 that had an issue with Spell Check hanging on a specific file when selecting Change All.  This was resolved with changes made to Spotlight plug-in and verified in Vectorworks 2020 SP3 Build 531768.

Retesting Spell Check in this file in Vectorworks 2023 Build 662280 as well as Vectorworks 2022 SP4 Build 653494 & SP3 Build 646432.  Both experience a hang when Change All is selected (hang for Change is usually less significant).  If let sit, the Vectorworks seems to eventually come out of it, but some times takes up to 30 minutes.

I will continue to test back to see about narrowing down between VW2021 SP3 and VW2022 SP3. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-184925

Speaker Array tool runs vary slowly when working with symbols

When using the speaker array tool and selecting symbols rather than generic shapes, the placement, populating, and drag/move of the array takes a major performance hit.

To test, open a new document.

Place an array and select the bumper and various random speakers from the generic offerings. Populate the array via the Populate Array button in the OIP. Notice the speed.

Place another array and this time choose symbol based objects for the bumper and speakers. Populate again. This time around it should take much longer to complete the task.

Next, move each array set around the drawing. The generics move much faster than the symbol based.

Our user are going to want to use our extensive libraries of symbols rather than generic shapes. Speed is critical and performance should be similar between the two.

Demo file attached. To immediately see my results, simple move each array and compare the about of time it takes.
The generic array takes 1.2 seconds to move. The symbol based version takes 35 full seconds to move. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-187966

What happens is I'll be working on modeling a design, and navigation will be smooth and responsive – then at some point navigation becomes very slow and sluggish, seemingly unrelated to model complexity. I'm not sure what triggers this change. Today it happened quite suddenly after simply adding a few extrudes to the model.

The issue seems to only affect navigation with the SpaceMouse, as using the regular Flyover tool still works fine.

Strangely, closing and restarting Vectorworks doesn't solve the issue. I have to completely restart my computer, then navigation is once again smooth and responsive.

This issue doesn't seem related to any particular file or action, so I'm not sure how to add better documentation to this entry, but I wanted to file it anyways. The motivation for filing this today is that I started a brand new file this morning for a new design, and around 2p the slow navigation suddenly began. This was also the first time I confirmed my suspicion that it takes a computer reset to fix the issue. 		Josh Loy

VB-185929

Nested symbol inserted into Wall fails on IFC export

This comes from a large UK customer AQP who creates large residential schemes. As part of their workflow they create repetitive flat units as Symbols. They also model custom Doors and Windows as Symbols then either insert directly into Walls or create Door and Window object using Symbol Geometry.

See attached screen recording and files - once IFC is exported, these symbols don't keep their position, but explode to random locations (possibly Symbol and Project Origin). Only way to keep them where they should be is to attach IFC to Flat symbol at top level, but that means no objects within can be individually queried in the BIM model.

Let me know if you need further information or clarification. I have a customer that is stuck with their IFC exchange and would appreciate some feedback.

Thanks, Luka 		Mihail Rizov
VB-186726

VS ModelVecToScreenVec() & ModelPt2DToScreenPt() return incorrect values in VW 2020 and newer

In VW 2020 and later, the VectorScript procedures ModelVecToScreenVec(), and ModelPt2DToScreenPt() return incorrect values when the Plan is rotated and the User Origin is moved.

If you plot the values returned from these calls back to the implied origin it can be seen that the "Faux Origin" is rotated twice the distance as the plan rotation angle.

In the attached file, the plan angle is 10°, but the ModelVecToScreenVec(), and ModelPt2DToScreenPt() calls are returning values as if the plan angle is rotated 20°.

These errors only occur when the Plan is rotated AND there is an offset to the User Origin. If the User Origin is NOT moved, or the Plan is NOT rotated, the calls work correctly in all VW versions.

It is also assumed, but not proven that the inverse calls ScreenVecToModelVec() and ScreenPtToModelPt2D() also have problems. Please verify that these calls execute properly in Rotated Plan View with and without a shifted User Origin.

  		Josh Loy
VB-191839

Lighting Instrument Symbols and 2D Components

The implementation of 2D Orthographic components in Lighting Instrument Symbols is very welcome and many users will find this feature very useful indeed, especially when creating sections where graphics like Movement Radii need to be displayed.

This does not work when used with Lighting Accessories. Currently, I can only get 2D components to work on Accessories that are pre-attached to lighting Instrument Symbols (clamps). When a Clamp accessory is attached (or any other Accessory) the 2D component does not appear. Also, the displacement of the Lighting Instrument geometry is not reflected by the 2D Component when a Clamp is attached.

Please find file attached. 		Kevin Linzey

VB-191155

IFC objects - inconsistent assignment of GUID at object creation

I'm not sure if this is a VB or WAD and should therefore be a VE, but during BCF testing, Kris, pointed out to me that the reason some objects were not being seen in saved Snapshots is because they did not have GUIDs assigned. 

I had not realised that GUIDs are still not automatically created for all object types upon their creation. (eg objects such as Walls, Slabs Stairs do get GUID assigned to them upon creation, whilst Windows, Doors, Beams and Columns do not). Is this something that can be fixed?

 

Many thanks,

Martyn 		Mihail Rizov
VB-188712

Wrong Export IFC of Symbols with Groups

Hi Vectorworks

Attached a customer file. If you ungroup the objects inside the symbols, the export is correct.

Best regards, Marc 		Mihail Rizov
VB-186644

IFC-Export: Psets fields with a value of 0 (zero) are not exported into IFC

When custom or default Psets fields have a value of 0, these fields are not exported into the IFC file. (I checked the file content in a text editor)

To replicate (see video):
1) Open empty document
2) Draw a styled wall
3) Goto the Data Manager (WallStandardCase) and change a custom Pset with a Record Format field type integer or number to 0 (zero) or 0.0.
4) Export IFC
--> All Pset fields are there but the ones with the zeros - unless it's a zero as a string.

For some reason the Pset field IfcWallCommon.ThermalTransmittance exports anything but what is written in the field formula. 		Mihail Rizov

Note that corresponding formulas in worksheets and Data Tags do work as expected

VB-188980

IFC-Export: Wall - Export Separate Instances, creating multiple IfcOpeningElements per opening

Hello all,

Here is the description of the behavior:

. a multilayer wall is to be exported to Ifc-format using the "Export Separate Instances" option.

. in this case each wall layer creating an own opening (IfcOpeningElement) per object (window/door)

. The multiple openings (IfcOpeningElements) have the same GUID per object in the wall.

. This leads to irritation and miscalculations in planning

Question:

Is the behavior correct and BIM compliant?
Or is it a BUG?

Can you please suggest an workaround?

 

For a better overview, please have a look at the video and the files in the attachment. 		Mihail Rizov

--> custom pset mapping the component (t=index) material custom field
'Bauteil-ID.KG - 3.Ebene'
--> The resulting IFC export shows the correct field value for each component

Repeate 1-3 with file 1 "Test-ALa-01.vwx"
--> The resulting IFC export shows, that both component (IfcBuildingElementPart) receive the same field value (namely of the core component material custom field), not two different values as with file 2 - how it should be. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-191427

*DOM: Frequently crashes on Windows Systems

User G0W98Z:
https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?serial=GHXNWZ-JZZ3QT-ET8XZQ-G0W98Z
Dominique:
https://analytics.vectorworks.net/crashes?serial=EHXNWN-0Z031S-EB2TYS-Z00508

Since about one or two year, we hear often about crashes related to some (random) dlls like kernelbase.dll, libcef.dll, BCGCBRO3060u141.dll and others. They are all on Vectorworks 2022 or 2021.

Also in some cases there is an error Message "Encountered an improper" or "Eine Resource konnte nicht gefunden werden". A low-level Windows Messages. Related to driver or system Resources? Normally we can wait and since a Windows Update, Driver Update VW Update those reports gone away.

In this case we still hear often about this crashes. Now we have an import customer for us which have some issues and the main issue is, that they have 4-7 crashes a day they work with Vectorworks. I guess it must be related to some kind of geometry in their Drawings but it is very hard to reproduce. Well I can "reproduce" the crashes in a statistic way like this:
1. Open File "Layout Blättern Crash"
2. Open 4 additional Documents (Architectural Template in the International Version)
3. Turning the Modell in "Layout Blättern ....vwx" in Solid and Wireframe
4. Switching the Layouts in one of the templates by using ctrl arrow up and down 5. Do the same in "Layout Blättern ....vwx"
6. Repeat, here I have crashes every 10-20 Minute when I "work" on this like explained above.

Attached some movies with crashes. The best to see is maybe "Crash 1503". The number is the Time here. The crash is always at the end of the movies. I know this Tests looks rude against Vectorworks but the users can "reproduce" those crashes by:
1. switching Documents,
2. open Documents,
3. switching to layout,
4. just do noting or edit the drawing
5. Exit Dialoges
and being more friendly to Vectorworks than me in my test.

We have really a lot reports from windows customers about similar crashes. It would be very important to be able to target those crashes, we really hope you are able to help and to analyze some known issue or be able to profile and reproduce those crashes on you own machines and would be able to give us some feedback.

The customer also switched on the detailed log now. Also I am able to reproduce it similar like the customer.

My PC AMD 3950X 16 Core 64 GB RAM, Windows 10 21H2 Build 19044.2006 (See System Profile attached.)
Rick Berge
VB-189617

Interpreting Prolific Successive 'Begin Session' Actions

*I have a one crucial question, framed to help us improve our technical support service for Vectorworks users*

When the Partner Services' website facility, 'License Session History' shows many successive lines showing only 'Begin Session' actions and zero 'End Session' actions, one imagines the user concerned is either experiencing many, many crashes or is using 'End Task' or 'Force Quit' a crazy number of times. But there are probably other things that can cause successive 'Begin Session' actions, such as:
* The internet being unavailable when Vectorworks is quit, but is (strangely) available only when it is opened. (Which is _super_ unlikely in any case).
* The Vectorworks License Session History server being unavailable, again coincidentally only during End Sessions.
* I cannot think of any other reasons…

*So my question is:*
Can we rely on successive 'Begin Session' actions in the License Session History page as an indication of how frequently Vectorworks is _either_ crashing or being force quit? 		Juan Almansa
VB-191094

Script Editor line numbers vanish when editor window is scrolled

When editing a script that has more lines than the Script Editor window can display, scrolling makes the line numbers on the left vanish. The line numbers can be restored by resizing the window vertically, or by adding or deleting a line of text.

This is happening in VW 2023, back to VW 2017 while using an Apple M1 processor running OS 12.6. It does not happen on an older Intel Mac i7 running OS 10.15.7.

See attached test file and two screenshots. The first screenshot shows the line numbers before scrolling, and the second shows the line numbers after scrolling. 		Konstantin Lalkovski

VB-188034

BIMcollab: Spaces show up twice in IFC4 export (still in 2022 SP4b)

Some months ago I contacted BIMcollab support, because BIMcollab ZOOM shows our IFC exported spaces double, which is very irritating. I sent them a screenshot and a simple IFC test file. (I'm attaching everything here).

In their last email they told me this:
{quote}Our development team has informed us of the following:
 
Some BIM programs export IFC files in wrong ways regarding spaces.
When this happens, every space will be related to the building story container twice. Once through IFCRELAGGREGATES and another through IFCRELCONTAINEDINSPATIALSTRUCTURE.{quote}
and attached a screenshot showing the double relation.

The email continues like this:
{quote}{color:#000000}BIMcollab ZOOM handles these badly exported IFC's by making sure that the geometry of the IfcSpace is not duplicated in the model, but unfortunately, removing the double space from the navigator is not something very obvious to do.{color}
 
{color:#000000}In any case, our development team has reported the problem in the ZOOM backlog and will work towards improving this in a future release.{color}{quote}
I had to make new files, because I couldn't find the old ones. But you can see the same issue. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-189720

Export IFC4: Viewport lands at the same position as the original. It does work in IFC2x3 though.

The VIP customer uses a viewport to duplicate walls on a different storey.

Exporting this to IFC2x3 results are good. The model looks the same. See screenshot.

Exporting this to IFC4 results in the walls of the viewport being at the same position as the original walls even though location data suggests, they shouldn't. See screenshots.

The expectation would be: IFC4 looks the same as IFC2x3. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-191147

T02317: (IFC) Data is and isn't by style

When we think style based options, we think of options that are set by style and options that are set by instance.

The new button "(object) Data..." opens the dialog titled "(object) Data" and changing information there will always change this information for all selected wall instances only.

On the other hand, when editing the "(object) Style" - like the wall, making changes to the data will overwrite all Data set in "Wall Data" dialogs for wall instances, if the user ticked the checkbox "Replace Data".

I know many customers have all or at least most checkboxes ticked by default, when working with walls. And as such making changes to the Wall Style equals making changes to all Wall instances with this style.

This can lead to quite some confusion within teams, when expectations of what certain buttons do are not what happens in reality.

Changing the dialog title to "Edit (object) Instance Data" for example would be a great way towards avoiding confusion about what this button actually does.

Other than that the button could be grayed out if set by style (that would require a toggle within the style dialog). Or you could get a warning that says "You are about to edit style based Data." or the opposite if the current logic remains.

Food for though. 		Mihail Rizov
VB-186342

Export to IFC: stairs are missing

When exporting the attached Vectorworks file to IFC, the stairs are not exported.

IFC file result is also attached. 		Mihail Rizov

VB-189093

Document settings don't stick

If you set up a template with document Preferences and settings, such as no page breaks, A1 size, etc., you're expecting these to be embedded in the template.

However, when I created the Landmark UK BIM template, I turned off the page breaks and the watermarks, turned on the grid, and set it to A1 (landscape).

If I open a new version of it from a new build in 2023, it opens with page breaks on, and the A1 size is not ticked in the dialogue box. If I then adjust these settings in the Document Settings, close the file and open a new one from the same template, it now has the correct settings. It seems like the settings you manually set up becomes a Vectorworks preference instead of a document preference.

This doesn't happen with all the settings - units, for example, seem to stay as set up in the template.

This is making me a bit confused - what is actually part of the Document settings and what's not? 		Hernán Stamati

VB-189581

Dimension Tape Class Text Style keeps text black

User created a file in an older version of VW and created a text style to be used in his dimension class.

In 2021 using the dimension class, if he draws dimensions or uses the dimension tape, the lines and text are the same color.

In 2022 using the dimension class, if dimensions are placed the text and lines are the same color. With dimension tape, the text will stay black and not take on the dimension class color.

I have followed his steps and created a new blank file in 2021,I applied a text style to the dimension class. and placed dimensions and dimension tapes objects.  The text and lines are the same color.

If I open the 2021 file in 2022 and place dimension tape objects using the dimension class, the line will be the class color but the text will remain black.

I have tried also doing the above steps with a new blank file in 2022 and 2023 Beta, and in both of those cases the dimension tape stays black.  Open the 2021 file in 2023 results in the same issue above. 		Karthick Chilaka
VB-192364

room schedule for rotated spaces shows incorrect room dimensions

User submitted a file where they have many space objects not showing the correct space size in room dimensions of worksheet.

Room schedule shows the Space Room Dimensions for the X and Y value of the space.
The design layer is rotated, when returned to top plan, the design is about 45 degrees rotated. The Room Dimension value is determined from the true X and Y value of space.

For example. A.03 on the room schedule shows 17,45x17,43 and I have attached a screen shot showing how that dimension is derived.

As a work around I explained the user would have to return to top plan and physically rotate his design, or manually input the space dimensions in each space settings. 		Karthick Chilaka

the main is feet and inches and the secondary is mm

If he changes to second or third mode, the 3/4" disappears.

VB-191523

Viewport: Dimension witness lines not the same as in design layer

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

The witness lines are not displayed as expected in the Viewport. The Viewport scale seems to be correct and we don't find a reason for this, please take a look.

Like its shown in the video, the vertical witness lines are displayed too big in the Viewport compared to the Design Layer and the diagonal witness lines too small compared to the Design Layer. When going in the Viewport Edit Mode and putting on and off the OI arrow inside option, refreshes the witness lines causing the vertical ones to get smaller. Now we have both vertical and diagonal witness lines too small in the Viewport, compared to the drawing. Why? Thank you in advance. 		Karthick Chilaka

VB-192505

VCS: Measurements in the cloud

I'm not sure if I should report this as a wish instead of a bug. Please transfer to VE if you can't treat it as bug.

Currently, it is possible to generate PDFs from within the cloud. But there is a big difference (advantage!) when it comes to measurements if the PDF creation is triggered through the Nomad app or in the cloud portal / publish command in Vectorworks.
* From the cloud: The scale can be read and snaps are detected for correct measurements
* Trough the VCS portal (in browser): The measurements in VCS have to be done without snapping and the scale needs to be calculated manually from the sheet layer scale (e.g. in millimeters).
* Publish (in VW): The measurements in VCS have to be done without snapping and the scale needs to be calculated manually from the sheet layer scale (e.g. in millimeters).

Of course the user would expect the snaps and scale detection in every PDF. 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov
VB-191223

- Open attached testfile (use VW debug version on Mac)
- Move one of the stairs using the mouse
- If you're running debugger, you'll note that the stair PIO's regeneration code is called. However, the stair's ResetOnMove property is set to false so this should not happen.

This bug might be causing speed issues. 		Rick Berge

VB-188659

DOM: Display Errors 2022, Monterey Vega 48

A Couple of customers are moaning about Display Issues with Mac Hardware. Most of them are working on relative old Hardware but not all. An actual support-case is from a customer, which have that issue on several Macs in the office. iMac 2019 Vega 48 Graphic-Card and Monterey.
What have been done until now:
1. PRAM, SCM reset
2. Disconnect all external devises except Keyboard/Mouse
3. New User
4. Disabled all non-standard-fonts

We told, that kind of issue is typical for corrupted hardware or driver issues which is triggered by Vectorworks because the use of Graphic Engine or a cache RAM which is not used without Vectorworks. But I am not sure. Do you ever heard about that issue or have a solution?

Josh Loy

VB-191878

Typing in "Drawing Title" doesn't apply to all selected viewports

If you select multiple viewports and try to type in a Drawing Title in the OIP, the text only fills the Drawing Label of ONE of the viewports (I believe the first selected one).

One would expect the text to apply to ALL selected viewports, since that's how fields typically work when multiple objects are selected.

Drawing Title is not a unique field (like Drawing Number is), so there's no reason that the entered text shouldn't apply to the entire selection.

As an example of why this is a problem, within my industry it's common for a sheet to have up to two dozen elevations, all with a unique Drawing Number [we actually use a letter] but they all have the same Drawing Title — simply "Elevation". It should be fast and easy to select all of them and type this in, but as it stands, I have to enter the title individually for every single viewport. This wastes a lot of time when I'm creating dozens of elevations per week. 		Rick Berge
VB-185612

KLS: Group Container visible on edit when multiple view and sheet layer

Group container still visible when editing a group, which is on a sheer layer.
Multiple view pane active.
See video. 		Rick Berge
VB-185406

In recent VW versions, locked objects cannot be duplicated and moved (Opt-Click-drag), so why are they duplicated in place?

In VW 2018, the behavior of duplicating locked objects changed. In VW 2017 and earlier a user could select objects, some, or all of which may be locked, and Opt-Click-drag them to a new position. All selected objects would be duplicated and moved, including the locked objects. Upon duplication, no duplicates would be locked.

From VW 2018 to the present, Opt-Click-drag duplicates all selected objects but only moves the unlocked ones. Additionally, the duplicated locked object(s) remain locked, whereas in earlier versions duplicates of locked objects were created unlocked.

This is a significant change to a very long history of VW behavior and one with a significant unwanted side effect. If locked objects cannot be moved on duplication, why are they even duplicated?

Copy and Paste of locked objects still works as it always has. Locked objects can be copied as part of a selection and pasted in a new location and the copies of locked objects are not locked upon pasting. In my opinion, Opt-Click-drag should work the same way.

See the video Mark Doubleday posted in this thread [VB-185298: Locked objects Duplicate with the Move by Points tool|[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/92601-jira-vb-185298-locked-objects-duplicate-with-the-move-by-points-tool-mark-doubleday/&do=findComment&comment=421332]]

Additionally, Cmd-D, the keyboard shortcut to "duplicate selected objects" suffers the same behavior as Opt-Click-drag when VW Pref "Offset duplications" is enabled. Unlocked objects are duplicated and shifted, but locked objects are duplicated in place. This defeats the preference's setting of shifting duplicated objects.

In all, I think this is a regression. To me, the locked attribute does not imply that a locked object is off limits to duplication. It just states that the locked object cannot have its attributes or position changed without first unlocking it.

To see the effect:

1) Draw 3 rectangles.

2) Lock one of them.

3) Select them all.

4) Option-Click-drag the selection to a new location.

In VW 2018 to the present, only the unlocked objects are moved, but the locked object was duplicated and remains in place. Note the OIP shows 3 objects selected.

5) Select All.

Note in the OIP there are now 6 objects selected which indicates the locked object was definitely duplicated. 

In VW 2017 and earlier, all selected objects are duplicated and moved. This should be the desired behavior.

  		Rick Berge
VB-191062

Specific document : Corrupted file

Can't open the file, attached a screen shot of the error message Rick Berge

VB-186881

Difficulty with "both sides" Elevation Benchmarks and complex markers

See the bugfiles and screenshots. Kosta and Aleksandar, this goes back to our discussion in late December and early January about 'flipping' markers. For simple markers (those that do not involve concatenated text), the behavior we have implemented is fine and correct. But when the user has complex markers, the text can read backwards and be confusing (for example, "3.25m + Second Story" instead of "Second Story + 3.25m"). There are two possible solutions:
# automatically determine concatenated text and draw the text blocks from left to right always (I think this will be difficult and troublesome); OR
# provide a contextual "Flip Elevation Benchmark" command that will flip the EB graphics around the insertion point and leave all the leader lines in place. (I think this will be easier and allow the user to always get what they want, even if they have to take an additional step.)

What do you think? 		Kostadin Ivanov
VB-184571

"Hi Jeroen,

It looks like this is a possible bug that has been submitted recently, but our engineering team has not been able to reproduce. It might be related to the PDF Viewer or Reader that is being used. Can you submit this as a bug on JIRA so our engineering team can follow up with you directly?

Thanks,

JOSEPH BLOCK
TECHNICAL SUPPORT MANAGER
D: 443.542.0411" 		Josh Loy

4/20/22, 9:14:49 AM Opened "BASE 4451-4455 v04.vwx".4/20/22, 9:14:49 AM Opened "BASE 4451-4455 v04.vwx".4/20/22, 9:30:25 AM Saved "BASE 4451-4455 v04.vwx" as "BASE 4451-4455 v04.vwx".4/20/22, 9:45:27 AM Closed "BASE 4451-4455 v04.vwx".

What really occurred was that a Backup File was created at 9:30:25 named "BASE 4451-4455 v04-Backup-20220420093025.vwx"

 

The original file was never saved, as expected.

Log should report accurate actions.

VB-192441

Objects shift toward left overall and some ones go outside of the crop when set "Projection" to "Perspective" for a section viewport created from Clip Cube.

Steps to reproduce.
1) Create or place some objects.
2) Enable the Clip Cube.
3) Highlight the upper surface and resize toward the bottom.
4) After resizing, right-click the cube and select "Create Section Viewport".
5) "Create Horizontal Section Viewport" dialog box opens. Click OK.
6) Choose "Perspective" on the Projection on OIP.
7) Click "Update" on OIP. The objects in the viewports shift toward left overall. More than half of them go outside of the crop and be invisible.

Hitoshi Takeuchi

VB-192530

Different Color when I export a File from VW2023 to VW2022

Hi Vectorworks

 

When I export a file from VW2023 to VW2022 the RGB Code is totaly different. It's also not the same color at the object. Have a look at the video.

-Click on it

-Notice the red highlighting stays on the other rectangle. Even deselecting both rectangles keeps the red highlighting visible.

VB-192481

DSTOP when trying to set AuxMarkerNode class to 0

Open the attached file. During file read, it finds an aux marker with a non-zero class ID. It attempts to set it to 0, as is currently expected of such nodes. The SetClassID code DSTOPs that it's trying to set an illegal class reference, and refuses to set the ID to zero.

There's another DSTOP it hits later because it doesn't change the class ID. As far as I know this has no user-visible effect. 		Rick Berge

VB-192424

Error by center drawing on internal Origin

When center drawing on internal Origin, the buildings (Mesh) are also shifted. But they should stay on site. After the 'Undo' does not work correctly. Rick Berge
VB-192405

TXT Function doesn't work with some numeric values

In some situations the TXT function aren't working as desired (see https://developer.vectorworks.net/index.php/Worksheet_Functions).

Some examples (see also document):

=TXT('Space'.'Area', 'SquareCentimeters', 'noUnit') -> The conversion from document unit to SquareCentimeters works well, but 'noUnit' is ignored. The result is 802007.618 sq cm (desired *without* unit)

=TXT(B4, 'RoundHalf') -> The rounding to half is ignored

(B4 has a numeric value)

The problem is, that the user needs to try it, to see which combinations are working and which ones aren't (Try and error). There is no help which shows what combinations of numeric values and parameters are working. 		Rick Berge
VB-192372

Vectorworks Cloud Services: error when starting application on Windows

When trying to initiate the cloud service App with Vectorworks 2022 SP5 on Windows, the user gets an error message:

{{An error occurred while setting up VCS desktop client.}}

The IT guy told me, that their security is very tight and prevents any unauthorized software to even start. So, he asked me which processes are being started in the background, when launching the Cloud Services application and which ports it's using or are required. Is there any documentation available about this? 		Lyuben Hadzhipopov

Select all elements on the left, unselect all elements on the right.

Another problem happens when Renderworks textures are not available, so it is is not a usual scenario:

-Disable the texture interface from the 'Debug/Debug Options' menu.

-Alternatively, disable Cineware by renaming the Cineware folder in the VXWorks directory.

Choose Purge as described above.

The following elements are purged but they are still in use in the document:

Texture: Component Insulation Rigid

Hatch: ConcreteSurface HF

Hatch: Paver Crushed Stone Course HF

VB-192380

2023 License server not working correctly unless 2022 is also installed

This is coming from Apple and their automated testing system.

Their serial number is GJXUSN-BZR3T0-E2YXZJ-G0RFVC

See the email below from them:

Hello!

I’m working with Dave (cc’d) on an issue with activating Vectorworks 2023.

We have our license server at swe-licserv-vectorworks.g.apple.com, port 5053. We’re observing that Vectorworks 2023 does not activate unless you also have Vectorworks 2022 installed on the machine.

If you attempt to license Vectorworks 2023 without 2022 installed, we’re observing that the app tries to talk to an API at activation.vectorworks.net, which then redirects to api-load-balancer-public-18656393.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com, but then something happens and the app fails to activate. It never gets to the point of attempting to contact our license server, per the macOS logs.

We’re observing that the issue goes away if you install Vectorworks 2022 and check out the license from that app.

Are there any known issues that sound like this? What logs could we provide to help with the investigation?

Additional info:
Apple allows calling outside hosts so that's not what the problem is from what I can tell since once I install 2022 it works fine connecting to the same license server.
Sasha Wood
VB-192263

'For each selected group, do you want the class assignment to apply to all the subjects...'

This does not happen in previous versions and these are not groups. 		Rick Berge
VB-192339

Obj of tdType 0 is treated as a container during old version file read

Open the attached file. Early in the translation phase, you should hit the HandleObjectInheritanceError() function DSTOP, which occurs when it seems to think it is translating an old-style round wall but the tdType in the object is 0. This may be because it gets changed from obsolete type 89 (since round walls are now wall type objects) before the conversion to type 0, but I'm not sure about that.

This does not seem to have any effect on the resulting file. 		Rick Berge

In 2022 making the objects inside the symbol invisible will not allow you to select the symbol after.

I have attached my test files and a video. 		Rick Berge

VB-192302

Edit Symbol dialog contains different options for flipped symbol instances

# Place an unflipped symbol and a flipped symbol in the document.
# Use the "Edit" command to edit the unflipped symbol and note the options in the dialog.
# Use the "Edit" command to edit the flipped symbol and note the options in the dialog.

*Notice the following differences:*
* The unflipped symbol has the Double Click popup parameter but not the Edit Symbol Options radio button.
* The flipped symbol does not have the Double Click popup parameter but does have the Edit Symbol Options radio button.

This dialog should provide all options in both cases. 		Rick Berge

VB-191997

vstanev DSTOP A proxy parametric found without a parametric parent.

This error comes up when opening the attached file on Mac OS in a debug build.

I saw it come up once during the file load (in the midst of many other reported errors) and again when file load was nearly complete.

If this is an actual error it should be addressed, or if it is not an actual error the macro should be removed, to reduce noise that makes it difficult to recognize and debug actual issues on the loading of this file. 		Rick Berge
VB-191994

HTsafak result (*result)-tdType kParametricNode

This error comes up repeatedly when opening the attached file on Mac OS in a debug build.

Rather than clicking 'Never Show This' I used the Close button to count how many times the file generates this error - after seeing over a hundred occurrences (interleaved with other errors) I instrumented the code, and discovered that during load of this file this VERIFYN will fail 490 times!!

If this is an actual error it should be addressed, or if it is not an actual error the macro should be removed, to reduce noise that makes it difficult to recognize and debug actual issues on the loading of this file.

 

 

  		Rick Berge
VB-191995

Bruce DSTOP GetObject is being asked to handle an out of range SysName (-1 - legal 0 17098

This error comes up repeatedly when opening the attached file on Mac OS in a debug build.

Rather than clicking 'Never Show This' I attempted to use the Close button to count how many times the file generates this error - after several hundred I decided to instead comment-out the DSTOP and instrument the code to count the total. It turns out opening this file will hit this DSTOP code 7,210 times!!!

If this is an actual program logic error (probably not since it is in #if TEST) it should be addressed, or if it is not an actual error the macro should be removed, to reduce noise that makes it difficult to recognize and debug actual issues on the loading of this file. 		Rick Berge

VB-191172

Viewport Section In-Place Mode Calculates Cut Graphics for Objects on Invisible Layers

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Section Viewport that displays a building model. The file includes a layer named "Main Floor-Furniture" that has a bunch of mesh-based Symbols from default content. This layer is set to invisible in the Section Viewport.

To reproduce:

- Update the SVP and then enter its Section In-Place mode

Note that it takes about 45 seconds for the section and render to complete.

- Now close the file without saving, then reopen it
- Delete the "Main Floor-Furniture" layer
- Update the SVP and enter its Section In-Place mode again

Note that now it only takes a few seconds, so it looks like VW is doing some kind of calculations for all the invisible objects on the "Main Floor-Furniture" layer. However, in the first scenario, if you manually make the "Main Floor-Furniture" layer visible after entering the in-place edit mode, it still goes through another long update phase.

The same thing happens in past versions. 		Josh Loy
VB-191976

RLM: when using a reverse proxy the web interface not cleanly loaded

When using a reverse proxy the web interface for the G series cannot be loaded cleanly by the RLM.

The left column, i.e. the navigation page, cannot be loaded here if the interface is called via DNS name or via FQDN.

Problem in the header "\n \r" at the marked point. See Screenshot.

The error message in the ReverseProxy log is: upstream sent invalid header: “\x0d...”

The current workaround is to address the web interface via IP and not via domain name or FQDN. This is problematic in large networks. 		Sasha Wood

VB-191664

However, legacy features are not turned on.

If I turn them on and check "Display screen objects" in the "Unified View Options" dialog box, I am allowed to fillet.

  		Josh Loy
VB-191699

Format Text Dialog should apply vertical align before applying line spacing change

This is a minor text layout workflow/usability issue. It is not new.

One important way our text object Vertical Alignment setting is applied involves changing of line spacing. If vertical alignment is top, and you change line spacing from single to double, the text object will grow downward. If vertical alignment is center, it will grow equal amounts upward and downward. If vertical alignment is bottom, it will grow upward.

When using the OIP or Text menus to change these things, behavior is predictable because you only change one setting at a time.

However when you use the format text dialog, you can change both vertical alignment and line spacing in a single operation through the dialog. In this case, the dialog should first apply the vertical alignment, then adjust the line spacing; it does the opposite.

*To reproduce:*
# Create a multi-line text object with single spacing and vertical align set to Top
# With this object selected, open the Format Text dialog
# Change vertical alignment to Bottom and line spacing to Double

{*}EXPECTED{*}: the text object will resize its top edge higher to accommodate the double-spaced text, leaving its bottom edge unchanged

{*}ACTUAL{*}: the text object resizes by lowering its bottom edge, as if it was still top-aligned; it now shows it has vertical alignment Bottom but it did not use this setting when resizing for the new spacing. 		Rick Berge
VB-191575

Document Window Shows a Pink Background in Mac Full Screen Mode

The attached movie shows this from a blank file.

To reproduce:

- Close all files
- Now close the Home Screen window

Note that the default background is a clearish white color.

- Now open another file
- Enable the Window/Use Full Screen option
- Close the file, then close the Home Screen again

Note that now the default background is bright pink.

If I try this in VW 2022 before the Home Screen was added, the default background was solid white.

This might be related to the bug reported in VB-190088, which also involved a pink fill showing in the background.

This only affects Mac. The same thing happens going back to SP0. 		Josh Loy
VB-191708

Graphic Legend - Text Tool Fails Inside Cell Annotations After "Pick Cell Image" is Pressed Twice

Movie and test file are attached. To reproduce:

- Enter the Annotations for one of the cells
- Press the "Pick Cell Image" button twice
- Now activate the Text tool and click in the drawing

Note that the Text tool becomes deactivated, and the cell picking tool becomes active.

If you try it a second time, the Selection tool will now become active. If you try it a third time, it works as expected.

If you click the "Pick Cell Image" button _more_ than two times, you'll have to reactivate the Text tool even more times before it'll work.

I don't see this problem with other tools.

The same thing happens going back to SP0. 		Josh Loy

To reproduce, hide the first cell, then make it visible again.

Note that the annotations have been removed.

This is working as designed, but per John's comment in VB-191656 we should show a warning dialog so the user knows the annotations will be removed.

Josh Loy
VB-191685

Conflict between updating references and saving a file

Hi Vectorworks
Does anyone know the problem that the SWAP file is not deleted because you update references? So, during the saving process of file “A”, someone opens file “B” where the file “A” is referenced and during the opening process of file “B” the references are automatically updated. There is no error message when saving file “A” but the SWAP file remains on the server (with a different file size). When file “B” has finished opening and file “A” is saved again, the SWAP file disappears.
It looks like the update reference process blocks the saving workflow. Isn't updating references not only a read-only operation?

Best regards, Marc 		Rick Berge
