VB-186613

Spotlight Cable Tools user created Worksheets, Voltage Drop field missing information

Related to VB-186611

If a user creates a worksheet to manage cables, the ='CableObject'.'VoltageDrop' does not work; UNLESS one has already run the cable tools Create Cable Report command.

Whenever the ='CableObject'.'VoltageDrop' is invoked, it should automatically collect the needed information.

In the screenshot attached, I ran the Create Cable Report command upon a single cable which resulted in showing the voltage drop. I then refreshed my own worksheet and it properly displayed the voltage drop.

refreshing my column requires a multistep process each time a cable is added to a drawing. Rerunning the Create Cable Report and then refreshing the user created worksheets. 		Rick Berge
VB-191571

Window Geometry Disappears After Undo/Redo

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a few in-wall Corner Windows.

To reproduce:

- Select the Walls and open the Wall Components dialog from the OIP
- Change the name of the component as shown and click OK
- Now Undo the change, then Redo

Note that some geometry disappears from one or both of the Corner Windows. The portions that disappear seem to change every time these steps are run.

This only seems to affect Shaded and Hidden Line render modes. If you reset the Window the problem will fix itself, so this looks like some kind of VGM syncing issue.

VB-191325

Section Viewport: Background render hidden line and polygon wrong display

In the attached file we have a Section Viewport "1/Layout Plan A0" that is displaying a Slab. When using the various Background Render possibilities we can see a few discrepancies, as described below.

Background render: Hidden Line and Polygon variants.
- The Slab is only partially displayed, the majority of the Slab is missing.

Background render: Dashed Hidden Line
- The Slab is fully represented, but the Line is not Dashed. 		Josh Loy

VB-191301

Edit Story Dialog List Browser Changes the Order of Story Levels After Edit

Movie and test file are attached. The file uses the default Story setup from the Architect (Imperial).sta template.

To reproduce:

- Open the Organization dialog and go to the Stories tab
- Edit Story-1

Note that the browser lists "Top of Slab" above "Finish Floor", and "Ledge" above "Bottom of Slab".

- Now edit the "Top of Slab" or "Ledge" levels and make a change (enable the "Use Elevation Benchmark" or "Create Layer" options)

Note that now the dialog changes the listed order of the Story Levels, and the Story Level that was just edited moves downward in the list.

I'm finding that this can make things pretty tricky when you're editing multiple levels and the order is constantly changing.

This only seems to happen with Story Levels that share the same elevation, when the dialog list is sorted by Elev Offset (which it is by default). 		Rick Berge

VB-191203

DOM: Permission Issues Site Protection Installer Monterey 12.6

Hello
I have some issues installing the Site Protection server on my Computer after a Customer have the same issues. We both try to install on an intel mac with Monterey 12.6. We tried different installers by the customer he get an error -148. I think The Installer exptected a System Folder, that do not exist or a permission issue on a Folder so that the installer could not save a license File. On my Computer I got ActivationMessage11 with the International Site Protection Installer. With the German Installer I got the “Aktivierung fehlgeschlagen, da der Ordner mit den Aktivierungsdaten nicht existiert”
in english: “Activation failed, because the Folder with the Activation Data is missing”. This is an english Version on a French System.
Serial GHXENZ-0Z33BL-ECY2Z1-2DD61B
Activation: AC6-T5Q3GF-EN-2DD61B

I think it is not a license Issue. Also the same issue with other Activation Keys from other Versions. It seems to be an issue on Monterey or a permission issue/ issue with existing files from older installations.

After I manually created the Folder "Reprice" which was not existing. Unter MacHD/Library/Application Support, the Installer was able to go forward. I think the installer do not have enough permission to create a Folder in this directory on Monterey. Some users already have this folder so they have no issues.

Every issues with site-protection results in customer, that are not able starting Vectorworks so I desided to rate as "critical" because on two monterey "site protection servers" I tested installation it failed at the same place


Kamen Kitanov
VB-191229

SBE: DuplicateArray and CStairShapePane::TransferValue: Speed problems

Please watch attached movie. There is a significant delay when the stairs are duplicated. But quite a lot of the delay does not happen within the stair's regeneration code as you would expect but in CStairPane::TransferValue (which is derived from IProviderShapePane and called by Vectorworks).
The stairs need to update certain widgets in the OIP by adding up all these values from all other selected stairs. So in TransferValue, a loop is called that traverses all selected stairs in the drawing. THe problem seems to be that TransferValue seems to be called for each of the newly created stairs thus causing each of them to traverse the entire drawing. SO the time for this is O(n*n) (n being the number of "new" stairs). This is causing the enormous delay. I think Vectorworks should do something to avoid this delay as there is actually only 1 OIP. Maybe TransferValue should only be called once after all stairs are duplicated and reset or there should be some way to inform IProviderShapePane::TransferValue that VW is in "Duplicate along array mode". 		Josh Loy
VB-191108

Viewport In-Place Edit Modes Don't Show Ruler Bars in 3D Views

The attached movie and test file show this in VW 2021 compared to 2022. The file contains a Section Viewport that shows a front-on view of the model.

To reproduce, in each version, enter the viewport's Section In-Place edit mode.

Note that the ruler bars show in 2021 but not in 2022 (or in 2023).

This also happens in Elevation In-Place edit mode for non-section Viewports.

When on a design layer the ruler bars do show in Front views, so it seems like they should also show here.

Ruler bars were removed in some areas as part of the 2022 Screen Plane Deprecation task (T02121), so I'm guessing this is related to that. 		Josh Loy

Rick Berge
VB-190774

Text with multiple colors can't be easily changed to default color

The attached video demonstrates this bug, which I think is a result of a mistaken logic in the color picker for detecting a change to a multi-color text selection.

To reproduce:
# Create a text object with three words, in default black color
# Change two of the words to distinct colors
# Select the text object; note that black pen color is active in the Attributes panel
# Click the pen color and select black as the color, attempting to change all text back to black

EXPECTED: there is a way to coerce all text back to black

ACTUAL: no change is applied because the color picker doesn't think you've changed anything, even though there are non-black text runs selected

ALSO: if instead of selecting the text object, you enter edit mode and select all of the text, the same issue occurs

BUT: you *can* change the color of all text in both scenarios _as long as you choose a color that is not currently displayed as the attributes pen color_. That is, the logic of whether you can make a change is not based on the colors of the text you have selected, it is based on whether or not you would change the active pen color shown in the Attributes panel (which does not show 'indeterminate' color for multi-color selection, as it probably should).

Found in the latest mainline build (2024) but went back and verified it's there in VW 2021. 		Rick Berge
VB-190793

Review existing worksheet function descriptions that populate wiki page.

Review existing worksheet function descriptions that populate wiki page.

Some help descriptions may have changed with the move from our older worksheet function help documentations, VW2020 and older:

[https://app-help.vectorworks.net/2020/eng/VW2020_Guide/Worksheets/Worksheet_functions.htm]

and the new link to a wiki page that is populated from help descriptions stored in Vectorworks string resource files.

[https://developer.vectorworks.net/index.php?title=Worksheet_Functions]

All descriptions should be reviewed to ensure that their details are sufficient and correct.

  		Rick Berge

VB-190525

Mac - Vectorworks fails to paste styled text from PDF even though same text from RTF works

This is a bug in the text clipboard-paste handling in Vectorworks on the Mac.

To reproduce this issue:
# Launch Vectorworks, create a new document
# Open the *VectorScriptGuide.pdf* file in the Preview application
# On page 6, select multi-line styled text beginning with *An Example Script* and including some of the procedure source code below that and copy it to the clipboard via Edit->Copy
# In Vectorworks, create a new text object and paste into it, _OR_ with the selection tool active and nothing selected, choose Edit->Paste

EXPECTED: in both cases, we end up with a text object that has multi-line styled text with the heading bold, the paragraph text in a serif font, and the procedure source text in a monospace font.

ACTUAL: the text style is not preserved in the Vectorworks test object; the title, paragraph text, and source code text are all just in the currently set default font.

NOTE that if you go to the TextEdit application and paste in the text copied in the PDF file, it will paste in correctly styled. If you then select it again in TextEdit and paste it into Vectorworks (using either approach), Vectorworks behaves as expected (applying text styles).

The data which the Preview application copies to the clipboard does include styled public.rtf data, so Vectorworks is simply not handling it properly. 		Rick Berge
VB-190526

Resource Usability: no feedback that you can't apply an image as a material

In the resource manager when you are searching for an resource it is easy to mistake an image resource for a texture resource. Although it is possible to filter correctly, the lack of feedback when you try to apply an image as a texture is still confusing and could be improved.

The feedback is inconsistent because, if you try to apply a material texture to a 2D object, you get a warning beep and the attempt does nothing. Applying an image to a 3D extrude does nothing to it, so it should also provide at least a warning beep, better yet an explanatory dialog.

To reproduce a problem scenario:
# In an untitled Vectorworks document switch to a 3D iso view and shaded rendering mode.
# Create an extrude and leave it selected.
# In the resource manager, leave All Resources as the filter type and in the search field type "Wood Decking Barn" and press enter
# Notice that there are several resources which appear which look very similar
# Right Click on "Wood Decking Barn Wood IF" and click Apply

EXPECTED: since this is an image resource that will not apply to our 3D object, a warning should be issued - at least a beep, better yet an explanatory message

ACTUAL: the texture will be downloaded (if needed) and imported to the current document, but there is no change to the selected extrude and no beep

Note that if at step 5 you instead right click on "Wood Decking Bar Wood <Surface Hatch>", the procedure will result in the texture applied to the object, which is probably what the user would be after in these steps. (If you have selected a 2D shape instead of an extrude, applying the image works properly creating a fill for the 2D shape.) 		Rick Berge

VB-188286

T02274 - Site Modifiers are Selectable in Plan View When Invisible

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Planar Pad modifier with default settings.

To reproduce:

-Make the Site-DTM-Modifier class invisible
-Draw a marquee around the modifier

Note that it can't be selected.

-Now enable the "Show Surface in 3D" option for the modifier
-Again try to select it with a marquee

Note that now it can be selected even though it's invisible.

It looks like this is happening because the surface component of the modifier isn't assigned to the Site-DTM-Modifier class, so it's technically staying visible/selectable even though it has no plan graphics to show. This leaves an odd situation where you can select things that you can't see.

Ideally the surface's visibility would also be tied to the Site-DTM-Modifier class. Since the modifier surfaces aren't intended to be viewed alongside the Site Model, they'll need to be hidden most of the time and that would be an easy way to do it. 		Josh Loy
VB-188188

T02274 - Site Modifiers Can't be Selected in Top/Plan When "Show Surface in 3D" is Enabled for a Surrounding Modifier

Movie and test file are attached. The file contains a Site Model and few modifiers, including a Texture Bed that surrounds a Planar Pad modifier and is on top of it in the stacking order.

To reproduce:

-Try to select the Pad

Note that it works fine at this point.

-Now select the Texture Bed and enable the "Show Surface in 3D" option

Note that now the Pad can't be click-selected, even if X-Ray Fills is used.

Since the surface of the modifier only shows in 3D it doesn't seem like it should be occluding things in Top/Plan. 		Josh Loy
VB-187010

Snapping becomes unavailable in some viewports

Sometimes, snapping to geometry in a viewport becomes unavailable until some seemingly random operation like opening another document or deleting a viewport is carried out. In the attached document I was able to show this reliably.

Open the document
Try snapping to any of the geometry in the viewport.
-> You will notice that you can snap to objects near the outside edges but not the inner part.
Enter the crop.
Delete the crop and exit back to the sheet layer.
Now, you should be able to snap to the expected points.

See movie if unclear how to reproduce.
Thank you! 		Josh Loy
VB-186918

PDF Export: A Graphic Error as occurred.

VB-186980

Imported PDF long load time to sharp image after zoom

Import PDF to Vectorworks and zoom in, the objects will take a great amount of time to become sharp after zooming.

After Zoom, time taken for the objects to be sharp displayed:

- With 26.0.5(622768): 6 seconds
- With 27.0.4b(645900) and Accelerate Graphics active: 57 seconds

- With 27.0.4b(645900) and Navigation Graphics not active, Vectorworks at first freezes right after I scroll the mouse wheel to zoom out, shown in the video at around 3:05 until around 3:58, thats 53 seconds of freeze! Afterwards it loads partially the pdf. It will need a full minute more to load the rest of the PDF. Thats about 2 minutes on total to load a sharp image of a PDF Import with Accelerate Graphics off.

This means even if a Customer has Accelerate Graphics ON, it will take almost a full minute for the PDF to be sharp displayed everytime its zoomed in or out.

I am marking this as Regression, because of the huge difference of time between 26.0.5 and 27.0.4 and also as QRT because the time needed to sharp the pdf is really bad for the Customer. 		Josh Loy

VB-188908

Edit Viewport Crop: Caching Graphics

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

When changing the Crop, Caching Graphics loads for a few seconds.

When exiting the Edit Crop of a Viewport, Caching Graphics loads...

Even if nothing was changed during the Edit, Caching Graphics loads.

Customer complains about this saying he wastes too much time during the day, due to this constant loading, because he uses this Viewport functions a lot for his projects.

Unified View is not off. 		Rick Berge

When trying to do the same for symbols from within the current file, it will detect the class of objects within the symbol rather than the class the symbol itself it on. 		Rick Berge

organization dialog will not appear anymore until the user restarts vectorworks. 		Rick Berge
VB-188529

SBE: Vectorscript Parser can't handle files containing BOM (Byte order mark)

About 7 years after the unicodization of Vectorworks, Vectorscript parser reports a syntax error if a Vectorscript file contains a byte order mark (BOM). This is very annoying. In Unicode times, it often happens - after editing a VS file or by some weird behavior of Perforce - that a Vectorscript dialog suddenly gets a BOM and after that the dialog can't be executed any more because Vectorscript reports a syntax error in the first line.

As BOM is an official part of text file format in Unicode times, the Vectorscript parser should handle this also.

Problem exists on Mac and Windows.

To reproduce, just add a BOM to an arbitrary VS dialog script (most text editors support this) and try opening the dialog in Vectorworks.

Vladislav Stanev

VB-187565

It would be better if Vectorworks 2023 does not ask for file access permission

When launching Vectorworks 2023 for the first time, it asks for file access permission. Please refer to Permission.png. Vectorworks 2022 does not trigger the dialog. It would be better if Vectorworks 2023 also does not trigger the dialog.

Attaching Vectorworks 2023 to Xcode showed the file access request dialog was triggered by GetUserPreferences(bool). Please refer to Callback.png.

To test this, please open the Terminal App and run the following command to clear the previous agreement to allow file access in the desktop folder:

tccutil reset SystemPolicyDesktopFolder

or

tccutil reset SystemPolicyDocumentsFolder

if file access in the Documents folder is requested.

You can also use System Preferences to clear the previous agreement. Please refer to SystemPreferences.png. 		Rick Berge
VB-188013

Windows Character Map paste overrides active text style and color

I'm not sure if this is a bug or a feature request, but given that Character Map is a source of special characters (not really a source of styled text content), I think if possible we should let the active Vectorworks text style prevail and only paste in the (unformatted) text. I'm not sure if the Windows clipboard API makes it possible to disambiguate this.

To reproduce:
# With nothing selected, open Format Text dialog and set font to Arial, size 20 pt, style Bold
# Also use Attributes panel to change pen color to blue
# Create a text object and type some text and verify it's 20 pt blue Arial in bold
# Without changing anything create another (empty) text object
# Open the Character Map program and Selector or double-click a number of characters so they appear in "Characters to copy:", and click copy
# Paste into your new text object

EXPECTED: the characters are pasted in using the style set for the text object, much as if they had been typed

ACTUAL: the characters are pasted in using a default size, style, and color (Cambria 15.2 pt plain, black pen color)

Note that MS word gives the option to paste with or without formatting, so that's how this could be a feature request, to have additional format-aware paste options.

Also note that if you first paste into notepad.exe, then copy from there, the behavior is as expected - we get the extended characters in 20 pt blue bold Arial.

Even with general default support for pasting styled text from other applications, I wonder if it's possible to detect that the pasted text is coming from Character Map and in that case treat it as unstyled.

 

  		Rick Berge
VB-188270

Creating a resource folder with a long name fires this ASSERT. Rick Berge

I would expect that the duplicated window would insert at the location of my cursor when I released the mouse button.

VB-188012

End key moves cursor without clearing selection, results in weird behavior

The text edit behavior in a text object can get into a state where it shows both a blinking cursor and (at a different location) a selection, which makes it indeterminate what will happen when the user carries out an action, such as typing or pasting.

To reproduce:
# Create a text object and type "hello bug"
# In edit mode, select the word "hello"
# Use Ctrl-C/Cmd-C or the edit menu to copy the word; hello should still be selected
# Use the End key to move the blinking cursor to the right of the word 'bug'
# Either type some text, or use Ctrl-V/Cmd-V or Edit->Paste

EXPECTED: because there's a blinking cursor after "bug", the text typed or pasted will be inserted after "bug"

ACTUAL: the text typed or inserted replaces the selection on the word "hello"

Note that if you use the arrow keys to move the cursor to the end of the string, the selection on "hello" is cleared so the bug does not occur; paste or typing happens at the end as expected.

I think the fix is to make use of the Home/End keys clear a text selection esp. when they move the cursor outside of the current selection.

This is probably a pre-existing bug.

UPDATE: this occurs on Mac as well as Windows, if the Mac keyboard has home/end keys (e.g. Apple Magic Keyboard) 		Josh Loy

Best regards, Marc 		Josh Loy

VB-187657

Multiple text object style changes behave inconsistently in OIP, Format Text Dialog, Text Menu

These issues were found while trying to implement the text style button behaviors for the new View Bar (task T02250, ticket PLAT-247). This is a counterpart to VB-184926 - that bug talked about the visible UI controls, this bug is about the applied functionality.

When applying a style like italic or bold, the code paths are very different from different UI components (OIP vs. Text menu vs. Format Text dialog), and the actual behaviors are also different from the user's perspective.

 

To reproduce the issues:
# Create a new Vectorworks document with three simple text objects
# Using the OIP while selecting each object separately, make one object bold, one object italic, one object plain text.
# Select all three objects.
# With all objects selected, toggle bold on*

*do this three different ways: 1) using the Text->Style->Bold menu item, 2) using the Text->Format Text dialog clicking the Bold checkbox and hitting OK, 3) clicking the Bold checkbox in the OIP

EXPECTED: all three approaches to applying bold (step 4) result in the same outcome

ACTUAL: if the Text->Bold->Style menu item is chosen, bold is toggled in each selected text object, so you end up with a bold-italic object, a bold object that was formerly plain, and a plain object that was formerly bold. If the Format Text dialog is used, all objects become simply bold; note that the italic object loses its italic. If you use the OIP bold checkbox, the bold style is added to all objects; plain object become bold, bold object stays bold, and italic object becomes bold-italic.

This has been an issue for some time, reproduced in VW 2021 and 2022, on both Mac and Windows. The code that implements each of these control paths is quite complicated, with proxy-UI code for menu dispatching in the first case, code specific to the font dialog in the second case, and very entangled OIP proxy-UI/widget code in the third case.

  		Rick Berge
VB-187646

Everyone DSTOP C run-time heap is not valid. Check debug output window for more info. Use _CRTDBG_CHECK_ALWAYS_DF flag in InitDebugCRT() to help locate problem.

Seems to only happen if I start out with no document open. I can reproduce this pretty reliably, but I'm not sure which steps are essential. I don't know whether the asserts that happen along the way are the cause, but I've seen those asserts without the run-heap assert happening. I've supplied a movie in case I've left off some steps. I hit "never show this" for all asserts except the one for the heap.
# Preferences need to be set so that VW starts without a document open.
# File>New, template Architect (Imperial)
# In Nav pal, set 2-Floor Layout as active layer and set Layer Options to Active Only
# Activate wall tool, pick a style (don't think which style matters, but I used Ext Bearing-2x6-Mtl Siding. There will be an assert, I dismissed it.
# Draw the wall.
# Click on Layers button to activate Org dialog, click on Stories pane. Direct-edit the Story Height. I used Delete key on keyboard to do the edit, don't know if that matters. Hit return, when next dialog pops up, choose Move the Story and all Stories above it. Click ok and click Ok on org dlg. 
# This assert will occur during the idle loop check. 		Rick Berge

VB-187202

If opening open a Vectorworks file stored in Windows Server 2019 from a specific Mac OS, you can open it the first time, but from the second time it becomes a read-only file.

If opening a Vectorworks file stored in Windows Server 2019 from a specific Mac OS, you can open it the first time, but from the second time, an alert will be displayed and it will be read-only.

If opening a file for the second time, it is easy to make it read-only by changing the dialog of MacOS from "as List" or "as Columus" to "as Icons" and opening the file.
Even if it is not read-only, it will become read-only if you repeat it several times.

・Alert content
"The file is currently in a read-only state(file may be in use by another application). Do you want to open a copy of it with a new name?"

Specific Mac OS: Sierra / El Capitan
Vectorworks version: VW2021SP5 / VW2020SP6 / VW2019SP6 / VW2018SP6

 

I know it won't be fixed, but I'll report it.
Would you please let me know if you have any information.

 

Hayato Wada

A&A 		Rick Berge

VB-187058

File size versus resource size in different scenarios

This issue can be thought of as a continuation of VB-184863, but from a different perspective.

Can certain resources be changed in such a way that it takes up less space? Sure, but this is not the question I'm posing here.

My question is this:
Where is the difference?

Deleting a certain symbol definition from an 800MB vwx document (with VGM cache) reduces its file size to 527MB, but importing this same symbol into an empty file and orbit the view to get the VGM cache and then saving that file, results in only 82MB, NOT 273MB.

[Here|https://jira.vectorworks.net/browse/VB-184863?focusedCommentId=828810&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-828810] [~rberge] says, that this symbol takes up 223MB.

I'm attaching four documents and a video explaining these documents and their differences.

Furthermore:
Disabling VGM cache for HK-078x100.vwx reduces its size from 82 to 9.1MB, while disabling VGM cache for HK-078x100-support-mesh.vwx does not reduce its size of 9.3MB. Quite astounding, wouldn't you say? 		Josh Loy

VB-186723

Mode bar text style drop-down should refresh when a change invalidates it

When the Text tool is active the mode bar shows a Text Style drop down - you can select a named text style resource to apply to new text objects.

However if there's no text object selected you can also make atomic changes to the default text style for new objects through the Text menu, for example changing the font, size, or typographic style. If such a change is made which differs from the mode bar's active text style, the latter should revert to <Unstyled>.

Specific reproduce instructions:
# Create a new document and activate the Text tool
# In the mode bar set the text style to Notes 10 pt
# In the Text->Size menu change the size to 20 pt; note that this size will be used when you create a new text object

EXPECTED: at step 3 since the size no longer matches "Notes 10 pt" that style should no longer be shown in the mode bar text style pull-down

ACTUAL: the mode bar text style pull-down continues to show "Notes 10 pt" even though the text tool is now configured to create text objects with 20 pt size

I have not tested everywhere but I suspect this is a pre-existing issue on both Mac and Windows. Found in VW2023 but reproduced in VW2022 also.

  		Rick Berge
VB-186717

RBerge plugin accidentally wiped fTextStyleRef!

Open the attached Rick Berge
VB-186524

slow performance file with layers not displayed in the navigation palette

Attached is a file that is sluggish. Pan, zoom, etc. seems to be lagging quite a lot.

After opening the Purge Tool, which took a few minutes to load, we can see (screenshot attached) that there are 112352 Design Layers, although in the Navigation Palette we can only see 22 Design Layers. Why is this?

When deleting this 112352 Design Layers, it also deletes needed Layers that we can see displayed in the Navigation Palette. I could do this only the first time. After trying to Purge this again (attempted two more times), Vectorworks freezes and after 30 minutes is still trying to execute the operation. The first time needed a few minutes, can't say exactly how many as I unfortunately didn't measured the time (one of the reasons I have tried to Purge a second and third time. other was to better test performance).

After the first and only successful Purge, the file is visibly faster, but it deleted also many objects that are in the file and are needed for the Customer. This is not a viable solution for the problem. Nevertheless, I believe that first detecting what is causing the performance problem is a priority.

Is it possible to see what is causing this file bad performance? Please take a look. 		Rick Berge
VB-186579

Format Text dialog size field does not honor selected range of text

If you are editing a text object with a varied run of fonts, styles, etc. when you select a word or sequence of characters with uniform formatting, the OIP and Text menus will reflect that selection. For instance if just one word is bold and you select that word, you'll see bold checked in OIP and in Text->Font Style menu. The same is true for font, size, etc.

The Format Text dialog works this way too, except for font size. For some reason it just picks one size used in the text object and displays that, even if you have text of a different size selected.

To reproduce:
# Create a text object with the text "small medium large"
# Edit the text object and select each word in turn, using OIP (or sim.) to change "small" to 10 pt text, "medium" to 14 pt text, and "large" to 20 pt text.
# Now while still editing, put the cursor in each word (or select each word) and note that OIP's size pulldown updates; sim. for Text->Size menu.
# Now do the same, only open the Format Text dialog from the Text menu as you put the cursor in or select each word.

EXPECTED: the size field in the Format Text dialog reflects the active text size based on edit selection or insertion location in the multi-styled text.

ACTUAL: the size field always displays the same size no matter what you select in this text object - for example it might always display 10 pt, even when you have the 20 pt word selected.

This is not new - same behavior exists in VW 2021 and 2022, both Mac and Windows. 		Rick Berge
VB-186637

unexpected/unintended mouse movement

Load the MultiView_AcceptanceTest.

Select the bottom right pane and disable multiview.

Use the mouse to switch the render to Shaded.

When you click the mouse do not move it.  This is important.

After the redraw, do not move the mouse, the view starts to move down the screen.

Moving the mouse will stop the movement of the scene. 		Josh Loy

In comparison, when exceeding the number of licenses for Spotlight module, "ConnectCAD", additional licenses are not allowed. User is presented with message, "Can't acquire a license from the server for the following modules: ConnectCAD"

I tested with Site Protection Server versions 12 and 14. I also tested using a dongle with license file and a Internet activation license file, with the same results.

Attached is one of the license files I used and only allows for 1 Braceworks and ConnectCAD license. In the attached video, I have already launched Vectorworks, with Braceworks and ConnectCAD enabled on another computer. You'll see when trying to launch a second copy of Vectorworks, with Braceworks and ConnectCAD, it only catches the ConnectCAD license.

VB-186475

Everyone ftd (event.fActiveView-GetCoreData()).fCoreDocumentIndex

# Open two blank documents 
# Undock one of them
# Moving the cursor between them should trigger this assert


The assumption in the comment is not correct.
Mouse-entered and mouse-exited events are associated with the drawing view (fActiveView) that has just been entered or exited.
It can be different from the active one if there are two document windows open.

This is a BUG-only assert but I think understand if something unexpected is going on here. 		Josh Loy

-Go to View > Zoom > Fit To Objects note the current zoom level in the ViewBar

VB-186303

Slow sheet drawing, may be memory usage

[https://forum.vectorworks.net/index.php?/topic/93964-slloowww/]

 

This is from user Tom Klaber on the forum:

Vectorworks seems to be running slower and slower.  It will just stop and think about nothing for MINUTES.  A change in sheet layer will be met with 3 to 5 minutes sitting there.  No operation done - just a change in view.  The view is visible - but it will go into Not Responding for MINUTES.  What is going on??  What is it thinking about?? Its just a sheet with 2 elevations.  It is so frustrating.

 

Even changing panels in the Navigation panel - not even switching layers - just switching between Sheet Layers and Design Layers in the Navigation pane - can seize VW up for minutes.  

 

What is going on??

 

So - its definitely a memory issue.  I have isolated it to the fact that after I publish the set - the memory is shot - consumed to 96% and will not recover.  I have 32 GB - but I need to quit VW / restart the machine to get any useability back.  This is extra frustrating because if I need to make a small change to the export - I have to republish which will Cookie Monster my memory like a sheet of warm fresh baked Tollhouse chocolate chip cookies. 

 

I am not tech savvy enough to understand why this would be - but I have noticed that the more BIM hidden line renderings I have the worst it is. 

  		Josh Loy

VB-185713

When running any Renderworks rendering with "Crop perspective view" enabled, 2D objects outside of the crop frame display.

--------------------------
Target environment
--------------------------
Mac/Win
v2022
--------------------------
About Problem
--------------------------
When running any Renderworks rendering with "Crop perspective view" enabled, 2D objects outside of the crop frame display.

If "Turn off unified view" in "Legacy 2D" tab on "Document Preferences" is turned on, 3D objects outside of the crop frame display as well.

Steps:
1) Go to File > Document Settings > Document Preferences...
2) Check "Enable legacy 2D feature" in "Legacy 2D" tab and click OK.
Then go to "Document Preference" again.
3) Check "Crop perspective view" in "Display" tab and click OK.
4) Draw a 2D and a 3D object.
5) Set the current view to "Right Isometric".
6) Set the projection to "Normal Perspective".
7) Drag the frame corners to decrease the size of the window, to be the objects are on outside of the frame.
8) Run any Renderworks rendering. (Ex. Final Quality Rendering)
9) The 2D object that is on outside of the crop frame displays.
10) Go to "Document Preference" and check "Turn off unified view" in "Legacy 2D" tab.
11) The 3D object that is on outside of the crop frame displays as well.


*Remarks
-If exporting as PDF, both 2D/3D objects that are on outside of the frame don't show.
-In case of runnning "Shaded" or "Hidden Line" Rendering, objects on outside of the frame don't show.
-With enabling "Turn off unified view", 2D/3D objects that are on outside of the frame show when running Fast / Final Quality / Custom / Artistic Renderworks.
-With disabling "Turn off unified view", 2D objects that are on outside of the frame show when running Fast / Final Quality / Custom Renderworks
-Only when running Artistic Renderworks, objects will show properly.

Please refer to "sample12819.vwx","movie12819.mov","Turn off unified view_ON.png" and "Turn off unified view_OFF.png".


Best regards,
Rie Ichimura
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-185940

DirtyBoundsProc is called with improperly handled type

In the function DirtyBoundsProc in RotUnit.3D.cpp, there's a test for IsDesignLayerViewport, after which it builds a TViewportObjectHandler from the handle. But this is invalid because certain design layer viewports are ParametricNode-based, so various asserts follow. The code should differentiate between viewports and parametrics and use TDLViewportHandler in the latter case. Josh Loy

We cannot find the reason why this objects are being double displayed, please take a look at this. 		Rick Berge
VB-185950

Eyedropper Tool Hangs when picking up All Attributes from an object in one file, then from another object in another file.

To reproduce:
# Open both "File 1" and "File 2" VWX files in Vectorworks.
Each file contains just one object.
# Make File 1 active
# Select the Eyedropper tool and:
- Set it to Pick Up Attributes mode.
- Select "All Attributes" in the Settings popup in the tool mode bar.
# Click on the object in the document to pick up its attributes.
# Make File 2 active
# Use the Eyedropper tool with the same settings and click on the object in the document to pick up its attributes.

Result:  Vectorworks hangs 		Rick Berge
VB-185916

Selection support - wrong deterministic values (3+ windows)

In the test file, there are *three* window objects. Their list browsers are initialized with different bitwise operation flags (1-0-0), (0-2-0), (0-0-4) *(Low=1, Medium=2, High=4)*.

*Issue:* with different selection order different (and wrong) deterministic results will be accumulated.
*Reason:* consequtive iterations of different object flags leads to consequtive two-by-two comparisons (saved and iterated value). The new (D)eterminted or (N)ot result overrides the old one.
*E.g.:* (1-0-4) & (0-2-4) = (N-N-D). Then (1-0-4) & (1-0-0) = D-D-N. The last comparison overrides any previous results, instead of starting from determined and only changing to not-determined specific field values with each iteration.

Notes:
* Reproduced in earlier release versions too.
* Depending on the plugin implementation, there might be issues with two or three+ objects in multiple selection. 		Vladislav Stanev
VB-185910

Wrong Result of Database Formula

Hi Vectorworks

The formula "=DATABASE((C=CONCAT('Kreis ', A7)) | (C=CONCAT('Rechteck ', A7)))" shows in the attached file only one object, instead of two objects.

Best regards, Marc 		Rick Berge

VB-185603

Truss Snapping Settings

User has submitted a file where they use the truss tool, select the truss object and start placing it on the drawing.  Each additional section of truss no longer snaps to the previous truss with just one click.  The process requires 2 clicks and it will not simply add the truss to the end (see attached video)

When placing the next truss object, the entire truss highlights instead of just the single line indicating the direction of the truss.

I found if right click on placed truss and select customize truss symbol data, then just clicking ok on the next two dialog boxes, it resets something and that symbol of truss starts to work as it should.  This needs to be done on every different type of truss though.

VB-185256

Images Effects Preview doesn't always work.

This is minor but worth noting.
-In the video capture, I have a sheet layer viewport.
-I'm applying the image effects.
-In this particular case, I'm adjusting the Blur and Sharpness level.
-Notice at certain level (around 75%) the preview is completely Blurry. But when it's
around 100% the viewport is blurry but you can see the objects.

  		Josh Loy

I tested that with 2020 (I have no 2018 accessible right now) and found a Speed regression from about 500% in 2022 compared to 2020. It would be nice if you could take a look at that. Thank you very much. 		Josh Loy

VB-184965

Vectorworks freezes when ungrouping objects

Vectorworks freezes when ungrouping objects, to reproduce the problem follow the steps below:

1. Create a new blank document

2. Import the attached DWG file

3. With Select Similar Tool select all Symbols that are in the file.

4. Modify > Convert > Convert to Group

5. With Select Similar Tool select all Groups that are in the file.

6. Modify > Ungroup

Vectorworks will freeze. 30 minutes later is still frozen and trying to do the operation. 		Rick Berge

The attached video shows the problem being reproduced.

As example, like shown in the video, activate the Design Layer #12 and pan/zoom it to a place away from the origin point. Afterwards, double-click on the Design Layer #13 to switch to it. Vectorworks will center the drawing into the origin point. 		Rick Berge

VB-184940

DLVP Shows the Wrong Bounding Box After Being Moved

Movie and file set are attached. The set contains two files; a source file with a building model and a target file that references the source file through a DLVP.

To reproduce:

-Update the reference
-Move the DLVP to a new location

Note that the DLVP's bounding box is correct at this point.

-Now update the reference again

Note that now the bounding box becomes much larger.

VB-184643

Windows: Significant delay on creation of new text object in new document

I found this issue running a recent 27.0.x autobuild on Windows. -I suspect it is existing behavior but have not yet checked earlier builds.- I also reproduced it in 26.0.6b build 625988.

To reproduce:
# Launch Vectorworks, wait for new untitled document to load
# Select the Text tool
# Click on the draw area to create a text object

EXPECTED: the new text object is immediately created and a cursor becomes active allowing you to type text content into it

ACTUAL: there is a delay of several seconds, with a spinning delay cursor, before the text object actually appears

This only happens initially - after that text objects are created on first click.

This does not happen on Mac. 		Rick Berge

Even if not, the file in general feels very sluggish and the RAM used is high.

VB-184655

When the Floating View Pane of Multiple View Panes is activated, the shortcut key for selecting a tool that uses the Alt key does not work.

It occurs in VW2018 to VW2022 of Windows OS.
When the Floating View Pane of Multiple View Panes is activated, the shortcut key that uses the Alt key does not work in the shortcut key for selecting a tool.
　For example, Alt + 2: Double Line Tool, etc.

Reproduction procedure:
1) Execute View> Multiple View Panes> Create Floating View Pane.
2) Make sure that a tool other than the Doble Line Tool is selected while the Floating View Pane is active.
3) Press the shortcut key "Alt + 2".
4) The Doble Line Tool should be selected, but it doesn't work.

Please also refer to "12754.png" on the screen.

Best regards,
Takaaki Mizuno
A&A 		Josh Loy
VB-184622

Snapping Suspended Doesn't Always work with Wall Companents.

This is minor but worth noting.
-See attached video capture.
-Snapping is Suspended.
-There is a Solid Symbol on top of a wall with components.
-Notice when I move the symbol straight down (holding Shift Key).
-The symbol will sometimes snap to the components and the components
will disappear. I have attached the Video capture and file for additional information.
Josh Loy
VB-184616

Text objects by class within parametric object not affected after changing the class text style when 'Use at creation' is turned on.

To reproduce this bug follow these steps:
# Create Plant, Landscape Area or Hardscape and show tag
# Set the tag class to use new text style and choose Use at creation
# Close with OK
# Note that Plant/Landscape Area/Hardscape Tag don't change 
# Open Settings and close with OK (don't change anything): The tag will have the new text style applied

I think that the problem is not in the Landscape project because I found that in the function _void CheckForClassObjectWithoutByClass(BlankHandle u, void* env)_ ( SRefListMgr.cpp ) it is checked whether the parent of current object is a _kParametricNode_ and if it is not only then _env.found / foundText_ will change to true which will lead to calling the function _gSDK->SetTextStyleByClass_ and the subsequent recalculation of the text object. 		Rick Berge
VB-184607

I was simplifying my model file which contains 12 walls and few windows/doors. When I attempted to delete the objects from the upper floors, VW froze.

 

I've attached the test file and a sample crash from the activity monitor. Maybe the sample crash has clues as to why VW froze? 

Apple M1 mac mini

16 GB Ram

  		Rick Berge
